lines.text: (thinking) ... How strange. It seems to me that I have met you before, traveler ...
Well ... great are the mysteries of time and space... Oh, please forgive my rudeness, son of patience. I have not even greeted you yet.
Welcome, friend, take a seat on my humble rugs and enjoy a pipe in peace.
Who are you?
My name is Abuyin ibn Djadir ibn Omar Kalid ben Hadji al Sharidi. I am a seer and a prophet, an astrologer, and a purveyor of tobacco.
What kind of tobacco do you offer?
My pipes are filled with spicy, refreshing apple tobacco.
Help yourself whenever you want, Son of Adventure.
Do you have other tobacco as well?
I offer only the very best tobacco. This apple blend is a symphony from my homeland, the Southern Isles.
But, of course, I'm always open to trying a different sort of tobacco - if somebody should succeed in producing a really good tobacco.
How is that done?
Start with my apple tobacco as a basis. And then try combining it with another ingredient.
This is done at an alchemist's bench, provided you know the essentials of alchemy.
Where can I get apple tobacco?
I shall give you two portions. It is up to you in your wisdom to do with them whatever you want.
If you crave more, then direct your steps towards Zuris, the Master of Potions. He produces this tobacco and he sells it, too.
Let me try your tobacco.
No, I'm afraid this mixture does not agree with me. But maybe you'll find somebody else who really appreciates this ... er ... delicacy.
I've got a new tobacco blend ...
Let me try your tobacco.
This tastes incredible! I've never had a better smoke in my life!
How did you prepare this blend?
I mixed the tobacco with honey.
You have done well, Father of the Art of Blending. I would be delighted to fill my miserable pipes with this.
Fill 'er up, then.
Thank you, Son of Generosity. No other blend could be as good as this one. I shall buy every bit you can bring me of this.
I've got some honey tobacco for you.
It is a great pleasure doing business with you.
Are you interested in this package of weeds?
A package of herbs - that's not swampweed, is it? Oh, take it away, Son of Improvidence.
If the city guards catch me with that, they'll throw me into jail - and you will fare no better!
If you're planning to sell this stuff, I advise you - leave this town.
Try and get rid of it somewhere outside of the city walls. In here, all you can get for it is trouble galore.
Can you make me a prophecy?
My services are yours for a modest fee, oh Father of Generosity.
How much do you want?
For a paltry 25 coins, I shall risk a glance through time for you.
But remember - the future is always uncertain. All I can do is glimpse some fragments of time.
Tell me about the future.
All right, Seeker of Knowledge. I shall now enter a state of trance. Are you ready?
Oh Father of Coins, I ask you for 25 gold pieces in return for a glimpse into the future.
(Trance) ... Orcs ... they are guarding an entry ... an old tunnel ... the Valley of Mines ...
(Trance) ... Men in shining armor ... a magician ... your friend is with them ... he is waiting for you ...
(Trance) ... Fire! An attack ... a mighty creature ... the flames ... many ... shall die ...
(Trance) ... what is that ... ? A city... Ruins ... Quarhodron in Jharkendar ...
(Trance) ... he is summoned ... Quarhodron in Jharkendar!
... I'm sorry - the vision is over. There's nothing more I can see.
Can you make me another prophecy?
Oh Son of the Mysterious Future, it is not within my power to lift the veil of time.
Only when time sends me another omen shall I be able to see for you again.
When will that be?
When the future has become present and you have continued your journey.
Can you make me a prophecy?
Yes, time has progressed and I shall give you a prophecy in return for a few coins.
How much?
For a paltry 100 coins, I shall risk a glance through time for you.
Tell me about the future.
All right, Son of Bravery. I shall now enter a state of trance. Are you ready?
Oh Father of Coins, I ask you for 100 gold pieces in return for a glimpse into the future.
(Trance) ... A mercenary ... he will need you ... a terrible murder ... the Eye ...
(Trance) ... the sinister henchmen ... they are coming ... searching for you ... a guardian will fall ...
(Trance) ... but the three shall unite ... only then shall you receive what is yours ...
That's all. There's nothing more I can see.
For a paltry 250 coins, I shall risk a glance through time for you.
Tell me about the future.
All right, Son of Knowledge. I shall now enter a state of trance. Are you ready?
Oh Father of Coins, I ask you for 250 gold pieces in return for a glimpse into the future.
(Trance) ... you shall force ... what is nobody's destiny but yours ...
(Trance) ... through fire and snow ... through ice and flames ...
(Trance) ... Men in foreign armor ... a swamp ... lizards ... they await you ...
That's all. There's nothing more I can see.
For a paltry 500 coins, I shall risk a glance through time for you.
Tell me about the future.
All right, Son of Knowledge. I shall now enter a state of trance. Are you ready?
Oh Father of Coins, I ask you for 500 gold pieces in return for a glimpse into the future.
(Trance) ... the place of knowledge ... another country ... a dark place far away ...
(Trance) ... brave companions ... you shall make your choice ...
(Trance) ... a temple ... lies lonely in the realm of Adanos ... hidden in the fog ...
That's all. There's nothing more I can see.
For a paltry 1000 coins, I shall risk a glance through time for you.
Tell me about the future.
All right, Son of Knowledge. I shall now enter a state of trance. Are you ready?
Oh Father of Coins, I ask you for 1000 gold pieces in return for a glimpse into the future.
(Trance) ... Darkness pervades the land ... evil will triumph ...
(Trance) ... the King shall lose his war against the orcs ...
(Trance) ... you shall return, but you shall not find peace ...
That's all. There's nothing more I can see.
(scornful) What do you want?
Here, I've got a mutton sausage for you.
Sheep sausage, sheep cheese ... sheep milk ... it's getting so I can't stand the sight of it.
So do you want the sausage, or not?
Oh, give it here already!
I'm new here.
So I see.
If you still don't have any work, talk to Parlan. He'll assign you some.
What happened between you and Babo?
You shouldn't believe everything you hear.
(insistently) Let's get something straight: I shall go my own way. The way that Innos foreordained for me.
I won't allow anyone to stand in my way, and certainly not that simpleton Babo.
Shouldn't we novices stick together?
The rest of you can stick together as much as you like.
But please, don't waste my time. (cold) And no one should get in my way.
Innos alone knows which path we shall take.
My family has always stood highly in Innos' favor and nothing about that is going to change.
We'll get along just fine.
I hope so. Once I'm a magician, I can put in a good word for you.
What are you planting here?
We're trying to grow healing plants that Master Neoras can use to brew potions.
(triumphant) You are too late!
I was here first! I have won!
(menacing) Only if you get out of here alive.
Do you want to kill me? You will never succeed.
Shut up!
(mocking) It is hopeless, you have lost! Resign yourself to it.
Only I am destined to become a magician.
Destined my ass. The chest is mine.
(furious) No, you cannot do that, I will kill you first.
You win.
(furious) No, you cannot deceive me. You're trying to get rid of me.
I shall prevent that!
Congratulations, you have really deserved it.
(distrustful) What does that mean? What are you planning?
What are you talking about?
(nervous) You want to dispute my victory. You want to kill me and take all the glory for yourself!
You will never succeed!
(surprised) You found the hiding place before me. That cannot be ...
(determined) That must not be! I shall not permit it.
They won't even find your corpse.
So how's it going?
Oh - thank you for your concern, Sir Paladin. I enjoy the work and I am certain to be selected as a magician soon.
(arrogant) You are only a guest here in the monastery of Innos. Therefore you should act accordingly and not disturb me while I am working. Good day.
I've got to go.
Don't let me stop you.
So long. I really wish I could have done more for you.
Is there a problem?
(sweating) ... Eh ... no, no ... everything's fine. (nervous) It ... would be better if you left now.
Are you sure?
eh ... yeah, yeah ... everything's fine. You ... eh ... I ... I can't talk to you now.
Eh ... not now, I can't talk to you now.
Thank Innos. I thought my time had run out.
My name is Akil. I farm this humble piece of land.
Who were those people?
You ought to recognize them. Those were mercenaries from Onar's farm. Like you.
Those were mercenaries from Onar's farm. Those bastards don't know anything but plunder and murder.
I'd been fearing the worst ...
(deep breath)... well, thank Innos it didn't come to that. Tell me what I can do for you.
Nothing. Just as long as you got through this all right.
You're an exceptional fellow. May Innos guard you on your way.
What about a few gold pieces?
I'm afraid I have to disappoint you - we're poor farmers. It's just enough to live on.
All I can offer you is a meal. Go to Kati and let her take care of you.
What did the mercenaries want from you?
You're pulling my leg. The mercenaries wanted to collect the rent.
You don't know that? Onar, the landowner, hired them. They guard his farm and collect the rent for him.
That means they go from farm to farm and take whatever they want. And whoever can't pay gets a taste of their steel.
Have you heard anything about missing citizens?
Don't make me laugh. Heard of them? Some of my own people are missing.
Tonak and Telbor used to work on my fields, until 3 days ago.
And I know exactly that they wouldn't up and leave the farm just like that.
And yet, they've simply vanished and no-one can tell me where they went.
If you happen to find out what's become of them, be sure to let me know, will you?
About your farmhands ...
You brought them back - you're one brave man.
At least one of them has survived.
Take this gold as a token of my gratitude.
Baltram sent me. I'm supposed to pick up a shipment for him here.
So you're his new messenger. Okay, I've already made up the package.
You know your way around this area ...
Sure, what do you want to know?
Where can I find Onar's farm?
Just go back down the stone steps and follow the road to the east.
At some point you come to a tavern. From there you go farther east until you come to the big fields. That's where the mercenaries hang out.
What is that tavern to the east of here?
Ask Randolph. He knows more about it than I do. He's been there a few times.
What is there in the woods behind your farm?
There's just a whole bunch of monsters back there - and the wolves are the least dangerous.
A few bandits are also said to have their caves there. Well - they've left my farm alone so far.
Did anything else happen?
No. I hope the sheep stay where they are right now.
My sheep keep disappearing. Soon I won't be able to feed us anymore.
The orcs have shown up everywhere. Someone even mentioned their headquarters. Ask the farmer Lobart about that.
They've also spotted plenty of lizard people in this area. I wouldn't go into the caves if I were you.
The black hoods are looking for you.
Now there's a novel concept.
All right. I just thought I'd mention it.
Is there any other news?
Someone keeps stealing my sheep lately. I haven't been able to sleep properly for nights.
Who could have done that?
I've got a hunch about that.
Some really nasty fellows have settled into the caves over in the forest.
I find it hard to believe that they're living on berries. I'm almost certain that's where my sheep are disappearing to.
How many sheep are you missing?
It must be at least three that have disappeared now.
Not my problem.
I understand. You have other things to worry about.
I found the sheep rustlers.
You were right. Those fellows in the forest cave did it. They'll never steal sheep from you again.
Thank you, noble servant of Innos.
Thanks. So the militia really does care about us small farmers.
Thanks. You sure are a strange mercenary. Not at all like the others I know.
Take this as a small token of thanks for the selfless favor you did for me.
Very good. Here's a few gold coins. I hope it's enough.
I need to talk to Lord Hagen!
He's in the great hall, straight through there.
Whatever it is you want from him, keep it short - he is a busy man!
What does it mean to be a paladin?
A paladin is a warrior of Innos. He lives in order to serve him, and fights in order to do him honor.
In return, the gift of magic is bestowed upon us. The magic of runes - which we are granted as recognition for our deeds.
Can you teach me something?
If you prove yourself worthy, I shall bestow the magic runes of the paladins upon you.
Beyond that, I can teach you to increase your magic power.
I only instruct paladins.
Am I worthy of receiving a rune?
As a sign of your rank, I bestow upon you the Rune of Light. It is the symbol of truth and justice.
Light the way for all those who walk the path of Innos.
You must earn all other runes. Come again when you think you have proven yourself worthy.
Which way have you chosen?
The way of healing or the way of battle?
You are not yet worthy of receiving the next spell for this path.
I choose the path of healing.
I choose the path of combat.
I want to increase my magic power.
If you want to increase your magic power even further, you must seek another teacher.
If you're looking for me, you'll usually find me near my camp in front of the palisade.
Palisade?
Just continue west from here and you'll see what I mean.
Who on earth are YOU? You don't look like the others.
What others?
Well, the mages who are hanging around those ruins over there.
Are you one of that bunch, then?
Brave thing to run around here by yourself.
Who are you?
I'm sure you've heard of me before.
(proudly) I'm Alligator Jack.
Feared all over the country. I'm one of the most dangerous pirates around here.
Together with Cap'n Greg I've boarded more merchant vessels than I count.
You're looking at a living legend here.
Do you know a fellow named Raven?
Of course. He's the leader of the bandits to the east.
What's your business with HIM?
I've got a better idea.
Come and join us.
That'll give you time to think about it.
Once you've tried our good home-brewed rum, things will look very different.
I've got to kill him.
(laughs) What? YOU? How are you going to do THAT?
Isn't that guy way out of your league?
You won't even get close to him. The bandits he's surrounded himself with will skin you alive first.
You won't even get past their first outpost.
The way you look, those bandits will get itchy fingers when they spot you a mile away.
I want to join him.
(slyly) Is that so?
But you don't look at all like someone who would want to join those crackpots.
I need a bandit's armor.
What would you do with THAT?
It'll only get you into trouble if you're seen with it.
Everyone's going to take you for a bandit and will try to kill you.
Sounds good ...
Yes, but only to someone who's suicidal.
Do you have any idea where I could find armor like that?
We used to have one in our pirate camp.
But I don't know whether it's still there.
Your captain's name is Greg?
Right. He's the greatest pirate the sea ever spawned.
I think I know your captain. I met him in Khorinis.
(laughs) Greg? In Khorinis? Nonsense!
Greg is out at sea after booty with some of the lads.
The only thing that could bring Greg to Khorinis would be one of the King's prison galleys.
He's one of the most wanted men in the land.
He'd never march into town voluntarily and have the royal guard throw him into prison.
If you say so.
Where's your pirate camp?
See the cave passage over there? Go through it and continue west, and you'll come to our beach sooner or later.
That's where our log huts are.
I can take you there if you want, if you do me a favor first.
What would that be?
I'll have to get the boys some meat before I can go back to camp.
You're a strong fellow.
I could use your help hunting. Interested?
What is it you hunt?
Only alligators, usually. But they're no good for eating.
And there aren't any left around here anyway.
So I take what I can find: swamp rats.
What?
Most beasts around here taste like old socks, or they're as tough as alligator meat.
Those fat swamp rats are the only thing that is remotely edible.
Tell me more about you pirates.
We've been living here for years. Back before the war, everyone knew us from here to the mainland.
Our flag alone would spread terror among the crews of merchant vessels.
But those times are past now. It's been weeks since we've run into a merchant vessel.
Our Cap'n Greg left to try and catch another.
The rest of us are sitting here in camp, twiddling our thumbs until he comes back.
I hope he'll bring back lots of booty.
Let's go hunting.
All right. With two people, that's child's play.
Are you ready?
Yes.
Great. Just stay right behind me.
No, not yet.
Hurry up, then.
The hollow.
There should be some of those beasts around here.
Follow me.
I was afraid of that.
What?
This handful of beasts here is only about half of what I need.
Now we'll have to enter the canyon.
Watch out, it's very dangerous deeper down in the canyon.
If you hold your life dear, stay very close to me.
What IS there in the canyon?
We avoid that area if it's at all possible.
That's where you find razors. Tough beasts, those. Stay away from them if you want to live another day.
Fine, let's go.
All right.
Come on.
Say, can you tell me what I took you along for?
You didn't kill a single swamp rat.
Oh well. Maybe you can be useful some other way.
Well done, we can use someone like you.
You brought down one of those beasts on your first hunt. Not bad.
You're a talented hunter.
My goodness! If you continue like that, I'll be able to stay in camp next time.
Here, take this swamp rat meat to lazy old Morgan.
You'll find him in our camp.
He's probably lounging on the beach somewhere. He'll be waiting for this.
Henry usually guards the entrance to the camp and keeps a lookout for bandits.
If he refuses to let you in, just tell him that I sent you.
Maybe that'll make him a bit more sociable.
Henry is a little too eager and a bit bossy, too.
Do you know Angus and his friend Hank?
I haven't seen them in a while.
And I wouldn't mind if the pair of them never came back.
Why?
Oh, those bums always hung around the lake, scaring off the game.
WHAT lake would that be?
Remember our hunt?
Yep.
The lake in the hollow. That's where I usually saw them.
The lake in the big hollow.
Just walk east from our camp. You can't miss the hollow.
There's lots of little waterfalls there.
But watch out - if there's nothing but dry sand underfoot, you've missed a turn and entered the canyon.
Can you teach me something?
Sure, I'm a good hunter and I can show you how to skin animals and pull their teeth.
I'll teach you if you like.
But first show me that you're ready for the hunt.
Once we've been out hunting together, I might do it.
Teach me!
What is it you want to learn?
Always make the cut at the belly, or the quality will suffer.
All right then.
Let's go hunting.
Come along.
I no longer need you.
What are you doing here?
(laughs) This is my home!
What am I supposed to do here? I'm drinking.
I'm going for a little walk.
But if you mean, what do I do all day - I arrange fights.
You arrange fights?
Every day, from noon until evening.
And right here!
Behind the warehouse in the harbor district - home, sweet home!
What are the rules for the fight?
Quite simple: All regular weapons are allowed. No bows or crossbows and NO magic!
We fight until one of us drops. And as soon as one of us is flat on his back, it's over, got it?
Whoever leaves the corner is out! So if you quit, I win!
The stake is 50 gold coins. If you win, you get 100 back. If not - well - then your money is down the drain. (grins)
Got it?
Yep!
How's it going? Do you want to go up against me again? I think I've gotten better in the meantime ...
I think you've won often enough.
Don't get me wrong, but my skull's still buzzing from the last time...
Come back again later. In the meantime, I'll train ...
I want to fight against you!
First give me back my sword. Then we'll see...
Nah, nah. Before I go up against you again, I need a better weapon!
I had to sell my sword a few days ago.
With that baby, I'm unbeatable! If you get it back for me, I'll take you on again!
I think that should be enough for now ...
Let me have a short break.
Besides, I've scraped enough gold together by now.
I'm quitting, and I'm going to find me a place to stay somewhere in the city...
Who knows, maybe I'll open a weapons shop ...
Do you have 50 gold pieces?
I only fight from noon until evening.
The fighting is only worth it if there are enough viewers to make bets!
It's much too late now. Come back tomorrow at noon!
It's still too early, come back later!
Here you are ...
(loudly) We have a new challenger!
The bets are placed...
Are you ready?
Nope ...
Then go get them! No fighting without a stake!
Come here!
Then let's see what you can do!
Just a second ...
Take your time...I'm starting now!
Oh man! You pack quite a punch.
Here's your 100 gold pieces! You've earned them!
I see you already took your gold.
You could have waited until I gave it to you - I keep my word!
You went through my pockets while I was unconscious!
That's bad form, man! No matter, the money was yours anyway! Here's the rest.
It was a good fight. Your stake is gone - don't make too much of it, it was for a good cause! (grins)
Hey, like I said, whoever leaves the corner loses the fight! If you want to try again, I'm at your service!
And one more thing: No one talks about what goes on behind the warehouse.
The militia puts everyone who does the slightest thing here behind bars. And those boys don't like to see betting on fights.
The fight was over, you bum!
I don't like it when people don't obey the rules.
Get out of here!
If you wanted to fight me, you only needed to challenge me.
If you wanted another fight, all you needed to do was challenge me!
I don't want anything to do with lowlifes like you! Beat it!
(surprised) You 'live' behind the warehouse?
It's only temporary. (grins) When you have as much gold as I do, you can afford a bit of luxury!
I was a drill instructor in the army, but I left that bunch to seek my fortune in adventure.
Now I've wound up in this shithole. My last 100 gold pieces went to the guards at the city gate.
So, I'm seeing to it that I come into money again. I even had to sell my sword.
To whom did you sell the sword?
I swapped it to a trader in the marketplace for some stuff.
The guy's called Jora. The torches and the bit of meat that he gave me are long used up.
He isn't likely to give me the sword for nothing ...
It's an old sword. He won't want much for it. Just think of the money as an extra stake for the fight. (grins)
I've got your sword!
Ah! That's much better than fighting with an old stick!
Good! I'm curious whether you'll dare to challenge me again!
What do you know about the war against the orcs?
There's not much to tell. The war has been going on for too long.
The country people are starving. Everywhere there are peasant revolts that are put down mercilessly by the King.
But there's just too many of them. If the war doesn't end soon, the realm will fall apart.
Can you train me?
If you really want to learn how to fight, then go up against me. (smirks) The lesson is no extra charge.
I keep my word. I'll teach you everything I know - provided you have the necessary experience.
As long as you have the necessary experience - sure.
Train me as a swordfighter!
You're no longer a beginner!
You're already better. Soon you'll be a regular fighter!
Whatever it is that brought you here - you had better forget it and hit the road.
Hey, you're still here. I'll give you a choice, stranger: piss off, or die.
You guys get out of here now, got it?
Looky here, we've got a hero at our hands - a truly stupid hero.
Do you know what I think?
Who cares what you think?
I think that the only good hero is a dead hero. So do me a favor - hurry up and die!
Who are you guys - a pair of jokers?
You got it. I'm still going to laugh when you're lying face down in the mud.
(calls) Engardo, let's get started! You grab the farmer - I'm going to take care of this clown!
I don't want any trouble.
But trouble is what we're seeking. We've come a long way just to start a little trouble.
Yes, we are going to cause a lot of trouble. And I shall start with you if you don't beat it right now.
I've only come to fetch something.
So are we. And we were here first. So piss off, or I may have to hurt you.
I want to join you mercenaries.
Oh, really? Piss off, then - or you're not going to join anyone ever again.
You had your chance. But you don't seem to want to listen to reason.
All right - so I'm going to kill you now. (calls) Engardo, let's do them in!
Are those your sheep?
The only one that belongs to me is the one that answers to the name of Lucy. (laughs) That's my wife - Lucy.
The sheep belong to the militia. All the sheep they collect from the farmers they bring to me.
Boy, that lunatic's hammering is wearing me down.
Who are you talking about?
Can't you hear that hammering? Who do you think hammers all day long in the harbor district?
I mean that lunatic Fellan. He takes the hammer to his hut every day.
I could take care of Fellan ...
You want to help me? What's in it for you?
You tell me.
Oh, that's how it is! All right - if you can get him to stop hammering, I'll pay you 25 gold pieces.
But I'll tell you one thing right now - you can't talk to the guy. He's nuts. The only thing that will help is a few decent punches!
I'll see what I can do ...
You can think about it. Remember, I'll pay you 25 gold coins.
If I beat him up, I'll just get into trouble with the militia ...
Down here at the harbor, no one pays much attention to brawls ...
But if you steal around here, or mess with the sheep, you'll be in trouble.
Fellan will hammer no longer.
Hear that? No more hammering. At last. I thought the fellow would never quit.
You've done me a huge favor. You know what, I'll give you 30 gold pieces.
And, how are the sheep?
Fellan's hammering is going to drive them crazy. One of these days they'll go completely to pieces.
The sheep eat and get fatter and fatter. Just like my wife. HAHAHA (laughs loudly)
I'll probably have to slaughter one of them. For the last meal!
For what?
For the mercenary who murdered the paladin. Of course he'll be executed.
I just have to decide which of the creatures will go to the slaughtering-block.
Lucy is really lucky to be alive.
I thought you said Lucy was your wife.
Right, but I also called the sheep Lucy. I mean the sheep that was meant for the last meal for that Bennet.
But that all worked out. Lucy will be glad.
As time goes by, watching the sheep eat gets to be pretty boring.
I'm saying goodbye to them. Lord Hagen has ordered that all the sheep are to serve as provisions for his army.
Well, then at least I'll have more time for my wife.
One of my men told that the bandits are circulating wanted posters with your face on them.
He also says you denied that at first.
So what is it all about?
I don't know why those guys are looking for me...
I hope for your sake that you're telling the truth.
I cannot use anyone in the militia who doesn't have a clean record.
Most of these bandits are former prisoners from the mining colony.
I should hope that you didn't get involved in any way with those cutthroats!
The merchant Canthar was here. He said that you are an escaped convict from the mining colony.
I don't know whether that's the truth and I prefer not to ask you, but you should clear that matter up.
Have you come to pay your penalty?
I had already asked myself if you would even dare to come here!
Apparently, the charges against you have multiplied!
I warned you! The penalty you have to pay now is higher!
How much?
You have severely disappointed me!
Some new things have come up.
Suddenly there is no one left who accuses you of murder.
No one any longer remembers having seen you steal.
There are no longer any witnesses that you were ever involved in a brawl.
Apparently all the accusations against you have been cleared up.
I don't know how that happened, but I'm warning you: don't play any games with me.
In any case, I have decided to waive your debts.
See to it that you don't get into any more trouble.
I want one thing to be clear: you're going to have to pay the full amount of your penalty anyway.
So, what is it?
How much was that again?
You must be the new fellow who has caused trouble here in the city.
It is good that you have come to me before everything becomes even worse for you.
Murder is a serious crime!
To say nothing of the other things you have done.
The watch have orders to execute every murderer on the spot.
And most of the citizens will not tolerate a murderer in the city!
I'm not interested in hanging you. We are at war and we need every man.
But it will not be easy to make people feel better about you again.
You could show your remorse by paying a penalty - naturally, it would have to be reasonably high.
It is good that you have come! You are accused of theft! There are witnesses!
I will not mention the other things I have heard.
I will not tolerate such conduct in the city!
You must pay a penalty in order to atone for your crime.
It is one thing if you brawl with the rabble in the harbor ...
But when you attack citizens, or the king's soldiers, I must bring you to justice.
And that sheep thing wasn't really necessary either.
If I let you get away with it, soon everyone here will do whatever he wishes.
So, you will pay an appropriate penalty - and the matter will be forgotten.
I have heard that you were after our sheep.
You realize that I cannot let that go.
You will have to pay compensation!
How much?
I want to pay the penalty!
Good! I shall see to it that everyone in the city learns of it - that will restore your reputation to some degree.
I don't have enough gold.
Then see to it that you acquire the gold as quickly as possible
And I'm warning you: if you add to your guilt, things will get worse for you.
Innos be with you, stranger! What brings you to me?
I've got an important message for Lord Hagen.
Well, you stand before one of his men. What is this about?
Lord Hagen receives only paladins or those who are in service to the paladins.
It is beneath his dignity to waste his time with members of the common folk.
It's about a sacred artifact - the Eye of Innos.
The Eye of Innos - I have never heard of it. But that doesn't necessarily mean anything.
If there truly is an artifact of this name, only the highest members of our order would know anything about it, in any case.
That's why I have to talk to Lord Hagen himself.
The hosts of orcs are led by DRA-
(interrupting) I KNOW that the armies of the orcs are growing ever stronger.
You don't mean to tell me that THAT is what you wish to report to Lord Hagen.
He would tear your head from your shoulders if you wasted his time with such stories.
And I am sure that you are clever enough to know that for yourself.
So, what is this really about?
That I must tell Lord Hagen myself.
Suit yourself. But you should know one thing:
Why are you paladins in town?
The goals of our mission are secret.
I can only tell you that there is no danger for the citizens of the town.
You need not worry.
Will you tell me now why you paladins have come to Khorinis?
Why are you paladins in town?
Now you belong to the city guard, therefore you are also subordinate to the paladins.
Now I can take you into confidence.
We have come on a mission from King Rhobar. With the collapse of the Barrier, the deliveries of ore have failed.
Therefore, we are getting the ore and bringing it to the mainland. With the ore, we shall forge new weapons and drive the orcs back.
I want to take up service with the paladins!
Good. I can well use every able man here. No matter what his reasons for joining us.
If you place yourself in the service of the paladins, I shall help you get an audience with Lord Hagen.
An honorable request.
However, I have my orders only to accept citizens of the town in the militia.
My commander is afraid that spies or saboteurs could sneak in.
He wants to limit the risk this way.
Therefore, you must first be a citizen of the town - whether this rule makes sense or not is disputable, but orders are orders.
What should I expect with the militia?
Let me make one thing clear. To be a soldier of the militia means much more than strolling through the city in a uniform.
It is a dirty and even a bloody job. Once you are one of us, a great deal of work will be waiting for you.
But it is worth it. Besides the pay, you might someday have the chance of becoming a holy warrior of Innos.
Look, I've got this letter of recommendation from your provisions master.
(disbelieving) What? Show me.
(impressed) Well, I'll be ...! This must have cost you quite an effort. It's no easy feat to get something like this out of Martin.
All right. I'm convinced. If Martin vouches for you, I shall let you join. Let me know when you're ready.
Isn't there a faster way to join you?
Mmh (stops short) - you're really serious about this, aren't you?
Good, listen. I have a problem. If you solve it for me, I shall see to it that you are accepted into the militia.
But the most important thing is: you must not breathe a word of it to anyone!
What's your problem?
Recently there have been a number of thefts in the city. Thus far, we have not been able to capture anyone, the thieves are simply too skillful.
The scum know their business. I am sure that we're dealing with an organized gang.
It would not amaze me if there were a thieves' guild in Khorinis. Find the  leaders of the gang and hunt them down.
Then I shall see to it that you are accepted into the militia - regardless of whether or not you are a citizen.
But you must say nothing about our agreement!
Where should I start looking for the thieves?
If I knew that, I would go there myself!
I can only tell you this much: We recently turned the entire harbor district upside-down and found nothing, absolutely nothing.
The people there are not very talkative, particularly if you wear the armor of a paladin.
But you are an outsider, they will not distrust you so quickly.
You could ask around the harbor first. But be careful. If the people there realize that you are working for the paladins, you will learn NOTHING!
What should I do once I've found one of the thieves?
If it is a matter of a lackey, a henchman or some small fry, it would be best if you avoid a fight.
Come rather to me and report. I shall then see to it that the fellow winds up behind bars.
The city guard could intervene in an open battle and you would not have the opportunity of explaining to them what is going on.
Furthermore, there is a bounty for every rotten apple you put behind bars.
However, if you locate the leaders' hideout - well - then you probably won't be able to avoid a fight.
I've come to collect the bounty for a criminal.
Rengaru stole from the merchant Jora. He tried to skedaddle, but I caught him.
Good, my men have already picked him up. He won't be stealing from anyone else in the near future.
Here is your money.
Halvor is a fence. He sells the goods that the bandits steal from the merchants.
So he's behind it. My men will lock him up at once.
I don't think he'll create any difficulties. I shall give you your bounty now.
Nagur has killed Baltram's messenger. He tried to use me as his new messenger in order to intercept Akil's shipment.
That fellow will get his just punishment. I shall have him locked up immediately.
Here, take the bounty that you are entitled to.
Canthar the merchant is trying to get rid of Sarah!
Sarah? The weapons merchant in the marketplace?
I was supposed to foist a letter on Sarah which claimed that she's supplying weapons to Onar.
I see. I shall gladly pay the bounty for that bastard. He is already as good as behind bars.
Sarah is selling weapons to Onar.
Sarah? The weapons merchant in the marketplace? Do you have proof of that?
She has a letter in her pocket which details the delivery of arms to him.
She won't get away with that. I shall have her arrested.
About the thieves' guild ...
You can forget the business. I have sent a few men down into the sewers.
The thieves' guild is now merely a sad chapter in the history of this city.
Yes?
I'm working on it ...
All right. I shall give you a bit more time to fulfill your mission.
Good! Keep me informed.
I found the hideout of the thieves' guild!
Where?
In the sewers below the city.
What? We have sealed off the sewers ...
It looks like that didn't keep them from spreading out down there.
Have you hunted down the criminals?
I hunted them all down!
You have done the city a great service.
If you are still interested in a position with the militia, let me know.
You have fulfilled your duty, as is proper for a servant of Innos and a soldier of the king.
You are entitled to the bounty for the bandits. Here, take it.
I'm ready to join the militia!
Martin, the provisions master, vouches for you and has even recommended you. That alone is enough for me.
I shall keep my part of the agreement and accept you into the militia, even though you are not a citizen of the town.
But don't tell the whole world about it! The fewer people who learn about this exception, the less I shall have to justify myself afterwards.
Then you are a citizen of Khorinis?
The blacksmith has taken me on as an apprentice.
Harad? I know him. He works for us. He is a good man.
I am the alchemist's apprentice!
We don't exactly have a lot of scholars in the militia. Perhaps your abilities could be of great use to us.
I don't know much about the alchemist. But people say he is an honorable man.
Bosper the bowyer has taken me on as his apprentice.
Then you also know something about living in the wild? That is good, because the militia has assignments not just within the city walls.
We can certainly use people who know their way around in the wilderness.
And the bowyer is an important man in the city.
If he vouches for you, there is nothing standing in the way of your acceptance into the militia.
Furthermore, you have managed to rid us of the thieves' guild. I would have accepted you for that alone.
That may be - but you are still not a citizen of this town and I have my orders.
You can join us if you wish. But your decision will be final.
Once you wear the armor of the militia, you cannot simply take it off and no longer belong to us.
Are you prepared to fight together with us for Innos and the king?
I'm ready!
Then so shall it be. Welcome to the militia.
Here is your armor.
Wear it with pride and dignity.
I'm not quite sure yet ...
As long as you still have doubts about your decision, I cannot accept you into the militia.
Can I finally see Lord Hagen now?
You are now in the service of the paladins. They will let you in. But you had better have something important to say.
Don't worry, I do ...
Remember that you are meeting the chief paladin. Behave yourself accordingly. You represent not only yourself now, but the entire militia.
Will I get a weapon, too?
Of course. Peck usually takes care of that. But it occurs to me that I haven't seen him for quite a while.
Find out where he's hiding and bring him here. Then he will give you a weapon.
And if you want to sleep, you can lie down in one of the beds in the bunkhouse.
I've managed to track down Peck.
Yes, he is already back at his post and going about his duty. Where did you find him?
He crossed my path in town.
All right, then go to him and get yourself a weapon.
He was in the 'Red Lantern'.
So, he's hanging around with the girls instead of doing his duty.
I believe I shall have a few words with him.
Here is your pay.
Have you got an assignment for me?
Lately there has been an increase in the sale of swampweed in the city.
We cannot allow this stuff to catch on.
Otherwise, everyone here will start smoking and no longer be able to work, let alone wield a weapon.
Particularly now that there is the danger of a possible attack by orcs or mercenaries.
I suspect that the mercenaries are behind it. I bet they are bringing the stuff into the city.
What is there to do?
Mortis, one of our men, heard in the harbor pub that a package of swampweed has arrived somewhere in the harbor district.
Look around down there and bring me the package.
About the package ...
Have you found it?
Not so far.
Yes, here it is.
Good work. We shall guard the weed securely.
I threw it into the harbor basin.
So? Well, the main thing is that it can no longer fall into the wrong hands.
Have you got another job for me?
You have taken the package of swampweed out of circulation - good.
But I would like to know who is distributing the stuff among the people.
It must be someone in the harbor district.
If someone regularly came from outside the city, he would have been caught some time ago.
What exactly am I to do?
Find the dealer and get him to sell you some weed. That will not be easy, but we cannot arrest him otherwise.
Talk to Mortis, he knows the harbor district. Perhaps he can help you.
About that weed ...
I do not believe that we will learn anything in the harbor district now.
Not since that bouncer is dead.
This girl from the Red Lantern, Nadja, is dead. Must have been some freak accident.
You were not discreet enough.
I know who's selling the weed in town. It's Borka, the doorman at the Red Lantern.
Indeed? Do we have proof?
He sold me some swampweed.
Fine, that's enough for us. I shall have him arrested at once.
... I'm still working on it.
Good, remember that you must get the fellow to do business with you.
Have you got another assignment for me?
Lobart the turnip farmer has problems in his fields.
If we help him, it will solidify his relationship with the city. So go to him and see what is wrong.
I've helped Lobart.
Excellent. If Lobart is happy, then he will continue to sell his turnips to the city.
What about the missing people?
What about them?
Shouldn't we try to find them?
Lord Hagen gave me orders to protect the town and the surrounding farms.
That means that we're taking care of the people who are still HERE.
The militia patrols the streets at night. That's all I can do.
And YOU will take care of the tasks I give you, understood?
About those missing people ...
Just leave me alone with THAT. I've got other problems.
I've been able to rescue some of the missing people.
And here I was, wondering where the hell you've been all this time!
You're a member of the militia! You were not given orders for such an action!
But ...
How many people did you find?
All those who were still alive ...
All?! I ... Er ...
I am so proud of you! And I'm glad that I let you join us.
That was a grand deed.
You had better go directly to him.
I was in the Valley of Mines and saw the dragons!
I have a letter from Commander Garond that confirms everything I said.
That'll interest Lord Hagen!
What about Bennet, the blacksmith?
You mean the mercenary? He is sitting in jail where he belongs.
Can I talk to him?
Certainly, just go in. But if you try to help him escape, you will be in for it.
I think that Cornelius is lying.
Are you sure?
No.
Then you should not announce your suspicion so loudly.
Cornelius is an influential man. He can make your life hell if he wants to.
As long as you have no proof, I cannot help you.
Yes.
What proof do you have?
I've read his diary! They bribed him. Everything was just a bunch of lies.
If that is really so, you must go to Lord Hagen immediately.
Show him the diary. He will take care of the rest.
Ehhm, well, I think ...
I need proof, not suppositions. Get the proof, then I can do something for you.
Until then, you should think carefully about what you say.
So now you are a paladin! Congratulations!
I thought from the beginning that you wouldn't stay with the militia long.
How's the situation in town?
Everything is under control.
Carry out your assignments.
From now on you report directly to Lord Hagen. Go speak to him.
I have killed all the dragons in the Valley of Mines!
If that is true, you must tell Lord Hagen about it.
The castle in the Valley of Mines has been stormed by the orcs!
No! Lord Hagen must hear of this.
Don't I know you? You are Cor Angar. You used to be a templar in the swamp camp.
(resigned) Call me Angar. I have set aside my title. The Brotherhood of the Sleeper has disbanded.
Curious, but you seem somehow familiar to me. Yet, I cannot quite recall you.
What's the matter with you?
(dismissively) Oh. I haven't been able to sleep properly for some time. These constant nightmares.
The Brotherhood of the Sleeper has been enslaved by evil.
Your former friends from the swamp camp roam the land wearing black robes and feeling really irritated by anything that moves.
What are you talking about?
They serve the enemy now and are nothing but soulless warriors of evil.
By all the gods. Would that I had not allowed myself to be blinded so. That will never happen to me again, that I swear.
How did you get here?
After the collapse of the magic barrier, I hid myself in the mountains. It became time for me to do something.
I strayed about for days, until I suddenly awoke in the castle. Do not ask me what happened. I don't know.
To make matters worse, I have also lost the amulet which I have had for years. I shall go mad if I do not find it again.
Where exactly did you lose your amulet?
Somewhere in the south, shortly before I awoke here in the castle.
It must be here somewhere.
I suspect it was stolen. I absolutely must have it back.
What happened to the others from the swamp camp?
The last thing I remember is that the Barrier collapsed, accompanied by a nerve-shattering scream.
Stricken with panicked fear, we fell to the ground, writhing in pain. That voice. It grew ever louder.
And then when it was over, they all ran mad and disappeared into the bleak night, screaming loudly.
I have not seen them again.
What will you do next?
I shall rest a while first, so that I may take up the search for my lost amulet.
I have heard something of dragons.
It is also being said that many warriors have come to the Valley of Mines to hunt them.
I am thinking of joining them.
I found your amulet.
Thank you. I thought I would never see it again.
What makes it so special for you?
It was a gift.
I see.
What are you planning to do now?
Get out of this accursed valley.
Perhaps we shall meet again. Farewell.
Maybe I can help you find your amulet.
Why not. Some help cannot hurt.
What about the dragon hunters?
I will speak with them later. Maybe they can use a strong arm.
When will you go?
As soon as I feel better.
Where do you want to look?
I shall go to the south, where I was last.
There is a cave tomb there, surrounded by many boulders.
I've got to go.
Watch your back.
Is something wrong?
Do you hear that? Never in my life have I heard such a dreadful noise!
What do you mean? I don't hear a thing!
The whole area here stinks of death and destruction. The putrid creatures guard the rocky entrance to the crypt in front of us.
Something ghastly is concealing itself in there and sending its henchmen to the surface of this world.
I am almost certain that my amulet was lost somewhere here.
Have you talked to the dragon hunters?
Yes. But I had expected a fellowship like the one we had in the Swamp Camp.
The boys are nothing but a wild, motley collection of idiots. It's nothing for me.
What's hiding in the cave in the rocks?
Something will not let me get close to the entrance!
It is guarded by a magical creature. I have seen it at night, searching the area. A disgusting thing.
It glides back and forth between the trees, and you get the impression that it sucks up all life in its surroundings like a sponge.
Let's go together.
I shall try it. But be careful.
(bellows) Only death and destruction. I must get out of here.
(whispers) There it is! Do you hear that?
What's the matter?
I cannot go farther with you.
Something tells me that I will never get out of here alive.
I can't explain it, but ...
I have to get out of this accursed land as quickly as possible, otherwise I'm going to suffer the same fate as my brethren.
Every time I face one of these ... hellspawn, I have the feeling that I am fighting my own people.
Angar? What are you doing here?
I was on my way to the pass when I bumped into the orcs. I couldn't shake off the god-forsaken brutes.
I'll wait a while and then move across the pass. I'll see you on the other side!
I don't like to leave you alone!
Sure. Off you go. I'll see you.
How are you?
The headaches have become unbearable since we've been here on the island.
Damnit. This finally has to end.
Don't worry about me. Let's get out of here.
You had damn well better hurry. The next attack by the orcs will cost us our lives.
I'm doing my best.
That's not enough.
So help me and stop complaining.
I will. You go first. Move on.
Relax.
That's easy for you to say. I'm about to lose my mind here.
Stay back now.
I'll have to take care of the rest by myself.
Good luck.
Sure thing.
Follow me.
You go first.
Aarh! These headaches are driving me insane!
You pulled through.
Can we finally get out of here?
Yep. The enemy has been defeated.
Then let's not waste any more time. Go to the captain and tell him to weigh anchor.
I hope there aren't any more of you renegade sect members.
Anything is possible. The Seekers were very thorough, though. Even I almost became enslaved by them. Who knows?
What will you do next?
Maybe I'll retire to the country and become a farmer. I'm tired of fighting.
How's it going?
Quite well. But I still have these miserable headaches, although they've gotten better since I'm no longer in the Valley of the Mines.
I'll stay here. Then you'll know where to find me if you need me.
I'm going to leave Khorinis. Would you like to join me?
The farther I get from the Valley of Mines, the better. When do we go?
Right now, I've got enough people to man the ship. Maybe I'll get back to you later.
Fine. I'm here if you need me.
Go to the harbor, then. I'll meet you there later.
On my way.
I'll let you know when it's time to go.
Good.
Stay here and take care of your pain.
All right. I'll go back. Maybe it's better that way.
Come back on board.
You're worse than I am. A bit more decisiveness would do you good. See you later.
(quietly) Ah - finally. I've been waiting for you, stranger.
Who are you?
I'm called Attila ... but is my name important? Our names are meaningless.
You should know that best, stranger. (laughs quietly)
What do you want from me?
I'm here to explain a few things to you. And afterwards, I'm going to kill you.
What's this farce about?
You shouldn't die ignorant at the end of your journey. Consider it a final show of respect to the condemned.
I'm going to leave now ...
I'm afraid ... I can't allow that. Resign yourself to it. It is time to die.
Who pays you for this?
My employers work out of the public view, as do I.
A condition of my contract is that I name neither their names nor their residences.
Why do you want to kill me?
You blew the whistle on Halvor. Now he's sitting in jail. That was not part of the plan.
You sold Rengaru to the city. He is only a petty thief, but you shouldn't have done that.
Nagur is behind bars because of your interference. An unforgivable mistake, as some see it.
My employers are not exactly pleased about it. To prevent you from making yet another mistake, they have sent me.
I can give you gold - a lot of gold.
Futile. That's not why I have come. The only price that you will pay is your life. And right now.
Let me at least draw my weapon.
Good, then prepare for your last battle.
You're not even wearing one on your belt. You don't have much time left, stranger. Your death awaits you.
Ah - finally. I've been waiting for you, stranger.
Who are you, and what do you want from me?
That isn't important. What is important is what you've done. You have remained loyal - even if you weren't aware of it.
Some benefactors have become aware of your loyalty. And they are offering you a chance. So use it.
Hey, just tell me why you're here.
I have a gift for you. Everything else is up to you, stranger. (laughs quietly)
My task is done - for now.
But who knows, perhaps our paths will cross again...
Who are you?
I'm called Attila ... but is my name important? Our names are meaningless.
You should know that best, stranger. (laughs quietly)
Hello, beautiful maid.
Stop trying to sweet-talk me, boy. Tell me what you want. I'm busy.
How's the field work coming?
Look at these huge fields we have to work, and you know how it's coming.
Are you looking for farm work?
Maybe.
In that case, you should go and see our farmer Sekob, the old slave-driver. Maybe he's got something for you.
Of course, you could also try Onar's farm at the end of the long road.
But beware of the mercenaries. They don't take to strangers.
No. Actually, I want to become a mercenary.
Then you're wrong here. You can usually find the mercenaries on the landowner's farm.
Say, the nasty fellow over there ...
That's Bronco. What about him?
Is that your farmer?
(laughs) Is that what he told you? Sekob is our farmer. Bronco is nothing but a layabout and ne'er-do-well. But strong as an ox.
That's why nobody says anything when he doesn't work.
He fears no one except for you mercenaries.
The only people who could get him to work are the mercenaries. He's afraid of them.
Where's Rosi?
She couldn't stand it here any longer and went north, into the woods.
And apart from that?
I'm busy.
(shyly) Hello, you're also new here, aren't you?
Yes. How long have you been here?
I've been here for four weeks. Have you already been given a fighting staff?
Not so far.
Then take this one. We novices all carry a staff as a sign of our ability to defend ourselves. Can you fight?
Well, I've wielded a weapon or two ...
If you want, I can teach you something. However, I have a request ...
What request would that be?
Well, one of the paladins, Sergio, is in the monastery at the moment.
If you can persuade him to go through a few exercises with me, then I'll train you.
I shall see what can be done.
I talked to Sergio. He's going to train with you every morning for two hours, starting at five o'clock.
Thanks! What an honor for me!
If you want, I'll also show you the secrets of combat.
I'm ready for training.
You've learned everything about two-handed combat that I can teach you.
Fight for Innos. Innos is our life - and your faith gives you strength.
A servant of Innos never provokes an opponent - he surprises him!
No matter where you go - always take your staff along.
A servant of Innos is always prepared to fight. If you don't have any magic, your staff is your most important defense.
A servant of Innos fights not only with his staff, but also with his heart.
You have to know the point up to which you can retreat.
Remember, you fight well if you control your opponent and don't give him a chance to be in control himself.
You have only lost when you have given up.
Here, have a sausage.
Oh, mutton sausages, great! They taste the best - come on, give me another sausage!
Then I won't have enough left for the others.
You have one sausage too many anyway. Namely, the one for you. And what's a sausage among friends?
Come on, I'll give you a 'Fire Arrow' spell scroll for it.
All right, here, take another.
All right. Here's your spell scroll.
No, I won't do that.
Man, you're one of those people who are very particular about everything, huh?
What happened between you and Agon?
Oh, we had a disagreement about how to take care of fire nettles.
Agon had watered them so much that the plants almost had root rot already.
Once the roots were completely rotten, he blamed me for it.
They've made me sweep the courtyard all day ever since.
Why did Agon do that?
You'll have to ask him that. I think he just can't stand it when someone is better than he is.
You seem to know a thing or two about plants?
We had an herb garden where I learned a few tricks from my grandpa.
I'd really prefer to work in the garden again.
I'm supposed to sweep the novices' chambers.
You've saddled yourself with a lot of work there. You know what - I'll help you. You'll never finish that alone.
But I really need a 'Fist of Wind' spell scroll - you know, I got lucky and was allowed to read a book about it.
And now, naturally, I want to try the spell. So, get me the spell scroll and I'll help you.
About the spell scroll ...
Do you have a Fist of Wind spell for me?
Here's the spell scroll you wanted.
That's good. Then I'll help you clean the chambers.
No, not so far.
Then I'll wait until you do.
How's life here in the monastery?
I don't mean to complain, but I never thought that it would be so strict here. If you don't stick to the rules, they punish you.
Of course, a lot of novices want to study the teachings of Innos in the library, so they can be prepared if they're chosen.
But I think the best preparation for the test of magic is fulfilling our own tasks.
What's the deal with the Chosen and that test?
Talk to Brother Igaraz. He knows a lot about that.
How are you?
(humbly) I thank the magicians for my task.
I enjoy working in the garden and hope that the magicians are satisfied with me, Master.
(startled) F.. f.. fine, Master.
I, I work hard and try not to disappoint the magicians.
What are you doing here?
(sheepish) I try to accomplish the tasks given to me to the satisfaction of the monastery.
I must not speak with you. It is not looked on with favor if we talk to strangers.
You must never lose faith.
(caught in the act) No, ... I mean, I would never do such a thing. Honest!
We all are often put through severe tests.
Yes, Master. I will always remember that. Thank you.
That doesn't sound terribly happy.
(caught in the act) Well ... I mean, everything is just fine, really.
Only ... Oh, I don't want to complain.
Stop whining then.
(afraid) I ... I ... please don't tell the magicians.
I don't want to be punished again.
I'll think about it.
Aw, come on, you can tell me.
And you really won't tell the magicians?
Do I look like I would?
All right. I have a problem with one of the novices. He's got a hold over me.
Come on, spit it out, then.
Igaraz, that's the novice, found some of my private papers.
He threatened to give them to the magicians if I don't do what he says.
I think that's a little too personal for me.
I understand, you don't want any trouble. Then I'll just have to deal with it myself.
You'll manage somehow.
What are you supposed to do for him?
I don't like to talk about it. In any case, it isn't pleasing to Innos.
I don't want to think what would happen if it came out.
What kind of documents are those?
(unsure) That's nobody's business. It's entirely my affair.
Come on, tell me.
They are, eh ... entirely normal documents. Nothing special.
I won't ask any further.
Maybe I can help you?
You would do that?
That depends, of course.
(hastily) Naturally, I'd pay you for that.
How much?
Of course, I don't have much money, but I could give you a spell scroll. I have a healing spell.
I'd rather stay away from that.
Then I don't have a choice, I have to play along.
I'll see what I can do.
(happily) Honestly, it just has to work. It has to!
So, you only need to find out where Igaraz keeps the stuff. Then you swipe it from him and everything will be just fine.
Relax. You just continue for now. I'll see to the rest.
I've got your documents.
Really? Thanks, you've saved me. I don't know how to thank you.
Yeah, yeah, just calm down.
(nervously) Are they really mine? Are you sure? Show me.
I'm going to keep them a little while longer.
(stunned) What!? What is that supposed to mean? What are you planning?
Just kidding.
(tartly) Ha ha, I can't laugh about it. So where are they?
Here.
I didn't mean to insult you, but I'm really nervous about the whole thing.
It's all right. Have fun with your DOCUMENTS, then.
That's my own business.
The documents belong to me. You don't have the right to keep them.
See you.
Igaraz and I are partners now.
(stunned) What? You can't do that.
Looks like I can. I shall keep those papers, and everything stays the way it is.
I shall settle the financial part with Igaraz.
Well, then, take good care of the plants.
You're a swine. A miserable, greedy swine. Innos will punish you.
Mind your language.
I'm being far too nice, like always.
Haven't you got anything to do?
I understand all right, but believe me, there will be consequences.
Based on the bare facts, the price has gone up.
You're no better than the others. What do you want?
What have you got?
I can give you 121 gold coins, that's all I have.
That won't be enough.
But I don't have any more money. If I had know that before, I never would have entered the monastery.
Agreed.
Here is the money and the spell scroll.
Here they are.
Yeah, they're complete.
Did you look at them?
Does that make a difference?
No, just as long as I have them back.
Now I hope I can rest easy again.
Are you satisfied with your task?
(less than convincing) Yes, of course. My faith in the wisdom and power of Innos gives me strength.
(wriggling out) I don't mean to seem disrespectful, but I have a lot to do today.
You may carry on.
(relieved) Thanks.
It's all right, but I need to get back to work, otherwise I'll never get finished today.
I don't want to work half the night again, in order to finish my obligation and stay out of trouble.
How are things?
Ah, a new face here on the farm. Has the old skinflint finally granted me an apprentice?
I'm not an apprentice.
Oh. I see. I'm not as young as I used to be, you know? And I've been waiting for a replacement for years.
You aren't here because the neighbors are annoyed, are you?
What's the work you do here?
Oh, I guard the sheep, and I've been doing that for as long as I can remember.
The animals are very loyal and very smart, you see. If you treat them well, they'll follow you for a lifetime.
Have you seen any bandits passing through here?
I certainly have. They passed along the edge of the field near Sekob's farm and entered the forest to the north.
They were carrying loads of weapons. They looked like they were all set to win the war against the orcs.
If my eyes didn't deceive me, they were also dragging a young woman along to the forest.
I really hope they left her alone.
I'm just glad they stayed away from our farm.
What's the trouble with your neighbors?
The grass on this side of the big field is always so stunted and dry. So I mostly go to the big pastures of the other farmers.
The landowner doesn't mind, but Bengar, the farmer on the high pastures, always makes a huge deal out of it when I take the animals up there.
He says Sekob should pay if I take his animals onto Bengar's pasture.
But Sekob won't spend a measly coin for that, so I can't go up onto the plateau anymore.
Where can I find the high pastures and Bengar's farm?
Follow this path and cross the big crossroad.
If you stick to the right, you'll see a big outcropping of rock. Behind that to the right are the high pastures and the pass.
Maybe I should talk to Bengar.
You'd do that for me? What will you tell him, I mean, I don't want any trouble, you hear?
We'll see about that.
You can bring your sheep back to Bengar's pastures. I've talked to him.
Thank you. I'll be right on my way.
Here, take these sheepskins as a token of my appreciation.
Everything else all right?
I can't complain. Thanks for asking.
These are bad times. I can't find my sheep!
I guess I'll have to fess up to Sekob.
Welcome, stranger, my name is Baltram. Have you come to stock up on food?
I'm afraid I'll have to disappoint you. I don't have much in stock right now.
But I'll be getting a new delivery soon.
If you've come to buy food from me, you can just go away again.
I don't think much of you mercenaries! You cause me nothing but trouble.
Why are you looking so doubtful?
I see that you bear the sign of the 'Ring of Water'.
So are you a member, too?
What if I am?
Then I would tell you that Lares wants to be relieved from his post down at the harbor.
Fine. If that's so, I'll see to it that somebody deals with it.
I see.
Have you got a job for me?
No, I already have an errand-boy. Try with the other merchants.
Are you looking for a job?
Sure, what's it about?
My errand-boy hasn't come back, and I'm waiting for a delivery from the farmer Akil.
And how much is it worth to you?
I'll give you 50 gold pieces.
Fine, I'm in.
Okay, just tell Akil that I sent you. He'll give you a package. Bring it to me.
Show me your wares.
They never should have let it get so far. Now one of the mercenaries has actually murdered a paladin.
Something had to happen one of these days!
People like you will get nothing from me.
Why?
First you stir up the farmers, and then you act like nothing happened.
Now beat it, you're driving away my customers.
(casually) You're doing business with pirates?
(feels caught) What? Who told you that?
I talked to one of them. He seems to be waiting for you in his bay.
What can you do? These are hard times. Everybody has to look after his own.
That was all I wanted to know.
You will bear the consequences for this!
Hey, listen. I'll tell you all that I know and, in return, you won't rat on me, okay?
Weren't you afraid of getting caught?
That could happen. You found out, too, didn't you?
But you'll keep your mouth shut, right?
(curtly) What is it you're trading?
I mostly supply them with food.
And for that, they give me the finest rum that is to be had in Khorinis.
(grins) I could take care of this deal for you.
That would be great. I cannot leave Khorinis at the moment.
Here, take this package and tell Skip not to be so stingy with the rum this time.
It should be at least 3 bottles.
(curtly) What do you know about the pirates?
(hastily) They live in a remote part of the island of Khorinis.
It can only be reached with a cog or some other ship, as far as I know.
The citizens of Khorinis fear them. Quite rightly so, for they're nothing but a bunch of nasty cutthroats.
Still, if you ask me, they're nowhere near as bad as the bandits.
I got the rum from Skip. But he gave me no more than 2 bottles.
(angrily) Damn expensive, that. Who does he think he is? Well, give it here then.
I can't give you much for it now. This here must be enough.
Where can I find Akil's farm?
Just go straight out here through the east gate and follow the road to the southeast.
After a short while, you'll come to a stone stairway. Go up that and from there you'll already be able to see Akil's farm.
I've got Akil's delivery.
Excellent. Finally I can offer fresh goods again. Here are your 50 gold pieces.
Couldn't we do business together after all?
Listen, if you bring me 10 hams and 10 bottles of wine, then I'll deal with you again.
I'll see what I can do.
I've got your wares.
Show me.
We already agreed on 10 hams. Come back when you have enough.
And what about the 10 bottles of wine? Did you forget them?
Hmm, it isn't the best quality, but in these times you can't be too picky.
Now there's nothing that keeps us from doing business together.
How's it going?
You're not from around here, are you? Never mind - neither am I.
Where did you hang around before?
In the woods, hunting scavengers and wolves together with some hunters.
But I gave it up. These are dangerous times. There's a lot of riff-raff running around out there ...
Where can I find the other hunters?
We had our camp outside, near the tavern, half way to Onar's farm.
But I don't know whether there's anyone left in the camp now.
There used to be two of us here in town, until a few days ago.
My friend Trokar is an excellent hunter.
So where is your friend Trokar now?
Well. It's a curious story.
Only a few days ago, we were both standing at the bar in Coragon's tavern, discussing the hunt.
Don't ask me what happened next. I had had a few by then.
I vaguely remember Trokar saying that he was going out to get a few swampweed reefers. He never came back.
Where does one get swampweed reefers?
Somewhere down at the harbor, as far as I know.
Didn't you go looking for him?
No. But I reported it to the militia.
But they haven't been able to find him yet.
I hope he didn't get attacked by a wolf, or worse.
I'm afraid that I'll stumble over his body some day when I'm out hunting.
I don't think I could bear that.
Bosper said you used to work for him ...
Yes, I did. But he was only interested in his blasted hides.
I told him how dangerous it's gotten out there. He didn't really listen to me.
Well, anyway he paid well - I can't complain about that.
Can you tell me anything else about him?
(laughs) Bosper had one of his bows stolen recently. In broad daylight.
Some guy just waltzed into his store, took a bow, and left.
The thieves are getting more and more brazen!
Can you teach me something about hunting?
I can teach you how to sneak properly and how to handle a bow.
If you want to learn how to skin an animal, go to Bosper. He's the one who taught me.
Teach me how to sneak!
All right - so, first you have to make sure that you shift your weight properly.
To achieve that, bend your knees and always put your foot down heel first.
Make sure that you always keep your weight on the foot you're standing on until you've got your other foot securely placed.
Most creatures you can't sneak up on unless they're sleeping. The beasts just smell you.
So always pay close attention when you're out there.
I want to be able to handle a bow better!
Okay, then let's see if I can teach you anything ...
You should now look for someone who knows more about it than I do.
All right, your aim has become more accurate already.
Why don't we go hunting together?
Hmm. With two it isn't so dangerous, that's true...
Do you know anything about hunting, then?
I mean, do you know how to skin an animal?
Do you have 50 gold pieces?
Yes.
All right, but I want to see 50 gold pieces. For that you can keep the skins and sell them to Bosper.
That's a fair deal, isn't it?
No.
Then it wouldn't be worth it.
Come back when you've learned something.
Later ...
Here they are ...
Where, then? You don't have the gold.
Let's go hunting!
All right, follow me. Outside the south gate is a wood where we should find more than enough critters.
(to himself) Probably more than we'd like ...
So, what do you think, should we go farther into the woods or not?
Let's go back!
That's what I'd prefer. We'd probably wind up running straight into the arms of an orc.
Let's go on.
All right. (to self) Let's hope this works out ...
That's it! I think I'm going back to the city.
It's just too dangerous out here for me - even with two of us.
So, see you!
You can sell the skins to Bosper.
Okay?
Yes. But I'm not going out of the city any more - at least not any time soon.
My knees are still shaking from the scare that orc gave us.
Sure. Let's bring down a few beasts!
You're the farmer here?
You could say so, but I'm really just a tenant.
All the land here is owned by one big farmer.
How do you make a living?
Mostly hunting and the wood we cut. Of course, we also raise sheep and work the land.
Onar saddles me with all these laborers, and I have to keep them busy somehow. Only a few of them are good hunters, you see?
You're employing day laborers?
Onar sends away the workers he can't use on his farm.
Then he sends them to me. I feed them and they work here for me.
Has anything strange happened around here lately?
Many strange things are happening these days.
But none as strange as the mysterious disappearance of Pardos.
He's one of my field workers, and certainly not the kind who would drop everything overnight and slink off just like that, you see.
What exactly is so strange about his disappearance?
Pardos is such a timid sort - the furthest he's ever been from the farm is to the end of my fields.
He would run away at the mere sight of a meatbug.
Those things may not be pretty to look at, but you really couldn't call them dangerous.
(disgusted) They say there's people who eat them. Gross.
You get used to it.
Maybe he was simply fed up.
Working in the fields was his life. I cannot imagine him having gone to work for another farmer.
With me, he could do whatever he wanted.
Any clues at all?
I think those bandits must have dragged him off. They've been roaming around this area for days now.
I once saw them drag a citizen of the town off to their camp.
It looked like they were going to make him a slave.
Where is this bandit camp?
At the far end of my fields, some stairs lead down to a small hollow. That's where they have made themselves at home.
I'd like to go look for Pardos there, but there's no way I'm going up against those guys.
And you had better give them a wide berth, too. They're not known for their sense of humor.
Has Pardos come back?
Yes, he's inside, resting. Thanks for everything you ...
Never mind.
Wait, I'd love to give you a reward, but I haven't got ...
Forget it.
Were the bandits carrying weapons when they passed by here?
What kind of a stupid question is that? How would they be bandits if they weren't armed?
I mean a whole LOAD of weapons. A big delivery.
I see. Yes, now that you mention it, they were carrying lots and lots.
Some in barrels, some in bags, and some on the cart they brought.
What do you think of Onar?
He's a greedy bastard who will get us all hanged in the end.
One of these days, the paladins will come out of the city and make us small farmers bleed for what he's doing here.
But I haven't got a choice. The militiamen only come here to collect and not to defend the farm.
If I held myself loyal to the city, I'd be very much on my own.
At least Onar sends some mercenaries now and then to see how we're faring.
What have you got against the royal troops?
It's obvious. There hasn't been any improvement now that the paladins are in the city. Just the opposite.
Now these cursed militiamen come onto our land even more often and steal everything they can, and the paladins don't do anything about it.
The only paladins that I've ever seen are the two guards at the pass.
They wouldn't budge an inch, even if the militia slaughtered us all.
The pass?
Yeah. The pass to the old Valley of Mines by the waterfalls at the other end of the high pastures.
Ask Malak about it. He was there a couple of times last week.
I'm supposed to deal with your militia problem.
What? I told Onar he should send a couple of his MERCENARIES.
This is my chance to prove myself.
Terrific. Do you know what the militia will do to me if you screw it up?
Here I was thinking no one would come now.
I already told Onar days ago. What am I paying my rent for?
These bastards come by here once a week and collect the taxes for the city.
It's a good thing you came just now. This is their usual time.
They should be here any moment.
There's so many of you. Why don't you just go up against the militia yourself?
It's true that there's a lot of us. But we're not trained fighters like the militia.
Let the militia come, then, I'll deal with them!
I can't wait. Here they come now. See, I told you so.
Just don't screw it up!
Well then, good luck! You show 'em.
Your militia problem is a thing of the past.
Are you crazy? Do you know what those guys will do to me when you're gone?
They're still standing around over there. Tell them they should disappear COMPLETELY!
Not bad. Maybe there'll be something left over at the end of the month now for a change. Thanks.
You even wanted to pay for me. That's very decent of you.
Balthasar the shepherd isn't allowed on your pasture?
Oh, yes. The story. I told him Sekob should pay me money if he wanted to lead the sheep to my pasture.
To tell the truth, that's only harassment. I just can't stand Balthasar.
The militia are gone, and Balthasar can use your land again.
Why?
(threatening) Because I said so.
Mmh. All right, whatever you say.
Let him find a place for his beasts somewhere behind the field.
Take care.
You too.
How are things?
Malak has disappeared and taken everything and everybody who would work for me with him. He said he was headed for the mountains.
He couldn't stand it here anymore.
Times are tough. I don't know how much longer I can hang on.
The hordes of monsters pouring out of the pass every day to haunt the high pastures are really getting to me.
If at least I had a few helpers or mercenaries.
There was even one who was willing to work for me. Changed his mind, though. I think his name was 'Wolf'.
Malak is dead.
Then everything will just get even worse.
I found you the mercenary you wanted.
I've never seen anyone like that on my farm. I can only hope it will work out.
Here, take this. I think you'll find it useful.
Malak is back.
It's about time. I thought I'd never see him again.
It'll be all right.
Malak is here again, but the situation has hardly changed.
Unless a miracle happens, all of us here will be wiped out.
Wolf is a strange fellow, but I think it will work somehow.
Without Malak, nothing gets done around here anymore. If something doesn't happen soon, I'll have to give up my farm.
Hopefully, he'll come back soon.
I do not sell any weapons. Khaled does. He is in the house with Onar.
What about forging equipment?
What do you need?
What kinds of weapons do you make?
Plain swords at the moment, not much else.
But if I had some magic ore I could forge weapons that are better than all comparable weapons made from regular old steel.
You wouldn't happen to know where to find some around here? (laughs) Besides in the Valley of Mines, I mean.
No.
Of course not.
Are you with the farmers or the mercenaries?
You're pulling my leg, aren't you?
I was just curious.
Have you ever seen a farmer who also forges weapons?
No.
Then why do you ask such stupid questions?
I want to join the mercenaries!
Stop blabbering then, go to Torlof and let him put you to the test.
I have passed the test.
Good, I'll vote for you, then.
Can you teach me how to forge a sword?
Sure.
That will cost you a bit, though. Let's say 30 gold pieces.
Fine. Here's 30 for you.
And that was a damn good price, too! We can start as soon as you're ready.
Stop playing me for a sucker. 30 and not a coin less.
Maybe later.
Teach me how to forge a sword!
It's quite simple: get yourself a piece of raw steel and hold it into the fire until it glows.
Then put it on the anvil and hammer the blade into shape.
Most important, watch out that the blade doesn't get too cold. You only have a few minutes at a time to work on your weapon ...
The rest you can find out for yourself - it's merely a matter of practice.
Teach me how to forge magic ore weapons!
But you don't even know the basics.
First you need to learn how to forge a decent sword. Then we'll see.
As long as you aren't one of us, I'll be damned if I tell you the secret of the magic ore weapons.
Only very few blacksmiths know it at all, and I believe that not even the smiths in town know anything about it.
And that's a good thing, too. Otherwise, those boozers of the city guard would all be wielding magic swords next.
Nothing against you. (grins) You seem to be OK.
If I had magic ore, I might even do just that.
Aw, come on - I'm with the mercenaries, and I can forge - what else do you want?
Can you tell me, then, how I am supposed to forge a magic ore weapon without any magic ore?
Weeell ...
That's what I thought. I need at least 5 lumps of that ore - or you can forget it,
Great, you brought me the ore, and you also know how to forge a decent sword.
Well, fire away, then ...

The most important thing is: It doesn't matter at all whether your weapon is made of magic ore throughout, or if you have only coated a simple steel blade with a layer of ore. The surface is all that matters.
