And since the blasted stuff is so expensive, you just grab a steel billet and a few lumps of ore.
Naturally, it won't do to just coat a finished sword with magic ore. You'll have to forge the weapon yourself from scratch.
Everything else depends on the weapon you would like to produce.
Where can I find magic ore?
Well, if only I knew that. There must surely be some in the mining colony.
But maybe you'll luck out and find a few leftover morsels somewhere around here you can scrape together.
I think there are some mining tunnels in the mountains south of here. Maybe you'll get lucky there.
But watch out, I have heard it's teeming with bandits up there.
Here you are - 5 ore nuggets.
(laughs) Show me!
Really! Knock me down with a feather!
You can keep two of these things. You'll need them in order to forge your own weapon.
No, not yet. Come back later.
I want to know more about forging magic ore weapons.
I can teach you how to forge magic ore swords, or even two-handed blades.
I have improved my technique. Now I can teach you how to make bastard swords or heavy two-handed swords with ore.
I think I have outdone myself this time. I have designed two battle blades. That's the best thing I have seen so far.
Listen. I think I just had an ingenious inspiration. Magic ore weapons, coated with dragon blood. And I know exactly how I'll go about it!
(grins) Do you want to know?
What kind of weapon would you like to make?
How come you're in the slammer?
Those swine have thrown me in the hole. I'm supposed to have murdered a paladin.
But I didn't do it, they're only trying to frame me.
Why would they do that?
How would I know? You've got to get me out of here.
Talk to Lord Hagen, tear down the wall, who cares - just do something!
What happened?
I went downtown with Hodges to buy some supplies for our boys.
Suddenly we heard a loud scream and the sound of running feet.
Get to the point.
We knew at once that something had happened and that they would grab us at once if they saw us there.
We ran like hell. Then, just before we got to the city gate, I tripped and sprained my ankle.
The rest is soon told. The militia was on me at once, and they threw me straight into this hole.
Who was murdered?
I have no idea - one of the paladins, I don't know them.
Have you got a name?
Some Lothar, I think. Well, I don't know, I'm not really sure.
You had better ask Lord Hagen, he knows all the details.
Do they have any evidence against you?
They say they have a witness who recognized me.
Do you know who the witness is?
No. All I know is that he's lying.
Who leads the investigation?
Lord Hagen himself. Since the victim was one of the paladins, this falls under martial law.
What does that mean?
That's easy to guess. If I don't get out of here, they're going to let me swing without further ado.
You've got to help me, or there'll be a war. Lee's not going to take this lying down.
You can figure out for yourself what that means.
Man, and here I was thinking they'd really hang me!
Well, it worked out all right in the end.
You can say that again. You should have seen the face of the soldier when he had to let me out!
(laughs) He was so scared he almost did it in his pants.
Which reminds me, I've got something for you.
What do you mean?
(grins) A present.
What present?
We have heard of the dragons that are said to be in the valley.
They're really there!
All right, I believe you.
At any rate, some of the boys have decided to go into the valley as well.
(grins) They are planning to tidy up in there.
What's that got to do with me?
(proudly) I have developed a new type of armor. Dragon hunter's armor!
It is sturdier and lighter than traditional armor.
Since you're the one who saved me, I want you to have the first piece. It's a gift!
I thought you might want to be in on the fun. You're going to need the right equipment when you go down to that valley.
Also, I am interested in dragon scales. Genuine dragon scales. I shall pay you a good price for them.
How much do I get per scale?
Anyway, I thought you would surely want to participate in the upcoming dragon hunt.
And?
Here, take this amulet. I think you'll need it more than I do.
I've got a few dragon scales for you.
Genuine dragon scales!
Here's your gold!
All right, that should be enough. I could sell you new, improved armor if you want.
I want to buy the armor.
Very good. You'll be delighted with it.
I should certainly expect that at this price.
You'll find that it is worth every single gold piece.
You don't have enough gold.
I know how the armor can be improved even further.
(smiling to himself) Tell me, then.
You could coat the dragon scales with magic ore.
(laughs) That thought has already occurred to me, too. And you're right.
My newest armor beats everything you've ever seen. It is lightweight yet sturdy.
It is PERFECT.
You can buy it if you want. I don't make this offer to just anybody, and the price only just covers the manufacturing costs.
Give me the armor.
This is the best armor I have ever made.
A true masterpiece.
You don't have enough gold.
Can you repair jewelry?
That depends. You would have to show me the piece first.
Also, I need to get out of here first.
Before that, I can't do a thing, obviously.
Can you have a look at this amulet?
Sure, let me see.
Hmm, that is a beautiful piece of work. The setting is shot. I think I can fix it, though.
How long will it take you?
Well, I'm stuck here for now. Or do you see a forge in this place?
If I were in my smithy I could do it all in one day. But, of course, first I'll need to get out of here.
If you leave it here with me, it will be done by the time you come back tomorrow.
And I won't even charge you for it. You got me out of the slammer, after all.
Here's the amulet, please repair it for me.
All right. I'll have finished the new setting by tomorrow.
You can come to me and get it then.
Is the amulet ready?
Yes, here.
I had to make a new setting for the stone.
I worked on it all night, and now it's as good as new.
If you keep interrupting my work, it will take even longer.
Is there anything you can do with dragon eggs?
Dragon eggs? How the heck did you come by these?
I took them from some lizard people.
Let me see.
Mmh. Very sturdy material. Ideal for finishing armor. If one can manage to get them open, that is.
What about it, then? Do you want it?
Sure! Give it here.
How many more times are you going to shove that blasted thing at me? Do you want me to buy it or not?
I'll pay you, mmh, let's say 300 gold coins for each egg you can bring me.
It's a deal.
Right-o.
Then keep those things coming if you can get them.
Ehmm. You say you took it from lizard people?
Right.
Most lizard people dwell in caves, as far as I know.
It wouldn't surprise me if you found more of these things in the caves around here.
Here. Take this map. It'll help you find the caves.
But first you need to get a map of the caves from a cartographer in town. It would be a pity if you couldn't find them all.
These are dragon eggs, not paltry chicken eggs.
(exasperated) All right. 350 it is. But I can't give you more than that - or it just won't pay for me.
Save your gold, then. I think I'll keep it.
Let me know when you change your mind.
Interested in some more dragon eggs?
Sure!
Here. I've got another.
I've got some more here.
Great. Give here. Have you looked everywhere, then? Surely there must be more.
Just where do you dig up those things? There can't be many more now.
I don't think you'll find many more now. And I've got so many already, I hardly know what to do with them.
Oh, right. Here's your money.
I need to go to an island. I could use a smith.
And so you thought of me?
Yes. What do you say? At any rate, that would get you out of here.
Better than Onar's farm. Boy, even hell can't be THAT bad. Count me in.
My crew is already complete at the moment.
Then make sure to send one of them away again.
Be my smith, then. See you at the harbor.
All right. See you later.
I'm going to let you know when I need you.
Fine. I'm here.
I'm going to find myself a different smith.
It's this one minute, and that the next. Make up your mind, will you? Once you've figured out what you want, let me know.
Come back. I can't find another smith.
(irritated) Right! It's only me, so who cares. See you later at the dock.
Are you doing all right?
The smithy on the ship is a little on the rusty side. It's the sea salt that does it. It may be a little difficult to produce anything decent here. But apart from that...
Yes, provided the orcs don't come back.
What weapons can you sell me?
Only the best. You know that.
Can you teach me your craft?
Depends on what you want to make.
I want to become stronger.
In times like these, a strong arm is what's needed.
I've got a dragon egg here.
Well?
Well. I thought ...
I know what you're thinking. Forget it, keep the thing. I don't want it.
We've done all we needed to do.
I'm glad to hear that. I've had just about enough of this old smithy. I need to plant my feet on firm ground once more.
Come with me!
I don't need you to make a fool out of myself.
What are you doing here?
That is truly the stupidest question I have heard in a long time. What does it look like?
Never mind.
I can't tell anything from that idiotic face you're making. That's why I have to ask.
You're mouth is too big for my taste. It's time somebody shut it for you.
I haven't a clue.
I'm waiting for something to finally happen here.
What do you expect to happen?
Oh, man, you are really not the sharpest knife in the drawer. If I knew that, I wouldn't have to wait.
What could happen, then?
You're getting on my nerves. Look, I don't care what happens. Just as long as something does happen.
Why don't you do something, then?
If you don't stop asking stupid questions right now, I'm going to shut your dirty mouth.
If you just wait around here, nothing will ever happen!
That's it!
What are you hoping to find here in the Valley of Mines?
Gold and honor. What else? When I'm finished with the dragon, I'll be swimming in gold.
Enough to spend the rest of my life frequenting every tavern and cathouse in the country.
Either that, or you'll be dead!
So what? That's part of it. If you want to get rich, you've got to take a few risks.
Well, then, I wish you luck.
I don't need luck. Just my axe.
How would you like to work for me from now on?
We tried that once. Didn't work very well. Thanks, not interested.
Mmh. Why not? What are you paying?
I'll pay you 100 gold coins for now.
All right then. It's a start, anyway. Go ahead. I'll follow you.
You'll get half of the booty.
That sounds good. But I'm warning you, don't try ticking me, or you'll regret it.
And one more thing, I don't want any weapons or other junk you collect here. I'm only interested in gold, got it?
But, what am I saying. You already know all that.
Count yourself lucky if I spare your life.
Wait a minute! Didn't you say half the booty belonged to me? Give it here!
Here's your share.
All right. Let's get going.
I can't afford you.
Stop whining at me. We agreed on half.
Ich f�rchte, ich muss mich von dir trennen.
If you say so. Then I'll just have to take my share.
Really dicey area here. You go in front. I'll keep in the background.
Don't scatter your gold all over the place.
Better give it to me, then.
This is where our collaboration should end, I think.
Suit yourself. I can think of better things, too. So long.
I'm starting to get the feeling that I should get more money from you.
100 gold coins should do it.
No sweat. Of course, I haven't forgotten that we're splitting the booty.
That's why I won't bug you so often about giving me more money.
I want another 100 gold coins.
All right. You're worth it.
I should say so. Then let's get going.
You poor sucker, you can't even pay a man-at-arms.
I think I'll find another business partner.
I can't afford you.
Then you can just do your crap alone from now on.
Do you need a healing potion?
Sure. It can't hurt.
I guess I need to wait until you've got one for me.
Unfortunately, you don't have any at the moment. I'll get back to you later on that.
I'll give you something later.
But don't forget.
That's it. All the dragons are dead.
Yeah. And I'm still standing.
Are you sure that was the last one?
I should think so.
Too bad. I was just getting warmed up.
Would you fancy a little trip around the world?
What?
Never mind. My ship is full anyway.
Quit yanking my chain, man.
I'm going to leave Khorinis and go to an island to look for new opponents.
Won't you come along?
I don' t care about more opponents. I want ...
Where we're going, there will be more gold than you can carry.
If that's the case, I'm in. Where are we going?
But first we need to get you out of the Valley of Mines.
No problem. I'm on my way. Meet me at the pass.
I just thought I'd mention it.
Well, well. Have fun, then.
Will you make it across the pass?
Quit babbling. Go on. I want to finally get over the top.
And? Where are the riches you promised me?
So what did I tell you earlier, at sea?
For now, your task is to guard this ship.
I don't fancy swimming all the way back.
Crap. If I had known that, I'd have stayed in Khorinis.
All ship-shape aboard?
(irritated) Yeah, yeah. All is quiet.
Those dirty beasts!
Damnit, what are you doing up here? You're supposed to guard the ship.
It's not going to sink any time soon, man.
Was that it, then?
That was it for now.
Now, can I ...
You can raid the entire island for all I care.
Great.
Damn. Not now.
OK. Not much longer now.
I can't wait.
Hey, where do you come from? Have you come from the castle?
I just chanced to come by here ...
Boy, nobody just HAPPENS to come by here. We're screwed here - surrounded by snappers!
Not a day has gone by so far without one of us biting the dust.
You won't tell me where you came from? All right - may the snappers take you then!
Yes, I come from the castle - why?
What's the situation there?
No better than here. The orcs are still there, if that's what you mean.
Damn. You're not safe anywhere.
I'll tell you something. If I weren't scared shitless, I'd just beat it out of here.
What are you doing here anyway?
I'm the general dogsbody here. Schlep stuff around, keep an eye on the snappers, Bilgot here, Bilgot there.
I should have just stayed home with my old lady. It wasn't any different there, but at least there was something decent to eat.
And now I'm all that remains of the men-at-arms that were assigned to Fajeth.
How was I to know that this expedition wasn't going to make it back?
My pal Olav made himself scarce. Maybe HE pulled it off ...
What do you know about the snappers?
Why do you want to know that? And don't tell me you're just curious!
I'm going to hunt those snappers,
That's crazy. I've watched them - those are bloodthirsty beasts.
Then tell me what you know about them.
Hm ... I could help you - but only under one condition!
What do you want?
If you manage to kill the snappers - then you have to get me out of here!
I can't take it here much longer - have you talked to Fed? The guy is wrecked - and I don't want to end up like him!
Tell me what you know. Then I'll get you out of here!
I knew I could count on you. So, pay attention. I've watched the snappers for quite a while.
They're very cunning and have a kind of ... communication. They never go alone and attack only in a pack.
But there's something else. There's a lizard among them that's different. It rarely shows up - but I've seen it.
The other beasts bow when they go past it - but they always keep it in sight as they do so.
As long as that one doesn't move, no lizard in its vicinity will.
Where can I find that bloody beast?
I saw it by the steps to the old watchtower.
Fine. I think I understand. Thank you!
Remember, you gave me your word!
It's time, Bilgot! Pack your things, we're off.
I'm ready!
Can't you walk a little faster?!
I'm going as fast as I can.
Right, there we are. Now hit the road. This area's hot!
Thank you!
Don't get yourself eaten. That would be a pity.
Farewell!
What are you doing here? I thought you were headed across the pass?
I just can't go on. Let me rest for a moment. I'll manage. Don't worry!
If you say so.
Just a little break.
I found Olav.
And what's he up to?
He's dead. The wolves ate him.
Oh, damn. I hope that at least I will manage to get out of here.
How are things going with you?
What's up? Did Henry send you here?
Tell him he'll get his planks as soon as I'm done.
If he can't wait that long, he's welcome to saw them himself.
What are all these planks for?
We use them for the palisade, you dimwit.
Greg thought it would be a good idea to secure our camp this way.
We can save ourselves the work, if you ask me.
If the bandits are really planning to attack us, this ridiculous palisade isn't going to stop them.
We should never have tolerated them in our valley in the first place.
If I had known all this in advance, I'd have stayed in Khorinis.
Can I help you saw?
Nah, I can handle this by myself.
I joined up here not long ago, and letting others do my work won't get me anywhere, if you get my drift.
What are you doing now?
I'm taking a break.
(gloating) Francis got my old job.
Let him saw planks until his arms fall off.
I'm looking for Angus and Hank.
(sighs) I've no idea where they are - the bandits must have got them.
You were friends with them, weren't you?
All I know is that they were going to meet up with the bandits in a cave not far from here.
It must be somewhere outside of our camp, to the east.
I don't know where exactly. I've never been there myself.
Maybe you should ask Alligator Jack about this. He's always roaming around outside the camp.
I found your friends.
And? Where are they?
They're dead.
(hatefully) Those damned bandits did this!
It's possible.
Those cursed swine. May they roast in hell.
(to himself, hatefully) If only I knew the name of the lowlife who did this ...
I know who murdered Angus and Hank.
(excitedly) Who? Who did it?
His name is Juan, he's one of the bandits.
You've got to do that bastard in, do you hear me?
He must not get away with this.
Juan is history.
(eagerly) And? Did he suffer?
Come off it, kid!
(sighs) Oh well. Just as long as you killed the swine.
You've been to Khorinis?
Yes, I kept myself afloat there picking pockets and doing a little swindle or two.
But when ever fewer ships came in, business got worse and worse.
At some point, I got tired of being on the run from the militia for a few crusts of bread.
That's when I joined Greg. Now I'm stuck here.
(sighs) Sawing all day to build a palisade that's of no use to anyone.
Can you teach me something?
Well, I could show you how to pick other people's pockets unnoticed.
But you should be fairly dexterous, or you can just forget it.
Show me how to pick pockets.
First, you need to make your intended victim feel completely safe.
I used to walk up to people and chat to them. That worked like a charm.
Then you can take a snatch, but make sure they don't notice a thing.
Anything else?
Yes, keep training your dexterity. The more dexterous you are, the more chances you'll recognize.
And the sooner you can relieve your victim of his stuff without getting CAUGHT!
That's all - in theory, at least.
Forget it! You're not nimble enough!
You'll have to become more dexterous first, or find a better teacher.
So, you slimy worm, you have indeed dared to come before the gate of the master.
Are you the one pulling the strings here?
I am the Guardian of the Halls of Irdorath. The mightiest source of Beliar's power on earth. The divine strength of the master flows through my hands.
Only one word from me and you will fall into eternal madness.
I see. Guess I'll have to rid myself of another middleman.
Who's your master?
He is a wanderer between the worlds. His divine wisdom enlightens us.
He is the chosen of Beliar, who will free the kingdom from the wretched followers of Innos.
He brings death to all who doubt his splendor.
Sounds familiar.
What's hidden behind that huge portal over there?
(laughs) My lord's chambers remain inaccessible to you. I shall give you no opportunity to open the gate.
You used to be a follower of the Sleeper.
That is the distant past. The master has opened our eyes. No one can stop us now.
The master has shown us the only possible way to deal with you unbelievers.
Just how many more of your kind will I have to kill?
We are many. You have no idea how numerous are those who await this time of freedom.
Cries of lamentation will flood across the land when we go out into the world.
To free the world of the barbarians who call themselves the Guardians of the Fire. Our gathering here in the temple will not last long.
Yes.
(threatening) Enough of this drivel! I shall destroy you.
Your sight will fade and your spirit will vanish into the darkness.
(to himself) Without that soul summoning amulet, I'd have a serious problem now.
Hey, how did you get in here?
Through the entrance.
Funny... I HATE jokes.
You killed the minecrawlers? Good. I'll take over now. Go on, beat it.
Wait a minute.
You still aren't gone?
We still have to set something straight.
I'm looking for Raven.
Yeah - and what makes you think that Raven wants to talk to YOU of all... wait, are YOU... Is it YOU?
You're the guy we've been looking for the whole time. What are YOU doing here? You should be long dead!
People are always telling me that.
Those morons all failed - but you won't get past me. This time I'll finish you!
Like I already said - it's Raven I'm looking for - you aren't important to me.
I'll kill you - I've survived every battle so far!
Enough talk. Let's fight.
(triumphant) It's too late for you anyway! Raven is opening the temple right now! Hahahaha - Die, bastard!
HAHAHA - I'll defeat you all the same!
AARGH! You miserable dog!
And I survived the explosion of the Barrier without a scratch!
You can't defeat me, I'm Raven's best friend! His right hand!
And I thought I did you in.
Everything comes to an end.
And who do you think brought down the Barrier?
You and a lot of other guys, too...
Obviously he's got no time to be picky...
Yes, that was his biggest mistake...
How's it going?
The militia has bullied us long enough. Now that the mercenaries are on our side, they won't dare to just show up here any more.
The King may think he can get away with anything. But we're not going to take it any more.
Good. If you see a few militiamen, pound them one for me too, will you?
Good. Innos be with you.
The King's troops aren't exactly welcome on the farm.
A lot of people here may talk to you anyway, but you certainly won't make yourself popular.
In town, they're talking about a peasants' revolt!
Nonsense. We aren't doing anything except defending what we've worked hard for.
It's certainly true that the war is being fought on the backs of the peasants. But Onar is no longer prepared to just stand by and watch while the king bleeds us dry.
Can I rest somewhere around here?
If you're looking for a place to sleep, go to the barn. But don't lie down in a mercenary's bed by mistake.
Onar makes sure that they leave us farmers alone, but with strangers who don't belong on the farm, the mercenaries can do whatever they like.
Cipher told me somebody stole a package of swampweed from him ...
And?
He thinks you're the one who took it.
Oh, THAT's why the guy is always gawping at me so stupidly.
I've been extra friendly to him lately, because he seems to have hit a rough spot.
But there was nothing I could do. I'd look at him friendly like and he'd stare at me like he wanted to kill me.
Give me that weed, or else!
Listen, all I've got is this one reefer of weed. Take it and leave me alone.
You know that Onar's mercenaries look out for us, right?
So don't do anything stupid!
I don't believe a word you're saying. Give me the swampweed!
I don't have it. Honest.
What do you want here?
I want to see the prisoners.
Yeah, go ahead and say good-bye to your pal.
We've put away the swine who murdered Lothar the paladin.
All the cells are empty at the moment.
All right, mate.
Of course.
Go ahead, but don't stay away too long, understood?
You haven't come to get your buddy out of here, have you?
Forget it! As soon as I raise the alarm, the boys will be here in an instant!
And then we'll have us some minced mercenary! (dirty laugh)
Hey, you're the guy who filed a complaint against Canthar, the merchant.
Lots of people came here to vouch for him. Well-respected people.
The matter must have been a misunderstanding. These things happen.
In future, you should be more careful about who you send to jail.
I'm sorry. I've got no time right now.
I've got some training to do.
The canyon awaits.
How's it going?
I can't complain. It's a bit boring, but at least I don't have to work.
I'm preparing for the next task that Greg has given me.
What task?
I mustn't say.
No offense, kid. But I've worked hard for the privilege and I don't want to lose it again.
Can you teach me something?
Who around here can teach me something?
Henry and Morgan are leading our raiding troops.
They can teach you how to be a better fighter.
Henry's people all use two-handed weapons.
Morgan prefers the faster one-handed weapons.
Who else?
Beats me, I've never been interested in anything else.
But I'm sure that Alligator Jack or Samuel could still show you a trick or two.
Can you tell me something about Francis?
Look around you. The only ones working are Henry and his boys.
Morgan spends all day in bed, or guzzling booze.
No such nonsense with Greg. If you don't toe the line, he'll kick you in the butt, and that's that.
Give me that bandit's armor.
I'm not that crazy. Greg will have my head.
He explicitly stated that no-one will get that armor unless he orders it.
I can't give it to you. Especially not now that he's come back.
You're supposed to give me the bandit's armor. Orders from Greg.
From Greg? Whew, I already thought I'd have to go after all.
This spy job in the bandits' camp is nothing short of a suicide mission.
I'd rather have Greg heap his chores on me than get myself killed by those bandits.
(irritated) The armor.
Oh yeah, right, here it is.
Just be careful. Those bandits are a bad lot.
Hey, you! Where are you going? No matter what your plans are - there'll be plenty of time later.
You're right in front of the pearl of Khorinis - the RED LANTERN. This is the most beautiful brothel in all of Myrtana, damnit!
Sailors from the most remote corners of the world dock here just to spend a few nights in the Red Lantern.
And now it's you who has the chance - nay, the honor - of spending a night with Nadja, the most passionate flower of the gods!
Come on in and you're going to experience what others cannot even dream of!
What are you standing around for out here? Go on in and meet our passionate Nadja.
This hot creature of the night will give your life a new meaning!
Do you know where I could buy some weed?
No, piss off!
I've heard you're selling weed.
I'm sorry, Mr. City Guard, sir. There must have been a mistake. I know nothing about weed.
Says who?
That is besides the point.
I just want to know who sent you so I can be sure you're all right.
Says Nadja.
What do you know, the little bird has sung. You know, you shouldn't believe everything this gal tells you.
So do you want to cut a deal, or not?
... all right ... let's make a deal. You give me 50 gold pieces, and then you'll get your weed. No haggling.
Let's make a deal. Here's the gold.
All right ...
... here's a fresh, resinous stalk of weed.
Welcome to my shop, stranger!
I am Bosper. I craft bows and trade in furs.
What brings you to Khorinis?
I need to get into the upper quarter ...
Where the paladins are? Forget it.
You need to be a respected citizen here, or at least hold a decent job.
As a stranger, you stand no chance of getting in.
So I noticed ...
I'm looking for work!
Mmh - I could use a new apprentice.
The last one just gave up his job two days ago.
Do you know anything about hunting, then?
Weeell ...
I could teach you how to skin animals.
I'll pay you well for every skin you bring me.
I can get you some skins if that's what you mean.
Excellent! Bring me as many animal skins as you can - I will buy them from you for a good price.
I want to start as your apprentice!
(grins) Great! You seem to know the basics already.
Harad thinks you're a good man.
But Harad isn't convinced of your abilities.
But Harad says he's never seen you.
Thorben gave you his blessing. I'm not all that pious, but I'm fine with it.
Thorben will only give you his approval with the blessing of the gods.
Thorben has no idea who you are.
Constantino says you can sign up wherever you want for all he cares.
Constantino says you're being accused of a crime here in town - I hope that this is something trivial?
See to it that the matter gets cleared up.
Constantino has never even heard of you.
And Matteo says you're worth your weight in gold.
And Matteo mentioned some debts - whatever he meant by that, you had better talk to him.
Matteo says he has not yet talked to you about this.
Matteo says he has never seen you before in his life.
This means you have the approval of all masters!
You now have the approval of four masters. That will suffice for you to be accepted as an apprentice.
You can work for me at any time if you want.
You need the approval of at least four masters in order to be able to start an apprenticeship in the lower part of town.
This means that you should talk to all those who do not quite approve of you yet.
Before I take you on I need to know, of course, whether you're any good at all.
You brought me back my bow, but that doesn't say much about your talent as a hunter.
I'm in!
You aren't going to regret this! I think we'll be able to work together well.
Good - I'll think about it.
Don't make the wrong decision! You'd be perfect for me.
What if I want to sign on with one of the other masters?
(grumpy) Balderdash!
Harad and Matteo already have apprentices.
Constantino the alchemist is a loner - and he hasn't taken an apprentice in years.
And as for Thorben - everyone knows he's dead broke - he probably couldn't even pay you.
I, on the other hand, am in urgent need of an apprentice - and I pay well, too.
But no matter where you want to sign on - you need the approval of all other masters from the lower part of town ...
Why did your apprentice give up his job?
All he said was that it had become too dangerous out there.
If you're really interested, then you can ask him yourself.
His name is Bartok. He's probably hanging out near Coragon's pub.
Go through the underpass from the smithy, then you're headed straight for it.
Will I get your approval to sign up with a different master?
(disappointed) I had hoped you would choose me.
But if that's the way you want it ...
Does that mean you'll vote for me?
If none of the other masters objects - yes.
You brought back my bow, after all.
But you would certainly have made a good hunter.
(sighs) All right! You shall have my approval - but on one condition.
Work for me, at least for a short time.
That way you can find out for yourself whether you like my craft or not.
And who knows - maybe you'll end up liking it, and you'll stay with me.
If you're good enough to sign on with ME, you're also good enough for all others here.
What do you want me to do for you?
I will teach you how to skin an animal, and you will bring me - let's say - half a dozen wolf skins.
Bring me half a dozen wolf skins.
Then I'll know that you have learned your trade.
If it doesn't take you forever and if the skins are in acceptable condition, I will take you on if you like.
Or (sighs) you can start with one of the other masters - if that's what you really want.
About the wolf skins ...
You're already apprenticed to a different master now. I will buy the skins from you for the regular price.
I've got them - here.
Great! I knew you would be suitable for this job.
Here's the pay I promised you.
And? What do you think? Isn't this better work than banging away at swords all day, or filling little bottles in a dusty chamber?
We had agreed on half a dozen - but you've still got time. Go and get those skins.
Teach me how to skin animals!
Right. Listen. It's quite easy, really.
You take a sharp blade and cut open the animal's belly. Then make a few small incisions on the inside of the legs, and you can peel off the skin.
Bring me the wolf skins and we shall see ...
Show me your wares.
You're not here to browse through my wares, you're supposed to get me those skins!
So get going!
I've heard that someone stole from you.
Who told you that? Probably Bartok, huh? Didn't he have anything better to tell you? Oh well.
Let me tell you, if I get hold of this bastard he can say his prayers!
I left the shop only for a moment. When I came back, I could only just see him leave - with my bow on his shoulder.
I called the guards right away, but the lowlife ran towards the harbor. And they lost him there.
I lit a bonfire under their asses then, and they searched the entire harbor district. But they didn't find a thing.
Those bumbling lackeys!
I bet my bow is still in town somewhere. I informed the guards on both city gates, and they haven't seen anyone leave with my bow.
When I get my hands on that bastard ...
I think this bow belongs to you ...
My bow! Where did you find it?
In a dark hole full of rats.
I hope you didn't get into trouble ...
No - I've done this kind of thing before.
Hm - thank you anyway. I owe you for this!
How are things in town?
If the orcs really show up to besiege us, it's going to get unpleasant around here.
There's only one ship - and the paladins are guarding it. And I don't think they'll use it to rescue the citizens.
Is there no other way of getting out of here?
No, none of us can leave this island without a ship.
There's nothing new so far. Drop in again later.
You up and joined the militia, eh?
Not that I care. Just as long as, besides orcs and bandits, you hunt a few wolves as well. (grins)
Looks like your career took off like a rocket. Paladin of the King!
Wherever you go from here, don't forget your old master ...
You went and entered the monastery, huh? I hope they let you out often enough so you can keep me supplied with skins ...
Where have you been gadding about for so long?
I need more skins, did you bring any?
There you are again ...
What are my tasks as an apprentice?
That's easy. Bring me as many pelts as you can get.
I'll pay you a better price for them than any of the other traders would give you.
Apart from that, you needn't show up here in the shop. I can get along just fine by myself.
And where am I supposed to sleep?
I don't have any room for you here. They're bound to have a bed for you in the hotel at the marketplace.
I've got a few skins for you ...
A sheep skin? You didn't go slaughter some farmer's sheep in the pasture, did you?
I wouldn't dream of doing that ...
Wolf skin, that's good ...
A warg skin? Those beasts are tough ...
Ah, even a shadowbeast skin - those are worth a lot.
What the hell is THIS skin?
I ripped a troll off for that one.
That ... that is worth a small fortune.
Another huge troll hide ... are you hunting those things down?
Whenever I stumble upon one, I seize the opportunity ...
And the hide of a black troll, at that!
Good work. Come see me again when you have more ...
But you know - I'm only interested in the skins of wolves, shadowbeasts and the like ...
I see that you have mining shares for sale.
Ahem. I know nothing about that. You can have them if you want.
That's him all right! Let's give him what for!
Come back again later. I'm sure to have something new for you then.
What are you doing here?
My name is Brahim. I draw maps, and sell them.
Since you're new here, maybe you could use a map of the city.
It's quite affordable - and very useful until you know your way around.
Is it true that some townspeople have simply vanished?
So I've heard. But I'm not sure whether it's really true.
Just look around you. Does this rathole look like the place where you want to spend your golden years?
Small wonder that people are getting themselves out of here.
Show me your maps.
You won't find better in that monastery of yours.
Good maps are important, especially for people who come from the mainland, Mr. Paladin.
I knew this piece would interest you.
What piece would that be?
Well, that old map you just bought.
I know your kind. You go for any chance of finding riches.
Where did you get this map?
Oh, I found that in a stack of old maps which I bought recently.
The seller must have overlooked it.
What kind of a map is it?
It seems to be a treasure map or the like.
But you look to me like one who will get to the heart of this matter himself.
Why don't you keep it for yourself?
I'm an old man, and the times when I set out myself are long past.
I leave that to younger people.
Looky there. A newbie.
And a landlubber at that!
You're a bit scrawny for a pirate.
Anything new?
You can say that. I'm injured. Have you got a healing potion to spare?
What now? Are we going to clobber those beasts, or not?
The questions you ask! I don't think there's a single razor left in the whole damn canyon.
No, but now that Greg is back, I hope that is bound to change soon.
(conspiratorial) Wait a moment.
(laughs) Not as far as I can see. Same old, same old!
Can you teach me something?
Teach you? You bet! I could teach you to become stronger and improve your dexterity.
But why would I want to do that?
Because I'll buy you a drink?
(grinning) Not bad, kiddo! Got it - first try.
But don't even bother to bring me some cheap rotgut.
I'll get you some grog.
Are you trying to poison me???
I'm NOT touching that muck! Do you have any idea what's IN there?
Old Samuel has some GOOD stuff as well! Go get me some of THAT!
You're talking about his 'Hasty Herring'?
Aye, that's what I mean.
Have you ever tried Samuel's special recipe?
No, not yet.
Then have a go at it. It's a MUST-try!
How I LOVE this concoction!
Here you go.
Ahh! Down the hatch like liquid fire!
Teach me something!
You were going to get me something decent to drink, boy!
All right, lad! You've gotten quite a bit stronger already.
The more dexterous you are, the better you'll hit your target.
You're supposed to help me.
That's news to me. Says who?
Says Greg. We're off to hunt razors in the canyon.
(grinning) Finally, something's happening around here!
Then let's go right away, the sooner we do in those beasts, the sooner we get to be back here.
Come with me.
Let's go back a little first.
I'm right here!
I no longer need you.
All right, no problem.
Maybe we can have a drink together some time.
Enough already! Are you trying to depopulate the whole island?
We're headed back to the camp.
I'm headed back to the camp.
New in the city, huh? I'm Brian! I'm Master Harad's apprentice.
What's it like to be the smith's apprentice?
Why do you ask? Do you want to be my successor?
Maybe.
Why not ... I'm almost done with my apprenticeship, and then I'm going to leave the city.
But not because of Harad. He is a good master - I have learned a lot from him.
Why do you want to leave the town?
Because the people here are getting on my nerves! Above all the other masters.
I still remember what a fuss it was getting accepted as an apprentice with Harad.
Really, every one of those jokers had something to say about it.
I want to decide for myself who I can or can't take as an apprentice.
Who are the other masters?
Well, there's Thorben the carpenter, Bosper the bowyer, Constantino the alchemist and Matteo.
He sells armor, but first of all he's a merchant.
All the masters have their houses here on the street.
And Constantino's shop is in the underpass to the temple.
Tell me more about Master Harad.
He's not in a very good mood right now.
A few days ago, the paladins came and ordered him to forge some swords for them.
They've even forbidden him to sell swords to anyone else.
Now he slaves day and night to finish the job as quickly as possible.
Can I buy weapons from you?
Not really. I'm merely an assistant.
The weapons that are made in this smithy are collected by the militia and taken to the towers, where they are stored.
But if it has anything to do with forging, maybe I can help you.
What can I get from you?
If I still have a couple of steel billets, you're welcome to them. That's all, I'm afraid.
Since Harad isn't here any more, the militia is keeping an eye on me.
I'm not allowed to continue running the smithy. They're afraid I'll just sell the whole thing and skedaddle.
I can sell you some steel billets.
Can you repair jewelry?
I'm just an assistant, I'm glad if I'm even allowed to make a dagger.
Jewelry? You'll have to ask the master.
I heard that you are interested in Jack's old lighthouse.
Jack is considering going back to sea. But his lighthouse would be unguarded then.
But it should be clear to Jack that I'll make a smithy out of his lighthouse when he isn't there.
Is that a problem?
(laughs) Not to me. I won't get Harad's smithy anyway. I've put that thought right out of my head.
Agreed. We'll meet at Jack's.
And, what do you say?
Lawdy, what a mess. Jack won't recognize the place when I'm done with it.
Are you the one who runs this place?
I am Bromor. This is my house, and these are my girls. I like my girls.
And if you like my girls, too, then you'll pay for it - 50 gold pieces.
And don't get the idea of making trouble here.
Are all your girls accounted for?
Of course they are. Or did you think I want to go to jail over something like that?
(irritated) Er ... I wasn't asking about your payroll. I mean, are they all PRESENT? Or have any gone missing?
Oh. Yes, actually. One of my girls has up and left. Her name's Lucia.
I reported it to the militia, too. But they claim they haven't found a trace of her yet.
How long has Lucia been missing?
Several days. I don't know exactly how long.
I assume she's run off with one of her suitors.
That bitch made off with part of my savings. A really valuable golden dish.
If I get hold of her, I'll give her what for.
So how's that any business of YOURS? Are you trying to make fun of me, or what?
I found the dish that Lucia stole from you.
Great! High time I got it back.
Here's your dish.
Thanks. That's very generous of you. Anything else?
Don't you want to know what became of Lucia?
No. Why? I've got the dish back, haven't I?
I've managed without Lucia so far, and I will in the future. Why would I try to make her come back?
What about a reward?
You get to have a good time with one of my girls - for free. What do you say?
That's not enough.
Take it, or you needn't show your face around here again.
Forget it.
Then leave my establishment right now, you bastard.
And don't even think that you'll get served here ever again.
Agreed. Here's your dish.
Thanks. Go to Nadja. She'll accompany you upstairs.
I want to have some fun.
Fine. (grins) You're not likely to forget the next few hours of your life any time soon.
Go upstairs with Nadja, then. Have fun.
I can't stand it when people try to pull my leg. Get out of here if you can't pay.
Can I get 'special' goods here, too?
Sure, all my girls are very special. (grins)
If you have enough gold, you can go upstairs with Nadja.
You are possessed.
What? What are you talking about? Get out of here.
(fatherly) So, where are we headed, then?
Are you the foreman here?
I'll give you one upside the head, you rascal.
If you want to go ambling across my land, you'll pay me 5 gold coins, or you're in for a good thrashing!
Your land? Are you the farmer here?
You can bet on that. Why else would I make you pay me a toll?
I don't mind if you go ask the others about me. Heh heh!
If I have no choice - here's your money.
(mischievously) Thank you. And have a nice day.
You don't even have 5 gold coins. Trying to pull a fast one, are you?
Forget it. You won't get anything from me.
Then, I'm afraid, I'm going to have to tan your hide.
You boys from the city guard are short of money, huh?
I don't care if you are a magician. You'll have to pay. Understood?
Come on and try it, then.
Well, in that case ...
You, the farmer? Don't make me laugh. You're nobody, really.
Whaaat? Want me to smash your face in?
Well, let's see then what you've got.
I hoped you would say that.
Sekob is the farmer here, and you're nothing but a small-time crook who's trying to wangle money out of people's pockets.
Says who?
Says me. Sekob wants you to go back to work instead of loafing around here.
So what? What are you going to do now?
Never mind!
Scram!
All right, then I guess I'll have to tell Onar the landowner that there's a farmer mouthing off here who refuses to pay his rent.
Ahem. Wait a minute. Onar will send all his mercenaries after me.
So what?
All right, all right. I'll give you whatever you want, but leave the mercenaries out of this, OK?
Here, I'll even give you all my gold.
And I'll go back to my field. Anything but the mercenaries.
So? Busy as a bee, are you?
So? Still got that big mouth?
You're a mercenary, aren't you? I might have known.
(fearfully) You won't go fetch those mercenaries, huh?
Don't beat me, please.
I'll even go back to work, OK?
So, still got all your teeth?
Man, you're a tough one! I wouldn't want to face you in battle.
I think you broke every single one of my ribs.
And I didn't even hit you all that hard. Oh well, never mind, I like a guy who can take a few blows in stride.
This here potion will help you get back on your feet. It also works wonders for your bowels!
I have nothing against a good fight. But when I start a fight, I end it, too.
What's your task here?
My job? I'm training the lads. I teach them how to get muscles of steel.
I also take care of the prisoners. I'm like a damn father to those bastards.
But my real art is to get them to talk. And believe me - I have ways to make anyone talk.
Sounds awfully nice ...
But those flea-infested blockheads we have currently locked up don't have much to say anyway.
And they won't let me deal with that Gorn.
Anything new?
Everything seems quiet. No new prisoners - nobody who needs help finding the right words - too bad.
Could you train me?
Sure I can help you become stronger, but I don't give away anything for free.
How much do you want?
Hmm ... you run around outside of the castle, don't you? Here's what I suggest.
My assistant, Den, made himself scarce during the last attack. What a quitter.
But he didn't run for it empty-handed. He took the contents of our cash-box with him.
What cash-box?
We have this chest where we keep the stuff that we have ... er ... collected over the course of time.
And that was a tidy sum. The chest contained 200 gold pieces, along with some precious jewelry.
If you bring me back the gold, you can keep the jewels, and I'll train you.
Do you know where Den was headed?
As far away from here as possible. I guess he may have tried to get through to the pass.
Thanks, that's very helpful.
Well, what can I say? I have no idea where he went.
I've got something for you.
Excellent. I can train you if you like.
Listen, just bring me 200 gold pieces. I don't care where you get them - just as long as it's gold.
I want to become stronger.
Tortured anyone today?
Can't you see I'm busy? Come back later.
Why aren't you at work?
(distraught) But that's disgusting!
Have you had a look in my chamber? Those filthy meatbugs are everywhere.
I have no idea who set up quarters in there before, but I'm certainly not going back into that filthy sty.
I hate those beasts. And stop grinning like an idiot.
The meatbugs are gone. You can go back to polishing your thumbscrews, or whatever.
Are you really sure that not one of those monsters is left?
Pretty sure.
All right, then. Here, take this gold as a token of my gratitude.
Aw, don't make me cry.
Are you all right?
(apprehensively) And you are sure that those meatbugs are gone?
Ahem ... look, there's one right behind you.
(bellows) What?
You're possessed!
Go to the monastery and have them heal you.
I'm beyond help. Go away!
Somebody needs to cut those demons out of your head.
(screams) NO!
What's the matter??
It's so damn cold here, man! I don't see why Sylvio insisted on coming here of all places.
There's plenty of other places around where there's something to be had!
Everything else all right?
Just don't get on my nerves.
Not now! I'm freezing! I just want to get out of here as fast as I can.
Damnit. Sylvio is dead.
What are your plans now that Sylvio is dead?
No idea. I guess I'll go with the other dragon hunters if they still want me around.
Do you know where the others are?
I think so. At least I saw one of them at the river over there.
Take me to the other dragon hunters.
Hey, I'm not your lackey.
Count yourself lucky if I let you live.
Leave me alone.
I'll pay you 50 gold coins for it.
All right then. Fork over the dough.
Follow me. I'll take you to where I last saw one of the other dragon hunters.
You don't have 50 gold coins, and I'm not falling for that crap. Get lost.
Suit yourself. I'm sure I'll find them.
Don't get lost, then.
I ought to just tear off your head.
Shut that big trap of yours.
Draw your weapon. We'll put an end to this now.
So be it.
The two of us should have a chat ...
Listen, you win! Now leave me alone.
I wouldn't know about what.
Sylvio doesn't like being talked to. You might have gathered as much by now.
We need to talk, you and I.
What do you want?
I think the best thing would be if you didn't show your face on the farm any more.
See to it that you're gone by tomorrow. We understand each other?
You're still here after all ...
I thought we had agreed that I shall let you depart in peace.
You really should have listened to me.
I don't believe this! The fellow is still here!
I'm NOT going to leave here!
(sighs) I guess we're going to have to discuss this again.
(grouchy) Yeah, yeah, go tell it to someone who cares.
Does the name Pepe ring a bell?
I don't get a word of what you're blathering about, but I don't like your tone!
You were supposed to guard his sheep.
What do I care about his sheep?
Lee cares about them.
What are you getting at?
If you keep getting on my nerves, I'll se to it that you are made to pay for the sheep.
So if you're at all interested in your pay, leave me alone from now on!
(furious) You, you ...
(calmly) Yes?
(to himself) Wretched little lowlife ...
Who do we have here? Don't I know you from somewhere?
Who wants to know?
I'm Buster, one of Lee's mercenaries!
And YOU had better be a little nicer to me, or I'll have your hide!
All right, what do you want here?
I know Lee!
Everyone knows Lee! That doesn't mean a thing, pal. Right now, you're talking to ME!
So, where are you headed?
That's none of your business.
Nobody talks to me like that, you worm! I think it's time for a sound thrashing.
If you say so. I'm on my way to see the landowner.
Indeed ... Hm - you don't look all that dangerous to me.
You've got that right.
(smugly) Yep, over the years you learn to spot these things, buddy.
We get to fight orcs here more often than not. Or the guards from town. Persistent little buggers, they are. (laughs)
I've killed a beast or two on occasion.
Ha! (laughs) You probably flattened a few weevils in the fields and chased a couple of rats from their holes.
We're dealing with orcs here! Well, yeah, and with those scummy city guards. (derisive laugh)
Want to find out?
Oh my! I picked on the wrong fella, didn't I?
You could say so.
Then come on, show me what you've got.
Impressive.
(laughs) That's our business, kid! We even produce our own weapons and armor!
We defy death every day. But a country bumpkin like you wouldn't know about that.
Whatever you say.
(with a bored grunt) Get a move on, you wimp!
I guess I'll have to show you how much I know about that!
Are you having a peasants' uprising all by yourself, then?
All right then, show me what you've got.
So?
(snorts) As if you knew what I'm talking about. You think you're mighty strong, don't you?
(angry) Maybe it's about time that somebody taught you a lesson!
Do you mean REAL orcs? Those big things?
(sighs) I mean ... Just a moment! Are you trying to pull my leg?
(smiling) Far be that from me.
You worm! (stupidly aggressive) You're really asking for it, huh?
Then come and show me what you've got, you hero!
Any time!
Come closer, then, buddy!
Only kidding ...
Yeah, right, draw in your horns! Just get out of my sight!
What do you want, you wimp?
I challenge you to a duel!
Ah-ha! You won't take this sitting down, huh? All right - come here!
You want to try again? Pesky little bugger - all right, come here!
But don't run off again!
I want to join the mercenaries!
Anyone who can whack as hard as you shouldn't have too much trouble around here.
You're not the best of fighters, but a coward you're not.
My vote doesn't count much since I haven't been here for long, but when Lee asks me I'll vote for you.
You? I don't recall that they ever let a coward join the mercenaries ...
Running away in a duel - that won't get you far around here!
I want to find out more about the mercenaries and this region.
I can't tell you much about this region. You had better ask the farmers.
And as for us mercenaries - we have a very simple rule: If you can stand your ground, you're in.
I think you're made of the right stuff to be one of us.
But you shouldn't let it get to your head that you lucked out during our last fight.
There are plenty of lads on the farm who are quite a bit better than I am ...
Sentenza, for one. He guards the entry to the farm. Whatever you do, don't pick a fight with him.
But why am I telling that to YOU, you wuss!
What about this Sentenza?
He'll try to squeeze some gold out of you when you come to the farm - he does that to all newcomers.
And if I were you, I'd pay up. That's what I did back then. And the good thing was that he voted for me afterwards.
One good turn deserves another, he said. I lost all my gold in the bargain, but it wasn't much to begin with. And I was glad of it in the end.
I once watched him beat up a fellow who had decided NOT to pay him.
Thanks for the hint.
Indeed. Could it be worth anything to you?
Here you are - 5 gold pieces.
Thanks, man. Looks like I can take a few tonight after all. I won't forget this.
No.
That's what I thought.
Lee is the leader of the mercenaries, isn't he?
Right - hey, now I remember where I know you from! You were in the colony, too.
(sighs) So I was.
I didn't see you when the big bang happened. Not for a while before that, either.
I had other problems.
You've missed out on quite a lot then - things have changed since we were in the slammer together.
What became of the mercenaries in the colony?
Once the Barrier was gone, Lee led us out of the colony. He said that nothing could happen to us if we all stuck together. And he was right.
It wasn't too long before we found ourselves a cozy spot right here. The landowner pays us to beat up the militia from the city.
And most of us would have volunteered to do that even without pay.
But Onar feeds us all and we can bide our time until we see a good opportunity to get away from this blasted island.
Can you teach me how to fight better?
I might well be able to give you a hint or two ...
You're not nearly as dumb as you look. All right, I'll teach you what I know. Then maybe you'll even stand a fair chance against me ...
Hey, you, buddy!
What do you want?
These last few days, I've been thinking about how we could make some quick money in this dump.
And?
I think I've stumbled across a possibility to make money fast.
A merchant from town would shell out a lot of dough for a certain thing.
Why are you telling me this?
I can't do it myself. I need to stay here and watch those stupid sheep.
You mean, the farmers.
That's what I'm saying.
What's this about?
The merchant claims that he could market shadowbeast horns very profitably.
Someone would have to go to the woods and harvest those beasts. And that's where you come in.
How much is to be gained there?
A bunch of money, I tell you. There will be enough for the two of us.
And since you gave me that gold back then, I'll make you a special price.
Sounds good! I'll let you know when I manage to get some horns.
Who is this merchant you're talking about?
No can do, pal. I'd have to be really stupid to tell you my source. Were you trying to pull a fast one on me?
Either you make the deal with ME, or not at all, capisce?
My city merchant has made his farewells.
What is that supposed to mean?
He's dead. You can keep the horns. I wouldn't know what to do with them now.
How do you gut a shadowbeast?
You don't know that? Oh man, I'd have expected more of you.
I've got a shadowbeast horn for you.
I've got some more shadowbeast horns for your merchant.
Great. Give here. And get me more. Who knows for how long that merchant will still want these things.
Here's your share.
Teach me.
Listen up, then. You do in that shadowbeast, and then you hold its horn with your right hand as tight as you can.
Then you stick your knife in its forehead and cut a furrow in the flesh around the horn.
Then you use your knife to lever the horn from the skull, and you put it in your pocket.
Well. And then you bring it to me. That shouldn't be too hard for you to do.
I'll get back to you about that.
I hope so.
What do you think of this dragon hunter thing?
The boys could come away with a lot of gold - if they don't kick the bucket first.
Myself, I prefer sticking with Lee.
I've got to go!
Suit yourself.
It was very foolish of you to attack me.
(mocking) Did you think you could defeat me that easily?
Either you make amends for this, or I shall see to it that you bitterly regret your deed!
And what exactly did you have in mind?
Here's your gold - let's forget the matter!
Very reasonable of you!
I don't have that much!
Then why are you stealing my time?
Who do we have here then?
You are on your way to the city - am I not right?
Maybe.
Hm! (snorts) You look like a fugitive! All fugitives are headed for the city.
You could even be a former convict from the mining colony.
(hastily) I don't care where you come from. But I believe I have an interesting offer for you...
How goes the work, peasant?
What can I do for you?
I can't complain.
Can I do something for you?
Do I look like a farmer?
Just like a farmer. But you don't talk like one!
(pondering) If I am not entirely mistaken, I have an interesting offer for you...
What do you have to offer?
The way you look, the guards will never let you into the city.
(ironic) If you are as 'convincing' with the guards at the gate as you are with me, they will never let you into the city.
I can help you get into the city.
I have here a small piece of paper. With the royal seal and the governor's signature. A pass.
With this scrap of paper in your pocket, you can run about as raggedly as you please, and the guards will leave you alone.
Interested?
I am a traveling merchant. I sell a bit of everything.
There must be a catch to this ...
(exaggerated) No. No catch. You will merely owe me a favor.
How will YOU get into town?
The guards know me. I will simply tell them that I have lost my pass.
What do you want for your pass?
(pleased) I KNEW you were the right man!
Listen. You will get the pass from me - now.
Just like that?
Just so. BUT: If I meet you in the city, you owe me a favor.
Do we have a deal?
Sure. Give me that paper.
Here. Be careful with that, it is very valuable.
One more thing: Don't even think about breaking your word!
As a merchant, I have a great deal of influence in the city - it wouldn't go well for you, believe me!
No! Keep your paper!
Hm. I seem to have misjudged you, huh?
Well. Do you want something else? Can I interest you in my wares?
Show me your wares!
Take your pick.
You still owe me a favor. It is time to pay your debt.
Hey you, I have a proposition for you.
What do you want?
I want my old stall in the marketplace back. Sarah snatched it away from me.
But she has had that spot long enough. I want her to give up the stall.
And what's my part in this?
I will give you a letter to stick in her pocket.
Then you go to Andre and tell him that Sarah is selling weapons to Onar.
She lands in prison, you pocket the bounty, and I get the stall.
You have two days to accomplish this.
What's in it for me?
When I have the stall, you will get a weapon from me - and a damned good one.
What will happen if I refuse to do that?
That would be truly stupid of you, because you see, I know that you are an escaped convict.
If that gets around, it could do considerable harm to your situation in the city...
No, I want no part of this.
That was the wrong decision, boy. We shall speak again.
All right, looks like I've got no choice.
You're a clever lad. Here is the letter.
How am I supposed to foist the letter on her?
Let her show you her wares - and while she does, you hide the letter on her.
And bear in mind, I am an influential man in the city, so don't try to play me for a fool.
Don't you have a job to do?
First foist the letter onto Sarah, then go to Andre and accuse her..
Do that - and don't try to cheat me, you would regret it.
You are taking your own sweet time about this. Get going!
Sarah is dead.
Really? Wonderful. Then you have completed your half of our little bargain.
Well done. Sarah is where she belongs.
I have taken over her goods, so if you need a weapon, come to me.
You were going to give me a weapon.
Correct. Here, this weapon is a masterpiece of the blacksmith's art.
Oh, here you are again.
Why aren't you in jail?
I have been released. As I already told you - I am an influential man in the city.
In the meantime, I have dealt with Sarah myself. You can forget the business with the letter.
Did I not warn you? It would have been better if you had done what I told you.
Now word is out among the merchants that you are a convict.
A regrettable affair - now you won't be able to get even a piece of bread here in the marketplace.
I could, of course, sort things out for you for, shall we say...
Have you come to pay?
All right, I'll pay up, you leave me no choice.
(grins) Good. Then I shall see to it that your reputation with the merchants rises once again.
I haven't got enough money on me ...
Then get it.
How much was that again?
I warned you, but you wouldn't listen. We will discuss this later.
Now get lost, I want to rest.
You're selling illegal mining shares!
Yes, and? So what! If I don't do it, someone else will.
It would seem that we have a few thieves in the city who steal stuff from the rich people.
The city guard recently turned the harbor district upside-down - but they didn't find anything.
What led you into this poor area? What are looking for here?
I've lost my way.
Then watch out that you aren't robbed.
I'm just looking around a bit.
Aha. Then you had better not be caught looking around.
What do you know about the thieves?
Nothing. But all the citizens are scared and have become distrustful - particularly towards strangers.
Don't get caught in strange houses - no one takes kindly to that.
Yes, you have to protect yourself against thieves. A sturdy cudgel works best.
Can you teach me anything?
Oh, I'm forging a few fittings and nails and repairing iron parts.
But I don't know enough about forging weapons to be able to instruct you.
If you want to learn that, then go see Harad. He sure knows how to forge weapons!
But if you want to train your muscles a bit, I can help you with that.
How much do you charge for the training?
I heard what you did for Edda. I'll train you for nothing.
50 gold pieces and I'll help you to become stronger.
I want to train with you.
I heard what you did for Edda. I'll train you for nothing.
Good, we can get started as soon as you're ready.
Get the gold, then I'll train you.
I want to become stronger.
Hey, are you the new guy who knocked down Franco?
Yes, why?
(angry) Because now I have to take over his job. You did a great job! Thanks a lot!
What? Me? No!
Ah! No offense!
After the attacker was dead, Thorus assigned me to get a new man for the camp.
And Franco sent Logan.
And Franco sent a new guy.
Hey, I just do what Thorus tells me. I don't know anything about the attack itself.
And what's it like leading the hunters?
Leave me alone!
I see you've become a fighter for law and order.
It doesn't matter that you're in the service of Innos. You're one of us. And I hope that's the way you see it, too.
So now you belong to the church of Innos. Fine, but you're still one of us - I hope you won't forget that.
Your deadline has passed. You shouldn't have come back.
I see you received our gift. I am Cassia.
All right, Cassia, so tell me why I'm here.
You caught our attention by winning the trust of some of our friends.
And we want to offer you a chance. You can join us.
Just look who found his way here. Attila underestimated you. I'm not going to make the same mistake.
What's being played here?
We wanted you to die for blowing the whistle on a friend. That's why we sent Attila.
Your presence here, however, opens up a new option ...
... what do you want to offer me?
You can join us.
Tell me more about your organization.
People in town are pretty nervous about us. But nobody knows our hideout.
The handful of people who even know that the sewers exist believe that they are locked and not accessible to anyone.
And as long as they don't find us, we can work in peace.
What do you know about the missing people?
Why would that interest you?
I want to find out what happened to them.
When you emerge from the sewers, swim down along the coast to the right for a while.
You're bound to find your answers there ...
What's in it for me if I join you?
You can learn special abilities from us - abilities that will allow you to live in luxury.
But I wouldn't have to hide out down here, would I?
(laughs quietly) No. You only have to stick to our rules. That's all.
What can I learn from you?
Jesper is the master of stealth. He will show you how to move without making a sound.
Ramirez is an exceptionally gifted burglar. No lock can withstand his picks.
And I can teach you how to be a pickpocket.
I'm also going to help you become more dexterous. For dexterity is the key to your abilities.
What are your rules?
The first rule is: You don't breathe a word about us. To anyone. Ever.
Second: Don't get caught.
Third: If you draw your weapon down here to attack someone, we'll kill you.
And the fourth, and last rule is: those who want to join us have to prove themselves.
What happens if I get caught?
Just don't get caught, OK?
How am I supposed to prove myself?
Now will you join us or not?
That stubborn old alchemist - Constantino - has a beautiful ring.
But he doesn't really need it. I want to see it adorn my hand.
OK, I'm in.
Great. You'll be given an opportunity to prove yourself. And if you want to learn from us, you're welcome.
And what if I don't want to join you ... ?
You're missing a one-time chance, but you can go.
(serious) And don't even think about betraying us. You would bitterly regret that.
In that case, I shall kill you.
OK, I'm in.
(smiles) You've made a wise decision. If you succeed in proving yourself, you may join our ranks.
If you would like to learn the thieves' abilities first, feel free - you're going to need them.
Try to kill me, then.
Too bad. I thought you were smarter than that.
I need to think about this.
Do that. I'll give you two days to come to a decision. After that, you will no longer be welcome here.
Can you teach me?
Sure, no problem. Just let me know when you're ready.
Sure. Pickpocketing and dexterity will cost you 100 gold pieces each.
I want to become more dexterous. Here's the gold.
We can start whenever you're ready.
Come back when you've got the gold.
I want to learn about picking pockets. Here's the gold.
We can start whenever you're ready.
Come back when you've got the gold.
I want to become more dexterous.
Show me how to pick pockets.
If you want to empty somebody's pockets, distract him. Just start talking to him, have a chat.
While you're talking to him, size him up. Look out for bulging pockets, jewelry, or leather straps around the neck. And, most of all, note how keen the fellow seems.
Robbing a drunk day-laborer is not the same as stealing from a watchful merchant, mind you.
If you're too clumsy, of course, he'll smell a rat. So, above all: keep your cool.
I've got Constantino's ring.
Congratulations. You passed your initiation test. Now you're truly one of us.
Take this key. It opens the door to the hotel. (smiles) Then you won't have to swim every time.
Furthermore, you should know that we have a secret sign. A particular nod.
Exactly. When you talk to the right people and make this sign, they'll know you are one of us.
So where are you hiding your loot?
Come on, you didn't really think I would tell you that?
You'll have enough opportunity to get your hands on some loot of your own. Remember - those who are too greedy end up with nothing.
Have you got a job for me?
Not as long as you're wanted in town as a thief.
Clear that up - pay your penalty or get rid of the witnesses, I don't care, just as long as you clear it up.
Yes. There is a matching set of chalices. Six of them.
King Rhobar once captured them during a campaign - but he sacrificed many men so he could get them. That's why they're called the Blood Chalices.
Each of the chalices by itself is not all that valuable - but the six of them all together are worth a tidy sum.
Where are these chalices?
They're here, in town - they belong to the rich merchants in the upper quarter.
Bring them to me. In the meantime, I'll try to find a buyer for them.
What's in it for me?
Either half of the profit, or you get to pick a special item from my booty.
About the Blood Chalices ...
I've got all six chalices now.
Good work. I've found a buyer in the meantime.
You can have your reward now. Thanks for doing that for me.
There's nothing else I have to do for you - but you can learn from me at any time. Moreover, there's enough on this island just waiting for a taker. (smiles)
I can only sell these chalices as a set. Bring me all six.
I've come to pick up my reward.
What's your choice?
Give me the gold.
Give me the potions.
Give me the ring.
I am Cedric the swordmaster, paladin of the king.
Can you train me?
I can train you in combat with one-handed weapons.
I only train paladins.
I want to train.
You have learned everything about sword fighting. I cannot show more.
How's it going?
I'm cooking a delicious stew for the diggers and guards.
But the slaves - they don't get anything. Some stale water and old bread, at the most.
That won't hurt those city boys.
Hands off my pots! Nobody touches my pots, understand?!
I'm responsible for the food, and that means nobody else has any business here! I hope I made myself clear!
Who made you a cook, of all people?
That was Commander Garond. Before I became a prisoner, I used to be the cook in the Raging Boar.
And what did they lock you up for?
There was a misunderstanding between a guest, a meat cleaver, and me.
Anything new?
If you want to learn the news, then ask the knights. I'm just an imprisoned cook.
Nice camp.
You said it. It stinks like a slaughterhouse here. Dead animals and rotten trees everywhere.
What are you doing here?
I've been sitting here for some time just waiting for the right moment.
Right moment? For what?
There's supposed to be a dragon holed up over there. A pretty vile swamp has built up there since he came.
I can well remember a time when you wouldn't get your feet wet around here.
But now, I'd never go in there alone.
Well. Rod is still here. But he'd run at the first sight of meatbugs.
What about you? You didn't just come here for the pleasure of it, did you? Let's go in there together.
I prefer to stay alone.
Suit yourself. So I was mistaken about you!
Why not - I could use some help.
That's good. Then I can finally get out of here. This stink is unbearable. Just give the word!
I changed my mind! Let's go together!
Just give the word!
Now would be a good moment to get going!
Let's go, then!
The swamp starts just behind the next bend here. I suggest we go straight through here.
Or you can also check the passage over there, so none of the beasts can attack us from the rear. What do you prefer?
Let's not waste any time!
(bellows) Attack!
I can already hear the creature. We must be careful!
Go ahead and see if we can attack.
Damn. Is it dead?
Calm down. It's over!
Boy, what a humdinger.
The swamp dragon is dead! What are you going to do now?
No idea. I haven't thought about it, really. At any rate, you could now return to Khorinis as a hero.
I bet there's a pile to be made out of this. Think about it.
How are things?
Hey, don't I know you from somewhere?
It's possible ...
I used to deal in swampweed back in the colony, remember?
And what are you dealing in now?
Ah, don't ask.
I brought a whole package of swampweed with me from the mining colony.
Many of the mercenaries like a little smoke now and then. I've earned a small fortune on the side.
But some bastard stole all the weed from my chest!
I'm pretty sure it was that Bodo. He bunks in the same room as me, and he always grins at me like such an idiot ...
What are you going to do about the thief, then?
One of these days, I'll catch him puffing away on my weed.
And then I'll find a quiet spot and teach him a lesson he won't forget.
If I knock him down here in the middle of the yard, the other farmers will notice, and I'll pay an arm and a leg.
How come?
Quite simple. We can't rough up the farmers, otherwise Lee makes us pay a heavy fine. That's the way Onar wants it.
And the more witnesses there are, the more of a fuss there is. That makes things more expensive.
So I'll pull the thing off nice and inconspicuously ...
I want to join Lee's people!
LEE'S people?! If Lee keeps on this way, they soon won't be his any more!
Why?
Lee has always been a quiet one. It was that way in the colony, too.
But lately, he's overdoing it. He just wants to sit here and wait until the paladins drop dead from starvation.
Sylvio thinks we should clean up a bit on the small farms and outside the city.
I think that would make for an excellent change.
At the moment, most of us are just twiddling our thumbs here - do you want to join up anyway?
I want to become one of you no matter what!
You already know that we take a vote on every new recruit?
What are you hinting at?
Well, I haven't had anything to smoke in a long time. Bring me a few swampweed reefers and you've got my vote.
You can surely scare some up someplace.
About the swampweed ...
You brought back my packet! Now everything will be all right.
I'm certainly going to vote for you ...
I'll see what I can do ...
Here's a few stalks for you ...
Ah! You are my man!
You've got my vote.
That's all? I can smoke that much in one sitting!
It's got to be at least 10 reefers.
At any rate, you've got my vote for joining us.
Show me your wares.
Sure. Help yourself.
I don't have any swampweed at the moment. Do you want something else?
I know who took your weed.
Who? Was it that Bodo?
No - one of the mercenaries did it - Dar.
That bastard - where is he?
Finding him won't help you, he doesn't have the package any more. He sold it in Khorinis.
WHERE IS HE!?!
Behind the kitchen building, on the corner ...
I'LL FLATTEN HIM!
You really gave Dar what for ... are you feeling better now?
(sighs) Yeah, that felt good.
Not to HIM, I suppose ...
The little beggar has no business going through my chest!
Would this package of swampweed happen to be yours?
Well, I'll be! Where did you get that?
It's a long story ...
Doesn't matter, really, you're a decent guy.
Here, take this as a reward. Have fun with it!
First let me roll a few ...
What do you want? I'm not giving anything away.
I'm looking to become an apprentice.
Really? And with whom are you going to sign up?
I'm in need of healing.
(curtly) Why, are you injured?
Yes.
Go to Vatras then, he'll patch you up all right. And stop bleeding all over my floor!
There's barely a scratch on you and I have more important things to do than talk to you.
Not really.
Get lost, then, or you may well suffer an injury.
Can I sell you some herbs?
If you have any to offer ...
Show me your wares.
I want to sign up with you as an apprentice.
With ME? No! I have already had the dubious pleasure once of grappling with an apprentice. That's quite enough for me.
I invested several years in his education, and in the end the poor fool up and poisoned himself.
Go sign up with one of the other masters!
I want to sign up with one of the other masters.
You have come to ask my approval?
Hm - as far as I am concerned, you can sign up with whomever you like.
Well, you're not going to get it! The things I've heard about you do not speak for you.
I shall not vote for a criminal such as yourself to attain an honorable position in our town.
Until you have settled this matter with the commander of the city guard, my answer shall be no!
What will I have to do to become YOUR apprentice?
(sighs) I couldn't bear yet ANOTHER dilettante on my conscience.
There is a multitude of herbs out there. Used in different variations, they develop the most diverse effects.
You probably don't even know half of them.
(sighs) Here - this is a list of the most important plants.
Bring me a plant of each kind, and I might reconsider taking you in as an apprentice.
About the plants ...
If you cannot handle that by yourself, you won't be any good as an alchemist either!
I've got all the plants I was supposed to bring you!
What? You're pulling my leg, right?
By Adanos! It's all there all right.
Who knows, maybe some day you could make a decent alchemist after all.
I see.
Can I become your apprentice now?
As far as I am concerned, yes.
All that matters to Harad is that you will be able to defend the city if it is attacked by orcs.
And it looks like you've got him convinced of that.
But he thinks you are a coward.
But Harad claims he has never seen you before.
Bosper has been quite reluctant to comment on your qualities.
I suppose he would like to take you on as an apprentice himself.
But he still agreed in the end.
To withhold one's approval for this reason is certainly not an honorable thing to do!
But if all other masters approve, you won't need his vote.
And Bosper doesn't know you yet.
Thorben is a very religious man.
He has given you his blessing. That is a good sign.
He will only give you his approval with the blessing of the gods.
Thorben does not know who you are.
As for Matteo - he's singing your praises high and low.
Matteo says there's still something you owe him. If you want his vote you had better take care of that little matter.
Matteo says he has not yet talked to you about this.
Matteo says he has never seen you in his shop before.
This means you have the approval of all masters!
You now have the approval of four masters. That will suffice for you to be accepted as an apprentice.
Are you ready to begin your apprenticeship with me?
You need the approval of at least four masters in order to be able to start an apprenticeship in the lower part of town.
This means that you should talk to all those who do not quite approve of you yet.
(irritated) No way! I have heard rumors that you stand accused as a criminal here in Khorinis!
I shall not take you on as an apprentice until you have settled this matter with the commander of the city guard.
Yes, Master.
(sighs) All right then! I hope I'm not going to regret this decision.
From this moment, you may consider yourself my apprentice.
I need to sleep on it first.
All right! If you cannot really put your heart into this, you should choose a different calling.
(irritated) I refuse to instruct you any further as long as you are accused of a crime in town.
Go to Lord Andre and set matters right again.
So you have joined the militia? I've already heard about that.
Get yourself apprenticed in a hurry, and then up and join the militia? I'm not going to make it that easy for you.
I expect you to stick to our agreement and bring me plants and mushrooms on a regular basis.
