If it's too much for you to work two jobs at once, you'll just have to sleep less!
I see you have entered the service of Innos. I guess that means that, from now on, you cannot spare a lot of time just to fetch herbs for an old man.
Still, I consider it a great honor to have supported you on your way.
If, in spite of your new duties, you should find the time to occupy yourself with alchemy, you can always be sure of a warm welcome here.
What have you been up to?
I expect more of my apprentice than just dropping in at my place once in a blue moon!
Did you at least bring me some mushrooms?
There you are again...
What are my tasks?
I realize that I cannot expect a young man to spend all day indoors with me.
From time to time, you shall bring me the plants I need. In return, I shall instruct you in the art of alchemy.
You can buy the bottles from me. Most of the ingredients, however, you will have to get for yourself.
And I expect you to behave properly as a citizen of this town.
What plants am I supposed to bring?
I shall buy everything you bring me - and I'll pay the usual price.
For mushrooms, however, I shall pay you a special price.
You wanted mushrooms ...
I've got a few murky mushrooms here ...
Ah! Those are the best! Well done! Here's your gold!
And here are some of the others ...
I've got a few mushrooms here!
These are not quite as good as murky mushrooms, but I'll take them anyway.
Why are those things so important?
Even though you are my apprentice, I won't tell you everything.
All right - I shall tell you, then. But you must keep it to yourself.
Murky mushrooms are full of magic energy. And every time you eat one, a little bit of this energy will accumulate in your body.
Once you have eaten a sufficient amount of these mushrooms, your magic energy will increase ...
If I had told you that earlier, you would have gobbled up all the mushrooms yourself, wouldn't you?
(sighs) Oh, man!
You have already asked me that. (mischievously) Who knows, maybe some day I'll actually tell you...
I'm going to bring you some ...
Great! Bring me as many as you can find ...
Instruct me in the art of alchemy!
All right. Basics first.
Each potion is made of plants - they possess all kinds of powers.
They do nothing but put all their power into growth - and modifying this power is what the art of alchemy is about.
To prepare a potion at the alchemist's bench, you need a laboratory flask.
You need to know the correct formulation and have the appropriate ingredients.
There are quite a few formulations I could teach you.
Potions which restore your lost strength, and even potions which affect your strength permanently.
You cannot learn everything at once.
I'm looking for new recipes for potions.
Do you have any previous experience with alchemy?
Yes, I do.
Yet you are still alive ... those aren't bad qualifications.
I think I can tell you a few formulations. It depends, of course, on what you want to know.
What recipes can you teach me?
I'm sorry. There is nothing else I could teach you.
I know a few - make your own choice.
The ingredients for an essence of healing are healing plants and meadow knotweed.
To prepare a healing extract, you need healing herbs and meadow knotweed.
Be sure to heat that extract very carefully.
Creating an elixir of healing takes quite a bit of experience.
You need healing roots and meadow knotweed. Take special care when heating it this time.
The elixir of life! A rare brew. Not so much because of the effort - the potion actually isn't all that hard to make.
But the ingredients are very rare. You need healing roots and king's sorrel.
The essence of magic is the simplest of magic potions.
Take fire nettles and meadow knotweed and heat them slowly.
Since you can already prepare an essence of magic, with a little effort you should be able to produce an extract as well.
You need to put the right kind of feeling into decocting that brew. Use fireweed and meadow knotweed for this potion.
The elixir of strength! An excellent potion. You need the rare dragonroot and king's sorrel.
When boiling the brew, don't let the bubbles get too big or you'll be in for a nasty surprise!
Can I get a drink here?
If you have gold, you can even eat here if you like.
Show me your wares.
And, how's business going?
Ah, don't remind me. Lord Andre is serving free beer at the gallows square.
Hardly anybody comes here now except for the rich people from the upper quarter.
What's wrong with them?
(laughs) Some of those swells can really get on your nerves.
Take that Valentino, for instance - I can't stand the sight of him.
But I can't pick my customers. I need every coin I can make.
What little I had managed to save has been stolen, along with all my silver.
Tell me about the missing townspeople.
�I heard that a lot of them went missing down by the harbor. Small wonder with all that's going on down there.
�Even Thorben, the carpenter in the lower part of town, has lost his apprentice.
�Hakon, one of the merchants in the marketplace, had an especially strange tale to tell.
�He said that there was this fellow he used to bump into every day, and then suddenly he vanished off the face of the earth. He even went to see the militia about it.
�The townspeople all pretty much panicked after that. I don't know what to make of it. I think it's all nonsense.
�Khorinis is a rough city, and many dangers lurk outside her gates.
Those who don't stay within the city walls will be attacked by bandits or eaten by wild animals. It's that simple.
You've been robbed?
Yes, some time ago. It was still rather crowded that night, and I was doing the round serving beer.
I wasn't gone long from behind the counter - but it was long enough for those bastards.
I went to see the militia about it - but they couldn't find a thing, of course. They prefer to get plastered on free beer.
Here - take this as a reward.
A very special beer. This is my last keg.
It's the very last drop!
I've got your silver.
Really!
Look what I have here...
Mmm? (surprised) But this is Lehmar's ledger!
What are you planning to do with that?
Here is your book.
Thanks! You saved my butt. Lehmar can get rather ugly.
What do I have to do to get into the upper quarter?
You need to be a citizen of the town. Go find some work.
Preferably with the craftsmen in the lower part of town. That would make you a citizen.
Well, and if that's still not enough, go talk to Lord Andre at the barracks.
Maybe he'll let you join the city guard. They can go into the upper quarter, too.
What is it with this Valentino?
He's filthy rich and has no need to work. And he brags about it to everyone.
Whether you want to hear it or not.
He drinks a lot and always stays until the end - then, early in the morning, he totters back to the upper quarter.
It's the same every day.
Valentino was unable to pay his bar tab last night.
He was blathering something about having being robbed, and paying me later ... Really!
And right before that, he had been crowing about how much money he had.
Then he put his hand in his pocket and made a funny face. He said he had been robbed ...
And? What did you do?
Well, I gave him a good thrashing, what else?
Here - take this ring.
What? I don't understand ...
It used to belong to Valentino.
You're welcome to pass it on to the next person who tans his hide ...
Welcome to the 'Ring of Water', brother.
You should go see Vatras now ...
If you have a problem with wolves or field raiders, go talk to one of the younger mercenaries.
You can come to me when the paladins show up here.
What?
Whenever one of you peasants comes to me, it's always about slaughtering innocent beasts.
I'm not a peasant.
Oh? And what is it you want, then?
As long as you barely know how to wield a weapon, you're in the wrong place here!
I want to become a mercenary!
You look more like someone who was born to work in the field, boy.
Can you wield a weapon then?
Have you gotten better by now?
So, how about one-handed weapons?
I'm not so bad at that.
Weeell ...
And two-handed weapons, then?
I can handle those.
I'm surely going to get better!
Well, at least you're not a bloody beginner. All right. I'm going to vote you in.
Whatever else you need to know, you can learn from me.
In other words: you're a bloody greenhorn!
Each mercenary needs to be able to rely on his comrades. All our lives depend on that.
I've heard that you belong to the 'Ring of Water'.
What rat has not been able to keep his big trap shut?
Lee told me about it.
Lares said you could help me if I told you that I 'reside beneath his wing'.
(sigh) Look's like I've got to deal with you now, doesn't it?
All right, so what do you need?
And be damn careful about what you tell me now. For if I don't like what I hear, I might just skin you alive.
(menacing) And woe betide you if I hear that you can't keep your trap shut. And I'm only saying this once, understand?
(furiously) That's it. Now you've gone too far. I'll sweep the yard with you.
I want your armor.
Say that again and you get to pick up your teeth from the ground.
I want your weapon!
(menacingly) Do you, now?
(grimly) Just try and get it!
Clear out. I want to take your place on this farm.
Don't get cute with me, kid, or I'll break every single bone in your body.
Teach me how to fight.
All right. What else?
You could help me to be accepted by the mercenaries.
(laughs) I can just see it now. Right. I'll try. What else?
Pay me for my silence.
Wouldn't you like that? Too bad for you. I won't be blackmailed, buster.
I don't really need anything. I'll get along by myself.
If that's what you want. You had your chance.
That's all.
That shouldn't be too hard.
It's already taken care of.
Oh. I guess I can't help you then.
What do you mean by that?
Well, it means that I cannot help you.
Or do you want me to go up against every single mercenary just so that you can join here?
You'll have to do that yourself.
So go ahead, take care of it and then come back here.
Ah yes. That's easy. Listen. Come back tomorrow. I'll have taken care of it by then.
But you're going to have to do something for me in return.
And what would that be?
Not far from here, to the south-east, there's a small bandit camp in the mountains.
If you go south-east from here you'll soon see the tower there.
One of my people, Patrick, left several days ago to do business with those varmints.
Well. I told him it was a rotten idea. But that idiot wouldn't listen to me.
I assume they've made short work of him. But I don't know for sure.
You're going to find out for me.
Forget it. That's much harder than Torlof's task.
It doesn't have to be. Such a small, greasy, nondescript fellow like you won't be of much interest to them.
And I can't do it myself. Those boys will get their dander up at the mere sight of a mercenary.
And what makes you so sure that they won't make short work of ME, too?
The fact that I know the name of their leader. It's Dexter. You'll simply claim that you know the guy.
His men will think twice then before they wring your neck just for the heck of it.
It could still get dangerous, of course.
But you can handle that.
Help me become a mercenary.
Let me think. Mmh. You'll have to get past Torlof if you want to make any progress here.
Have you already seen Torlof about it?
Not really.
Yes. That's with the test and all.
Ah. What test would that be?
I haven't accepted it yet.
I'm supposed to collect the rent at Sekob's farm.
I'm supposed to drive the militia away from Bengar's farm.
I went to see Dexter.
And?
Dexter is dead.
There was no trace up there of your buddy Patrick.
Dexter remembered him, but he said it had been ages since he'd seen him.
And you're sure that Dexter didn't lie to you?
No, I'm not. But this is all I can tell you.
I don't get it. He seems to have vanished off the face of the earth.
Well, you've kept your side of the bargain ...
What about Torlof's test, now?
Don't worry, you can go back to Torlof. Your task is fulfilled, and you've passed the test. I told you I would take care of it.
Patrick is back.
Yeah, man. I had almost given up hope. You ...
Hey, do me a favor.
Yes?
Spare us both your speech of thanks.
I wasn't going to thank you at all.
But ... ?
(grins) I was just going to tell you that you're a damned cheeky devil.
(grins) Stay cool!
What should I learn first, one-handed or two-handed combat?
Those two types of arms are rather similar.
As soon as you reach the next level with one type of weapon, you automatically learn for the other as well.
If, for instance, you are good at fighting with one-handed swords, but still a beginner with two-handed weapons ...
... your two-handed skills will go up as well whenever you train with a one-hander.
If you train with one type of weapon only, you will find the training more exhausting.
If you always train both, you will arrive at the same result with less effort.
In the end, the outcome will be the same either way - it's your choice.
What are the advantages of one-handed or two-handed weapons?
A good question. I see that you have given the subject some thought.
One-handed weapons are faster, but a little weaker.
Two-handers cause more damage, but you cannot strike as fast.
Also, you need more strength to wield a two-hander. This means additional training.
The only way to become really good is to invest a lot of effort.
I don't waste my time with beginners.
Teach me how to fight!
I can teach you to use any weapon - where shall we start?
I can train you to use a one-handed sword. But you're not good enough yet to wield a two-hander.
When it comes to one-handers, you're a bloody beginner! But your two-handed skills aren't so bad.
If you need more experience with one-handed arms, go find a different teacher.
I only train mercenaries, or worthy candidates!
You've become better already - keep it up!
You saw the murder of Lothar, didn't you?
(nervously) I need not answer any questions about a current investigation.
Lord Hagen already has everything I know on record.
What was it you saw?
(hectically) Really, I haven't got any time now.
(hectically) You need to go now, the office is closing.
Enough of that! What did you see?
(nervously) I... I saw how the mercenary struck down the paladin from behind.
(nervously) And then he took his sword and rammed it through his chest.
Are you completely sure?
(scared) Yes, of course. I saw it with my own eyes.
(scared) But I really haven't got any time now, there's a huge pile of paperwork I need to do.
I don't believe you.
(with fake confidence) So what, what are you going to do about it?
What is it you want?
(arrogantly) You don't even have enough gold to pay me.
How much?
2000 gold pieces. Well, that could make me rethink the matter.
You hold your life dear, don't you?
(scared) If you attack me, they'll hang you.
I have powerful friends. So don't you dare lay a finger on me.
Now get out of here! Or I'll call the guards!
They could make you talk in the monastery.
(white as chalk) What do you mean by that?
Well, we have ways to bring out the truth. Painful ways.
No, please don't. I'll tell you everything you want.
I could tell the mercenaries where you live.
(white as chalk) What is that supposed to mean?
I bet they're dying to make your acquaintance. They are not very happy at all.
You can't do that, they would kill me.
That is very well possible.
I'll say whatever you want, but you mustn't do that.
Perjury will land you in the slammer - for a long time!
You're trying to threaten me? A little guardsman is threatening me, the secretary to the governor?
If you don't get lost right now, I'll see to it that you are demoted.
Here's the gold.
It's better if I don't ask you where you got that.
To be honest, I don't really care.
But we're in business.
So what really happened?
I didn't see what happened. I received some gold for blaming that mercenary.
In times like these, it's everyone for himself. I needed the money.
Who paid you?
That's enough. He'll kill me if I rat him out.
Are you ready to tell that to Lord Hagen, too?
I'm not a lunatic. I can't stay in town now.
I'll give you my diary, that should be proof enough.
What are you doing? Are you melting down your gold?
No, I'm washing vegetables. Of course, I'm melting down gold - and I'm making coins out of it.
Because, just imagine: one fine evening Raven comes along and shoves a coin die in my hands.
Out of one single gold nugget, I can mint a heap of coins - I'm so good that no one can tell the difference!
How many coins will you give me for one nugget?
Well, I don't know you at all, but I'll make you a special price. For one nugget I'll give you...
Let's haggle!
Hmm...no. That's the standard price EVERYONE gets.
I thought that was a special price.
It is. Everyone here is special to me.
Let's trade...
But you don't have any gold nuggets on you.
(conjuring) KHARDIMON FATAGN SHATAR FATAGN BELIAR.
What do you know about Raven?
You won't believe it. I was there. I saw what he did in the tomb!
(afraid) He mumbled and called some strange words. Over and over...
(loudly) And then a blazing light came out of the tomb and I heard the SCREAM.
(calls) Oh, ye gods, that voice. That was the sound of the end of the world!
Raven spoke with it, they conversed - Raven and THAT voice!
I can't remember what they said - I just know that I could only master my limbs again many hours later, back in the camp.
Can you repeat Raven's words again?
Sure. Are you ready?
I think we had better leave it be...
Nice to see you. We feared the worst.
It wasn't all that bad. How's it going?
This is a very dangerous region here.
Some of the animals in the area have never been seen by anyone before us.
Close by there is a large swamp that managed to grow for several hundred years without anyone noticing.
Not a day goes by that we aren't attacked by the beasts from the swamp.
I advise you to be careful if you go for a stroll here.
Is there anything new about the stone sentinels?
We have already managed to eliminate some of them.
They stand there, paralyzed like pillars of salt, and don't budge.
But appearances deceive. If you get too close, they'll attack you!
There's no doubt that the source of their power can be found here somewhere.
May I bother you for a moment?
(surprised) It's YOU. I never thought I would see your face again.
It's very brave of you to show up here. There was a time we would have skinned you alive.
You can be glad that was a few weeks ago and we've all calmed down.
What are you doing here?
(confused) My task is to find out more about the guardians of the temple.
That is a tough nut, let me tell you. These stone sentinels have a characteristic that is utterly foreign to me.
One moment they're standing around completely lifeless and the next they're attacking you like they're possessed.
I still haven't been able to determine their driving power, but one thing is sure. It is of magical origin.
Tell me more about these stone sentinels.
(confused) I can't tell you much so far. Unfortunately, we have had to destroy them. Now they aren't dangerous.
When we came here, they attacked us.
We could only defeat them with our combined power, and I'm afraid there are even more waiting for us behind the portal.
There must be a way to banish their driving force, so that they remain nothing more than statues.
Can you sell me some equipment?
Why not? If I remember correctly, we've already done business.
Tell me what you need.
What are you smoking there?
Want a toke?
Sure.
Not bad, eh?
Where did you get the stuff?
(grins) I have my sources.
No.
Do you do anything besides smoke?
(sarcastic) Sometimes I let some vengeful swampweed junkies beat me up..
Not at the moment.
I want to join the mercenaries. Do you mind?
Who cares.
Cipher told me that someone stole a package of swampweed from him ...
(laughs subdued and moronically)
Would you know anything about that?
(very short) No.
(threatens) Where's the package?
Okay, okay, okay. I sold it to some bum in town.
It was at the harbor. I can't remember what he looked like.
Could it be that you need another thrashing?
Honest, man, I was totally stoned. I don't have the slightest idea what the guy looked like.
It was at the harbor near the boat-builders'. That's all I can remember.
What do I know?
I'll knock it out of you!
Relax. I'm way too stoned to fight with you!
Here, first take a big toke!
Blabbermouth! You told Cipher I took his weed!
Like hell will I vote for you.
Have you ever tried shroom tobacco?
Sounds interesting. Give it here.
All right, here we go ...
Have you ever smoked that stuff YOURSELF?
Well ...
Have you or haven't you?
I've been sort of busy ...
Oh, shit!
Holy Rhobar!
That stuff is way too harsh! Don't even try it!
There seem to be some mercenaries missing here.
Sure. That's true. Sylvio is miles away, and he took half the crew with him.
Who cares. I've got a better chance of becoming someone with Lee's boys. All I need is a bang.
If I could bring proof that I'm a real tough guy, maybe I could even become one of Lee's bodyguards.
Tough guy? You?
(angry) Oh, come on, shut up. Who are you anyway?
Some puffed-up nitwit from the city. You dorks got nothing going for you.
You've only been here for a couple of days, and you're spouting off already.
Who you trying to scare with your stupid magic bullshit? Not me anyway.
Now that I think about it, splitting your skull is exactly what would get me a lot of respect with Lee's boys.
Just you wait. I'll find a way to make an impression on Lee.
OK. Just try it.
Ooh, I can't wait.
I've got no time for this kind of bullshit.
Oh, yeah. The shining knight of justice, I forgot. Too bad. I thought you had more guts.
What would that look like?
I don't know exactly. Some kind of orc trophy wouldn't be bad.
Some kind of insignia from the orc leaders or something. A banner, an armband or a ring, or something like that.
I can't make any kind of impression here with much less. That much is obvious.
That doesn't concern me.
(angry) Of course not. I'd have been amazed.
All right, I know Lee won't exactly be thrilled if I get into it again with you.
I don't want to make any enemies here. So let's forget the nonsense, okay?
I've got the orc trophy you were looking for.
What's this you've brought me?
The ring of an orcish warlord.
Wow, in that case ... What do you want for it?
Give me some gold.
Mmh. 600 gold coins?
What was that?
Okay. I'll give you 1200 gold coins for it.
Take it or keep the ring.
It's a deal. Here's the ring.
Thanks. I can't wait to hear what the others will say about it.
That's not enough.
And I think it's too much. This business is too shady for me. No offense.
What can you offer me?
Either take the money, or this amulet that I ... well, let's say, acquired a while ago.
It improves your dexterity. I've tried it myself.
Give me the amulet.
Sure thing. Have fun with it. Now gimme that ring.
It was a pleasure.
What can I do for you? Are you seeking spiritual comfort?
Do you want to direct a prayer to our Lord Innos, or donate some gold for his church?
I need to talk to the paladins. Can you help me get to them?
Well, you need access to the upper end of town. However, this is allowed only to citizens and the city watch.
And, of course, to us Magicians of Fire.
How can I become a Fire Magician?
You must join our order as a novice. When you have served for a time, perhaps you will be accepted into the ranks of the magicians.
However, the path to acceptance is long and full of work and study.
I've come to get your blessing!
That's good, that's good - then you will probably want to donate gold to the holy church of Innos, won't you?
Actually, I wanted your blessing so I can sign on as an apprentice in the lower part of town ...
But I have already given you my blessing, my son.
Go with Innos, my son!
But, my son! Without a modest donation to the church, it is impossible for me to bless you.
How else can I be certain of your good intentions towards the holy church of Innos?
So how much does a donation usually run to here?
Well, that depends on what percentage you want to give. Let me see how much you brought.
(looking in money pouch) Mmmmh hmmm ...
Hm, you're a poor soul, aren't you? Keep the little you have.
Well, you don't have much, but neither are you poor. 10 gold pieces for Innos - we live modestly.
You have more than 50 gold coins. Donate 25 to Innos and receive his blessing.
You have more than a hundred gold pieces - the Lord says, give if you have.
The church accepts your generous donation.
I bless you in the name of Innos. For he is light and righteousness.
Where do you come from?
I come from the monastery of the Magicians, which lies in the mountains.
We accept everyone there who is pure of heart and feels the desire to serve our almighty Lord Innos.
Tell me about Innos.
Innos, our almighty lord, is the light and the fire.
He chose humans to be his tool, giving them magic and laws.
We act in his name. We administer justice according to his will and preach his word.
Tell me more about the monastery.
We instruct our students in all forms of magic. But the arts of the Magicians of Fire consist of more than these alone.
We are also well versed in the art of alchemy, and in the creation of powerful runes.
We also make an excellent wine.
What are you doing in town?
I have discussions with the paladins and support the citizens with my advice and helpful words.
Particularly in these difficult times, it is our duty to be there for the people and to help the poor.
I heard rumors about a statuette you have supposedly lost.
Have you, now? You can only have heard that from Vatras the Water Mage.
What's the problem?
A very valuable statuette has been sent to the monastery from the mainland. But it never arrived at the monastery.
Has the ship been raided?
(ashamed) No. It got to Khorinis safe and sound, and I went to collect it there.
Then, when I was on my way to the monastery, a band of goblins got hold of it.
(angrily) Now don't you look at me that way. We magicians are only human, too, you know.
Didn't you try to get that statuette back?
Of course I did! I searched for it high and low. But to no avail.
You said that the goblins have it now?
They stole it and made off into the underbrush with it.
I never saw them again. They're probably holing up in some pit in the ground.
Where was it that you lost that statuette?
I was on my way to the monastery. Near Orlan's tavern.
Orlan's tavern? Where would that be?
If you leave the city by this gate here and simply follow the path, you'll come to a house that stands by itself.
That's Orlan's tavern. The 'Dead Harpy'.
I've heard enough. I'll find the thing for you.
May Innos guide you and protect you from the dangers that await you outside the city gates.
I found your statuette.
Praise be to Innos!
What will you do with it now?
Nothing at all. It brought me nothing but bad luck.
YOU'll take it back to the monastery for me, son.
Naturally, they won't let you in unless you dedicate the rest of your life to serving the monastery.
But I'm sure you won't mind doing that if it means you can be of service to ME, right?
Go with Innos, my son!
I took your statuette to the monastery. So you can relax now.
That's good news. May Innos protect you.
Take this as a small token of my gratitude, son.
I am poor!
So, you are impoverished. No wonder in these times. Take this gold, it should help you.
But you should look for work, then you will see how quickly gold comes to you. And then you may give to the church of Innos, as she has given to you.
I want to make a donation ...
You have donated more than 1000 gold pieces overall to me.
The blessing of the Lord Innos is always with you.
But I didn't bring enough gold ...
That doesn't matter, my son. You can also donate as much as you want later.
I bless you in the name of Innos. For he is light and righteousness.
You can donate at any time if you have brought enough gold.
Innos, you are the light which illuminates the path of the just.
In your name, I bless this man. May your light shine upon him.
The Lord says - if you wish to pray, open your spirit. And if you wish to donate, bring your gift along.
Innos, bless this man. Let your light shine upon him.
Give him strength to behave justly.
If you want to donate that much gold, you should actually bring it, too.
Look who's here. The great emancipator. Well, hero - what are you doing here?
I'm looking for a few answers.
I never thought you'd come here voluntarily.
What do you mean by that?
I mean that I've been looking for you. Haven't you seen any of my wanted posters?
They all bear YOUR mug. Oh yes ... you're very much wanted. Didn't you know that?
SOMEONE is passing around pieces of paper with my face on them. SOMEONE told me that it's you.
Somebody talks too much.
But you're right. I distributed those wanted posters. And, lo and behold - here you are.
So what do you want from me?
Me? Nothing whatsoever. But my boss is hell-bent on seeing you dead.
So he wants me to find you and bring him your head.
I don't believe a word you're saying.
Hey, it's true. I swear on my mother's grave!
A mercenary named Patrick's been seen here.
Patrick, huh? No idea what you're talking about.
I do recall some loud-mouthed mercenary who hung out with the boys out there sometimes.
(obviously lying) But I haven't seen him in ages.
(acting innocent) Maybe he got himself hanged at last. I wouldn't know.
There's this fellow with an eyepatch. He's looking for YOU!
Everybody's looking for me. I couldn't care less.
If that guy has some business with me, let him come here.
They say that you're kidnapping people from Khorinis.
So you found that out, too. Good work, buster.
And here I was thinking I had covered my tracks.
Where did those people disappear to? Maybe down the mines, somewhere here?
(laughs) They're far away in the north-east by now where you can't get to them.
I could show you where exactly, but I don't know why I would want to do that.
Who gave you this order?
My boss. He's a dangerous man. You know him: Raven, one of the former ore barons from the old camp in the Valley of Mines.
He needs those people to fulfill his plans. And that's all you need to know.
Raven, dangerous? Oh well ...
(irritated) What do YOU know? You don't know him like I do.
(unsure) He was a miserable swine even back then, but these days ...
He has changed since the fall of the Barrier. There's a black shadow across his face.
(intimidated) His fierce glance will pierce you like the claws of a raptor if you look into his eyes for too long.
My only advice to you is: Leave Khorinis as fast as you can, before it's too late.
(somberly) There's nothing here for you. Except for certain death.
An ore baron here, in Khorinis?
He's no longer an ore baron. He's got plans of his own, and Khorinis will feel that before long.
Your boss? Who's that supposed to be?
(laughs) Wouldn't you just love to know that? Yes, I can imagine.
(serious) I don't see any reason why I should tell you.
And what do you intend to do now? Kill me?
Yeah. But you set us all free. That's why I'm giving you another chance. Beat it - disappear, make yourself invisible. Go and don't cross my path again.
I need to know where you brought those people.
(laughs) Well. You could try beating it out of me ...
(menacing) It's better for you if you leave now.
If I see you around here again, I won't hesitate to kill you.
(attacking) You asked for this ...
Oh man, you'd have done better not to show up here. You're the wrong man in the wrong place.
You want my head? Come and get it, then!
(attacking) If that's what you want ...
Hey, I thought you were dead.
Yes ... so I was.
But now I'm back, and looking for proof of the arrival of the dragons.
Who are you doing that for?
I work for Lord Hagen. With the help of the paladins, the dragons can be stopped.
The paladins? Let me tell you something. After I managed to flee from here, I went to Khorinis.
I wanted to warn the paladins about the dragons. Heaven knows why I even tried.
That puffed-up Lothar didn't even listen to me - and certainly didn't let me talk to Lord Hagen.
Instead, they sent me back here with the expedition. So don't talk to me about paladins ...
The important thing is to stop the dragons as long as there's still time - no matter who helps us achieve that.
Stop them? We should get our asses out of this valley as long as we still have time for THAT.
Say - how did you manage to get across the pass? I thought that it was swarming with orcs.
There is a path through the abandoned mine which isn't held by orcs.
That's good to know. Then I will head for Khorinis before long - I've got a few old accounts to settle there.
Listen, I need this proof.
All right, I'll help you if I can. But I'm not going to stick my neck out for anyone.
All right, if that's your mission - go talk to Commander Garond.
If anyone knows anything about the dragon attacks, it will be the boys in the castle.
I'm traveling on behalf of Garond. He needs to know how much ore has been mined so far.
And then he will give you the proof you want?
That's right. So - can you tell me anything about it?
And while you're in the castle, you can tell Garond something that should interest him a lot:
There are FOUR chests of ore here in the back of the cave. Silvestro's people mined them.
Garond is welcome to come and get them - but I won't be here then.
In the cave close to where I hid he'll find the FOUR crates of ore. Silvestro's men mined them.
Garond is welcome to go and get them. I have no use for them anyway.
How did you come by the ore?
I was with Silvestro's group. We had been prospecting for several days when Silvestro suddenly became nervous.
He said that we should take the ore to a safe place.
Well, since I was planning to skedaddle anyway, I volunteered to hide the ore.
And that was lucky for me. Because the scrapers met with a few minecrawlers. And none of them survived.
What about the two dead knights in front of your hideout?
They met their doom during a fight with a group of snappers.
Well, the Valley of Mines has its own rules. I told them so. But they wouldn't listen to me.
What do I need to know about the valley?
Since the fall of the Barrier, a few things have changed around here. The orcs are now in charge.
We humans are nothing but fodder for the true rulers of the valley: the dragons.
Stay away from anything that is stronger than you - and avoid everything that resembles a dragon.
I want to buy Gorn his freedom, but Garond is asking 1000 pieces of gold.
A tidy sum of gold. I've got 300 gold pieces on me, you can take them. The rest is up to you.
Can you teach me something?
Sure, what would you like to know?
You have gained a little dexterity already.
(appraisingly) Good. Your strength has increased.
Let's go together.
To the pass? Why not ...
You go first. You've only just come from there.
But don't even think about going too close to the castle, or to the orc wall.
Also, we need to avoid all fortified camps of the paladins.
I have just escaped from one, and I don't intend to go back to toiling in one of the mines.
And it goes without saying that we're not going near any dragons.
Let me know when you're ready.
Come with me.
That's the wrong direction!
All right.
Wait here!
Okay.
I'll wait by the tower outside.
I'll wait near the mine.
I'll wait in front of the mine.
I'll wait close by.
No. I'm going back to the cave.
Come and see me when you're done here.
But don't wait too long, or I'm going back by myself.
You've got to be kidding. We're supposed to split up? Here?
Over my dead body!
We're going to the pass now - together.
Go ahead and take a look around - I'll be waiting outside.
To get to the pass, we'll have to go in the other direction.
There's something eerie about this old tomb.
Let's rather walk around it.
That's the entrance to the former New Camp.
I'm sure that a dragon has made himself at home in there.
This swamp is a dead end.
I wouldn't be surprised if there's even a dragon lurking for us inside.
Let's not go in there.
If we keep walking up the mountain, we're sure to meet a dragon.
And I would love to get to Khorinis ALIVE.
Let's take a different path.
This lake doesn't lead us anywhere.
To get to the pass, we'll have to go in the other direction!
This is the old tower of Xardas. He made himself scarce long ago, of course.
I'm sure there must be some nasty surprises waiting in there.
That's Fajeth's mine back there.
If you want to go there, count me out!
I shall give that mine a wide berth!
That's the mine where they took me when I came back with the penal convoy.
I'm sure that NOBODY'S still alive in there.
But if you take too long, I'll just go back to my camp.
Unless you want me to wait here for you.
This is one of the new mines of the paladins.
I've never been there - and I'm not going to go there either.
Let's give that mine a wide berth.
Suicidal, are you? Just stay well away from that castle.
Hey, are you even listening to me?! Stay away from the castle!
What part of 'Stay away from the castle' is unclear?
We can't continue here. The orc barrier is too dangerous.
I think it would be better if we headed west again and walked around to the other side.
If we continue in this direction, we'll only end up at the orc barrier again.
Let's go to the pass!
I shall go the rest of the way by myself.
I have a few things to take care of before I can return to Khorinis.
Thank you, my friend. I'll see you in town.
Right, here we are.
Remember, back then?
When we met here for the first time?
It's been ages ...
There was something ELSE in this place - hmm - damn! I just can't remember.
Whatever ...
How's it going?
I could use a healing potion. You wouldn't happen to have one for me?
Let me know when you want to get started.
Fine. I'm just taking a brief rest.
Fine.
Here we are.
This island is not as far away from Khorinis as I thought.
I didn't know about it. But now, of course, a few things are becoming clear to me.
I had always asked myself how the orcs could keep their supplies coming so fast.
With this outpost, that's a piece of cake.
On your way to the interior of the island, you are probably going to encounter a trap or two.
If you think you are stuck at some point, come to me. Maybe my experience can help you.
I need your advice.
An orcish colonel has his headquarters up there. I can't get any further to the interior of the island from there.
Orcs are smart creatures. They are often underestimated. I assume they have a secret passage of some sort. Search the walls for secret switches.
Remember, however, that switches must often be used in a certain order before they have any effect.
I have fought with a dragon, and now I'm facing an abyss with a drawbridge. The bridge has been hauled up, and I cannot get across.
Mmh. Have you already tried a ranged weapon? Maybe the mechanism could be activated with a shot.
I'm facing a host of undead and their complicated traps.
I'm sorry, I have no experience with the undead. You're on your own with this one.
Come see me again when you have a problem which my experience can solve.
One more thing. I'd rather that you didn't draw all the creatures that crawl around here to the ship. I hope this orc raid was the last attack I had to fend off here!
I need ammunition.
Maybe I can help you.
Train me.
What is it you need?
Life will be much easier for you if you always try to stay out of the line of fire.
When you move, always have the litheness of a cat in mind. The rest will follow automatically.
For best results, put in a lot of dry practice.
To steady your hand, breathe out slowly while you aim.
It was high time. It's strange you've never learned this ability before.
It's all over. Now we can get out of here.
Now will you look at this. I've never seen such a construction all my life.
How in earth did you manage to get past that thing?
I was lucky, I suppose.
(laughs) If you say so.
Fine.
What are you going to do now?
That's a good question. I think I'll go back to Khorinis first.
There's no more thieves' guild there. That opens up some interesting possibilities.
Mmh. Or maybe I'll simply take over Bromor's business. There's always money in that. Honest money.
Go to the captain now and let's get out of here.
How's business?
Lousy. Somebody should have told me that Khorinis has gone to the dogs in the meantime.
No idea. I've only known the city like this.
You should have seen it a few years ago. You would have liked it then.
Hey, you look completely flabbergasted!
(laughs) You thought I had bought it, didn't you?
I was unconscious for quite some time. But, as you can see, I'm still alive.
The most important thing is that we're both here now.
You've got to help me.
Good thing you're here. You need to help me.
What are you doing here?
I've been observing the guards. They're constantly on their toes.
I don't think it will be easy for me to get through there.
Who are you?
I'm sure it's just my clothes. The guards won't let me into town.
That's why I bought these togs from a trader outside of town. Now I hope you'll remember me. I am Diego.
Back in the slammer, I taught you everything you needed to know to survive.
You can't just have forgotten all that.
Er ... what exactly happened back then?
Holy shit, you really don't remember a thing.
Listen I really don't have time to explain everything to you now. Only this much: we used to be damn good friends, and I saved your life more than once.
And now I need your help.
What kind of clothes are these?
I bought them from a trader outside of town. The guards wouldn't let me in at first.
Also, there's no need to let the whole world know where I come from.
You've got a point there.
That's the way I see it. But even though I have doffed my Shadow garb, I'm still who I always was.
And I have big plans for this city.
What is this about?
A lot of things have changed since I left here. I have to get back on my feet somehow.
What's the problem?
I have to get into the upper quarter.
But I'm not a citizen of the town, and I don't have enough money to bribe the guards. That's where you come in!
So you want me to lend you some gold?
Nonsense. I've got some gold - a whole lot of gold, even! Unfortunately, I don't have it with me.
You need to go fetch my gold for me.
I've got no time for that.
Hey, I thought we were buddies! It was me, after all, who saved your butt back when they tossed you into the colony.
You're exaggerating.
Am I, really? Then think for a minute about what would have happened if I hadn't explained to you back then how to behave.
The ore barons would have had you for breakfast, and you would have died miserably down in the mine.
What's in it for me?
Have I ever asked you what you could give me in return? We are friends, shouldn't that be enough?
OK, I'll help you.
Well. Listen. Back when the Barrier was still in place, I hid a small treasure.
It's been quite a while. That's why I forgot to take it with me.
And I can't leave here at all at the moment.
To cut a long story short, you must go to the Valley of Mines for me and fetch my gold.
What are you planning to do with the gold?
I still have an account to settle with one of the merchants in the upper quarter. I need to take care of that.
And then I'll be all set for a new career!
Where did you get all that gold?
Am I the only one, then, who put some gold aside for himself in the Valley of Mines?
Filching a few nuggets was a piece of cake. Just in case we ever got out of there.
Everybody was so keen on that ore that no-one even cared for gold at the time ...
Where's the gold hidden?
Directly at the trading square. Above the abandoned mine. It's in a leather satchel.
Spare yourself that comment. I know myself that we must have walked right past it.
Just bring me the bag.
But don't forget to check that it's the right one so you don't walk all that way for nothing.
How can I recognize it?
It's full of gold. A whole lot of gold!
I will try to find your gold.
(grins) Just do it. That's enough for me.
OK, I'll help you after all.
I knew it.
OK, let's get straight down to business.
All right. I have hidden a treasure in the Valley of Mines, and you are to go and get it for me.
I'll stay here in the meantime and prepare everything.
Very good. Gerbrandt had better watch out now.
I found your gold!
Great. Show me.
But that's not all of it! Don't you trust me? I need the entire sum.
If my plan works out, there will be enough left over for you.
So make sure that I get the whole amount. It's important!
Listen, I still need to take care of the guards.
I want you to take this letter to Gerbrandt. He is one of the fat merchants in the upper quarter.
Give him my regards. I'll meet you in front of Gerbrandt's house, then.
I delivered the letter.
Very good. How did Gerbrandt take it?
He was rather shocked and made himself scarce right away.
(satisfied) I should think so.
I'm afraid that, first of all, I need to attend to furnishing my new house. If I remember correctly, Gerbrandt's taste is horrible.
What about Gerbrandt?
He has enjoyed the good life for far too long.
He was living here, in the lap of luxury, while I was forcing down meatbug stew.
I have no idea where he went from here, but he'll never get a foothold in Khorinis again - I'll see to that.
If you're looking for him, you should try the harbor district.
The house is yours, then?
Yes, from cellar to attic, with all the furnishings.
Having spent several years in less-than-befitting quarters, I'm looking forward to sleeping in a soft four-poster bed.
And then, for breakfast, I'll have a fine wine and some excellent ham.
You don't miss any chances, do you?
You betcha.
So how did you pull this off?
Did you think that Gerbrandt came by his fortune through honest business?
Of course he never got his fingers dirty when it came to really shady deals. He had a helper for that.
Of course, I caught on to a lot back then. Gerbrandt finally got rid of me. He was probably afraid that I knew too much.
You never told me about that.
You never asked me.
What about my share?
Looks like you haven't forgotten everything I've taught you after all.
But you're right, I couldn't have done it without you. Here's your share.
Can you teach me something?
Yeah, sure. Just let me know when you're ready.
I have to attend to my business first.
Teach me.
I can teach you to become more dexterous.
You've become more dexterous already. Keep it up!
I'm going to leave Khorinis.
A wise decision. I wish I could come with you. This town has changed too fast - the times where you could get rich fast are over.
I could instruct you in archery, lock picking, and dexterity.
Also, I'm sure you can use a decent thief.
I'll think about it. At the moment, my crew is already complete.
Take your time. I'm not going anywhere.
Why don't you come with me? We'll meet at the harbor.
Mmh. You're right, Khorinis is a dump. I'm coming with you.
Wait, I'll be ready in a second.
Well, I'm ready. I'll see you at the ship.
Maybe I'll let you know when the time has come.
You do that. And maybe I'll even go with you. Who knows?
You take care of the city.
Really? You don't need me any more? Oh well. Don't forget to drop by when you're back in town.
You think we'll meet again?
I shall never forget the look on your face when you lay on the ground after Bullit knocked you down and we met for the first time.
They can't get the better of someone like you. We SHALL meet again. Take care.
Come back. I want you to accompany me.
What has become of your determination, my friend? Sure I'll go with you - just make up your mind.
Wait, I'll be ready in a second.
All right, we can go.
(grumpily) What do you want?
I know a thing or two about forging.
Fine ... so what?
Can I use your smithy?
I've got a lot to do. We'd only be in each other's way. Just wait until it gets dark.
Then Parlaf and I will hit the sack and you can work undisturbed.
Can you teach me something?
So you already know the basics. I can show you how to improve your work.
Then you'll be in a position to make better weapons.
Show me how I can forge a good sword!
Make sure that the steel glows evenly all around, so that you get an even blade afterwards.
If you keep that in mind, the blades you forge will be harder and sharper.
That is all you need to know. If you're looking for steel here in the castle, talk to Engor.
Could you make a weapon for me?
I don't have time for that. Tandor hands out the weapons - I just make them, and Parlaf sharpens them.
How's work?
I forge the weapons for the castle's knights. Since we've been here, I've been fully occupied making new weapons.
And we'll need them, too. We'll show these damned orcs how sharp our blades are.
(calls) Hey, Parlaf - make those blades nice and sharp - orcs are damn tough creatures!
It could be better. If you didn't constantly interrupt me, I might actually get something done.
I was outside when the dragon attacked.
I saw it, big as 10 men - its fiery breath destroyed the huts in the blink of an eye!
A dragon! I'm staying here. Nothing is going to budge me. I'm not crazy!
Traveling so far from home?
Out here you have to be careful, especially when you're all by yourself.
What are you doing out here?
Well, the tavern is too expensive for me, that's why I settled here.
The previous inhabitants don't seem to need it any more.
Who used to live in this camp?
No idea, probably some hunters. I suppose it got too dangerous for them out here.
Isn't it too dangerous out here?
Well, not if you can defend yourself. My crossbow has already proven to be of service many times.
It's not all that big.
But deadly, if you know how to handle it. I used to have a bigger one. Unfortunately, I lost it.
I ventured too far north into the mountains. There's a big stone circle there with a sacrificial altar.
While I was hunting scavengers up there, these vile undead beings came out of the woods and attacked me.
All I could do was run for my life.
While I was running, the crossbow slipped from my hand. I bet it's still lying up there by that strange stone circle in the north.
Here. I found your crossbow.
Indeed, this is mine. Don't tell me you were up by the stone circle?!
Most certainly!
That was pretty reckless of you. But thanks anyway.
Naturally, I'll repay this deed. I hope this is enough.
Can you teach me something?
Before I teach you anything, you'll have to improve your dexterity.
If you can pay. Like I said, at the moment I'm a bit strapped for cash.
How much do you ask?
Maybe later.
Here's your gold.
Good, as far as I'm concerned we can begin immediately.
Teach me something.
I can't teach you anything more. It's time you looked for another teacher.
(sadly) What do you want?
I'm busy distributing sausages.
Thanks. Hopefully, that won't be the last sausage I get around here.
What are you doing here?
I have transgressed against the precepts of the community.
Now I'm waiting for the decision of the High Council whether I may remain in the monastery.
Tell me what happened.
I took a book from the rooms of the magicians while I was sweeping, so I could read it later.
Master Hyglas noticed it immediately, of course, and asked me about the book.
Out of fear of being punished, I lied about it - but he caught me later when I was in my chamber with the book.
He was really angry and informed the High Council. Now they are discussing whether I can stay.
Is there any way I can help you?
No, I've been delivered up to the mercy of Innos and the magicians.
Hey, have you really demanded the test of fire?
Yes. And I intend to pass it.
Good - maybe I can help you with it. I can give you a very useful spell scroll. A SLEEP spell. Interested?
What can I do with it?
With this spell you can put people into a magic sleep for a short time. But only if their will is weaker than yours.
That could be very useful if someone is standing in your way ...
And how do I know whether the other person has a weaker will?
You needn't bother trying it with the magicians. But you could put most of the novices to sleep.
No, I don't need your help.
You can come to me any time if you change your mind.
What do you want for it?
Every magician who is accepted gets one wish.
And if you really pass the test of Fire, then you could fix it so that I can stay in the monastery.
All right, give me the spell scroll.
Good luck in your test. May Innos help you.
I changed my mind. Give me the sleep spell.
Good, if you pass the test, you'll see to it that I can stay in the monastery.
(joyful) Thanks, you saved me!
(frightened) Oh - forgive me Master - I didn't mean to impose.
(respectfully) I thank you for being allowed to stay in the monastery. My life will be different from now on ...
How's it going?
Good. I really enjoy the work, Master.
I thank Innos that I can be here in the monastery.
How's it going?
You're asking me that? I put all my hopes on you and you left me in the lurch.
Now I've got nothing left but alcohol. And it's all your fault!
Here, 5 gold pieces for you.
(nervously) 5 gold? You're giving me 5 gold to make up for destroying my life?
I'll take all your gold!
I can explain everything.
Save your cheap excuses.
You lie every time you open your mouth. Now leave me alone.
Watch what you're saying there.
Yeah, go ahead and threaten me. It won't do you any good.
I'll tell the whole world what a hypocritical bastard you are! As soon as I've finished this bottle ...
Now get out of my sight, you disgust me!
What's up?
Aah, just leave me alone! I don't want anything more to do with you!
What are you cooking there?
A fish soup. It's not all that tasty, but at least it's hot.
You can try a plateful if you like.
What can you tell me about the city?
Most citizens in this town are afraid of thieves. Therefore, it is not a good idea to enter strange houses.
But if you're looking for a place to stay overnight, you're welcome to sleep in my hut. There's an extra bed that you can have.
Aren't you afraid of thieves?
The only valuable thing I ever owned has already been taken.
Someone stole my statue of Innos.
Could you cook me some soup?
I cook for everybody. For you, too, if you want. All you need to do is bring me a fish.
Could you cook me some soup?
Starting tomorrow, you can come and get some soup every day.
Nothing could be simpler. Here, have a plate.
Bring me a fish, and I'll cook you a tasty soup.
No, not today. Come back tomorrow.
Look, I've got a statue of Innos for you.
Oh - thank you very, very much. May Innos let his light shine on you ...
Yeah, never mind.
It was nice knowing you...
How's it going?
You want to know how it's going? I'll tell you how it's going.
First some pirates brought me here on a stormy night. Man, I barfed all over that nutshell.
Then Raven locked up the mine because some idiots are too greedy for gold.
And then Franco became the leader of the hunters, killing anybody who's against him.
I'd say it's going pretty badly.
How did Franco get to be leader?
Quite simply. He killed Fletcher. He was the leader of the hunters before.
Fletcher was okay. Franco's just jerking us all around.
Franco sent me here about that stone tablet. Have you found it?
Man, I haven't even looked for it. All I know is it's supposed to be in this old building deep in the swamp.
And my inner voice tells me, 'Edgor, stay far away from old buildings deep in the swamp.'
I certainly won't risk my ass for that bum Franco!
Where exactly is this old building?
Just go left past the big rock here. After a while you'll come to another big rock.
You have to go left or right past that one - I don't know any more, it was too long ago.
But the ruins are supposed to be on some sort of rise. All but hidden among plants.
Maybe you'll get lucky and you won't find it...
I found the stone tablet!
(bored) Really? You must be a brave guy.
(bored) Then you've certainly earned your way into the camp. (yawns)
Can you teach me something?
I know a lot about bloodflies. I hate those miserable beasts even more than I hate Franco!
But I know how to tear the stingers and wings from their dead bodies. (crazily) Yeah, tear them out...
Besides that, I know how to remove the secretion from the stinger.
If you want, I can teach you all that junk.
Of course, nothing is for free out here...
Get me the gold. I only want coins, not nuggets.
About the bloodflies...
What do you want to know?
How do I get the stingers from the bloodflies?
Turn the dead beasts onto their belly and cut them open crosswise. Grasp the innards and cut through all the tissue at the back.
Then you can remove the stinger with a jerk.
How do I get the wings?
Grab the wings with one hand. With the other you just cut them out along with the upper layer of skin.
How do I remove the secretion from the bloodflies.
Cut open the upper layer of the stinger lengthwise - then the healing secretion will flow right out.
That way it's completely safe to suck out a stinger - or use it for some potions.
What's up?
It's been a long time since we've seen a stranger on our land who didn't want to skin us.
I hope I'm not wrong about you.
I'm Egill.
And the strange bird over there is my brother Ehnim.
How's the field work going?
Great. If those miserable field raiders weren't constantly destroying our harvest ...
Why don't you do anything about the field raiders?
You're joking. Since I've been on this farm, I've killed so many of the beasts that I've lost count.
But alas, new ones keep coming.
Your brother tells a similar story.
(slyly) Aha. What exactly does he say?
That he has also done away with plenty of field raiders.
What? That loser can't even find his way home by himself.
Tell him he shouldn't brag like that.
Ehnim is a bit irritated about this thing.
He shouldn't puff himself up so much, else I'll tear his head off. Tell him that.
Haven't you done enough damage? I think you should go now.
Who are you?
My name is Ehnim. I'm one of the field hands.
And the half-pint over there is my brother Egill.
We've been working here on the farm for Akil for several years.
How's the field work going?
Do you want to help? There's another hoe back there. Grab it and then head for the field.
You just have to make sure the field raiders don't surprise you. They'll tear your arm right off with one bite.
Why don't you do anything about the field raiders?
I've killed more of them than I can count. The only problem is, they keep coming back.
Your brother told me the same.
What? That goldbricker? He always disappears just as soon as the beasts come onto our land.
He shouldn't be talking such nonsense.
Your brother thinks you're a braggart.
What? He's actually got the nerve to say that?
He'd better watch out or I'll teach him a lesson.
Go and tell him that.
I think the two of you should just relax.
The bastard didn't give in, am I right?
I'll tear out his guts. Tell him that.
Why don't you tell him yourself?
I'll do that.
Do whatever you want. I'm leaving.
Yeah, just slink off quietly.
Do you want to cause even more trouble? I think it would be better if you left now.
You're STILL here.
Obviously. Still miffed?
Never mind, forget about it. Say, have you been to Lobart's farm lately?
Maybe. Why?
Oh, nothing important. I just wanted to talk to Vino again about his still.
Vino is dead.
Oh dear. Well. That's that, then.
Still? What still?
Oh. I probably shouldn't have said that. Vino's always been very particular about his little secret.
Whatever, now I've let it slip out anyway. Back in the woods, Vino set up a secret still.
A while ago, he asked me to get him something to grease his portcullis with.
It's rained a lot recently and the thing rusted shut on him. Now the winch is stuck and no one can get in any more. What a mess.
And? Have you got the grease?
Yeah, sure. The best there is. Molerat fat. Terrible stuff, let me tell you. It's even used to grease ship's cannons.
Sell me the grease.
That won't be cheap, mate. It's damn rare in this part of the country.
How much?
Mmh. 100 gold coins?
It's a deal.
All right. Here you go.
(to himself) Oh dear. Vino's going to kill me.
Damnit, where did it go? What a bloody nuisance. Well, sorry. Obviously, I don't have it any more. Here's your dough back.
I bet this is my brother's doing again. That bastard.
Now isn't that swell. First you make a big deal of it and then you don't even have the money. Just beat it.
That's too much.
Okay, okay. 70 gold coins, then. But that's my final offer.
That's still too much.
(angry) Then forget about it. Have a nice day.
I've got no time right now.
Don't let me keep you, man.
I don't have any time now.
Hello, pretty girl.
Hm. Just where did you escape from?
What did you want?
They say you are revolting against the King?
My father has decided that it's time we defended ourselves.
The militia never helped us anyway. They only came here to drag off our provisions.
What kind of work is to be had here on the farm?
My father pays money to all the men who help defend the farm.
Are you interested? You don't look like someone who has a passion for field labor.
How much does your father pay?
You'd have to negotiate that with him.
All I know is that each mercenary here gets paid every day.
Are there any rules here that I should stick to?
You don't touch anything here that isn't yours.
You stay away from areas that are none of your business.
And if you must pick a fight, stick to the mercenaries.
If you start a brawl with the farmers, everybody here will be against you.
What's your job here?
I sell the goods that we produce. If you want to buy something, just let me know.
But let me warn you. I won't stand for either haggling or stealing, understood?
Show me your wares!
What can I offer you?
Has anything significant happened lately?
A few days ago, my father decreed that we're no longer allowed to sell anything in town.
So now I'm staying here on the farm and selling my wares to visitors only.
The militia attacks on the neighboring farms are getting more frequent. Only a question of time until my father will intervene.
The land has become quite unsafe. Now no one ventures beyond his own fields. It's been a long time since any of us has been to town.
The mercenaries have become more and more restless. But since Sylvio and his boys have left, they seem to relax a little.
Everybody keeps talking about the impending orc attack. But I don't really believe in that. I think we're safe from them here on the farm.
You're selling mine shares?
So what. I paid an arm and a leg for them myself.
Thank goodness. The bandits are done for. You have saved my life.
Who are you?
My name is Elvrich. I come from town.
Master Thorben told me that you had disappeared.
Those lowly scum dragged me off here and were keeping me prisoner.
Lots of people are missing in town.
I don't know anything about missing people. I can only tell you what happened to ME.
What exactly happened to you?
I was on my way to the rendezvous I had set up with my girl.
Her name is Lucia. We had been planning to get away to the mountains. Away from the town and all those who live there.
I had just arrived at the meeting point when suddenly some of these bandits sprang out from the underbrush and captured us both.
I put up a fight, of course, but to no avail. There were just too many of them. You didn't happen to see them?
What did the bandits want with you?
Sometimes I could overhear them at night. I didn't get everything, but I think they wanted to make us slaves.
Where were they going to take you?
To a place somewhere here, on the island of Khorinis. But I think one can't get there without a ship.
They brought me to a mooring place on the coast. Some pirates were camped out there.
One of the bandits approached the pirates to negotiate. They were having a fierce argument.
I think that the bandit wanted the pirates to ferry him somewhere, along with me.
But the pirates wouldn't have it. So the bandits withdrew, and we've been sitting around here ever since.
They seemed to be rather at a loss. And then you came.
Pirates in Khorinis?
I don't know very much about them. I first clapped eyes on one of them at the mooring place.
They always stay in the background. Every single one of them is a wanted criminal in Khorinis.
They're afraid of the gallows. That's why you're never going to meet one of them in town.
Tell me about Lucia.
A girl from the harbor district. She used to work for that horrible Bromor. She's very pretty.
Where's the pirates' mooring place?
Not far from the harbor of Khorinis.
When you stand on the quay and look out to sea, all you need to do is get a boat and go to the right, along the coast.
The first small bay you come across is the mooring place I was talking about.
Bromor says Lucia walked off with a golden dish ...
Well. If Lucia really stole from Bromor, the bandits will certainly have taken the thing from her.
Where's Lucia now?
We parted ways at the big crossroads in front of Onar's farm.
The bandits dragged Lucia off to the woods behind Sekob's farm.
May Innos protect her.
Did the bandits who held you captive receive a shipment of weapons?
Oh yes. So many that they could barely carry them.
They took the whole kaboodle and disappeared towards Sekob's farm.
I found a letter from your Lucia.
(excited) What? Give it here!
(desperate) NO! I don't believe this. No. I just can't believe it.
(desperate) She can't just leave me behind like this.
(desperate) Take this letter back. I don't want it. I firmly believe that she's going to come back to me some day.
You should get yourself back to town in a hurry!
What else would I be doing? I'm going straight back to my Master Thorben.
Will you go look for the bandits?
Well, yes, I think so ...
If you find Lucia, get her safely back to town, will you?
I'll see what I can do.
Thanks for saving me!
You look like a digger.
I AM a digger. The last time I was in the mine, I worked my ass off.
What happens to the gold from the mine?
Thorus collects it and then distributes it. No one is allowed to keep what he mines.
Everybody gets only a part of the gold - that way even the hunters and guards get their share.
I think that's okay. Since we've had that rule, there have been fewer deaths, and the miners still get more than the guys who hang around outside.
What's the deal with these red stones?
That's something Thorus and Esteban thought up.
Thorus takes care of the gold distribution and Esteban organizes the workers for the mine.
Of course, he doesn't want to run to Thorus every time he sends someone to the mine.
That's why he gives us one of these red stone tablets and Thorus lets us in then. It's like a pass.
What do you know about the attack?
(scared) Hey, man, I didn't have anything to do with it!
(scared) NOTHING AT ALL!
(searchingly) Tell me, WHY did Senyan yell, 'Look who we have here'?
(drily) Unpaid debts.
You killed Senyan!
Do you have a problem with that?
(hastily) No, man, I don't have a problem with it.
Quite the opposite. (snidely) The bastard worked for Esteban.
Why aren't you in the mine now?
(somewhat unsure) I was in the mine long enough and slaved away until I was about to fall over. Now I need a few days' rest.
(sighs, somewhat unsure) Before I get my next red stone.
Lennar told me a bit about you...
Lennar? That guy's an idiot. You must have noticed.
He said you haven't been in the mine since the attack happened.
(intimidated) I... don't know anything!
You are working together with that Senyan!
You're both in cahoots with Esteban! I heard exactly what you were blabbing about!
Up to now Esteban hasn't given a damn about us. Why should I trust his people.
Leave me alone!
Help me find out who was behind the attack!
No! I don't want anything to do with it!
If an idiot like Lennar notices that you're behaving oddly, it won't take long before Esteban finds out, too.
(squirming) I... shit! I'll tell you one name. Nothing more.
I'm listening.
Huno... go to Huno. He must know something about this business.
What do you have against Esteban?
All that swine thinks about is money.
Every few days one of us gets eaten by a crawler.
But Esteban just won't send any fighters into the mine.
And why? Those guys belong to 'Raven's bodyguards' and Esteban is scared shitless to tell them.
He'd rather let us get killed!
So now you're the boss here. Okay, then I'll get going.
What's up?
I'm really slaving away. Well, the main thing is, I won't get eaten by a crawler.
Hey, yokel, have you lost your way? Go back to your field and pull up a few turnips.
You're at the wrong place at the wrong time ...
... so I guess that if you want to live, you had better hit the road now, get it?
Is there anything wrong with your ears, or do you have a death wish? (callously) Well - it's too late now.
Ah, so you're the guy who made it across the pass.
Yes.
Great. I'm Engor - I manage this expedition.
Just don't get the idea that I give anything away for free!
But if there's gold in your pockets, I'm always willing to cut a little deal.
Show me your wares.
You're the one who deals out the rations, or so I've heard.
That's right. Why? Should I feed you now, too?
If there's anything you want, you'll pay for it - just like everyone else.
Have you got anything interesting for me?
I can get you better armor - heavy militia armor, if you're interested.
It's not cheap, of course. So go get the gold, and I'll give you the armor.
Give me the armor.
Here you are, it'll protect you well - it's a damn good piece of work.
Go get the gold first.
Maybe I can help you with your work.
Hmm ... Sure, why not? I could use some help.
So, what needs to be done?
Our food supplies are low. Above all, we're almost out of meat.
So if you could get us some meat, raw or cooked, ham or sausages, that would be much appreciated. How about it, will you help us?
I don't have time for that.
So what are you wasting mine for?
Don't worry, I'll get you some meat.
About two dozen chunks of meat would help me feed quite a few hungry mouths. Come back when you have the meat. I need to get back to my work now.
Here, I bought you something.
That's not bad for starters, but I need more.
Great, you brought enough meat. That'll do for a while.
But don't get the idea that I'll give you anything for free now!
How's business?
So-so. I hope that the dragon hunters are as full of gold as they are of hot air.
Lousy! The paladins just aren't buying a thing.
How about you, is there anything else you need?
How's it going?
Crappy!
Mmh!
What else should I say. Nothing but up and down this damned river for days.
Orcs lurking on the left, bandits hanging around on the right, and every day I eat lurker meat. I can't take it any more, you see.
Ever considered getting out of here?
Yeah, sure. No problem at all.
First I'll carve my way through the hordes of orcs, say hello to all the other monsters that are all over the place, and then I just stroll right across the pass!
That would be quite a trick!
I got in here, too.
Are you trying to tell me you just came across the pass?
More or less, yes!
Then you got lucky. As long as things are so messed up around here, I'm not going to budge.
Hunting is my only consolation. But I'd like to see a target once in a while other than these disgusting lurkers.
Evil has taken possession of you.
Let me help you.
(screams) Don't touch me!
What's the matter?
(angrily) What's the matter? Just look at that mess under the bridge over there.
(angrily) I haven't seen anything like it in my entire life. Those swine should be exterminated, I tell you.
What happened?
I was traveling with my helpers when those horrible brutes came jumping on my cart from out of the blue and butchered everybody.
I'm lucky that I still know how to dish out a decent right hook, or they would have killed me, too.
That stuff there under the bridge is yours?
The cart, the goods, everything.
Look, I collected some of your stuff for you ...
You can keep it. None of it is really of any value to me.
But none of it is really of any value to me.
The only thing that's irreplaceable are the three stone tablets they stole from me.
Stone tablets?
The Water Mage in town wants to buy them from me, and I promised he'd get them.
I must have them back at any cost, or my reputation will be tarnished.
What would a Water Mage want with them?
He said he was going to study them and asked me to bring him more.
Where did you get those stone tablets?
I found them near old buildings such as mausoleums, or sometimes in caves.
I've already sold a whole bunch of them to the Water Mage in town.
They're pretty rare down here, though. I found most of them north-east of Khorinis.
Why don't you simply go looking for new ones?
During that melee with the bandits, I sprained my ankle.
I can still hobble along, but I don't want to walk very far on this foot.
Who were those people?
The bandits. Who else? They took over the bridge up there.
They rob everybody who tries to pass the bridge.
I knew they were lurking up there, so I passed under the bridge instead.
But my cart and my goods must have been too tempting for them.
Those scumbags simply jumped from the bridge - directly onto my cart.
I should have tried to steal past in the night ...
I need information about a weapons delivery for the bandits.
Weapons delivery? Yes, I know about that. Some swine from the city sold them so many weapons that they could barely carry them all.
Some of them are kept on the bridge where those bastards attacked me.
The rest of them were probably hauled past Bengar's farm on the high pastures.
Maybe the bandits wanted to take them across the pass.
Where are those high pastures?
Orlan's tavern is located just about in the center of the island of Khorinis. It's called 'The Dead Harpy'.
There's a way south from there. It leads to the high pastures and the entrance to the pass to the Valley of Mines.
About those stone tablets ...
I've got one here.
I've got some.
Thank you.
Now I'm still missing two.
I'm missing only one now.
That's enough. Now I can keep my promise to the Water Mage in town, and then go home at last.
I'll pay you for them, of course.
I'm going home now. Come with me if you like.
Maybe I can sell you a few things that might interest you when we get there.
What about this one, then?
No. This kind of stone tablet is magically charged.
Alas, the Water Mage won't buy this kind of tablet.
How many were there?
To save my reputation with the Water Mage in town, I need 3 tablets.
Are you a citizen of the town?
Haven't been in ages, boy. There's no love lost between me and the corrupt swine in the upper quarter of Khorinis.
I used to have quite a bit of influence there, you know. But that was months ago.
You managed to drive back the bandits?
Yes. But I'm sure they're still up there on the bridge.
Can you teach me how to hit hard like that?
Of course I can.
I can't sell you anything. All my stuff lies over there, under the bridge, lad.
I can only sell you something once I get home.
But I won't leave here until I have my stone tablets back.
(surprised) This here is YOUR hut?
Yes. Why? Anything wrong with it?
Don't you have any problems with the mercenaries?
As long as I don't interfere with their business, they'll leave me alone, too.
Moreover, they're good customers, and I pay them to keep an eye on my house when I'm not home.
There isn't much choice, I'm afraid.
Show me how I can hit harder.
All right, but you'll owe me for that.
Help me save my reputation, and bring me back my stone tablets.
Then I can show you how to make better use of your strength in combat.
Right. Pay attention. There's a simple trick.
When you hit, you don't take the strength from your arm, but from your entire body.
Turn your hip, bring your shoulder to the front, and stretch out your arm at the same time.
(laughs) If you hit right, you'll notice the difference!
If you want to learn more, you'll need to train hard ...
So you're the fellow who fought his way into camp.
That got around fast...
Franco was a tough nut. No one messed with him. No one - except you.
Just to make it clear, if you try the same shit with me, I'll kill you.
I want into the mine!
(grins) Of course you do. Then you're in the right place with me.
Because everyone who digs in the mine gets to keep a hefty share of the gold.
And I hand out the red stones you need, so that Thorus will let you in.
Give me one of those red stones.
Okay, but they aren't free.
Normally, I demand a share of the gold the boys get for digging.
(appraisingly) How much do you know about mining gold, hm?
You've probably learned a few tricks, right?
You don't appear to know a whole lot about it...
(snidely) If I give you a red stone, it won't be because you're such a great digger.
No, I have another job for you...
What sort of job?
One of the bandits planned to kill me. But instead, my guards killed HIM.
He was hot for your job, huh?
He was an idiot! A thug without a brain. He never would have got the idea to attack me on his own.
No, he was only fulfilling a contract - someone else sent him...
So I'm supposed to find out who was behind it.
Whoever sent me this assassin will pay for it. Find him - and I'll let you into the mine.
Senyan sent me to you about this business.
Senyan? He also works for me. I told him he should keep his eyes open.
How should I go about it?
Everyone here in the camp knows about it. So you're playing with all your cards on the table.
Try to find out who is on my side and who isn't and don't let the boys make a fool of you!
Talk to Snaf. That fat cook picks up a lot.
I need better armor.
Why? You already have some. That's good enough for you for now!
If you complete your assignement, we'll talk about it again...
About the assignment...
Listen, I have other things I have to take care of.
I thought you might be interested in knowing who was behind the attack...
Who is it? Tell me his name so my guards can wring his neck...
The trader Fisk is behind it. At the moment, he's sitting in the bar unsuspecting and drinking...
HA! Well done, kid. My guards will take care of him.
You heard him, boys. Go get Fisk.
Come back when you've found out who the guy is.
And what happens next?
What happens next? I'll tell you what happens.
Fisk will die a painful death. And everyone in the camp will find out about it.
That will be a warning to all of them.
Do I get a red stone now?
You did your job well. Someone like you has no business in the mine.
I can use you much better out here. You will stay in the camp and continue working for me.
I'll think about it.
You're forgetting who you're talking to. I'm in charge here and you will do exactly what I say.
And I say, you will work for me and no one else. Is that clear?
Are you trying to play me for a fool? There was never a question of me working for you.
It isn't everyone who gets an offer like this. But if you don't want it, you're free to leave the camp...
How about if you keep your word and give me a red stone?
Hey - one more word and my guards will have to hurt you, too.
(grins) What guards...?
What...? Ah, I see... you're trying to pull a fast one, just wait...
Give me the stone NOW or I'll get it myself!
Oh, you've got a death wish. All right, I'll do you a favor and put you out of your stupidity!
Who are you and what are you doing here?
I am traveling by order of Lord Hagen ...
Then you should try to reach the castle. That's where Commander Garond is. He is the chief commander of this expedition.
Where do you come from?
I am here on behalf of Garond ...
Very good. I can certainly use new men.
I am not here to assist you.
No? Then why did you come?
My mission is to find out how much ore you have mined so far.
Honored magician. Your presence gives me and my men confidence.
It would certainly be helpful to us if you could use your Innos-given power for us.
And my mission is to do everything I deem necessary in order to mine the ore and protect it.
That includes the requisitioning of men. You are in the service of Innos - therefore you will follow my orders.
Listen - I don't know why Garond sent me a mercenary - but he must have a reason.
But before I send you back, you will carry out a mission for me.
What can I do for you?
