For days, a horde of snappers has been roaming around our camp. Looks like they're just waiting for a good opportunity to attack.
I don't know what they're waiting for - but as long as they're here, there's no peace to be had in the camp.
That Fed, above all the rest, is scared out of his mind - and driving the other convicts crazy.
So who should I send? Bilgot? Ha - he's a wreck, too.
And Tengron? Sure he can fight, but he lacks the necessary guile.
The only one who can do it is you. I want you to hunt down those damn beasts and kill them.
My mission is more urgent than that. I can't help you.
Naturally, honored one. I will inform you about everything you wish to know.
I already have an order, from Garond.
And you will carry it out. But only when I send you back.
All I want to hear from you now is, 'What can I do for you?' Understood?
Everything has its price. If you can pay me, I might consider it.
I am not accustomed to doing business with mercenaries. I hate haggling for a better price.
But as a token of my good will, I'll pay you 100 gold pieces if you work for me.
Do we have an agreement?
No, I've got no time to take care of your problem.
You're turning down easy money? I would never have expected that from a mercenary.
Since you don't want to help us, I suggest you ask your questions and then clear off again.
I killed the leader of the pack.
Good. Without a leader, they're only half as dangerous. I don't think they'll attack us any more.
Here is your gold - as agreed.
The snappers are done for.
Good job. We should be able to handle all the other beasts out there.
You have earned your gold - here are 100 gold pieces, as agreed.
How's the morale of your men?
You want to know how my men's morale is? They can hardly work for fear!
Deal with these snappers, or someone's bound to crack!
Tell me how much ore you have mined so far.
Report to Garond that so far we've only been able to mine TWO chests of ore.
I've already taken too many losses thanks to the constant attacks.
If Garond can send me more men, then we can mine more ore.
I see. I'll let him know.
Good. Then the rest is up to you. We'll hold the position here for as long as we can.
How's the ore production going?
Badly. We aren't making any progress.
When we first arrived, it went well - but since then, my boys have mined practically nothing but splinters. Nothing useable.
But we won't give up - at least not as long as I'm in command here.
How's the ore mining going?
It has gotten quieter here. Why might that be?
The dragons are dead.
Well, then I hope my relief comes soon. I'm slowly losing my mind here.
You can see that for yourself. Lousy.
You're a fisherman?
(cynically) Now how did you ever guess that?
Can't you simply leave me alone?
Don't take it personally, but I haven't been too happy with the militia lately.
Don't take it personally, but I haven't been too happy lately. It's that militia.
Trouble with the militia?
Those bastards keep coming here and taking whatever they want.
Last week they made off with my entire catch. 'It's for a good cause,' they said.
I know that everybody's got to fend for himself since the farmers have stopped trading.
And, of course, sometimes people just go hungry. Small wonder that they're snatching the fish from right under my nose.
But if they keep doing this, I won't even have enough to feed myself.
Have you talked to the paladins about this?
(laughs) Are you joking? Do you really think they'd be interested if a poor devil like me has his problems with the militia?
Give me all your fish.
(angrily) I just KNEW it. Another of those scumbags.
You're too late, I'm afraid. Your friends were here yesterday, and they took everything.
Well. I guess you had better leave now.
Maybe I can help you.
I don't know. I suppose you'd have to know somebody from the militia who has connections to the paladins.
The paladins will hardly buy the fish from me.
I shall see what I can do.
I know how to resolve your trouble with the militia.
And how would that be?
I'm not here often enough to keep a constant vigil on your fish.
But I know somebody who can do just that.
Martin, the provisions master of the paladins, wants to hear your story about the militia and the fish.
And you think he can make the militia leave me alone?
At least that's what he said.
Great. Thank you. I cannot give you much. But wait ...
I found this strange blue stone on one of the islands off the coast of Khorinis.
I don't think it's worth a whole lot, but someone like you will certainly find a use for it.
Can you tell me something about the missing people?
My friend William started hanging out with a bunch of shady characters. And where did it get him?
One day he simply didn't show up for work, and that's the last we saw of him.
Your buddy William has disappeared?
So he has. He's a fisherman, but a little too big for his boots, I should add.
He should have stayed well away from that bunch.
What's he been up to?
William had some shady dealings with those crooks.
I think it was all about contraband that he sold to the bastards.
What bastards would those be?
I don't know who they are or what their business is here in Khorinis.
I only know the place where they met up with William.
I just happened to see William there when I was fishing in the bay.
Where exactly is that meeting place?
There's a bay opposite the harbor, north of here.
You can only reach it by boat, or swim.
There's a beach there, and a small fishing camp. That's where I saw them.
When did you last see him?
Only a few days ago.
Maybe he just went out to sea to fish?
That's not very likely. His boat is still moored in the harbor.
He'll surface again.
I don't think so. He's been gone for too long already.
I'm afraid that I'll be dragging his body from the sea at some point.
I think I've heard enough.
Spare yourself the effort. I don't believe you'll find him.
So, how are the fish biting?
Stop pretending you're interested.
I've seen better times. Too little to live on, too much to die.
There you are again!
Have you heard news of my buddy William, then?
He's dead.
(sighs) Yeah, that's what I'd been expecting.
Thanks for coming back here to tell me.
I'll go down to the pub and drink up his share of our last catch - that's what he would have wanted ...
What do you want from me? I'm not going anywhere!
Stay calm, relax - no one wants you to go anywhere.
Thank Innos. You know, over the last few days, several men have left the camp - and not one of them has come back.
They were all eaten by snappers. But not me. I'll just stay put here until it's all over.
What do you know about the snappers?
Bilgot watches them at night. A few of them are down at the pool at the base of the dark tower.
Others are right above us - on top of the cliff. They're just waiting until we're all exhausted.
We managd to trap ourselves here. Soon they'll attack the camp - and have their bloody feast ...
I see.
Are you all right?
The snappers are out there. Can you smell them ...? I can smell them ...
The snappers seem to have pulled back. But that doesn't mean anything. They'll come back - or the wolves, or the lizards, or the orcs.
And sooner or later they'll get us and feed on our dead bodies ...
OK, so you beat me. Some heroic deed that was.
Will you stop hammering now, or do I have to thrash you again?
No, don't hit me any more. I'll stop. But if everything collapses around here, it'll be your fault!
What's the matter? Want another punch in the face?
What kind of a loony are you? Fight, don't fight, talk - what exactly is it you want?
Why are you hammering?
For days now, I've been desperately trying to fix the leaks in my house.
The rafters have been crumbling away ever since we had those rainfalls recently. Soon everything's going to come down around my ears!
Could you stop hammering?
No, I have to finish this.
Stop that hammering, or I'll break every bone in your body.
Forget it, or I'll knock some sense into your head with my hammer.
I'll give you 10 gold pieces if you stop that hammering.
Hey ... That's very generous of you. But as to your gold, you can ...
... well, you know what you can do with it.
Just quit hammering, OK?
Just try not to bug me too much, OK?
Hellooo - are you feeling quite well?
Fine, just as long as I manage to get all this repaired in time.
The roof is getting worse all the time. The next time it rains, the water will be sloshing up to my ankles. And it's all your fault!
Have a nice day, Mr. Paladin.
Have a safe trip, honorable magician.
You look a little worse for wear. Haven't slept in a long time, have you?
Too long, I should say.
Come on, step closer. With me, you'll find what you're looking for!
Show me your wares.
You said that you've got what I need. Does that include information?
But of course. What is it you want to know?
Are there any other traders here at the harbor?
If you keep to the left at the quay, you'll find Halvor, my husband. He sells fish.
On the other side, there's Brahim, the cartographer.
Do you know anyone from the upper quarter?
(laughs) If I knew anyone up there I wouldn't be standing here, my boy.
What interesting things are there to see about the harbor?
Well. If you're looking for some action, go on down to Kardif's pub at the quay. There's always something brewing there.
You can hardly miss it. The guy standing by the entrance there will certainly draw your attention to it.
Besides that, there's the large ship of the paladins. The King's stately war galley. That one's really worth seeing.
You'll find it if you keep left at the quay and then pass under the high rock face.
Has anything exciting happened lately?
You could say so. It wasn't that long ago.
A thief ran by here. He must have stolen a bow in the lower part of the city.
Of course, the militia came way too late, like always.
He got away from them - just jumped into the harbor, and he was gone.
How's business?
Not so great. Back when the Barrier was still in place, times were better.
The prisoners would scrape boxes and boxes of ore from the mines, and my ships then brought it to the mainland.
And on their way back, they brought food and other wares.
But now we're cut off from the mainland and have to rely on the farmers for supplies.
How do you make a living now?
I don't know. But at any rate, no more shady dealings for me. That much is clear.
Right now, I'm living off of my savings. But if I can't get back into business, times are going to get rough for me.
I am ruined. I should have listened to my father and kept out of this mining business.
Hey you - wait a minute. You are headed for the Valley of Mines, aren't you?
And?
Here's a bargain. You give me a report of what's going on with the ore, and for that I get you ...
... a runestone.
... a ring that increases your life energy.
I'll see what I can do.
You've been selling weapons to the bandits.
(baffled) But - what makes you think THAT?
This list of merchandise that I took from a bandit bears YOUR signature.
I found this ring of the overseas traders' guild Araxos with the bandits. You're an overseas trader.
And the swords which the bandits were carrying bore your initials.
The swords which the bandits were carrying bore your initials.
You can admit it now. I've blown your cover.
So YOU did this. YOU'RE the one who gave me away. I'm going to make you pay for this.
You'd first have to get out of here, and I hardly think they're going to let you go any time soon.
(angrily, to himself) My time will come.
(pleading) I didn't mean to do that, believe me.
(pleading) First, all they wanted from me was food supplies. Business was really slow, so I got involved with them.
(pleading) Then they became more aggressive and threatened to kill me if I didn't sell them the swords they wanted.
(pleading) You can't blame me for this. I am a victim of circumstances.
Don't make me weep. You're pretty repulsive for someone who lives in the upper quarter.
You'd sell your soul for a fistful of gold pieces.
I've got my expenses to cover. If I'm not liquid, they're going to feed me to the mob from the harbor district.
The militia is going to deal with you.
You can't do this.
I should say I can. You'll be amazed.
By Innos. I'm ruined.
What will you pay me if I let you go?
You know I'm not doing too well. I can't give you much.
I'll give you 200 gold coins and a valuable ring.
That will have to do. Will you give me the incriminating material now?
Well, all right. Agreed.
Fine, here's your gold.
And the ring. We're even now.
No. I think I'd rather keep it.
Fine. Keep it then, but woe betide you if you rat on me.
I've been to the Valley of Mines.
And? How is the situation there?
The mines are all depleted, there's barely more than a few chests full of ore. It's hardly worth digging for that.
That can't be true! That means I'm ruined ...
What about our deal?
Now, about your reward ...
Here, take this runestone.
Here's your ring.
You're possessed!
Go away. Go already.
Where do you come from?
From the mainland. My people and I fled here.
The situation there is getting worse. The orcs leave nothing but burned-out villages behind.
The king has lost control of his realm.
You paladins have failed, if you ask me.
Where are your people now?
I left them.
They thought they could take everything they wanted, even if it doesn't belong to them. Count me out.
What else do you know about the war?
You haven't been to see your king in a long time, huh?
The orcs are outside the capital. But whether it's fallen yet, I don't know.
The last thing I heard was that the king is dead. But I don't believe that.
What are you doing here in the castle?
I heard about the dragons and wanted to help fight them.
Unfortunately, I lost my sword when I was sneaking past the orcs. Now I'm stuck here.
Without a sword, I can't get out of here, and the swords I can buy here are the worst junk.
I wish you luck with your search.
I really have to ask myself why I ever came here.
What will you give me if I find you a good sword?
Alas, I can't give you anything. I spent my last gold on the sword.
I shall find your sword.
That would be great. You should look for it on the high cliff to the south.
I probably lost it there, near the orc tents.
Maybe I've got another sword for you.
That's a good blade. Really excellent work.
Are you sure you want to give it to me just like that?
Yes, take it.
Thanks, I owe you.
In return, I'll show you a couple of tricks that will allow you to use your strength and dexterity better in combat.
No, I need it myself.
I can understand.
I found your sword.
Show me how to improve my abilities.
After these orc attacks, I quit. I'm just glad to still be alive, man.
A good fighter has to learn to transfer his abilities directly to his weapon.
All the dragons are dead.
Well done! If we had more people like you, then it would probably never have gone this far.
What are you doing here?
I am preparing for battle ...
Why?
Lately the farmers have had more and more problems with field raiders.
A few of them even managed to get themselves eaten.
Fat Onar didn't exactly find that amusing. None of us got our pay for a week.
And it was more or less my fault. Now Lee wants me to wipe out the creatures' nest by myself.
And the other boys have already made bets on whether I'll survive ...
Are you a good fighter?
I'm fair with a sword, but with the bow I'm very good! Why do you ask?
Where's the nest?
In the middle of the field here, in the big rock.
We could attack that nest together ...
You want to help me? Why?
I want to join you!
Oh, so that's the way it is. You want to prove how good you are ..
(cunningly) All right, let's attack the beasts together.
I want to see some gold!
(laughs) You bastard! You want to take advantage of my situation, huh?
Either I pay you, or I bite the dust.
All right. I can pay you 50 gold pieces - that's all I have.
Let's attack the nest!
In the dark? No, no, we'd better do this by daylight.
Right now? Or do you need to equip yourself first?
You could go back to the farm first ...
There's no time like the present.
Good, then let's see what you've got.
All right, let's wait a little longer ...
You know where to find me ...
Where the devil have you been?
So this is where they dragged the dead farmers. Disgusting.
The filthy things should all be wiped out now.
Let's go back!
What about our agreement?
Are you kidding? You didn't do anything for it.
Well, I could help you to get accepted with us, but I won't.
And why not?
If I tell everybody that you helped me, they'll hit me with a new assignment.
You understand that I don't fancy that, don't you?
Well, tough luck, kid. I'm sure you'll find someone else to help you.
Hey - you wanted to take advantage of my situation. Now I'm taking a bit of advantage of you.
But look at the bright side: you had a learning experience. That's something, isn't it?
I think your hide could do with another tanning.
I don't like having my leg pulled.
I'm shaking, I'm shaking.
It wasn't a good idea for you to take up with Sylvio.
You're one of Lee's toadies, aren't you? You've come to the wrong man!
What the devil do you want from me now?
I just love to watch you kiss the mud!
You just don't get it, do you?
Back at work?
Yeah, now I'm getting the very last piece of gold out of this mine.
Hi!
(grumpily) What do you want?
Where do I get a pickaxe?
Go to Huno the smith. But even if you have a pick, that doesn't mean that you can get into the mine.
If you want to get in, you have to talk to Esteban.
Don't even bother going to Thorus - he'll only let you in if you have a red stone.
Tell me, what do you think of Esteban?
(carefully) He's the boss here... he's... all right, I think.
(hesitantly) He always lets the good boys into the mine. The ones who know something about mining, I mean.
And you know something about mining?
I'm the best!
Sure thing, boss. You want to see the best in the mine? Then I'll get back to it...
Oh, something else. I'll let you in on a digger's secret.
Now and then it's a good idea to give it a really good whack.
If you've hacked a couple of times and nothing has come out, then drag the point of the pick sideways across the rock.
With a little luck, you'll get several chunks at once that way.
Well, there's something you should know. Gold isn't ore. There's one damn important difference.
I mean, what woman would hang a chain of ore around her neck? (laughs)
When picking, work from top to bottom. You can work the nuggets loose best that way.
There are also diggers who do it the other way around - but that's far more difficult.
Can you judge my gold-digging abilities?
Sure. I've been at this for over 35 years. There's nothing I can't assess!
For you, I'd say you're...
an absolute beginner.
a quite passable scraper.
an experienced gold scraper.
a genuine digger.
a damned good digger.
a master digger.
a guru among diggers.
So now you're as good as I am. Congratulations, partner.
(warily) Yes?
Do you have any idea who's behind this?
Why do you want to know?
(narrating) When the attack took place, I was trying to get my pickaxe from Huno the smith.
But he wasn't there.
And?
Usually, he's ALWAYS there. VERY suspicious if you ask me.
Esteban wants to see him dead!
Oh! You work for the boss?
Then I'll tell you what I know.
I want to talk to the guy...
(warily) So? And what do you want from him.
I want to bump off Esteban and I'm looking for an ally!
I won't have anything to do with that!
I have some interesting information for him!
You're in cahoots with the guy who ordered it, aren't you?
Absolutely not!
(appraisingly) Good! I'll tell you what I know.
That's none of your business!
So? Well, then I don't know anything about the business.
About the attack again...
I already told you everything I know.
Just leave me alone with that crap!
(appraisingly) Okay...
Then tell me again!
Hey, if you're looking for a decent trader here in the camp, then you just found him.
My hut is right behind Esteban. So if you need anything, come on by.
Listen, I don't want anything to do with that business, got it!
(innocently) I have my own worries, I'm a victim myself.
In what way?
I paid a lot of gold for my last delivery.
But it never came! Some swine made off with it.
(outraged) I've been robbed - probably by some of our own people!
What sort of delivery?
A packet of lock picks. Someone was supposed to get them from the pirates for me.
But a guy named Juan snatched it away from me. (angry) Including the gold that I paid for it!
The bastard is hiding somewhere in the swamp.
He's dead.
Good, then he can't cause me any more trouble!
He's still alive...
You let the swine live?
He wasn't alone...
Never mind - I can deal with those scumbags anyway...
As far as you are concerned...
I have a pretty good relationship with Huno.
I'll see to it that you get your armor cheap from now on.
And here, I once got this stone from Corristo.
It's the only thing that survived my flight from the Barrier. I think you'll have more use for it than I do.
Also, I'll give you one of my weapons.
(mischieviously) One hand washes the other - that hasn't changed since back then.
I have your package.
(pleased) Indeed! (suspiciously) What about Juan?
I opened your package!
(laughs) Of course! You just couldn't wait, could you?
Do you at least still have the lock picks?
And even more importantly, what about Juan?
Here's a dozen lock picks...
Very good. Some people are already waiting for new merchandise.
That isn't a dozen! (slyly) You're not trying to cheat me, are you?
Juan worked for Esteban!
(amazed) What?
Don't play games with me! You knew about it!
(calmly) Fine. You're right. But I hope you also realize why I didn't tell you about it.
Everyone in the camp knows you work for Esteban.
I don't have any desire to get dragged into this business just because you're hot for a red stone.
I see!
Good! Then leave it be. We don't want to be overheard!
I don't believe you!
Believe what you want! But I'm warning you, if you're planning on telling Esteban some fairy tale about me, you're next!
I'm not really working for Esteban...
So? You want to pull the wool over the old swine's eyes?
Then I'll give you some good advice, keep it to yourself.
When it comes to Esteban, trust NO ONE - not even me, got it?
Now enough about that - we don't want to be overheard!
So YOU were behind the attack.
Yes. Esteban is in the way of my business.
He won't let any of the bandits who work for me into the mine. He's making sure that EVERYONE works for him - and only for him.
That way, he can pocket a percentage of every deal and control the whole camp.
Do you want to take his place?
No, I'm a trader - I just want to go about my business in peace.
I could sell you to Esteban...
And then? What do you think will happen then? Do you think he'll give you what you want?
Forget it - I have a better plan.
What are you planning?
We'll get Esteban out of the way. That means YOU will kill him and take his place.
As long as his bodyguards are with him, I don't have a chance.
Then we'll have to get them to leave - by telling the truth.
What truth?
You have done your job. You know that I was behind the attack.
Tell Esteban and he'll send his boys to kill me. I'll expect them here.
When they're gone, you can deal with the bastard and I'll take care of the guards.
Esteban is dead. I can devote myself to my business again...
Here, this is for you...
Esteban is finished.
I've waited for this for a long time.
I think you've got things to do now, and I need to go back to my business.
So, if you need anything else, you know where to find me.
(anxiously) A dark cloud over the house... the one approaches...
With blood... needed to call him... HE who sees me... he sees me... oh, no, go away, begone...
Are you all right?
Green... green novice... I cannot find it...
How can I help you?
The green... the green novice will help the novice...
Here, take this swampweed.
Not green, not strong, not green, not strong...
Here, take this 'Green Novice'.
(recovering) AAAHHH...
My head... who... I am... Fortuno... what... what is wrong?
So, tell me what is wrong with you.
Once I belonged to the Brotherhood of the Sleeper. Everything was all right back then.
Fine, we were all condemned crimials, but for us novices life was free from care...
Hey, I was a prisoner in the Valley of Mines myself. Tell me something new.
I... I don't remember anything. Darkness lies across my mind...
Come on, concentrate. What happened? When did you come back to your senses?
Raven... I only remember Raven and... and dark rooms.
What about Raven? What did he do to you?
(sighs) I'm sorry. It's as though my mind were held prisoner... I don't understand it myself...
There must be a way to refresh your memory.
Yes... yes, maybe there is a way.
The gurus knew of various forms of altering the spirit and the will.
Do YOU remember anything about that?
No, I'm afraid this knowledge vanished with the gurus...
Damn. Well - if there is a way to free your spirit, I'll find it.
Do you need more swampweed?
Yeeesss, definitely. I will buy all the swampweed you can get your hands on.
I'll even pay you more for it than Fisk.
I've got swampweed for you...
I have a potion for you. It will help you to remember.
I trust you.
And...?
Aah! I... I remember again! Now I see... Adanos be with me - what have I done?
Yes, what have you done? And above all - what has Raven done?
I helped him... to make contact. With HIM. He wanted various elixirs... I brewed them for him.
He tried to open the portal to get into the temple.
Why? What does he want in the temple?
A powerful artifact... it lies buried together with the one who once bore it. A mighty warrior who fell to HIM...
And then?
We couldn't open the portal...
But Raven was SURE that he could, if he had the tomb of the priest excavated.
That's why he brought the slaves here. Victims he could force to dig where the powers of time lie at rest.
Tomb of the priest?
The resting place of a priest of Adanos. It lies in the mine.
I also remember the stone tablets. He believed that they would show him the way.
And once he was able to decipher the characters on them, he no longer needed me.
He put a spell of forgetfulness on me and... and you have freed me.
Attack? Sorry, I was... absent... for some time. I don't know anything about it.
Is this your hut?
No, it belongs to Greg.
I must get into Greg's hut.
Forget it!
Greg's not there. And I've locked the door and see to it that nobody sneaks around here to do a little looting.
So make yourself scarce, or I'll let you have it!
Greg is your boss?
Now don't try and tell me that you know him!
Any sailor - even any cursed landlubber on this island - knows the terrible Cap'n Greg!
(snootily) And he left ME in command!
I'm responsible for making those lazy bums do what he commanded!
Some of the boys may think they can do whatever they bloody well want now that the Captain's not here.
Won't THEY be surprised when Greg comes back.
I'll tell him everything that's been going on here, got it?
Including who's been trying to get into his hut.
So make yourself scarce, or you'll be in a load of trouble.
Give me the key to Greg's hut!
You must be joking!
I'll give you 1000 gold pieces!
That's not quite enough to make me betray my Captain, I'm afraid.
Be careful what you say, or I'll have your hide!
I'll give you 2000 gold pieces!
Boy, what you're asking for is mutiny.
(to himself) But, on second thought ...
Oh well, give it here. No-one needs to know.
Here's the key!
But hurry up before Greg comes back. And not a word to the others, understood?!
(laughs) Ha! I bet you don't have that much!
Well, then, let's see what you've got.
(shrilly) What? I'm the Captain here!
I'll teach you respect, you landlubber!
I found your hiding-place. Your treasure and your paybook. This is your book, isn't it?
Er ... I've never seen this book before.
And ... Er ... even IF this were my book ...
You don't REALLY believe the lads will buy YOUR story based on a few yellowed pages, do you?
You cheated them all out of their shares.
Er ... wait a minute ...
(slimily) You wanted the key to Greg's hut, didn't you?
I'll GIVE you the key to Greg's hut!
There's plenty of valuable stuff in there ...
(nervously) But you'll give me the book and keep your trap shut, right?
Just don't do anything stupid!
Here's your 2000 pieces of gold!
And I'll add another 500.
Here's 500 gold pieces!
(hastily) And now give me that thing ...
(furious) Thanks to you, Greg is making me saw planks now until there's no wood left on the island.
Just leave me alone!
Don't get lost or you'll wind up as food for the sharks.
Hey, what are you doing here? Do you want to get into the camp.
Yes, I am...
I don't care who you are. I'm Franco, I'm the leader here.
So, if you do a good job out here, I'll take you into the camp.
Ramon, the gatekeeper, will tell you if they need new people in the camp. Talk to him.
Thorus needs a new man.
Good. I'll take care of it.
Wait a minute, what about me?
You haven't done anything yet.
I've done a lot, only YOU don't know about it.
Okay, you want a chance? You'll get your chance. Move your butt to Logan. The swampsharks are breathing down his neck.
Help him finish off the beasts and you're as good as in the camp.
Where do I find Logan?
If you're standing in front of the camp entrance, follow the rock wall to the left. It's a bit farther into the swamp.
Logan is dead.
Damn. He was the best hunter we had out here. Cursed nuisance.
Be that as it may, I already sent someone else into the camp.
I helped Logan...
... but he didn't survive.
Okay, so you fought the swampsharks - you're useful - at least more so than most of the guys here.
So can I go to the camp now?
Listen - there's another thing I need you for.
A few days ago, I sent Edgor into the swamp.
He was supposed to get me an old stone tablet - but he hasn't been seen since.
See what he's doing and bring me that damned stone tablet.
What about gold?
What?
Do I get anything for my work here in the swamp?
(extremely friendly) You want gold? Sure, how much do you want? Fifty gold nuggets? A hundred? I'll give you as much gold as you can carry...
(loudly) Who do you think you are? Are you trying to make a fool out of me?
Now push off and do something! Otherwise, you won't get so much as one CRUMB OF GOLD!!
(sighs) So, WHERE do I find this Edgor?
Do you want the easy way or the fast way?
There are ruins everywhere. He's sitting around somewhere there.
I assume he was smart enough to build himself a fire. You should be able to find THAT.
Tell me the easy way.
Follow the path to the front gate. Sancho should be standing there.
Go left from there and follow the boardwalk
I'll take the fast way.
Okay. From here go diagonally left past the boardwalk, into the swamp.
Here's the stone tablet.
Good, very good. Raven will be pleased with you.
What about the camp now? Can I finally go in?
No, I already sent Logan in. He was ahead of you in the list.
No, I already sent someone else in.
And at the moment, there's no need for another man in the camp.
Besides, I can really use you here, (grins) now that Logan isn't here any more.
Send me in NOW!
(dangerously friendly) And what if I say no?
Then you'll simply regret it.
Are you threatening me? YOU? Want to threaten ME? - It's time for a lesson...
Then I'll just wait a bit...
(mockingly) Exactly.
You swine! I'll get you!
(strained) You miserable little wretch, you want to mess with ME? Just you wait!
A fresh face in our midst. Welcome to the 'Ring of Water'.
Vatras wants to see you. You had better go to him now.
You've got a lot of space up here.
It's nice enough. But if you go through the pass back there, you won't think so much longer.
If this little tract of land has impressed you, then wait till you see the Valley of Mines back there.
Who are you?
My name is Gaan. I'm a hunter and work for Bengar, the farmer here on the high pastures.
I spend most of my time here outside, basking in the sun.
Why are you looking so solemn?
You're wearing our aquamarine ring.
You belong to the 'Ring of Water'?
I certainly do. Good to see a new face in our ranks.
What's your task within the 'Ring of Water'?
I keep an eye on the entrance to the pass, to see who goes in and out.
Since the paladins have closed the gate to the pass, however, there hasn't been much coming and going.
Have you heard of those missing people?
Of course I have. That's why we're supposed to keep our eyes open.
But I haven't seen much that would give you a clue, to tell you the truth.
What do I need to know about the Valley of Mines?
No idea. I've only taken a fleeting glance at the valley. Looked pretty dangerous.
The best thing to do if you go there through the pass is to stay close to the beaten track.
Either you take the way through the big gorge, or the road over the stone bridge. That one is shorter and safer.
Now that the orcs are roaming all over the place, you have to be a bit careful.
I don't want to have to drag you to the herb witch.
Herb witch?
Her name is Sagitta. She is the healer for the farmers and the other people who live outside the harbor city.
A truly curious female.
No one really likes going to her and everybody enjoys gossiping about her.
But if you're sick, you won't find better help than Sagitta and her kitchen full of healing herbs.
You'll find her in the strip of woods behind Sekob's farm.
What does this dangerous beast look like?
I don't know exactly. Up to now, I've mostly heard grunting and scratching. But I've seen what it can do.
Even wolves aren't safe from it. The beast even bit the head off of one.
How much would you pay me if I killed that beast for you?
I'd give the person who killed it everything I could spare.
Where does this scummy beast come from?
Somewhere from outside the woods. Maybe from the Valley of Mines. But I don't know for sure.
I've never been to the Valley of Mines.
That horrible animal is dead, I assume.
Then I can finally hunt freely again.
Here's the money I promised you.
Can you teach me about hunting?
No problem. For 100 gold coins I can show you how to gut the animals you bring down.
Pelts and other trophies bring a lot of money in the market.
Here. 100 gold coins for your expertise on gutting animals.
Thanks. Now you're talking.
Ask me later, when you have some money.
What can you teach me?
That depends on what you want to know.
At the moment, I can't teach you anything you don't already know. Sorry.
Animals don't like to give up their claws. You have to place your knife very precisely.
Your hands should be slightly crossed. Then you separate the claw with a powerful tug.
Merchants are always eager to be paid in claws.
The easiest thing to take from an animal are the teeth. You move your knife around the teeth in its mouth.
Then you separate them from the skull with a skillful tug.
The best way to remove the pelt is by making a deep cut along the hind legs.
After that, it should be a cinch to pull off the skin from the front to the back.
These flies have a soft spot on their backs.
If you press there, the stinger will be squeezed out very far, and you can detach it with your knife.
The best way to remove the wings of a bloodfly is with a blow from a sharp knife, very close to the fly's body.
You have to watch out that you don't damage the delicate tissue of the wings. They're worthless if you don't do it carefully.
Now that this slightly oversized snapper is dead, I can show you how to remove its horn.
You push your knife deep into the animal's forehead and carefully lever the thing upwards.
If it won't come loose from the skull, you work on it with a second knife from the other side.
How's the hunting?
The last animal I could bring down was a large rat. Not very encouraging, and bad for business.
For several days now, some kind of snorting beast has been roaming the area.
It not only kills everything that moves, it also interferes with my work.
It's getting crazier out here. Meanwhile, dozens of these snorting animals have come out of the pass.
Under these circumstances, hunting is getting harder and harder up here.
I can't complain.
Wait a minute.
Is there a problem?
Minecrawlers. Lots and lots of minecrawlers. We've run into a nest here.
Why don't we attack the crawlers?
I asked that, too. But the guards had 'more important things' to do.
Bloodwyn has left it to me to remove this problem.
I don't suppose you're planning to fight the crawlers.
Why should I? So that we can get at the gold in the cave?
Bloodwyn will just take most of it for himself anyway. And I'm not risking my neck for the little bit I'd get.
If YOU want to fight the crawlers - don't let me stop you. Only - don't lure them all out here, okay?
Can you tell me more about Bloodwyn?
Yes. He's a gold-hungry bastard. He inspects every new vein and every nugget.
He can't go too far out of his way for gold. But we don't mean shit to him.
And otherwise?
He thinks he's the greatest and can't stand it if someone is better off than he is. Okay - I wouldn't go up against him, even so.
Just stay out of his way and don't provoke him - unless you want him to get furious and lose control...
So, that should be it. The crawlers are finished.
Bloodwyn is already on the way. That's what you wanted, isn't it?
I mean, you slaughtered the crawlers so Bloodwyn would come here. So, whatever you're planning, do it NOW.
You sure showed that bum. Nice work.
Then I'll take a look around the cave.
Wow, man, there sure is a lot of gold here.
To get to the chunks up there, we'd actually need a ladder.
But since the fall of the Barrier, nobody's been using ladders any more... it's really too bad...
What are you doing here?
What do you think, hm? I'm a gardener, I take care of the garden.
You're pretty much by yourself here, aren't you?
Yes, and it should stay that way. I'm glad that I have some peace here.
Once, they wanted to send me to the penal colony because I did some guy in.
But Larius the governor needed another gardener, and so I could stay here.
Over time, this garden has become my home. And I'm content with that.
Are you growing herbs as well?
A few. I'm growing fireweed and fire nettles. I also tried swampweed, but that doesn't really thrive here.
Well, I just harvested. So, if you want to buy something...
Show me your wares.
I've got some weed tobacco here. Want a smoke?
I don't know it - but sure, give it here. I'll roll myself a smoke.
Ack...ackack....
Harsh stuff. I think I'd better not smoke any more of it.
So you're one of us. Then I've got some useful information for you.
Some of the houses up here have secret panels that can only be opened by hidden switches.
People guard their valuables behind them.
Don't even think about asking me to join your raiding troop.
What do you think the other boys will do once I'm gone, huh?
When I come back, there won't be ONE full crate left in my hut!
I'll just stay here and guard our supplies.
What have we here? A fresh face. And not one of those filthy bandits, I hope.
I'm Garett. If there's anything you need, ask me first.
I can get you almost anything. Wine, weapons, and other stuff you might need.
Except for booze - if it's a decent drink you want, go see Samuel.
Who's Samuel?
He's our moonshiner. He's got his cave on the beach, a little distance from the camp.
You can't miss it, just walk north.
You'll be well advised to keep yourself supplied with grog.
Some of the boys here aren't very fond of greenhorns at all, if you get my drift.
A decent swig of grog can work wonders for you!
Where do you get your supplies?
Skip always brings loads of stuff from Khorinis when he visits there.
Until recently, he used to sell some of it directly to the bandits.
But since we've been at war with the bandits, I'm the one who ends up with all the stuff now.
What do you know about the bandits?
You'd better ask Skip about that.
He's been through quite a lot with that bunch, let me tell you.
Greg has given orders to do away with any bandit who shows up near the camp.
Your Captain Greg. What's he like?
He's a tough old bastard, and no doubt about it.
And greedy to the bone.
He makes Francis, our treasurer, pay out not a penny more than what it takes to prevent a mutiny.
And if one of us ever gets his hands on something REALLY valuable, he'll inevitably take it for himself.
I once took a compass from a royal frigate.
That bastard Greg made me hand it over, of course.
Bah. He probably buried it somewhere, just like the rest of his treasures.
Where might Greg have buried that compass?
Greg once told me that Death himself watches over my compass. Then he laughed.
Anything else?
There's a beach at the southern coast. It can only be reached by sea.
Greg is said to have been there often. Maybe you'll find something there.
I once went there to see what I might find myself, but the area is teeming with monsters.
If you really want to give it a try, don't forget to bring a pick.
Here's your compass.
(happily) Yes, that's it. I never thought I'd see it again.
Thanks, man!
This time Greg WON'T get hold of it again ...
Here, take this belt in return. It's my most valuable piece.
You bought this belt from me, remember?
And you paid a lot for it - (hastily) not that it wasn't worth it. Here - take back your gold.
What can you tell me about Francis?
Greg put him in command while he's gone.
But Francis is a total failure as a leader!
He can't even get Morgan to stir his lazy ass out of bed.
Henry and his boys are the only ones doing anything around here.
The others are just enjoying themselves instead of working.
I can only hope that Greg will come back soon.
He'll give them all a good swift kick in the ass.
Anything new?
Nothing ever happens any more since Greg left.
Now that Greg has come back, things are starting to look up around here.
We're not going to discuss anything before you have paid your penalty.
And that has gone up following the most recent accusations.
You seem to have gotten into even more trouble.
But I hope you're going to pay for everything now! All in all, this comes to ...
I am very disappointed in you. Your penalty amounts to ...
A few new things have come up.
Suddenly, you are no longer accused of murder.
No one remembers watching you commit a theft.
There are no longer any witnesses claiming you have been involved in a brawl or two.
It looks like all charges against you have been dropped.
I have no idea what went on there, but I'm warning you: don't go too far!
I have decided to waive your debts.
And don't get into trouble in the castle ever again!
I want one thing to be clear: you're going to have to pay the full amount of your penalty anyway.
So, what about it?
How much was that again?
So you're the one who made trouble here in the castle.
I've been asking myself how long it would take until you came to me.
Murder is just about the last thing I need here.
I need every single one of my people - and now I'm left with one less again!
To say nothing of the other messes you've gotten yourself into.
Let me explain something to you. We're all together in the same trap here.
And I desperately need every single one of my men. Including you.
If you feel like killing somebody, all you need to do is leave the castle. There's plenty of orcs out there.
I'm going to impose a penalty on you - although I really resent having to deal with crap like this.
Rumor has it that you've been filching stuff around here.
Not to mention all those other things I was told.
You're not going to get away with that. You don't seem to grasp the seriousness of the situation.
You shall be made to pay a penalty to compensate for your crimes!
I don't like to see brawls among my men.
And that sheep thing wasn't really necessary either.
So you are going to pay your penalty for that!
You're running around killing our sheep? They belong to us all.
You shall pay me for the meat.
How much?
I want to pay the penalty!
All right, I'll tell the lads to calm down then. But don't let me catch you at this sort of crap ever again!
I don't have enough gold!
Then you should come up with the gold as soon as you can.
And I'm warning you: cause any more trouble in the future, and the price will go up!
Where do you come from? You aren't one of the scrapers, and you aren't one of my people. Well?
I've come across the pass.
Over the pass ...? You actually got through - by Innos!
Why have you taken this path upon yourself, magician?
What are your orders, soldier?
I have to ask myself why a mercenary would take all that on himself. What are you doing here?
I come from Lord Hagen. He wants me to bring him proof of the presence of the dragons.
And you've come here just to fetch it and then disappear again?
That's what I had in mind.
So he wants proof? He can have it. But I can't send you back to Lord Hagen without giving him information about the ore.
Listen - Lord Hagen absolutely must learn what the situation is here and how much ore we've mined up to now.
All right, what do you want me to do for you?
I've got three troops of scrapers out there, but they haven't sent me a single nugget.
Visit the mining sites and report back to me how much ore they have stored.
Then I'll write you a letter that you are going to take back to Lord Hagen.
Of well - I guess I have no choice.
But why me, of all people?
Because you know a way to get through the lines of orcs. My boys would be hopelessly lost out there.
You, on the other hand, have managed to get through once already - that makes you the best man for this job.
I need some equipment.
Talk to the magician Milten here in the castle. He knows about the things you'll need.
Talk to Tandor about that. He'll get you everything you need.
How much will you pay me for the job?
(irritated) I am not used to haggling with mercenaries.
Oh well, I guess I have no choice. I'll pay you 500 gold pieces if you take care of this mission for me.
Where can I find the mining sites?
Here, take this map. It shows the two areas where the mining sites are located.
If you have any more questions, ask Parcival. He can tell you all you need to know about the scrapers.
Damn! What's going on out there? Has Beliar himself come to wipe us out?
My men are almost all dead and with the bit of ore we have, we CAN'T EVEN STOP ONE ORC LET ALONE AN ARMY!
This expedition is doomed to failure.
I talked to Fajeth.
What has he got to tell me?
His people have mined two chests of ore.
Hmm ... two chests? I don't need two chests - I need TWO HUNDRED.
He wants me to tell you that he needs more men.
What? I'm supposed to send even more men to certain death? He can forget it.
About Silvestro's mining site ...
Did you go see him? Did you talk to him?
Everyone's dead there. They were surprised by minecrawlers.
What about the ore? Do you know how much they have mined?
They managed to secure a few chests first. They're in a cave - along the path from the castle to the mining site.
Damn! Those were a lot of good men - may Innos have mercy on their souls.
I have met Marcos.
And? What does he have to report? How much ore does he have for us?
Four chests. He has left the mining site to take the ore to safety.
Now he is guarding the chests in a small valley behind the lines of orcs. He's asking for reinforcements, however.
What? Only four chests - and he left his mining site? Damn, that isn't good.
And now he wants more men ...? Well, fine, I'll send him two people.
What about the letter for Lord Hagen?
We have ten crates of ore on the whole - and we've lost twice as many good men.
You shall have your letter. Lord Hagen MUST hear of this. This valley is cursed - evil abides here.
What about my pay?
Oh yes, right. I still owe you some gold. Here's your reward.
How's the situation?
Now I'm only waiting for news about the last mining site - and I hope it's good news.
I need the reports about the other two mining sites. Then we shall see.
You should set out to find the mining sites. I'm desperate for news about the status of the ore production.
I want you to let Gorn go.
I can't let him go. He has committed many crimes and they must be atoned for.
Can I pay his penalty?
That might be a possibility - but certainly not a cheap one. I want 1000 gold pieces for Gorn.
That's a lot of gold.
Gorn also has much to answer for. Bring me the gold and I'll set Gorn free.
I want to buy Gorn free.
Agreed. You can go to Gerold and tell him to release Gorn on my orders.
Then bring me the 1000 gold pieces.
What are you planning to do now?
I've tried everything. You're my only hope now - and that Lord Hagen will send me reinforcements.
We'll continue to stand firm and pray to Innos that he won't leave us despondent in this dark hour.
What's new?
Damnit. What are you mucking about here for? I need those bloody reinforcements!
Even Milten has left the castle. But I don't need fewer people - I need more!
I'm back.
I can see that for myself. Where are the reinforcements?
Lord Hagen will come as soon as he has settled everything. Much has happened.
I don't care. I need troops. There are more and more orcs and we can't hold out much longer.
My men are tired, and we're running out of provisions.
Some volunteers have arrived.
You mean yourself and your fellow dragon hunters, huh? You can help us, but there just aren't enough of you.
You mean the dragon hunters outside in the yard? They may help us, but there just aren't enough of them.
If Hagen doesn't send some men soon, I can't make any guarantees.
I've got news about the dragons.
Report.
I killed the dragon in the swamp to the east of here.
The dragon in the rock fortress to the south is dead.
The fire dragon on the volcano to the south will wreak no more havoc.
I went to the western ice region and did away with the dragon there.
That's good news. Here. I'll give you some money towards your equipment.
Can you give me more information about the dragons?
I have other things to worry about. My strategic officer Oric can tell you more about that.
Have there been any more dragon attacks in the meantime?
Luckily not. For the moment they're holding off.
All the dragons are dead.
(in disbelief) All of them? So evil has been vanquished forever?
No, alas not. Their leader still remains.
Weren't the dragons the leaders of the orcs?
Yes, true, but they also have their own master. We must get rid of him as well.
I damn well can't go. I have to guard the ore, and the cursed orcs are still about, too.
You'll have to take care of it yourself. I can't help you.
May Innos protect you.
There is a problem with the smith.
What smith? He's disappeared into the woodwork.
Is he back? Then you can tell him...
No, I'm talking about Jan.
He is a dragon hunter, just like me, and a good blacksmith.
One of the dragon hunters. He's a smith.
That's good. Our previous smith just slinked off, the coward.
Jan would be willing to take over the smithy.
I see. So you think I can trust him.
Yes.
If you're so sure, then you can vouch for him.
If he causes any trouble, you'll answer for it. Agreed?
I'll think about it.
How can I trust him, if even you won't?
Without someone to stand for him, this Jan can keep his hands off the forge.
I'll vouch for Jan.
All right. He can use the smithy. Of course, he'll also have to provide my men with swords.
How's the situation?
What a damned mess! Some bastard left the main gate open. Now we're nothing more than fodder for the wolves.
When I get my hands on the traitor...
We'll all die like flies here if Hagen doesn't come soon.
What are you doing here?
I'm building a ship because I want to get out of here - as fast as I can.
But the way it looks right now, this ship will never be finished.
Why are you in such a hurry?
Soon the orcs will come and burn down the city.
What makes you think that?
Boy, have you noticed the paladins running around everywhere? Why do you think they're here?
I tell you, they're here because the orcs will attack soon. And that won't be pretty.
Why can't you finish your ship?
(dismissively) Oh, we have thousands of problems. The hull still isn't stable, and it's still missing a lot of boards.
But I have hardly any gold left to buy new material with, and the last delivery had bugs in it.
My boys don't work productively. One wants a fast ship above all else, the other one is worried about the figurehead!
As if we didn't have more important things to do!
Also, one of my people is simply not showing up for work any more. I'm beginning to fear that this will delay the construction even more.
You're short a worker?
Yes. His name's Monty. He's vanished into thin air.
That lazy pig is probably living the high life on a farm somewhere. I should never have paid him in advance.
I've heard that other people have gone missing, too.
Just what I'm saying. That's where the evil starts.
Farim the fisherman told me something similar. His buddy William is no longer around.
I bet that the orcs are behind all this.
Where can I find this Farim?
He's a fisherman. I think that his hut is near the provisions store of the paladins. But I don't know for sure.
When was the last time you saw Monty?
(angrily) He hasn't bothered to show up for work for at least two days.
And, how's it going NOW?
Monty is back! He's busy studying the plans.
Maybe we can get the ship done now ...
Can I help you somehow?
Yes you can. Find out what the paladins are planning. I want to know why they're here.
And I have to know if the orcs will attack - and how far from the city they are.
One of the bastards was even seen outside the city.
Just bring me all the information you can get.
I need to know how much time I have left to finish the boat.
Good. If you find out more, let me know.
Thanks for the information. The way it looks, we have all the time in the world for building our ship.
I've got some information about the orcs.
Let's hear it.
They're stuck in the Valley of Mines, and it looks like they're going to stay there.
To be on the safe side, the paladins are guarding the pass.
I know why the paladins are here.
Really? Tell me!
The paladins are here to get the magical ore from the Valley of Mines, not because they expect the orcs to attack the city.
As soon as they've got the ore, they're going to return to the mainland.
As to that orc outside of town ...
Yeees ... ?
Don't worry about him. The city guard is going to take care of him.
What's going on at the harbor?
The orcs are breathing down our necks and you're asking about the harbor?
I only wanted to ...
The biggest problem we have is that there aren't enough ships in the harbor to get us out of here.
To be honest, there's only one ship here, and that belongs to the paladins. They certainly won't let us get out of here with it.
Look around for yourself, there's nothing going on here.
Would you like a sausage?
Ah - delicious, that. Thank you so much, brother.
Innos be with you - I've never seen you before, are you new around here?
Yes, I only just joined.
In that case, I hope you'll get settled here fast. Let me know if I can help you with anything.
What room is this?
This is where they keep the holy relics of the monastery.
What relics?
Here rests the Hammer of Innos, along with the Shield of Fire. These are the most important relics of the Church of Innos outside of the capital of the realm.
Tell me about the hammer.
This is the sacred Hammer of Innos. With this hammer, Saint Rhobar slew the Stone Sentinel.
The Holy Scriptures say that the Stone Sentinel was invulnerable. He stood in battle like a tower, and the weapons of his enemies were smashed on his skin of stone.
With the name of Innos on his lips, Rhobar hurled himself at the monster and crushed it with one mighty blow of his hammer.
Tell me about the shield.
The Shield of Fire was borne by Dominique in the battle on the Southern Isles.
But the power of this shield is never to be wielded again - therefore, we have nailed it to the wall.
Is the Eye of Innos kept here, too?
Of course not. What a strange idea. Nobody knows where that divine artifact is to be found.
What are you doing here?
I am the guardian of the sacred artifacts.
Shall I take over from you for a while?
Is this a test? The mages have sent you to test me, right? Ooh - I knew it!
But I shall pass this test. Tell your mages that I stand firm as a rock, and that I shall resist all temptations, for I am a worthy guardian.
Why are the artifacts being guarded? Is there any reason to worry they might be stolen?
What an extraordinary concept. Whatever makes you think that?
Only those who serve Innos are authorized to set foot in the monastery. And no true believer would ever harbor such thoughts.
Don't you ever sleep?
What an unusual notion. Of course I don't ever sleep. Innos himself grants me the power which allows me to forego sleep altogether.
For how else could I fulfill the sacred duties of guardianship?
Do you really NEVER sleep?
No. If a guardian falls asleep, he has failed.
But I shall not fail, for Innos gives me strength and endurance, and I shall never tire.
(upset) Thief! You have disgraced not only yourself and me, but this entire monastery!
You shall atone for this sacrilege. And, above all - GIVE ME BACK THAT HAMMER!!
(desperate) The hammer has disappeared - how could that happen?
I have failed. Innos will punish me!
I'm bringing back the hammer.
You are a villainous thief!
So it's you who took it ...
But it is not my place to judge you. Innos shall administer his justice upon you, and you shall receive his punishment!
Halt! Who goes there?
You haven't come to send me back into the ore mines, have you?
I'll have to disappoint you, then. There's no way I'm going back.
You're a convict on the lam, right?
How perceptive of you. Why else would I have crawled into this filthy hole?
What are you doing out here?
What's with the idiotic questions? I'm hiding out here from you soldiers.
Stop beating about the bush. Either kill me now, or get lost.
Stupid question. Hiding, what else? Those militia swine have their spies everywhere.
I'm not going back into the mine, and that's final.
That roast smells good.
Don't touch!
What are you doing here?
Who are you, then? Looks like you're new and have no idea what goes on around here.
They call me Gerbrandt. To you, that's: Mr. Gerbrandt, sir. Got it?
I got it, Gerbrandt.
Careful with that big mouth of yours. You had better show me a little more respect, or you're headed for all kinds of trouble here.
I call the shots here. Whoever causes trouble has to answer to me and had better skip town in a hurry, because once I'm done with him, he'll wish he'd never laid eyes on me.
Most people around the harbor work for me. If you're ever looking for work, you had better see to it that my memories of you are pleasant ones.
I get the point, Mr. Gerbrandt, sir.
At least it didn't take you long to grasp how the wind blows around here.
As soon as business starts picking up again, I can surely find a use for a strapping lad like you.
You would make an excellent depot master.
Can you read?
No.
Never mind, at least you'll be able to lug a few sacks about.
If I am satisfied with you, I might even offer you a permanent position. There is enough to do around here.
Well, then, I'll expect you when the first ships come back here to dock.
I don't want a job.
You think you're awfully clever. Watch it, no one can get a job here as long as I don't approve.
So if you keep giving me the lip like that, you can find yourself a bug-infested straw tick to sleep on, because that will be all you can afford.
The time will come when you'll beg me to give you a job.
Of course.
Fine, fine. Trained staff is hard to come by.
How about your references?
References?
All right, I shall remember your face. Once trade picks up again, come and see me. I just might have a job for you then.
What is that about - are you trying to mock me?
You and your buddy Diego have wreaked enough havoc already.
Leave me alone!
Anything new?
People like you have no business up here. This is where the respectable society resides, and not tramps or crooks.
If you should ever succeed in becoming wealthy and respectable, you might find yourself more welcome here.
I cannot complain, honorable Sir.
I have seen the likes of you - you simply don't know your place.
I shall have a talk with the governor concerning appropriate safety measures for the upper end of town.
That's nobody's business but mine. I'm busy!
Diego says hello.
(scared) What? Who? What Diego?
And he wants me to give you this letter.
(agitated) That can't be. No. I'm a goner!
(fearfully) Is he in town, then?
Who?
Diego, of course!
Yes, I am going to meet him here shortly.
(desperately, to himself) This is the end, then. All is lost.
I've got no time, I need to get out of here. Quick. If he finds me here, I'm done for.
What are you guarding?
The prisoners.
And who is that?
A few convicts and the mercenary Gorn. A tough guy - strong as an ox.
It took four men to bring him into custody.
Can you let me into the dungeon?
No. NO ONE may enter the dungeon. That goes for EVERYONE. For you, for Milten and for everybody else.
This isn't some tavern where you can go in and out as you please. Remember that.
Can't you make an exception for me?
No.
And what if I pay you gold?
No.
I have a note here for one of the prisoners. Can you pass it on?
Hm ... in principle, I don't see why not. Who's this message for then?
For Gorn.
A very important prisoner. I don't think Garond would agree to that. But if it's important to you, we can certainly come to an agreement.
What do you want?
Our food rations are being reduced steadily. I want something decent to eat for a change.
Get me a tasty sausage and a fresh loaf of bread - and some sweet honey.
And a bottle of wine to go with it ... Yeah, that should do. You should be able to manage that. So, come back when you have the stuff.
I've got something for you. The food you wanted.
Good, give me the grub. Do you have the message?
Yes, here. Remember, it's for Gorn.
Come back tomorrow, he'll have received the message by then.
Come back when you have the stuff I want.
Did Gorn receive the message?
Yeah, I'm supposed to tell you from him:
And?
It's at the south gate.
Did he say anything else?
No. No idea what that's supposed to mean. Do you know what it means?
Perhaps. But you shouldn't think about it too much.
Yes, that may be better.
No, not yet. Come back later.
Set Gorn free. That's an order from Commander Garond.
I've already been informed. Here's the key, you can go in.
Don't you ever sleep?
No. Innos himself grants me the strength never to need sleep.
All quiet?
Quiet, yes.
But?
My navel's rubbing against my backbone, man. Garond cut the food rations again.
If I don't get a decent meal down my throat, then I'm going to bite Garond's fat ass.
Maybe I could give you something.
Are you crazy? Certainly not here. If one of the others sees, I'll have a ton of new friends, if you know what I mean.
You can find me in the magician's temple when everyone else has retired.
Quick, follow me to the magician's temple before the others come out of their holes. I don't want to wait until tomorrow.
There's hardly anyone in the temple at this time anyway. I'll wait for you there.
But just don't show up with dry bread or some raw hunk of meat, got it?
Not my problem.
You can talk. Garond certainly won't cut your rations.
Even if he won't admit it, he's scared shitless and he sees you as his only salvation.
That's enough. That's enough. With that I'll be fine for a while.
Here's my gold. I can't buy anything for it out here in any case, so you might as well have it.
I'd better go then, before somebody sees us.
Sure. Give it here. Do you have more?
Yeah. More, more!
There you are. So, what is it now? Do you have anything to eat for me?
I don't have anything right now.
First you make such a big deal out of it and now you want to trick me?
That's all I have.
And I'm supposed to believe that? All right, better than nothing. Here's a bit of gold for it.
Well. I need to get back to my post.
What about a juicy hunk of cheese?
A piece of sausage?
I could give you this ham.
A chunk of meat?
A good soup would hit the spot, don't you think?
Still hungry?
If the orcs attack again, not even a full belly will help me.
That must be a joke. I'm stuffed. Thanks again.
Yeah. But thanks for your help anyway.
It's all right, Master.
Beat it!
(dryly) Cool armor!
How's it going?
(dryly) Brave of you to come here. You got lost, huh?
That's some armor you're wearing.
Yeah. Hard to get. It's made of minecrawler plates. A guy named Wolf made it for me.
I used to be a convict here in the colony. Gave him a couple of minecrawler plates and a few days later the thing was finished. The guy's okay.
Where's this Wolf now?
It's been a while since I've seen him. Back then he was a mercenary here in the colony.
I suppose he still hangs around with the boys.
What are you doing up here?
I'm here to make money.
Here, in the middle of nowhere?
I'm a hunter. I specialize in difficult cases.
Fire lizards, minecrawlers, dragon snappers... Anything nobody else will hunt. That brings in the money.
What is there to see here?
A bunch of fire lizards, orcs and I don't know what all. Haven't been farther up on the high plain.
I'd advise you against trying it. The things that live up there don't sound too friendly.
Can you gut dragons, too?
(laughs) Ask me again later, when you're ready for something like that, okay?
Sure. Why not?
Teach me how to gut animals.
Why not? I've got enough at the moment.
What do you want to know?
At the moment, I don't know what I could still teach you.
You cut a fire lizard's tongue out of its mouth with one stroke of the knife, while you hold it with your other hand.
You have to peel crawler plates off the beasts' backs with a sturdy knife.
Mandibles are lodged rather deeply in the skull of a field raider or minecrawler. It takes some effort to pry them out.
The best place to separate a dragon snapper's horn from the skull is at the top of its forehead. Use a sturdy knife.
Dragon scales are really stubborn, but just when you think you can't do it, the thing comes right off the dragon's back.
The best place to take blood is from its underside. Look for a soft spot and stab with a sharp knife.
I am Girion, master of two-handed combat and paladin of the king. Why are you disturbing me?
Can you train me?
You do well to train in the noblest of all combat styles. As is proper for a warrior of Innos.
I shall instruct you. Report to me when you are ready.
If you wish to learn something, you must turn to a teacher from outside of our order.
I am a warrior, not a teacher.
I am ready to be trained.
Naturally, your education is not finished, but there is nothing more that I can teach you.
If you wish to improve your talent with the weapon further, you will have to seek out a true swordmaster.
Where can I find such a man?
Lord Hagen is a swordmaster. He will certainly instruct you.
Fight with honor. Combat is our life - and what is your life without honor?
Be cautious and quick in combat. Surprise your opponent.
Never go into combat unprepared. You can never know if it is your last.
A paladin is always prepared for combat. But he never begins a fight he cannot win.
A paladin fights not only with the sword, but also with his mind.
You have to know the point up to which you can retreat.
Remember, you fight well if you control your opponent and don't give him a chance to be in control himself.
You have only lost when you have given up.
Hey! Can you tell me what you are doing here?
I don't know what you're talking about.
I am talking about what you have worked out with the ship's guards up there. That stinks to high heaven.
Even if you are a magician, I still don't trust you.
Get out of my way, or I'll have to kill you.
You may be able to deceive the ship's guard, but you will find me a tough nut to crack, my little friend.
Even if you are one of us, that does not give you the right to steal the king's property. Die, you damned traitor.
When we have finished this business, you will turn the ship back over to me, understood?
I need the ship. So I will take it.
You cannot do that. The ore transport ...
How dare you, you stinking son of a ...
The ore in the Valley of Mines is not enough to satisfy the king. I was there. There's nothing more to be had there. Hagen's mission is a farce.
The real threat has its roots on an offshore island not far from here. I shall sail there and put an end to it.
Either you join me, or I'll have to do away with you. It's your choice.
Mmh. It sounds as though I have no choice.
Correct.
Well, all right. I shall join you, but only under one condition.
I can live with that.
Then do what you must do. I shall wait here for you.
Traitor!
Everything all right?
The orcs are truly brave to set themselves against me.
They really should know better than to challenge a paladin of the royal guard.
I think so. Will you need long for your mission here on this cliff?
Don't treat me like an idiot. Do what must be done and then surrender the ship to me.
Train me, the faster we will be able to leave here.
I seem to have no other choice.
Never prop up your elbows. That makes your aim much too stiff and you will inevitably twist your weapon.
Always loosen your left arm before a shot. That way you are more flexible when aiming.
Your blade must slice through the air like a reed in the wind.
Always use your strength with calculation. Running blindly at your opponent has never yet led to success.
Don't hold the shaft so tightly, then your blow will hit its mark.
Don't forget to parry. But the best defense is always to dodge your opponent's blow.
I have a ring from the orcish warlords.
I suspect that Lord Hagen will be able to do something with that.
Give it to me. I shall deliver it to Lord Hagen.
Here, take it.
Thanks. I don't think you have much use for it anyway.
I'd rather keep it to myself.
Suit yourself. You can't do anything with it anyway.
We can cast off now.
It's about time. I thought for sure I would rot here on this cliff.
Now surrender the ship to me immediately.
We're not in Khorinis yet. And, to be honest, I'm not terribly keen on going back to Khorinis.
I've been there long enough.
I thought as much. But this is neither the time nor the place to straighten this out. We shall discuss this again at sea.
So what. I'm glad to have you back on board in one piece, nevertheless.
You are a true warrior of Innos. I have no more doubt of that. I am glad to have you on our side.
Even if you are a rascal, in the end you acted with righteousness.
All right. Now go to the captain and let him navigate us out of here.
Heh? What?
Where do you come from?
We come from ... eh, from the city.
You're bandits!
Careful! You're biting off more than you can chew!
Relax. I won't rat you out.
I hope so, for your sake. Otherwise you're dead!
You can't scare me.
We'll see about that.
I never saw you in town before.
I can't stand people who stick their noses into things that don't concern them, understand?
I see, you come from the city.
Exactly.
Nope.
Then I'll have to beat it into you.
I see. From the city, then.
See! You understand!
Here, have a swig!
What are you doing here?
We heard about the dragon hunt. So we packed up our stuff and came here.
But to be honest, I don't give a shit about dragons. I just want a bit of gold.
Dragons have gold, don't they?
Certainly.
What do you know about the dragons?
I only know the stories they tell the children.
You know, virgins, gold, fire breathing, that kind of thing.
Where are you planning to go from here?
No idea. We're still thinking about it.
You could go to the castle.
Wild horses couldn't drag me there. Not to the paladins.
I'm not going back to jail. I was there once and that was enough for me.
What about the orcs?
The whole castle is surrounded. There aren't any gaps.
Trying to sneak through there is insane. If you try to fight, you're a dead man.
Nobody gets through there.
Ah, really.
What were you in the slammer for?
Like I'm going to tell you that, huh?
You magicians are in cahoots with the paladins. Nah, my friend. Forget it.
The swine nabbed me for poaching. For two lousy hares!
They slapped me with 10 years for that.
That was all?
Well, okay, of course I defended myself.
And?
I couldn't do anything about it, the guy tripped and broke his neck. Honest!
Sounds familiar.
You know what I mean. The rich bastards don't have any idea how we're treated.
That doesn't worry them in the least.
You shouldn't have let yourself get caught.
(angry) I bet you've never been in jail, have you?
Then I should teach you a lesson about what all can happen to a body in jail.
Can you teach me how to hunt?
You aren't serious, are you? Beat it!
An animal has more than just meat. You can sell the pelts or the claws. That can bring a tidy little sum.
I can hardly wait to get my hands on a dragon.
Show me how to gut a dragon.
So you can rake in all the dough yourself, huh?
Well, all right, but that'll cost you 1000 gold coins.
That's fair.
Without money it's not. First get the cash.
It's not worth that much to me.
Suit yourself.
Show me how to hunt.
The best way to remove the teeth is with a sturdy knife.
The fastest way to remove a bloodfly's stinger is to squeeze it out before you cut it off.
A bloodfly's wings are very sensitive. So be careful when you cut them off.
Use soft footwear when you're sneaking. A stiff sole can be very noisy.
You need a lot of strength to get the scales off a dragon. But you can handle that.
Look for a soft spot on the dragon's belly. That's where it's easiest to get dragon blood.
I've killed all the dragons.
Well, so what. Here in the valley there's still enough for us to get.
Can I be of assistance to you?
I've brought a heap of gold.
(with anticipation) Ah - you're bringing your offering for Innos. That's good of you, my son.
I shall use your offering for the best of the monastery as it pleases Innos.
What have you done with that gold? Did you spend it? Go get it and then come back!
Here, I've got the statuette that Daron was supposed to bring to the monastery.
(sighs) It is truly embarrassing that such a valuable piece is brought to us by an aspiring novice.
Nevertheless, this confirms your commitment to serve Innos.
I am very obliged to you, young novice.
Statuette? I see no statuette. Bring it to me, and I might believe your little story.
I'm looking for a place to sleep.
There's an empty bed right next door. The first on the right, next to the entrance. You can sleep there.
You can store your belongings in one of the unused chests.
And remember - you have no business entering the sleeping chambers of the magicians. You are also not allowed to enter the library unless you have been given permission.
Do you have an assignment for me?
You novices have worked hard lately. And those who work a lot shall eat a lot, too.
I'm giving you the key to the larder. You'll find some mutton sausages there. Distribute them among the novices - but fairly!
Once you have done that, you can come see me again.
I have distributed the sausages.
And you have done so fairly. Take these spell scrolls of healing - and go back to your work.
Really? Then you cannot have put much effort into fulfilling your task.
So, either you ate those sausages yourself, or you gave someone more than his share.
Listen, since you're new - and for that reason only - I shall let you get away with it. Keep that in mind, novice!
Do you have another assignment for me?
Yes. As you know, we make an excellent wine here and we sell it, too.
Orlan, the landlord of the inn 'The Dead Harpy' has ordered a shipment. We've agreed on 240 gold pieces for the bottles.
Bring him these bottles - but don't let him shortchange you.
I went to see Orlan.
And, did you get the 240 gold coins?
What have you done with that gold? Did you spend it? Go get it and then come back!
He put one over on me!
You sold it to him cheaper? Oh no, why did I have to send YOU of all people?
You really are utterly and completely useless. Now get out of my sight.
I've got the gold.
Excellent. You're really useful. Take this spell scroll of healing as a reward. And now go and find yourself something else to do.
But you've already spent part of the money, haven't you? You're good for nothing - begone!
What's your task here?
My tasks are many and varied. Not only am I the steward, but I am also the treasurer.
Moreover, I supervise the wine cellar, and I'm in control of the monastery's food supplies.
So, if there's anything you need, you can always come to me and get it - for a modest contribution, that is.
I need a few things ...
I need a new place to sleep.
There's a free chamber on the right here. Take the key. You'll find everything you need there.
Wait, mercenary. I need to talk to you.
What do you want?
The monastery is facing a very delicate situation.
At the moment, everyone seems to mistrust everybody else. And then, this thing with Pedro, that's extremely ... (gulps)
I have an assignment for you from the highest authorities. You are not a member of the Brotherhood of the Fire, and therefore the only one here who can settle this matter for us.
But I must warn you. If I give you this assignment, you'll be bound to fulfill it, too. Once you know what it's about, you'll have no choice. Do you understand?
Forget it. That's too risky for me.
All right. In that case, forget I said anything.
Tell me what you want.
All right. Then listen well, for I'm only going to say this once.
Serpentes wants you to kill Pedro for his treason as soon as you lay your hands on him.
You will be paid as soon as this task is fulfilled.
I never said that. And you haven't heard anything either, understand?
Everything ship-shape?
Up to now. Remember, I want to see some action.
Are there more orcs up there? Send them to me. I just got warmed up.
I need training.
Can't hurt.
Well. You used to be better than that.
You have to hold your weapon higher. A blind man could get through your guard with his cane.
You stayed with the ship?
Sure I did. Just imagine what we'd do if it weren't there any more.
Now what happens?
Nothing more. I want to go home.
(laughs) Home? Where's that? As far as I know, there's no such thing for you.
Let me make a suggestion. We storm the next tavern and drink ourselves senseless.
Mmh. Maybe.
Hey, come off it, man. It's over.
Somebody still needs to tell Biff, otherwise he'll rot on this island.
He'll be here in time.
There's nothing left here for us. Tell the captain to clear the ship.
I see you have joined the dragon hunters.
I followed Sylvio into the Valley of Mines, because I know my way around here best and wanted to get a clear picture of the situation.
I'll tell you what. Something's definitely brewing here. I've never seen so many orcs in one place in all my life.
It wouldn't amaze me if Garond and the paladins in the castle had all fled or been slain by now.
What are your plans now?
I'll follow the boys here to the Valley of Mines first, and then take off later.
I really have to find out what the orcs are planning.
I'll see you around.
Look out for yourself.
So this is where you holed up!
You aren't so easy to kill yourself, eh?
Have you caught anything yet?
I'm still waiting. I think there may be something to be had up there in the old rock ruins. There are lights up there at night, and I can hear screams.
Maybe it's Lester who has returned to his old ruin on the rock?
Can't be. As far as I know, Lester doesn't live up there any more.
A dragon?
Very likely. The high plain up there is guarded like the King's damn treasury. Alas, it's the only way to the fortress.
As if the dragons weren't bad enough already. They seem to have a few more monsters in tow.
What kind of monsters would those be?
I couldn't quite make them out properly, but they walk upright and have scaly skin. They move over the rocks like snappers that have gotten a whiff of prey.
I can hear them snuffling and snorting clear down here. I think they've taken over the whole plain up there.
What about the orcs?
