I've been watching them for quite a while. The barricade they set up down there must be hiding something. I suspect that crowds of them have already gathered back there.
You mean, even MORE than are here already?
It wouldn't amaze me if they tore down their palisade one evening and flooded across the land. I've got a bad feeling about this.
If that happens, I'll have to go back and warn Lee. He wants to get off the island anyway. By then, it'll be high time.
Can you help me get into the fortress?
I don't really know. I'm afraid the orcs will attack just at the very moment I look away.
That's paranoid!
Can't be helped. I'd never forgive myself if I came too late, you see? On the other hand ...
Whatever! Why else am I here? Let's charge the plain and fight our way clear to the fortress.
A little exercise can't hurt. Besides, I want to get a closer look at those beasts up there.
Let me know when you're ready!
Let's attack!
Just like old times, eh? But I'll tell you something: This is my battle. This time I'm going in front!
It was child's play. So, my friend, you'll have to take care of the rest. Make it hot for them! I'll go back and keep an eye on the orcs.
No Problem. See you around!
I should hope so!
The rock dragon is dead!
I don't hear any more screams! Were you up in the rock fortress?
Yes!
Ha ha! I thought as much. Wherever you show up, there won't be one stone left standing.
What are you going to do now?
I'll stick around for a while and then make my way back to Lee. Maybe we'll meet again there!
I'm getting sick of this damned area. It's time we finally got out of this country.
See you later!
Are you relaxed?
Sure, why not? The dragons are dead, aren't they?
The case is a little more complicated.
(laughs) Well. Like always. Let me know when you need my axe.
I could use you and your axe.
Well. I'm not surprised. What can I do for you?
Would you sail to an island with me and kick some enemy butt?
(laughs) Sure. Right away. Just tell me what to do.
At the moment, my crew is already complete, but I'll think about taking you on board, too.
If you have to kick someone else off your crew because of me, then take the weakest.
In these rough times, you need every man who can lend a hand.
Come aboard with me. Wait for me at the harbor.
A ship? Ha! I can say one thing for you. It's never boring with you. See you soon.
I'll let you know when it's time.
All right.
Maybe you had better stay here.
I'm supposed to let you go alone? Mmh. It's not easy for me, but it's your war. Come to me if you want me to follow you after all.
Come back. I need you.
There you are. And I thought you wanted to let me rot here while you had all the fun. See you later.
Everything all right with you?
You saved my ass, man.
I'll never forget that.
Milten got me out.
I'll never forget that.
What do you want to do now?
I think I'll load up on grub first.
And then?
Who knows ... Maybe I'll go back to the mining colony.
Someone should keep an eye on the orcs - otherwise they'll all show up on the doorstep without warning.
Enough of this lounging about - you're free!
It's about time somebody got me out of here.
I certainly hadn't expected it to be you, though. It's damn good to see you.
(grins) Garond says you eat too much and he can no longer afford to feed you.
Now that you mention it, I could stand a couple of beers. Let's get out of here, I've seen enough of this cell.
Wait, I've still got something here that you can really use.
I found this armor here in the cell. Some prisoner must have hidden it here.
It's too small for me, but it might fit you ...
Thanks! I'll see you at Milten's ...
OK, see you at Milten's.
Sure thing.
Listen - I've loafed around here long enough. It's time I saw something other than this valley.
How did you get over the pass?
There is a path through the abandoned mine.
Good. I'll wait for the right moment and then I'm out of here.
Where will you go then?
I heard that Lee is still alive. I want to join up with him again.
Then go to Onar's Farm. Lee and his boys are there. He needs good men such as you.
I'll do that. I'll go check out how they're doing there.
We'll meet again.
You can count on it.
Psst. Hey, you. Come here.
What is it?
On your way to the city? And really busy, too.
(slimily) Listen. You look like a smart guy to me. I bet you'll go far in life.
You're certainly nobody's fool. I could see that right away.
Say, you'd probably like to earn a couple of gold coins, wouldn't you?
I've got to be going.
(annoyed) So you won't help me. I'll remember that, pal. We'll meet again.
Why not?
You'll have to forgive an ignorant old seaman, I'm a stranger in these parts and I don't really know all the rules.
So I had to find out the hard way that traveling strangers aren't welcome in the harbor city.
(exaggerated self pity) Now I'm standing here with no idea how I'm supposed to get into the city.
I have some extremely important business to conduct and my client won't tolerate a delay, you see?
You'll help me find a way to get past the city guard, won't you?
You don't look like someone who has gold.
(exaggerated modesty) Well, I certainly don't move in the same circles as a gentleman like you.
But you won't refuse my small contribution to your surely considerable fortune, will you?
Well, what do you say? Can I count on you?
Cut the crap. Tell me what you want.
You see? That's exactly what I mean.
Nobody gets anywhere with you just by using pretty words.
I knew it. I'm dealing with a tough businessman here.
You're a businessman, and certainly interested in a small addition to your purse, aren't you?
Are you hiding from someone?
Of course not. What nonsense. I just enjoy standing among the trees so the wind won't blow right into my face.
But what about you, now? Do you want the job?
About the city guards ...
Yes? Got an idea?
They should let you pass if you're wearing these farmer's clothes.
That's just what I need. Man, I knew I could count on you.
(maliciously) Nobody will bother me disguised as a local yokel. Ha ha.
Excellent. You did really well. Here's your promised reward.
(annoyed) What? 50 measly gold coins? You can't be serious.
(patronizingly) Gold isn't everything, my friend. Take them for now.
I have the feeling that we'll be seeing one another soon.
And who knows? Maybe I'll return the favor. Look after yourself.
I'll have to think about it first.
(seriously) All right. But hurry up about it. I've got no time to lose.
I have a pass for the city.
(cynically) Oh, I see. I'm supposed to act like I'm a citizen of the town, or what?
(annoyed) Take a look at me, boy. Nobody is going to believe that.
You could get into the city as a herb gatherer.
(annoyed) What? Do I look like I'd be picking flowers in the woods?
What about bribery?
(roguishly) Well, if that worked for me, I'd have tried it already.
One more thing ...
(arrogantly) Listen, kid. I've got important things to do right now.
(threatening) We'll talk again later. Got it?
Look who just turned up.
The farmer boy.
The fellow who brushed me off so blatantly. So we meet again, eh?
(angry) I thought you wanted to help me. Instead, you just slipped away.
You thought I'd be stuck there forever, didn't you?
It just goes to show. Help yourself or no one else will help you. But I won't let you get away with it again.
You're just in time.
Who are you, anyway?
That's none of your business.
If I wanted to tell you who I am, I'd have done it already, got it?
I'm looking for a fellow. He isn't anywhere to be found in the city, and these losers here don't have a clue either.
He's thin, dark-haired and usually wears red armor.
As far as I know, he used to be a prisoner in the colony. I think his name starts with a 'D'.
What do you want from me?
Are you still having problems with the city guards?
(threatening) I'll GIVE you problems, you punk.
It could be that that's his name. I'm not sure.
I'll probably only know when I see him.
Anything else?
(angry) Yeah, you big mouth. There is something else.
I need weapons. I need provisions. Gold wouldn't be bad either.
I can't help you.
(angry) Oh. You don't WANT to.
This is the second time you've left me hanging.
Let me give you some good advice: Be careful that we don't meet again.
I'll remember that. You can count on it.
Gold? We all want gold.
Could be. And what would you do with it? Drink your way through it in the tavern or blow it in the brothel if I'm any judge.
And you have a better plan, eh?
(angry) You would crawl under a rock if you knew all I've done.
So none of that cheek, or I'll shut your big mouth for you.
Didn't you find a weapons dealer in the city?
You can't be serious! They only have junk.
Here's 10 gold coins.
(laughs) You poor sucker, you can keep your dough. I have a better idea.
There's a cave not far from here! I've been around here before, and I buried my stuff in a few places.
The cave is too dangerous for me alone. I want you to help me with it.
Weapons? The mercenaries have weapons.
Interesting. I heard that the fat farmer Onar had hired the boys.
(laughs) Not too bad for a landlubber.
Not a bad idea. Maybe I really should pay them a visit.
Provisions? You're in a tavern.
The stupid barman won't hand anything over unless you pay him for it.
I don't know anyone who meets that description.
I might have known.
You're talking about Diego.
Is his name maybe Dexter?
Let's visit the cave.
Come with me.
(commanding) What are you waiting for? Go inside and get the stuff.
All right, friend. Here's the cave.
And here's a pick for you.
I buried the stuff somewhere in there. X marks the spot.
What about you, then?
Someone has to guard our backs. And now, in you go.
What took you so long? Found anything yet?
No.
Trying to yank my chain, are you?
(acting innocent) There was nothing THERE.
Damnit. I knew it. Those vultures were faster than me - again.
Oh well. Never mind, kiddo. Gotta go. Catch you later.
Let's see. There's an islet in the small lake with the two waterfalls. One of my caches should be there.
There are two more spots where I buried something further up, in the high pastures.
One spot is behind the farm up there, and the other one's next to the entrance to the pass by the waterfalls.
There are stairs leading down from the fields of the farmer up there to those of the landowner.
There's another cache in the hollow where the stairs end.
Yes. I dug up a small bag of gold.
(greedily) Give it here.
Here you are.
There were 25 gold pieces in it. Here, take them.
Great. So they're still there.
You're not all that useless after all.
Okay, listen. I've buried even more. And I want you to get it for me.
I'll wait for you at the crossroads by the landowner's fields. Don't fail me. You'd regret that, buster.
I don't have it any more.
Bullshit. Do I have to beat it out of you, then?
Where exactly did you bury your stuff again?
One more thing ...
First, get me the stuff I buried. Then we can talk.
I'm grateful that you helped me. But that doesn't make us friends, if you get my drift.
We've been gabbing too much already.
Look, if it ain't Mr. Unreliable.
How are things?
So-so. Those mercenaries aren't much help, really.
I had expected them to have a little more guts at least.
But they're just a bunch of braggarts and loudmouths, if you ask me.
So what about those things I buried? Have you found them yet?
No, not all of them.
Then hurry up, will you? It can't be all that difficult.
What was your business with the mercenaries?
I already told you. I'm looking for this fellow in red armor.
But the idiots here have no idea what I'm talking about.
I take it you're looking for someone named Dexter.
Damnit. How would I know the fellow's name?
It was just a thought.
I know where you can find him.
(surprised) Really? TELL ME!
Not far from here.
He seems to be the leader of an evil gang of bandits.
(sneering) HAH. Yep. That's him.
I knew the old landlubber had holed up here somewhere.
Now all I need to do is scour all the hideouts and ratholes around here.
I'll find that bastard - don't need your help for that.
Maybe we should go see him together?
I've still got a bone to pick with him. I can handle that by myself.
(loudly) Where is that swine?
Who? The captain? He's right here.
(loudly) Then get out of my way.
(angrily) Now where did he go?
He was here.
(commanding) Well, go and find him then!
Ah. Dexter has bought it, right?
Looks like he's dead.
None too soon, either. Go check out what he's got on him.
Dexter carried nothing but this letter.
Show me that thing.
Aw, damnit. That doesn't help me at all.
We shouldn't have just let him croak like that.
You wouldn't happen to know how to cross those mountains in the north-east of Khorinis?
Maybe through an underground tunnel. The Water Mages are currently studying a portal which leads to the mountains in the north-east.
(angrily) What's this nonsense?
(mockingly) Bah. Water Mages. Can't you come up with something better?
No.
(with a resigned sigh) So I'm stranded here.
Dexter was my last hope.
What did you want from Dexter?
I've come from beyond the mountains in the north-east of this island. And I want to go back.
I had hoped that the bastard would know how to get there without a ship.
What is there beyond those mountains?
You had better not try to go there.
Those are rough lands. A wimp like you wouldn't last long.
I saw a pirate named Skip near the port.
That moron. I waited there for 3 days. So why's he coming so late?
Once I get my strength back, I'll give him what for.
I found your buried things.
Then you should be carrying about 100 gold coins, a golden chalice, a silver dish and an amulet, and they're all mine. Give them here.
Here's your stuff.
A bag with 100 gold coins.
100 gold coins.
A golden chalice.
A silver dish.
And an amulet.
Very good. You're lucky that you weren't dumb enough to simply take the stuff and run.
Here's your share of the booty.
I don't happen to have it on me.
Then get me those things before I get mad.
(threatening) Hey, you. What are you doing in my hut?
(furious) I've just been gone for a couple of days, and everyone thinks they can do what they damn well please.
What the hell is going on here?
The palisade still isn't finished? The canyon is overrun with beasts, and everybody is just hanging around, enjoying themselves.
(loudly) So this is all you've accomplished, Francis?
(loudly) Get off of my bench at once!
And YOU? What have YOU done?
And don't think I've forgotten that you still owe me a thing or two.
That is, things worth several hundred gold coins that I buried all over Khorinis.
You just pocketed them all, didn't you?
I'll have you work off every last bit of it.
I'll teach you the true meaning of work.
Not much so far.
Never mind. I'll find you something suitable, my friend.
I've been working.
Have you? And what?
I've done away with the bandits in the tower.
There are no more beasts on the beach to the north.
Well. It's a beginning, I guess.
What is there to do?
First of all we'll make things hum around here.
Morgan, that lazy pig, gets to saw planks.
YOU will take over Morgan's job and clear those beasts out of the damn canyon.
I guess I'll get going then.
One more thing. You're one of us now.
So get yourself a decent hunting outfit first.
Here's some of our armor for you. I hope it fits.
And don't dawdle - get right to it!
Am I supposed to do that all by myself?
Just go ahead and grab some of the boys.
Let them earn their pay instead of just gabbing all day.
What beasts?
The razors in the canyon are coming closer and closer to our camp.
I won't wait until they eat one of my men who's had a few too many.
About that canyon ...
Yeah, what about it?
Who can help me with that?
Take a few of the boys along.
They do nothing but loiter about anyway.
What beasts am I supposed to kill?
Get rid of the razors! The other creatures are harmless.
I killed all the razors.
Good. You seem to be a useful fellow.
I need that bandits' armor.
Prove yourself useful first. Then we can talk.
First, kill all the razors in the canyon!
Hey, you're quite something!
Bones was supposed to wear that armor and spy on the bandits.
But maybe YOU'RE the better man for the job.
Perhaps you even stand a chance of coming out of there alive.
Talk to Bones and let him give you the armor. Then put it on and go to the bandits' camp.
I need to know why those scumbags came to our valley in the first place.
Aye aye, Captain!
Have you got anything else for me to do?
The beach to the north is still teeming with beasts.
Looks like Morgan hasn't done a thing.
There are still bandits in the southern tower on the cliff.
Francis should have dealt with them.
You can handle that as well if you like.
The northern beach is cleared.
Great. Here's your reward.
The bandits in the tower have been dealt with.
Excellent. Good work. Here's your reward.
The bandits have found a gold mine.
I knew it! THAT'S why they came here.
Nobody would volunteer to live in this monster-ridden bog.
Good work. Here, I've got something for you.
Who are you?
I'm Greg, the leader of this lazy bunch.
Is that enough for you?
So how did you get here?
You weren't expecting me, huh?
Just so we set this straight. I'm Greg, and this here is my camp.
That enough for you?
There's one more thing I'd like to know.
And that is?
How did you get here?
I found a tunnel near the old pyramid, guarded by a few mages.
I simply sneaked past those blindworms.
First I took it for an ancient burial chamber and decided to check out what I could find there.
Imagine my surprise when I suddenly found myself in my beloved valley.
Just when I thought I would have to spend the rest of my life running away from the militia.
Where's your ship?
This is just my luck. For months, no ships have sailed between here and the mainland.
For months! And the first ship I run into happens to be a fully manned warship, belonging to the King.
Full of paladins, from her keel to the top of her mast.
That's what I call bad luck.
You can say that again. They sank us right away. I'm the only one who made it to shore.
What do you know about Raven?
He used to be an ore baron as far as I know. Quite a big shot in the colony.
I haven't a clue why he's here now and why people are following him.
But he's certainly up to something. He's not the kind who would hide out in a swamp.
So much for Raven.
Well, I'll be ... That's unexpected. Caught him with his pants down, did you?
That's certainly worth 500 gold pieces to me.
You're quite the daredevil. Carry on like that.
Are you waiting for someone?
I'm hunting. That should be obvious.
Not any more. You're here now, aren't you?
Why me?
You look strong. I could use a fellow like you.
What are you up to?
I want to hunt the snappers up there, but I think there may be too many for me alone.
Count me out on that.
Then scram, coward.
OK. I'll help you. You go first.
Sure thing. But don't get too close to the black troll back there. He'll rip you to pieces otherwise, got it?
And woe betide you if you chicken out.
I've got matters to attend to.
Don't talk nonsense. What can you possibly have to do here in the wilderness that's so important?
Can you teach me how to hunt?
Mmh. All right. You haven't been much help to me so far, but let's not be too harsh.
Sure. But that'll cost a bit.
All right. Here's your money.
Good. Then tell me when you want to learn something.
Bring me the money and you can learn something.
I'll think about it.
If you say so.
Teach me how to hunt.
What exactly do you want to know?
You already know everything I could teach you.
It's really no problem removing a bloodfly's stinger. You just have to find the base and firmly shove in your knife.
You can either just rip off the bloodfly's wings, or detach them with a sharp knife.
There are different ways of removing claws. For some animals a strong blow is needed - with others, you can simply cut them off with a knife.
Minecrawlers and field raiders have strong mandibles that you can remove from the animal's head with a strong jerk.
Minecrawler plates stick very tightly to the beasts' bodies, but you can get them off with a sharp, sturdy object.
Have you seen a novice pass by here?
A lot of peculiar figures passed by here today - including those two jokers up by the stone arch.
A while ago, a novice from the Magicians of Fire was with them as well.
The black troll is dead. Nicely done. I never thought those could be killed at all. I won't forget that.
You? Who would have thought we'd see each other again.
So it looks like we both know how to stay alive, and as you can see I've stuck with prospecting.
How much ore have you already mined?
A few chests. But there's nothing of that left here.
Paladin Marcos decided to take the ore to the castle, because we were constantly being attacked by orcs.
Do you know which way Marcos went?
He didn't take the direct route - instead he wanted to cross the river where it was frozen.
He wanted to cut around and approach the castle from the west.
Don't you want to leave the valley?
No, I'll keep on mining ore.
I'm not going to let a few orcs stop me - I've been through a lot more than that.
Back then when we were digging in the old mine, and suddenly the water broke in ...
But those are old stories.
How's your work?
This rock is damn stubborn - almost like it was trying to prevent us from taking the ore.
What do you want, stranger? I f you have come to beg, I must disappoint you. I am a poor widow.
My name is Gritta. Ever since my husband died, I have been running the household for my uncle, Thorben.
Matteo sent me. You still owe him some gold.
He wants his money? What for? The goods he delivered were flawed, bad fabric and bad seams.
And did you look at the colors? Those are not the colors I ordered. That's fraud, it is!
Let me tell you, back when my husband was alive, he wouldn't have dared to do that. Oh, my poor husband ...
... such a good man he was. Handsome, hard-working, a gentleman of the old school. We had it all, wealth, happiness ...
... sometimes we were even invited to high society events. The festivities, all the beautiful clothes and hairdos ...
... the fine dining and civilized conversations. Everything was better back then. No one would have dared to humiliate the heart of a poor widow with such ...
... ridiculous claims. Whatever shall I do? My pension is barely enough to make ends meet, and times are getting even rougher. One sees it everywhere ...
... people must scrimp and save. It's been weeks since the last ship came to town. My husband was the captain of a merchant ship - actually, he even owned the ship...
... from his long journeys, he always brought me presents - exquisite fabrics from the mainland, precious spices from the southern countries ...
... most people haven't even heard of these things. But then, one day I got the tidings that the Gritta had sunk - that was the name of the ship, my husband called it that out of ...
... love for me. I wept and prayed that my husband had survived the disaster, every day I hoped to hear from him, but all my longing was in vain ...
... may Innos have mercy on his soul. May he rest in peace. Since that time I have been living under these modest circumstances, and now this soulless, callous Matteo ...
... is after the last bit of my life savings. Please have mercy on a poor woman. Back when my husband was alive, he wouldn't have dared to do that. Oh, my poor husband ...
Cut it out. Where's the gold?
(defiantly) But I don't have the gold, I'm only a poor widow!
Then we'll simply sell a few of your togs. I'm sure you've still got a bunch of stuff in your closet ...
How dare you, uncouth lout! All right, here, take the gold.
(grins) See, that wasn't so hard.
(tartly) And now will you please leave my house.
I'm going to pay the sum for you.
You would do that for me? Oh, I knew you weren't a greedy bastard like that Matteo!
Yeah, yeah, never mind.
Come back once you've taken care of that - I want to show you my gratitude.
(menacing) Fork over the dough, or I'll slug you one!
(defiantly) You're nothing but a common thug. Go ahead, draw your weapon, and I'll call the guards!
It was very noble of you to pay for me. I want to show you my gratitude.
Here's a bottle of wine which my husband, may Innos rest his soul, brought back from the southern islands.
Also, I'm going to spread the news around. At last there's somebody in town whose virtue ...
Yeah, yeah, never mind.
As long as there are men like you in this town, I still have the hope that everything will turn out well.
Come back when the matter with Matteo is settled.
Why are you staring like an idiot? You won't dare to attack me anyway!
What else do you want? You've got my gold! Go away!
How's it going?
Everything's going to the dogs here. Wherever you look, there's crime and violence. Just imagine, they even murdered one of the paladins.
Oh, I'm so thrilled, Lord Hagen has set the mercenary free.
And how would that affect you?
Just think about it. Do you believe the mercenaries would have stood by and watched one of their comrades get hanged?
They would have tried to free him, and there would have been lots of bloodshed. I can only thank Innos.
The paladins are getting ready, and it looks like they're going to move out soon.
Same as always, but I don't want to complain.
That's war for you, these things happen.
Yes, there's this horrible war on top of it all. Everybody suffers and wonders how they are going to manage.
Sometimes I ask myself what we have done to deserve such a punishment from Innos.
It'll be all right.
You're trying to cheer me up - that's nice.
What have you heard?
Only what they're telling each other in the street.
I've heard that they already caught the murderer, but I can't tell you if that is true.
Everything all right?
Ah, an unfamiliar wanderer. I am very busy, so what do you want?
What interesting things are there to see here?
Interesting is well put. If you go deeper into the woods here, you will run into some very evil fellows.
They're about ten feet tall, hairy, and in a really bad mood. So don't go there if you're not strong enough for them.
What are you doing here?
Well, the things a woodcutter and hunter usually does.
Can you teach me something about hunting?
Sure. But first get me something decent to eat. I'm dying of hunger out here.
I want a bottle of milk, a loaf of bread and a fat ham, then I'll teach you what you want.
Here's the food you wanted.
Fantastic. And now?
Teach me how to hunt.
What do you want to learn?
I can't teach you anything you don't already know.
Cut a slit in the animal's legs so that you can strip the skin off. Do that from front to back, not the other way around.
When removing the teeth you have to take special care that they don't break when they come away from the skull.
You remove the heart of the animal with a deft cut in the chest. But it's usually only worth it with special animals or magical beings.
The mandibles of a minecrawler or field raider have to be removed with a very strong metal lever. They are lodged very deeply in the animal's skull.
To take off a shadowbeast horn, brace yourself against the skull with all your might, pulling on the horn and cutting the thing out with a hard blade.
There is only one way for you to get into our camp alive, and that's over the bridge.
Do you need it pounded into you? Take ONE step further and I'll throw you down the cliff!
If that's the way you want it...
Don't babble at me!
What's up?
Since Onar announced he was hiring mercenaries, the court has been overflowing with nothing but rogues.
All the rabble who didn't have the guts to come out of the woods before are here now.
The bastards really came from everywhere...
So you're a mercenary now too, hm?
Innos be with you!
People from the city aren't welcome here.
The mercenaries came from everywhere?
Most of them came from the penal colony.
Another group of mercenaries came from the south, where they were probably hunting orcs.
And I bet that a few bandits from the mountains have shown up as well by now to get a free meal!
What do you know about the mercenaries from the south?
Not much. So far as I know, they were hunting orcs there.
Sylvio is their boss. Bullco, Sentenza, Raoul and a few others work for him...
Which one of them came from the colony?
Lee and his people. Torlof, Cord, Jarvis, Wolf and whoever else.
What bandits were you talking about?
Ah, I'm just blabbering. I'm not really sure about it.
There are mountains with abandoned mines south of the valley. Some bandits are hiding up there.
They are also convicts from the colony, just like most of the mercenaries in this court.
The only difference is that they're even worse scum. They kill anyone who gets too close.
Beat it, convict! Canthar told me what a nasty bastard you are!
I am Hakon, the weapons dealer.
Every man should carry a weapon these days. Especially when venturing outside of the city walls.
Show me your wares.
It is an honor to me that a representative of our holy church should show an interest in my wares.
What do you know about the disappearances of the citizens of Khorinis?
I have seen many pass through the eastern city gate.
Some of those who came I had never seen before in my life, and many of those who went out never came back.
But what happened the other day was really quite strange.
There was this fellow who came here - I think his name is Joe. He bragged that he would soon come into some serious money.
He claimed that he knew how to get into one of the city towers where the militia keep their arms.
I haven't seen him since, even though I used to bump into him around the same time every day.
I reported this to the militia. I thought that maybe he'd been caught and throughn into the dungeon.
But Lord Andre had no idea what I was talking about. He didn't even know the fellow.
Tell me more about the area around the city.
It's gotten bloody dangerous out there.
Because of the bandits, for one thing, and also on account of wild beasts.
Even the animals don't seem to get enough to eat in these crappy times.
They're venturing closer to the city all the time.
Do you know anything about the paladins?
Yes! Those guys are ruining my business!
All you can buy in this entire town is a short sword, at most.
They've helped themselves to anything that's longer than a foot and a half.
(sarcastically) In return, I now get to live in the hotel free of charge - ha!
Where do you get your weapons from?
Nowhere! Harad has been my supplier up to now.
Harad the smith has been my supplier up to now.
Now all he does is make stuff for the paladins.
He works for those guys day and night like a madman, without pay. He thinks it's his duty.
All I can offer you now is my remaining stock ...
Harad told me about the attack by bandits ...
Oh? And?
He'll give me his approval to be accepted as an apprentice if I hunt down the bandits.
(laughs) Good old Harad. That must be his way of saying he's sorry that he can't produce any weapons for me at the moment.
What do you know about the bandits?
What do I know about them? They robbed me on my way to the city!
And I'm not the only one. They've been up to their tricks for quite a while.
The militia tried to track them down, but without any success.
I'll deal with it ...
What, YOU want to take on the bandits? By yourself? You're quite a good fighter, huh?
How much is the matter worth to you?
(slyly) You want to get in Harad's good books, don't you?
I don't think I should have to pay you for this ...
That's a dangerous business.
Well, it's all right with me. I'll pay you 100 gold pieces if you defeat the bandits.
Do you know who of the militia took part in the search?
The fellow's name is Pablo. He and a few others went looking for the bandits. But they didn't find them.
Do you know where I can find Pablo?
He patrols around the city. You'll find him either at the temple square or in the lower part of town.
Where did they hold you up?
Near Akil's farm. Just go out the city gate from here and follow the road to the right.
After a while, you'll get to a few steps. The bastards came from there. I bet they have their hideout back there in the woods.
I took care of the bandits.
Really? Anyone could say that. Do you have proof?
(sighs) Should I go back and cut off their heads?
(hastily) No - I don't think that will be necessary. I believe you.
You have done the merchants and the city a great service.
Harad will be content - I think.
Here is the money you were promised.
Where did you get those mining shares you're selling?
Sorry, but I can't tell you. It's too dangerous for me.
There you are again!
Harad has finally finished that damn assignment for the paladins.
That means that I can now offer you some new weapons. Are you interested?
Hey, do you need fish? Get your fish here, fresh from the depths of the sea!
Show me your fish.
Hey, if you want to buy fish, come to my booth tomorrow, OK?
Can you tell me something about those missing people?
Missing people? This is a harbor, pal. Things like that are bound to happen.
The sea is treacherous, and bound to claim a life now and then.
Captains of large vessels will always sign on new sailors in large seaports such as Khorinis to complete their crews.
And if they don't find any volunteers, some people may get dragged off against their will. And then they're gone.
Do you know of anyone who's missing?
No idea. Ask the ship builders.
What ship would that have been?
Good question. Not many ships have come into Khorinis lately, that's true.
Are YOU missing someone?
Me? No.
I think this piece of paper belongs to you ...
What...? Let me see.
(sweating) Er... OK, let's stay calm about this - er ... listen. I have resold the goods I got from the bandits.
(hastily) But there's no reason to take this straight to the militia, right? I'm sure we can come to an understanding, can't we?
Make me an offer, then.
All right. I'll tell you something. I can sell you more than just fish.
If you hand me this ridiculous piece of paper and, er ... forget about the matter, you and I can become the best of trading partners.
Looks like it's the slammer for you.
No, wait, you can't do that! After all, I'm nothing but ... you know ... small fry.
You should have thought of that sooner. Now I'm going to report you to Lord Andre.
You'll regret this.
Oh really? What kind of goods would those be?
Well, I could offer you ... quite special fish, you see. Not just plain ones for eating.
You mean like the one that contained your hidden message?
You've got it. I have several of those ... fish.
All right, it's a deal. I think we can keep this little matter between ourselves.
Thank you. Just drop in the next time you happen to be in the vicinity. I'm bound to have some interesting things for you.
I see. You haven't come just to buy fish.
(quietly) I'll make you an offer. If you have any silver plates or chalices - I'll take them for a good price.
For all your stuff, I'll give you ...
You brought too much stuff. I can't give you that much gold all at once.
Come back when you have some silver plates or chalices.
You can get rid of your silver here tomorrow. Today's too early.
Sorry, no more business for today. Come back tomorrow, OK?
All right, sold.
We've made some good deals today. Better not come back until tomorrow, or somebody might get suspicious, you see?
I'm looking for a crew.
But how are you planning to leave here?
That's my own business.
Suit yourself. It's none of my business, really.
I'm going to appropriate a ship.
Yeah right. Are you for real? The paladins will make short work of you, when they get hold of you.
Suit yourself - it's not my life you're risking.
Wanna come along?
Naah, I think not. I've plenty to do here and, honestly, I have no desire to encounter a slave galley full of orcs.
But I wish you lots of luck.
Can you help me?
I'm not the right person for that. But go talk to Jack, he should be hanging out here somewhere in the harbor. He'll know best what you need to make that journey.
Ah, a customer - what can I do for you?
I'm looking for a room.
You're in the right place, then.
One of the paladins told me that I could spend the night here for free ...
What does it cost to spend the night?
Absolutely nothing.
The paladins are responsible for the lodging of all travelers.
So can I stay the night here for free?
Yes, yes.
Just go up the stairs.
We still have one or two beds free.
Why do the paladins pay for everything?
I don't know what that's all about either.
For one thing, I think they want to get all the poor suckers off the streets so they don't make any mischief.
And for another, they want to get on the good side of the traveling traders.
Now that the farmers are rebelling, we have to rely on the traders for provisions.
Besides, I think they want to improve the morale in the city a bit.
Lord Andre has even arranged for free beer to be given out at the gallows square.
Who's staying here at the moment?
Almost all of them are traveling traders from the market.
Aha.
Don't even think of messing with their stuff! I don't want any trouble here!
I have a few questions about the city ...
Where can I buy something around here?
The market is directly in front of the door. You should be able to find everything there.
There are a few more shops and craftsmen on the other side of town. Most of them are near the other city gate.
Also, there's a fishmonger in the harbor district. His shop is directly at the harbor. He's easy to find.
Tell me about the town.
Khorinis is one of the wealthiest cities within the kingdom, even if it doesn't look like it at the moment.
But since the orc war started, trade has almost come to a complete standstill. The king has requisitioned the entire merchant fleet for military service,
which means that hardly any ships come into the harbor now. So, the supply of goods is very scarce now, and many citizens of the town are very worried.
Nobody really knows what the future will bring. There's basically nothing we can do but wait and see what happens. It's not like we can change anything.
How's it going?
You don't look like you care about other people's worries in the least.
Not really.
That's what I'm saying. Everyone here thinks of no one but himself. So what do you want?
That depends.
That depends on how much there is to be had, you mean.
I can't use the likes of you around here.
Yeah, sure.
What do you know, the world is full of surprises. I cleared out some of my stuff recently and sold a stack of old maps to Brahim, the cartographer down by the harbor.
Unfortunately, I noticed that I'm missing a document.
I assume it must have slipped in among the papers.
Could you perhaps get it back for me?
I'm not an errand boy.
I see - the problems of a common woman are too profane for you. Then I guess I'll have to take care to it myself.
What's in it for me?
A-ha, I knew it - you're really no better than the rabble down at the harbor.
So what is it you're asking of a poor woman?
Never mind.
At least you have a shred of decency left. If you get the document back for me, I'll give you 75 gold pieces.
You could be a little nice to me.
But that's outrageous. I ... get out of here! You boorish lout!
Gold.
Filthy lucre is more than I can offer you. Oh well - it'll be worth 50 gold pieces to me.
If you manage to get the document back, I'll give you 50 gold pieces.
I'll see what I can do.
You're so sweet. I wish you much luck!
If you bring the paper back to me, I'll give you a reward.
Did you mean this document?
Yes, that's exactly it. Thank you.
What's my reward?
Not so fast. Here's your money.
Where ... do you come from?
I found something interesting in your cellar ...
What were you doing in my cellar?!
You know damn well!
(coldly) I don't know what you're talking about ...
(distrustful) Look at you! Where do you come from? Hm?
(embarrassed) I...
(laughs) I know!
(conspiratorially) You don't have to tell me. I know everything.
Just don't even think of stealing anything here, got it?
We can't afford drawing attention to the hotel.
Look what book I have here!
Lehmar's ledger. How did you get hold of that?
Well...
If Lehmar doesn't have it any more, that's a good thing. But I'd rather have it myself ...
Here - take the book.
Thanks.
Take this as a reward.
What is this you've you given me?
It is a key to the gate of wealth.
Everything all right in the hideout?
I haven't seen any of them in quite a while.
I should go down there when I get the chance and check up on things.
Yes. But you'd better not talk about it ...
Did you know about the thieves' hideout?
(smirks) I don't know what you're talking about ...
The militia was here ... Somebody betrayed the hideout!
They couldn't pin anything on me, but Cassia and her people are dead!
I'm sure it was YOU...
I bought this here especially for you.
It cost me a lot of money. But you're worth it, you swine ...
(grumpy) What do you want?
I'm looking for work!
Hm - I could use a new apprentice.
Brian will have finished his apprenticeship soon, and then he'll leave the city.
Are you good for anything?
If you mean, do I know blacksmith's work ...
No. That's not what I meant.
Sooner or later, the orcs are going to lay siege to the city, and then the only men who will count will be those who are in a position to defend our city.
And I won't take on anyone as an apprentice who will disgrace me by fleeing the city with the women and the good-for-nothings, instead of holding the fort here with the men.
I'm not a good-for-nothing!
Those are big words! Can you back them up with big deeds?
What are you getting at?
Bring me an orc's weapon.
Orcs have been seen near the city. With a bit of luck, you won't have to search for long.
If you manage to bring one down, I'll take you on as an apprentice.
Provided the other masters agree.
Let's talk again about that orc thing ...
(brusque) What?
But an orc is a damn tough opponent ...
Hm - looking at you, you might be right. You don't have much meat on your bones. But that can change.
Nevertheless, you have to prove to me that you have the courage to fight.
So couldn't it be something slightly smaller?
Hm - (considering) Hakon, the weapons dealer in the marketplace, told me that he was attacked by bandits a few days ago.
The bastards are said to be roaming around somewhere outside the east gate.
Those cowardly rogues shouldn't be terribly bright.
Hunt the bastards down! Every single one of them. Then I'll know that we can use you here in the city.
Your orc is as good as dead!
Good! Then stop wasting your breath and let your deeds speak for themselves.
I've got the orc weapon you wanted.
Show me ...
You did it AFTER ALL? Good man!
It's been a while since I've had a weapon like this in my hands - I was a soldier back in the Orc War.
Those were tough times, I can tell you.
I knew there was a reason I took you on as an apprentice. Well done!
I didn't think you could do it. I'm impressed.
Too bad you've decided on another path.
I could have really used you.
When can I start as your apprentice?
We can really use a man around here who can beat an orc.
Moreover, Hakon told me how you settled the business with the bandits. Good man!
You didn't kill an orc, but Hakon told me how you settled the business with the bandits. Good man!
As far as I am concerned, you can start here right away.
As for the other masters ...
Thorben has given you his blessing.
Good old Thorben just wants you to get the blessing of the gods. I think that's a good idea.
Thorben says he's never spoken to you.
Bosper tried to talk me out of it. He wants you as an apprentice for himself.
I had a brief, but intense, discussion with him on this matter.
In the end, he agreed.
He asked me to at least give him the opportunity to interest you in his profession.
Take a look at it - you can always decide afterwards. Unless you don't want his vote, that is.
And Bosper doesn't know you yet.
As usual, Constantino doesn't care about anything. He said that as far as he's concerned, you can start wherever you like.
Constantino says you are accused of a crime here in the city - is that true?
If so, then you should get that straightened out immediately!
Constantino has never heard of you.
And Matteo says you brought him back his gold. Seems to me, you're an honorable young man.
And Matteo says you still owe him something. I don't know what there is between you, but you should get that straightened out.
And Matteo says he's never talked about this with you.
And Matteo says he's never seen you in his shop.
That means you have the approval of all the masters!
That means you have the approval of four masters. That's enough to be accepted as an apprentice.
Are you ready to start your apprenticeship with me?
You need the approval of at least four masters in order to be accepted as an apprentice in the lower part of town.
So you should talk to all of them who still aren't convinced about you.
Not before you've proven to me that you're good for something.
Count me in!
Good! I'll teach you how to forge a decent sword.
I already know how to do that!
Well, all the better!
Besides that, it's time you got a bit stronger. You're wasting away before my very eyes!
Good - I'll think about it.
Take your time. Brian will still be here for a while.
Can I sign on as an apprentice with a different master?
You're a good man.
Hakon told me how you handled the bandits.
I'll give you my approval.
Brian will still be here for a while. And a strong lad to take his place will turn up in time.
The other masters may well approve. But I will only give you my approval when you first prove that you're good for something!
You're with the militia now? I'm proud of you!
As long as you're in the army, naturally I won't expect you to fulfill your duties as an apprentice as well.
But if you need anything, you can come to me any time.
You managed to get accepted with the paladins!
I'm glad I took you on as an apprentice. Even if you didn't spend a lot of time behind the anvil.
So you've entered the monastery. I'd have preferred it if you'd stayed in the city. We need every good man.
But if you had to follow the call of Innos, then that's the way it is.
If you need anything from me, I'm here for you.
It's been a while since the last time you were here. Where have you been hanging around, hm?
There you are again ...
Do you sell weapons, too?
Forget it. Everything I make goes to the paladins or the militia.
I have a commission for 100 swords from Lord Hagen. He wants to equip the city guard.
What are my tasks as an apprentice?
Three guesses.
Forge, forge, and forge?
You aren't as dumb as you look. I pay per blade. If you don't work, there's no money. It's that simple.
Furthermore, I'll teach you everything you need to know to make a plain sword.
Making magic blades is only something for experienced smiths - and you're a long way from that ...
If you need a place to sleep, you can bunk down somewhere in my house. Everything clear so far?
I want to sell the weapons I forged.
All you have is the one on your belt. You'd better keep it.
Then make some! I'll only accept plain swords.
Good - give it here.
Fine, and here's your pay.
It's quite simple, boy. Get a piece of raw steel and hold it in the fire until it glows.
Then you pound the blade into shape on the anvil.
Teach me how to forge a decent sword!
Your first swords won't be masterpieces, but you can learn everything else later.
I want to become stronger!
You've already put on a bit of muscle.
Come back if you want to learn more.
Are you still working for the paladins?
I finished the commission from Lord Hagen.
Now I'm making magic ore blades for him - but for pay this time.
But I also have the time again to make a few weapons on the side for the merchants in the marketplace.
So, if you're looking for a good blade, you should try with them.
Tell me more about magic ore blades!
Creating a magic blade is a very complicated and expensive process, but the result is a blade that's easy to handle and practically indestructible.
The blade is certainly of good quality, but it will only show its true power in the hands of a paladin.
A paladin's sword is consecrated by Innos. As a result, the magic blade becomes an enchanted weapon that does incomparable damage!
I want to buy a magic ore blade.
I can only sell magic blades to the paladins. And even then only one each.
You paladins can count yourselves lucky to be allowed to wield such excellent blades.
By decree of Lord Hagen, I may only sell you a single magic weapon.
So, what can I offer you?
You don't have enough gold.
Take good care of your new weapon. It's worth a fortune.
I'll take the two-handed sword!
I'll take the one-handed sword!
Can you repair jewelry?
I'm a weapon smith, not a goldsmith. You probably won't find anyone here in the city who can help you.
People don't have money in their pockets any more, and nobody's gotten rich here in quite a while.
Most of them are just glad if they have enough to eat.
Where can I find a goldsmith?
There's supposed to be a good smith with the mercenaries on Onar's farm.
Maybe you should look there.
500 gold pieces.
400 gold pieces.
300 gold pieces.
200 gold pieces.
100 gold pieces.
HALT!
Friend or foe?
Foe!
Asking for a good spanking, you clown?
Tell me what you want here, or beat it, and fast.
Friend!
Anyone can say that! I don't know you, what do you want here?
One more step towards the camp and I'll feed you to the sharks.
You asked for it ...
I want in there.
Really? That'll cost you, though.
Huh? For what?
Don't make such a fuss.
There's PLENTY of stuff here in camp that might interest you ...
And you look like someone who's got gold on him.
So, a small contribution is not going to kill you.
Or did you steal those posh rags of yours?
You've got some gold, haven't you?
If you were planning to sign on with us, lad, you're out of luck.
Only the Captain decides who gets to sign on here, and he took half the crew and went to sea after booty.
But you can stay until he's back.
Provided you don't cause any trouble here!
Here's your 500 gold coins.
All right. Welcome to our camp!
Can't we come to an agreement somehow?
Well. Give me a good reason, and I might make it cheaper for you.
I'm supposed to bring Morgan this meat.
(curtly) Aha. And who sent you?
Alligator Jack. He says that Morgan is already waiting for it.
I see. Not in the mood himself, is he?
Malcolm sent me. He says the wood may take a while.
(griping) Oh great. I might have known. It's taking forever again.
I've got a delivery here for Skip. Is he here?
Yes. Skip is here. And now?
Let me in.
Mmh ...
You brought me a message from our woodcutters.
You want to play errand boy for Alligator Jack and bring the swamp rat meat to Morgan.
You've got a package for Skip.
And, best of all:
You got that varmint in the tower off our backs.
I never thought you could do it all by yourself.
Tell you what. You get in for free.
... or you just get lost. It's as simple as that.
Good. Here's your gold.
Thanks. Welcome to our camp.
I think that's too much.
Come on, I already made it cheaper for you.
Get lost, then.
What are you doing here?
What does it look like? I must see to it that these miserable wretches get the palisade built in time.
If they don't, Cap'n Greg will kick my ass all over the place.
Also, I keep strangers from traipsing in here just like that.
What are you building the palisade for?
Well, we don't want to make it too easy for the bandits!
Those bastards are getting more brazen all the time. They've been sneaking around our camp for days now. Just like sharks after a shipwreck.
Some of those good-for-nothings are holing up in the tower a little south of here.
But that's only an advance party, I'm sure.
If they're really stupid enough to mount an attack, we'll give them a welcome they won't forget.
Where exactly is that tower located?
Set off from here and keep to the right.
You'll find the tower on a small cliff there.
About those bandits in the tower ...
Yes?
They're history.
Great! One less problem, then.
Did you pull that off all by yourself? Respect!
Maybe you'll even be a real pirate some day!
What else do you want?
If you're planning to take them on ALL BY YOURSELF, forget it!
I'll be sending two people from my raiding troop soon. Let them handle the bandits.
Why would the bandits attack you?
Because there's WAR between them and us! What did you think?
Everything was peachy at first. We brought them here, they marched right into their swamp and left us alone.
But now, those bastards attack anyone who's not one of them.
Heaven knows what's gotten into them.
I reckon they may be after our boats. There's no other way to get out of here, after all.
You should ask Skip about this. He's been with them - and barely got away with his life.
He's got quite an interesting tale to tell.
(mischievously) Too bad you can't hear it, though. You haven't paid your toll, after all.
I want to join your raiding troop.
(laughs) You won't get past me that easily, kid!
First let's talk about whether you can get into the CAMP at all!
Well, welcome to my raiding troop, then!
One more fighter to help keep the bandits off our backs.
Hmm, I should have said, get one of the boys and smoke out those bastards in the tower.
But you already did that.
Well, my men are both dead. So you'll have to go it alone after all.
Get rid of those bandits in the tower for us!
Grab one of the boys and make short shrift of those bandits in the tower.
Aye aye, Sir!
Is there anything else for me to do?
We've been waiting for wood for our palisade for days now.
Malcolm and Owen should have been back some time ago.
Their woodcutters' camp isn't far from here, by the hollow to the south-east.
Malcolm said it would take a WHILE - not half an ETERNITY!
Tell them we're waiting for that wood!
No, wait! Tell OWEN. Malcolm is too unreliable.
What about Malcolm?
He's dead.
Well, looks like he ran out of luck, then.
About that woodcutter, Owen ...
He's dead.
Damnit! I guess I'll have to send a new man, then.
(grumbling) High time Morgan finally got around to getting rid of those beasts around here.
Owen will bring you the wood.
Very good. And high time, too.
Here's your reward.
Where's his camp again?
It's not far from here, to the south-east by the hollow.
Do you need help?
Do you know anything about building palisades?
No, not really.
Then I can't use you here. Go and help out somewhere else.
Get roaring drunk for all I care, but keep out of the way of my workers.
Can you teach me how to be a better fighter?
(laughs) First, pay your toll. After that, I can talk to you about fighting.
(slyly) It's all included in the price.
Sure, why not?
You're learning fast, maybe you'll be a real pirate some day.
If you continue like that, you'll soon be able to board a ship all by yourself.
Always remember - he who parries lives longer!
Teach me!
You're getting really good.
Greg's your boss?
He sure is. And it's CAPTAIN Greg to you. Have I made myself clear?
He's a great man. If you meet him, be careful not to get on the wrong side of him. You won't live long enough to regret it.
I've already met him.
Even better. So you know what I'm talking about.
He's not in camp right now, though.
Francis is in command for now.
He sits in front of Greg's hut all day and goggles at us working.
The Captain gave you your own raiding troop, did he?
Then see to it that your boys get plenty to do!
(amazed) What are you doing here?
What am I doing here?! What the hell are YOU doing here?
I came to the remotest spot on the island because I finally wanted some peace!
Civil war, bandit raids, hordes of orcs outside my door ...
That just wasn't my thing. I've retired from that madness.
There may be orcs here, but not very many.
And other PEOPLE - thank Innos - never show up here. (grumpily) Until today.
I am searching for stone tablets. You wouldn't happen to have found any?
(carefully) Yes ... But I'm keeping them!
They're the only thing there is to read around here.
I may not understand all of it yet, but I've been able to decipher some of the texts.
About the stone tablets ...
Shall I teach you to read them?
(hastily) But you won't get mine! You'll have to find your own!
Well, it's quite simple. A G is an O, a T is an H and an I is a C.
If you understand that, the rest is quite logical ...
I don't think there is any more I can teach you about that.
I have some clothes for you ...
Really? Show me, let's see if they fit!
They do!
Well, what do I do now? I gave all my gold to the pirates for the crossing.
All I can give you is a couple of old stone tablets.
Here, take them, by all means. I'll look for some new ones.
Oh, great. First you get me all stirred up and then ... (sighs)
And? How's life as a drop-out?
(proudly) I built everything myself. My weapons, my tools, my hut, everything.
Came here with nothing but a good mood ...
Sometimes, though ...
Yes?
Sometimes, I wish I had at least taken a few clothes with me.
I don't know how to weave or tan hides ...
And the nights aren't exactly warm in this part of the island.
I manage.
With clothes, I could get through the winter! After that ... we'll see ...
Better than Khorinis, anyway!
Even without clothes.
Don't bother me, I'm on duty.
Hey you, stop right there!
What do you want?
If you don't want me to smash in your face, you had better transfer a few gold coins from your pockets to mine - and pronto!
Say, have you seen a novice?
(puzzled) er - what? Hmm... (thinking) That might well be.
Give me 20 gold pieces, and I'll tell you!
How much do you want?
(grins) 20 gold pieces and we could be friends.
You're joking.
Do I look the part?
If I don't see 20 gold pieces before you come even one step closer ...
Then I'll flatten you. So fork over the dough already.
Get out of my way!
My, you have a big mouth for such a scrawny little fellow.
It's time I shut it for you.
All right, here's your money.
(sneering) I should say 20 gold pieces wasn't too much to pay for your life. You can pass.
OK, now, this novice came by here almost an hour ago.
He was in a bit of a hurry, looking behind him all the time, he was. Now scram.
Sorry, I don't have any money.
Yeah, these are terrible times all right.
But I'll tell you what - just hand me your weapon. Then I'll let you pass.
I'll tell you what: come back when you have money. No money, no bridge.
Just get out of my way.
So you want it the hard way?
Forget it.
OK, the hard way it is.
Here, take my weapon.
Stay away from that weapon. Just you wait!
You really want to take your chances? It's your call.
Here's your money.
Ah, now you're talking.
I won't give you a penny.
I'll get it for myself then.
Hey, who invited you? Get out of the house right now. There's no alms to be had here.
Yes, what is it?
Can you give me something to eat?
Here, take this. You're a good lad.
You can come back for more tomorrow.
You've had your portion for today! Come back later.
We don't feed idlers here. Go away!
Only those who work here get something to eat!
I'm sure you have enough money to buy yourself something in town.
I've got a few turnips here for you ...
Great! (laughs) That should be enough to fatten those guys up!
Since you're here anyway - I saw a traveling trader pass by here a few minutes ago.
I think he stopped on his way to town. Go to him and see whether he's got a decent frying pan for me.
What?! Is that supposed to be all?
It's not enough.
Go out to the field and get more, the men are hungry!
Give me the gold, and I'll go see the merchant for you ...
Are you saying I can trust you? Just don't spend the money on booze, do you hear?!
Here's your frying pan.
Fine. Let's see, then, whether it's any good ...
You still dare come back here? What have you done with my money, you good-for-nothing?!
You've had enough time now. Where's the money I gave you for the pan?
Sorry, it took me a while. Here's your frying pan!
Arrh, give the thing here, then. The very nerve - unbelievable!
Ah! You've still got it! Give it back to me. Now.
The very nerve - unbelievable!
You don't have it any more! I gave you 20 gold pieces!
Get out of my sight, you filthy thief!
Aren't you feeling well?
No, not at all. I've got this awful fever again.
I should really go and see the town healer, but I'm too weak for that.
Get well soon. I've got to go.
Let's hope that times will be better soon.
Can I help?
It would be wonderful if you could go to Vatras and get me my medicine.
He'll know what is to be done! I can't do it any more.
I've got your medicine.
Really. Our society needs more people like you. Thank you so much.
I hope that these few coins are enough.
How are you?
A little better already, thanks to you.
Not that great.
Hello, I'm new here.
Don't take this the wrong way, but I'm really not in the mood for conversation - I'm totally wrecked.
You're awfully busy, huh?
You can say that again. Bennet makes so many weapons that I can hardly keep up with the polishing.
What can you tell me about the farm?
This is Onar's farm.
That big building is his house. He vacated a wing for the mercenaries.
We farmers have had to bunk in the barn ever since.
(hastily) But it's all right with me, it's good that we have people who guard the farm.
The building here is the kitchen.
The kitchen is in the building with the smithy in front.
Maybe you'll be lucky and Thekla will have something for you to eat.
What about the mercenaries?
Onar hired them to keep the city militia off our backs.
But they also guard the farm, the sheep and us farmers.
So don't even think about stealing anything or rummaging around in somebody's chest.
They're just waiting for a chance to knock you down.
Can I buy weapons from you?
I don't have much. We take almost all the swords and axes into Onar's house.
Why aren't you working?
Haven't you heard yet? The paladins have arrested Bennet.
What happened?
Well, we were in the city to shop, when all of a sudden we heard a scream. Someone yelled: There they are, get them!
Boy, was I scared! I took to my heels and ran like the demons were after me.
Bennet was right behind me. I don't know what happened, but when I got outside the city, he had disappeared.
I must have lost him in the city.
So why was Bennet arrested?
Murder! Bennet is supposed to have murdered a paladin. What nonsense. I was with him the whole time.
So why don't you go to town and explain the whole thing?
They'd stick me in the slammer as his accomplice. Naah, certainly not in the current situation.
Situation?
You know, Onar and the city, that's bound to come to a bad end.
How did the mercenaries here on the farm react?
Naturally, I don't know exactly what they're planning, but some of them are really pissed off.
I can understand that.
If it were up to them, they'd rather attack the city today than tomorrow to get Bennet out.
Talk to Lee, maybe there's something you can do.
Do you have anything to drink?
I assume that it's not water you want.
No, damnit!! I need something alcoholic so I can finally get rid of these damned headaches.
When I haven't had anything to drink for a while, my skull feels like it's going to explode at any moment.
There's nothing I can give you.
Then scram!
One more thing ...
(bellows) Didn't you understand me? PISS OFF!!!
It's important.
(bellows) You asked for it.
(burps) Ha, that hit the spot.
So, now I can think clearly again. What can I do for you?
Here, take this.
I brought you something to drink.
(greedy) Gimme!!
I need some information.
(annoyed) I thought you understood me. I only talk to friends.
And friends offer you something to drink. Got it? Now scram!
I'm looking for someone who can teach me something.
I could teach you a few things. I'm the best fighter for miles around.
Since we're friends, I'll give you a special price. 300 gold pieces.
That's too expensive for me.
Too expensive? That's less than anyone else in my place would charge.
Think about it.
All right, here's the money.
Here's your money. I want to be trained.
You won't be sorry!
Here's something to drink for you.
I'm feeling a lot better. I'm ready for anything.
Let's start with the training.
First bring me something to drink!
Then we'll see what we can get out of your rusty paladin bones, hey?
What do you know. Even magicians use close combat weapons.
You don't need a teacher for this discipline any more.
What are you doing here anyway?
I don't have any idea what we're doing here or when it'll start.
And I don't care as long as I have enough to drink.
Do you know where the dragons are then?
What's in it for me, if I tell you?
Nothing, I'm looking for them myself.
You'd better watch out. You've got a hell of a fight in front of you.
I'd be willing to pay you for that information.
Pay me? Hmm. I'll give you the information for 200 gold pieces.
Too much!
Then forget it.
Deal. Here's the money!
I've still got a bottle of gin!
I'd fight every dragon in the world for a fine vintage.
Agreed. Give me the bottle!
I'll keep that for a rainy day.
All right, now, where are those dragons?
Naturally, I can't tell you anything precise, but I've heard that there are supposed to be four dragons.
We've seen a red glow over the highest mountain at night.
I swear by my mother, if you're looking for a dragon, then you'll definitely find one there.
I've killed all the dragons.
Take a hike and tell your fairy tales to someone else.
What do you want now? Piss off!
What are you waiting for? Go to the bar!
It looks like you're a master of your craft.
I've heard that before... Did you bring the steel?
Steel? No, I think you're confusing me with...
Hm... somehow you seem familiar. Do we know each other from somewhere?
Sure, from the Old Camp.
The Old Camp... right... you're that curious guy... I thought you were dead.
Yes, everybody thinks that. Who else survived?
A few. Some fled with Raven like I did. For a lot of others, the Old Camp became a grave.
I wouldn't know where from.
Hm... my brain is like a sieve... whatever...
Tell me about your escape.
Chaos broke out the day the Barrier fell.
Some hid - others fled, and there was plundering everywhere.
What did you do?
I was about to to leave the camp when it turned bright very suddenly and a scorching pain ate through my skin.
I'd been struck by damn lightning! It feels like I can still hear it...
Later someone told me that Thorus found me and took me with him.
I need better armor.
So - you can have this. It's Esteban's fault it's so expensive.
That damned dog pockets his share of every piece of armor I sell.
Fisk said you'd give me a good price?
Fisk, you say? Hm, well, I still owe him a favor.
Okay, I'll take the armor.
Sure thing.
No gold, no armor.
(dangerously) What do you want from me?
I'm looking for the person behind the attack...
And why are you coming to me about that?
I thought you might know something about the business.
I don't know ANYTHING!
(sighs) Now, listen! You move your ass out of here, before I forget myself!
I've heard a few things about you...
So?
Again? (threatening) It had better be something important this time...
I heard that you weren't in your place when the attack occurred!
(dangerously) What else?
Paul said you hate Esteban.
(dangerously) So? Did he? What else?
Emilio spat out your name! You definitely know something about the attack!
(calmly) You've been having a chat with old Emilio, eh?
And he isn't the only one who suspects you!
What's that supposed to mean, hm?
(threatening) Maybe I should also have a word with him. I'm sure that AFTERWARDS he'll say the exact opposite!
Nothing else...
If you were behind the attack, you'll pay for it!
(annoyed) You are such an idiot! Do you really think you can toady up to Esteban?
Get out of here!
I want to join forces with the assassin!
Against Esteban? Really? Then prove it!
I've been waiting for too long for a delivery of steel from the pirates.
I suspect that Esteban captured it in order to sell it to me later at a higher price.
Of course, he won't do that himself. A couple of bandits in the swamp are on his payroll.
How do you know that?
Drunken bandits talk too much...
Does this talkative bandit have a name?
His name is none of your business. But the guy you're LOOKING for is called Juan. Anyway, I haven't seen him in the camp for a long time.
You'll have to look for him in the swamp.
Okay, I'll do it for you!
Good. We'll see if you can be trusted.
First tell me who is behind the attack!
No. I don't trust you.
Look. The next conversation I have is either going to be with the person behind the attack or with Esteban.
Who I talk to is your choice.
(sighs) All right. I'll get you together with the perpetrator. But it happens the way I say, got it?
Go to the bar and talk to the barkeeper. You'll learn everything else from him.
I have the steel.
And? Was Juan there, too?
He was.
I knew it. That rat Esteban was behind it.
You're all right. To be honest, I hadn't expected this from you.
Here, take this as a reward.
Now, what about our agreement?
The man you want to talk to is waiting for you in the bar. Talk to the barkeeper.
I demand the Test of Fire.
The Test of Fire is from the olden days and has not been held for a long time.
What you are demanding is far too dangerous. So just don't think about it any more.
I am Master Hyglas, Guardian of the Fire and Keeper of Knowledge.
So Master Parlan has given you permission to study the scriptures.
Then it's up to you now to do exactly that. Study, so that you may find enlightenment in the scriptures.
What are you studying, Master?
My research focuses on fire - the power of Innos.
It is his gift and, at the same time, a mighty weapon - and I create runes which contain this power.
Very enlightening. Can you teach me that?
It is Innos who grants the magic. Only to his servants, the Magicians of Fire, is it given to learn how to wield this power.
I have demanded the Test of Fire. Ulthar gave me the task to create a fire arrow rune.
And now you want me to teach you the formula?
I don't know how else I could do it.
Hmm ...
All right, I shall teach you the formula. But first you need to find all the necessary ingredients.
What ingredients do I need for a fire arrow rune?
Read up on it - it's right there in the books.
Teach me to create the FIRE ARROW rune.
In order to create a fire arrow rune, you need to join the sulphur with the runestone at the rune table.
The power of the fire arrow spell scroll will flow into the rune, and you will possess a tool of Innos.
So, once you have all the raw materials, walk over to the rune table and create your rune.
Where can I find a runestone?
Hey, it's you who demanded the test of the Fire - not I. Finding that out is part of the test.
I've created the rune.
Well, well. You seem to have passed this test. That wasn't so hard, after all.
Then go to Ulthar now and show him your work.
Teach me.
Any news?
Hm, yes. Well, you have probably noticed those black-robed figures.
I've met them.
This brings us to the core of the matter. At the moment, we are observing a very rare constellation of stars.
To be more exact, the sign of the Ox currently stands in direct correlation with the sign of the Warrior. I suppose that you know what that means.
Hmm. Well, to be honest ...
Yes, right, I see. Well, I cannot explain the entire background to you now, but it definitely signifies great changes. And I do not like changes.
Therefore, I want you to get me a book from town. It is called 'The divine power of the stars'. You may have to rummage around for it a bit, but I'm sure that you can find it.
Get the book yourself.
You dare speak to me in such a tone? Your behavior does not show the respect that is due to me.
Get out of my sight and think about your behavior.
What's in it for me?
What do you mean?
I'd like to know what you'll give me if I bring you the book.
Nothing. What were you expecting to get? If you have time to run an errand in town for me, it is even your duty to help me.
I'll see whether I can find it.
That's good - it frees up my time so I can follow some other trails as well.
But don't take too much time. Time, I'm afraid, is what we have the least of.
I've got the book for you.
Very good, give here.
So you changed your mind after all. Very good. So where do you have the book?
You may withdraw now. I shall retire and study.
Found anything out yet?
Well, I cannot be completely sure, but the current constellation of the stars seems to indicate many dangers.
What kind of dangers?
Well, the structure between the worlds seems to be very weak. It only takes a small portion of the power that would be necessary otherwise to tear a hole into this structure.
Demons could use those portals to enter our world without encountering resistance.
No, I am still waiting for that book.
I told you that I am still doing some research, but of course that will take longer if I do not have the necessary materials.
What can I do for you, Brother?
What can I do for you?
I'm busy distributing sausages.
So you work for Gorax, huh? All right, pass the sausage, then.
Why aren't you working?
I am permitted to study the teachings of Innos. I seek wisdom in his words.
One day he will choose me - and then I shall take the test of magic and enter the Circle of Fire.
Who are the Chosen?
The novices whom Innos has ordained to take the test of magic.
He who passes it is accepted into the ranks of the Magicians of Fire.
What is the Test of Magic?
A test which is announced by the high council to all chosen novices.
It is an assignment in which faith and cleverness are put to the test.
All the chosen novices take part - but it is only possible for one of them to complete it successfully.
How can I be chosen?
You have no influence on that. Innos alone chooses his novices, and the High Council announces his will.
How can I study the scriptures?
You must gain access to the library.
However, Master Parlan will only give you the key if you have first finished your duties.
(proudly) It has happened. Innos has chosen me and I shall take part in the test of magic.
I'm in it, too - I demanded the Test of Fire.
You did WHAT? So either you are a favorite of Innos, or completely crazy.
I've already done a lot of crazy things, so I'm positive I can pull this off, too ...
Innos holds his hand over me - therefore I shall pass this test.
And, found out anything yet?
Since you stand no chance anyway, I may as well tell you:
Don't bother looking near the farms - there is nothing there that will get you anywhere.
Maybe we could work together ...
Forget it. I'll accomplish this mission alone. You would just be a hindrance to me.
Have you seen Agon or Ulf?
We split up at the inn. I went to the farms and those two set out together - but where to, I don't know.
Do you know anything about a 'living rock'?
(cackling) No! Did Serpentes give you this test?
Yes, why?
I think I can imagine what he means ...
You wouldn't be the first person to fail this test ...
Where exactly can I find this living rock?
Just keep following this path. After quite a while, you'll come to a river.
Just continue to follow the path up the mountain. It's got to be up there someplace.
When you come to a bridge, you've gone too far.
(laughs) IF you get that far in the first place ...
That's all I'm going to tell you ... (sarcastic) It's supposed to be your TEST after all!
Have you found out anything new?
Not yet, but I'm still searching.
Hey, wait. We need to talk ...
Actually, I don't think so ...
I've waited years for this test. Innos is with me and I MUST pass this test.
That sounds familiar.
You're not the only one who says that.
Enough chatter. I need what you found. So, time for you to die!
We need to talk about Babo.
(reserved) Yes, what's wrong?
You've got something which belongs to Babo.
What might that be?
A few papers. Babo would like them back.
(mocking) He would, wouldn't he. I can imagine. Unfortunately, I prefer to keep them, which brings us to a bit of a dilemma.
Where have you got the papers?
(smugly) Well, of course I don't have them on me. I'm afraid I can't help you further.
Where are they?
I have them safely locked up. And you will never get the key from me.
What was Babo supposed to do for you?
If I had known the baby would do it in his pants over a few swampweeds, then I would have seen to it that someone else took care of the monastery garden.
He's supposed to grow swampweed?
Of course. Since none of that stuff comes out from behind the barrier anymore, the price in the city has tripled.
It could have been a good bargain for everyone involved. But Babo didn't want to play along.
How much do you want for the papers?
(laughs) Ha, actually they're almost priceless. You very rarely see something like that here.
But I have no desire to wager my future against a few gold pieces.
300 gold pieces and you can do what you like with the papers.
I want to buy those papers.
Look, I can't leave here right now. I'll give you the key to my chest, there's nothing else in there anyway.
Have you got anything interesting for me?
Ehm ... no.
Ah - you've come just in time. I'm in need of an assistant for a magic experiment.
I'm sure you're eager to do me a favor for science's sake.
Easy, my friend. First tell me what this is all about.
I have developed a new spell. A Spell of Oblivion.
I've already successfully carried out a few practical applications, but I don't have the time to conduct one final test.
What's in it for me if I help you?
I could teach you how to brew potions.
I know the recipes for healing and mana essences and for speed potions.
Tell me more about the experiment and the spell.
The spell serves to make somebody disremember various events.
So far, I have only found it to work when the person in question is angry - for instance, if he has just been knocked down, or robbed.
Even if he has only witnessed such a deed, he will scratch it from his memory.
So I'm supposed to knock somebody down and then put a spell on him?
That would only make sense if that person were REALLY mad after beating him up.
(to himself) But fistfights are nothing out of the ordinary in the harbor district. I guess I'd have to find a victim elsewhere...
Yes, I think you get the point. But to make somebody angry, it is enough to attack him - you don't have to knock him down.
So you should pick somebody who's by himself - if there are other people around, you'll just get into trouble with Lord Andre.
Also, it makes no sense to cast the spell on someone who's busy attacking you. Wait for the right moment.
All right, I'll try out that spell.
Then take this spell scroll and find yourself a suitable guinea pig.
Once you're done, come back and tell me how it went.
About the experiment ...
Have you been successful, then? Or have you just wasted the spell scroll? Huh?
If you need more spell scrolls, you can buy them from me.
I used the spell scroll.
Fine, fine. And were you successful?
Yes, it worked.
Excellent. One small success for science, but a big one for me!
Now I can use my time to instruct you in the arts of alchemy.
I could also give you some useful things if you want.
Show me your wares.
Instruct me in the art of alchemy.
To prepare a potion at the alchemist's bench, you need a laboratory flask.
And you're going to need different plants or other ingredients for each potion.
What do you want to know?
You have learned all that I can teach you.
According to the reports I have received, the Valley of Mines is a dangerous place.
Make sure to equip yourself well before you leave.
The situation in the Valley of Mines is quite worrying. But we shall develop plans to get rid of the dangers and get our boys out of there along with the ore.
I thought you had come to talk to Lord Hagen. So you should go ahead and do that.
How is the situation on the mainland.
The war isn't won yet, although the royal troops are already driving back the orcs.
But small bands of orcs are gathering in many places, trying to scatter our army.
They fight without honor and without faith - and therefore we shall prevail in the end.
Can you teach me?
I can teach you how to fortify your arms in order to wield your weapons more effectively.
I only instruct the followers of our Order.
