I want to become stronger.
You are as strong as a troll. There is nothing more I can teach you.
The orcs are planning a major offensive.
Indeed. Well, that's very interesting. And how can you claim to know this?
I have talked to them.
Some of their leaders are haunting this area.
Mmh. That doesn't sound like a typical Orc strategy.
You had better come up with a way to get rid of them.
It would suffice if we had more information. I shall send somebody to scout out the surroundings.
What does that mean?
If what you say is right, that means that they hope to weaken us from the inside by attacking with their best warriors.
Usually, there is one warlord leading each horde of orc fighters. You rarely see two or more of them together.
They do this for a reason. Their leaders form the core of their attack strategy and are usually surrounded by the orc warriors.
Thus, it is really hard to get close to any of them without having to fight your way through a horde of at least 30 warriors.
What should we do now?
When they are seen in numbers like this, they usually form a raiding patrol led by the highest among them.
This highest warlord establishes the headquarters and withdraws to some cave from where he sends his troops into battle.
If we could get hold of this leader, it would give us a decisive advantage.
An orc leader usually likes to hang out in the vicinity of his enemies. It would be advisable to look for his cave somewhere not too far from the city.
Some orcs have been spotted near Lobart's farm. Maybe that's where you should begin your search.
I have been able to find the headquarters of the orcs. Their chief warlord has fallen.
This is great news. That will keep the orcs busy for a while.
Not bad, that. If we had more knights of your kind, the upcoming battle would be a piece of cake.
Here. Take our gold and use it towards your equipment.
May Innos watch over you always.
Innos be with you. What can I do for you, wanderer?
Bless me!
I bless you in the name of Innos. May the Lord's fire burn in your heart and give you the strength to act according to his justice.
Sergio sent me. I have taken over his task. So, what is it?
A dark wolf has been roaming the area recently. Track it down and kill it.
I have killed the wolf.
Good work, novice. You are a brave man. But now return to the monastery and go about your duties.
What are you doing here?
I am a Magician of Fire. A priest of our god Innos.
This shrine is consecrated to HIM, the highest god, the creator of the fire and lord of justice.
People come to me in order to pray to Innos and be blessed.
And for a small donation, you can get many useful things from me.
Show me your wares.
Where will this path take me?
The path leads to the monastery of the Magicians of Fire. However, access is permitted only to the servants of Innos.
And if you want to be accepted as a novice in the monastery, you must bring a sheep and ...
Since you have already chosen to join another group, entrance will be denied you.
I carry a message from Vatras.
What is this message?
It's a letter. Here.
Good, you can tell Vatras that I have received the message.
Take these potions as a reward for your service, they will surely be of use to you.
The seal is broken. What were you thinking, you fool!
Go and tell Vatras that I have received his message.
Ahoy, you landlubber, looks like you're stranded here.
You look a bit pale around the gills.
Never mind, my lad. All you need is a good stiff sea breeze.
What are you doing here?
Back when I was a young man, I went to sea and rode through many a big storm.
Many years ago, I settled here and took care of the Khorinis lighthouse for a long time.
No big deal. Not at all. But that old tower came closest to what I would call a home.
I haven't been up there in ages.
Why not?
Ever since those scallywags took over my lighthouse, I haven't dared get closer to it than twenty feet. Really bad rabble, that.
They're criminals from the Valley of Mines, you know.
There was this big bang on the other side of the mountains, and then they swarmed all over the land like flies. Now they're hiding out everywhere - even in my lighthouse.
I think they're on the lookout for a ship they can raid.
Ha! Let them. Then at least they'd be out of my tower.
Do you come to town often?
I always say, a town is only as good as its harbor.
A harbor is a gate to the world. That's where everyone meets, and where everything starts.
Once the harbor goes to the dogs, the rest of the city will follow soon.
Tell me about the harbor.
The harbor of Khorinis isn't what it used to be.
There's nothing but riffraff hanging about, the ship's don't come in any more, and trade is dead. This harbor's about to go under.
Why are the ships no longer coming?
They all say that, once the war is over, everything will be like it used to. That's a load of bilge water.
I tell you, a sailor can see when a town's going downhill.
A sailor feels that in his blood. And I tell you, forget about this harbor, its heyday's over.
What do you mean by riffraff?
Look at them, the lazy rabble. Most of them don't even know what work is. All they do is drink all day and spend their last pay at the brothel.
I tell you, stay away from them.
So why don't you leave?
Nobody would take an old sea dog like me on his ship these days.
Most people think that Old Jack's got the gout in his rotten old bones.
And? Are they right?
Balderdash. Once I've got those planks below my feet again, I'll feel like a young whippersnapper.
The bandits that were haunting your lighthouse are gone.
Is that really true? Finally I can get back to my work.
Come with me to the lighthouse. You get an incredible view of the sea up there.
Nice lighthouse you've got here.
Thank you. Just walk on all the way upstairs and take in the beautiful view, my lad. Make yourself at home.
Wouldn't you like going back to sea?
I'd give my right arm if only they'd hire me on a big schooner just one more time.
But for an old sea dog like me, that's not so easy, my lad. Anyway, who would take care of the lighthouse then?
I need your experience as a sailor.
Shiver me timbers. What are you planning to do, matey? You're not fixing to board the King's war galley, are you?
Who knows?
(laughs) That would be something. Oh well. But I can't give up my lighthouse just like that. Mmh. What shall we do about that?
What if I brought you someone to take care of your lighthouse in the meantime?
Not a bad idea, matey. And I know just the person.
Harad the blacksmith has an apprentice called Brian. I've talked to him many times before.
I'd like to entrust my lighthouse to him. I think he'd be just the person for that.
Go talk to him. Maybe we're lucky and the lad will help us out.
Never mind. It was just an idea.
Brian is dead.
Oh. These are terrible times. And such a nice fellow he was.
Brian will take care of your lighthouse from now on.
I had hoped you would say that.
Do you still need me?
Let's see whether the boy is any good.
Be my captain.
I've sailed the seven seas, my lad, but never before have I been captain of a ship.
I know nothing about navigation. You're going to have to do that.
I shall give it my best.
So, show me your ship and your crew. Do you know, then, where you're headed? I mean, d'you have a nautical chart?
Wait for me at the harbor. Don't worry about the rest.
If you say so.
Right, old man. Let us set sail.
Everything's ship-shape. Show me your nautical chart then.
Some trip this is turning out to be. I hope we'll get there in one piece.
D'you really have everything you need? We're not going to sail back just because you're still missing something.
If you're sure that you've got everything, go to the captain's quarters and hit the sack. You're going to need it.
Easy does it, my lad. I haven't even seen the tub yet. It doesn't work this way.
First, you need a complete crew with at least 5 men, free access to the ship, and a nautical chart. Otherwise, forget it.
So what happens next?
I've thought matters over. I'm going to stay here and guard my lighthouse after all.
I hope you know what you're doing, matey.
It won't be long now.
Keep your head on your shoulders and come back in one piece.
What are you doing down here?
If this hell breaks loose over us one more time, I'll get the ship out of here. With or without you, d'you hear?
None of this nonsense. I'll handle this.
Make haste, then.
I did it. I eliminated the enemy.
I had hoped that everything would turn out well. But I must admit that, during those last few hours, I haven't been so sure.
Can we finally set sail again now?
Just a moment, now. There's something else I need to do.
Make haste, will you. I don't want to catch scurvy here.
It was a really, really stupid idea to come here.
I thought there was something to be had here. But there's nothing here but a few arrogant paladins and orcs.
You forgot about the dragons!
(mockingly) How could I forget. I'll tell you what. I'm a blacksmith, not a warrior.
I make weapons. The fighting I leave to others.
Then why aren't you standing behind an anvil?
The paladins here won't let me into the smithy. I can't make anything unless I want to wind up in the dungeon.
You're one of them, too. So how about putting in a good word for me?
I'll try to help you.
How will you manage that? Parcival has ordered a watch kept on us.
No one would dare to disregard it.
I'll do whatever I can.
I can't imagine that he would listen to you.
What's in it for me if I help you?
I don't have anything. At the most, I could teach you something.
I know a method of making blades forged from magic ore even harder.
I've got to be on my way.
Terrific. I can't leave the castle now, and I can't forge anything either.
Where do you come from?
I've joined up with some men from the mountains. We were headed for the valley to make a real profit hunting dragons.
Their leader went by the name of Sylvio. Boy, what an ass. He treated me like I was his property.
What all happened in the castle?
Nothing that I've heard. Of course, I'm worried about what's happened OUTSIDE the castle.
I talked to Parcival.
So?
He doesn't trust us dragon hunters.
He doesn't trust you dragon hunters.
Damn. I just want to work.
Then I might as well give up. Only Garond could help me now.
Go get your hammer, there's work for you.
You did it? How did you manage that?
I had to vouch for you, so don't disappoint me.
Don't worry. I'm glad that I can work at all.
Are you selling any weapons?
No way. And then your colleagues here will stick me in jail for black-marketing, huh? Nah, forget about it.
I would if I could. But first I have to provide the paladins here in the castle with weapons.
But I can show you how to forge your own weapon.
Teach me how to be a smith.
What exactly do you plan to make?
Can I buy some armor from you?
Nothing that would be better than your armor. We should forget it.
A mage who wants armor? Forget it - go see a tailor. I can't make armor for you.
If I had any, I'd sell it to you. Unfortunately, I don't have any.
I guess there's nothing to be done.
Once you've got something after all, just let me know.
Can you make one for me, then?
Well, if you want something better, you'll have to get me the materials.
What is it you need?
You want to fight the dragons, don't you? Bring me some dragon scales - with those, I should be able to cobble something together for you.
20 scales should be enough.
I've got the dragon scales for you.
Good, something can be done with that.
Come back tomorrow, the part should be finished then.
I need 20 dragon scales, otherwise I can't make you any armor.
Is the armor ready?
No, not yet. Come back tomorrow.
Yes, a real masterpiece. You can buy it if you want.
I'll give you a special price. 12,000 gold pieces.
What? After all I've done for you?
Don't be like that. I've got to make a living here. Take it or leave it.
I want to buy the armor.
You can see that it's worth every gold piece.
You don't have enough gold.
I've killed a dragon.
I've killed a few dragons.
I've killed all the dragons.
So what? You are a dragon hunter, aren't you?
Aren't you one, too?
That's nice. But to be honest, I'm not particularly interested.
I already told you, I'd rather make weapons than set out myself to kill dragons.
There is one thing, however, that could interest me.
If you could get me some dragon blood, I would pay a high price for it.
I've got some dragon blood for you.
That's great. Sell me everything you have.
Everything all right?
Absolutely nothing is clear!
Why did you idiots open the gate? You paladins are a few beans short of a fart!
So they just go ahead and open the gate. Dimwits! I just can't get over it.
Hey! Don't I know you from somewhere?
It's possible. I was in the colony, too.
Right ... what do you want?
How's the situation?
Right now we've got real trouble. Two factions are building up among us mercenaries.
Sylvio and his people doubt that Lee is following the right plan.
How come there are two factions?
Most of us came out of the colony with Lee back then.
But some of the mercenaries hooked up with us later.
They didn't come from the colony, but were farther south fighting the orcs.
Somehow they got wind that Lee needed people. Their leader was Sylvio.
He agreed that Lee was in charge, but now he's trying to stir up the mercenaries against him and his plan.
A lot of Lee's people don't think that it's a big problem. But I know guys like Sylvio.
He'll go to extremes to realize his ideas.
Do you know what Lee's intentions are?
Lee wants us to wait and starve the paladins in the city.
He is planning to get us all away from the island. And Innos knows, I've got nothing against getting away from here.
I don't really know how he's planning to go about it, but I trust him. He's led us well so far.
Do you know what Sylvio is planning?
Sylvio found out that some of the paladins have moved out to the old colony.
He says the rest of the paladins wouldn't dare to attack us here and wants to take advantage of the situation.
Plunder the small farms, waylay the militia patrols outside the city, hold up travelers, things like that.
But Lee thinks that would be the worst thing we could do in our situation.
I want to become a mercenary!
I'm not sure that's a good idea ...
Where's the problem?
Well, I either have to vote for you or against you.
And in the situation we're in, I'll only vote for you if I can be sure that you're on Lee's side!
So what should I do?
Simple. Beat up a few of Sylvio's boys! That way both sides will know exactly where you stand.
And if you stick to the rules for a duel, you'll even win the respect of the others.
What are the rules for a duel?
Go to Torlof and let him explain it, if you're interested.
Just so we understand each other: I don't care if you stick to the rules or not. Just as long as the boys wind up out cold in the mud!
Which of the mercenaries are Sylvio's men?
There are six men. First of all, Sylvio himself and his right hand man, Bullco.
Then there's Rod, Sentenza, Fester and Raoul.
The rest of the people are either neutral or on Lee's side.
How may of Sylvio's people should I defeat?
If you knock three of them to the ground, then you've proven which side you're on.
Whom you choose is your business.
Just one little hint: This isn't about proving your courage. Don't go up against Sylvio himself - he'll make mincemeat out of you.
How many of Sylvio's men are still on my list?
I have bested Bullco.
I heard. Not bad.
Rod looks a little worse for the wear.
Sentenza was trying to squeeze some gold out of me - not a smart idea.
I knocked out Sentenza.
Fester tried to take me for a ride - that was his mistake.
Fester got what was coming to him.
And as to Raoul ...
I went to see Raoul ...
And?
He was badly in need of a proper licking.
You haven't knocked down any of Sylvio's men so far.
Good - keep it up.
I expect you to rough up at least three of them.
That's enough, that's enough.
You really whupped every single one of them, eh?
I'm impressed - if Lee asks me, I can vote for you without hesitation.
Any news?
Now you are one of us. That's good.
You made the wrong choice, you could have been one of us.
Lately, Sylvio's people have been really subdued. (dirty laugh)
Sylvio is finally gone. After he heard about the dragons, he and some of his boys headed for the mining colony.
He probably thought there is more to be had there.
Nothing, all's quiet so far. I can't wait to see how this all turns out.
What are you standing around here for?
I come from the castle. They've sent me to look for those missing, and to check out the area.
Those missing?
Some fled when the dragons attacked. Most of them didn't make it - no surprise there!
But if there are any survivors left, I'll bring them back.
Can you help me get into the castle?
Sure, but you have to do me a favor.
If you can make it to the castle, talk to the paladin Oric. Tell him that his brother bought it up there at the pass.
What do I need to know about this area?
If you want to live, go back to wherever you came from.
The greenhides have laid siege to the castle for weeks now - and those dragons are hiding out somewhere, too.
The entire Valley of Mines is teeming with orcs - no matter where you're headed, this won't be a picnic.
How can I get into the castle?
First of all, you can forget the direct path. But if you walk around the castle, you might have a chance from the back.
You should stay away from the paths and use the river. It will be best if you swim downstream for a stretch. It should be easier from there.
The orcs have set up a ram behind the castle. You can get in that way - creep up on the orcs as closely as you can, and then run for it.
You might just make it if you're fast enough.
What are you doing here?
I'm a scout. I roam the country. But all those snappers haven't made it easy for me.
It's a good time to land a few trophies - provided you know what you're doing.
Can you teach me how to do that?
I can show you how to pull the claws off those things once they're dead.
Show me how to pull claws.
The important thing is to remove the claws with a jerk. Don't be too hesitant, and don't go poking with a blade.
You don't only pull the claws from snappers that way, but also from lizards and shadowbeasts.
Do you know where Diego got to?
Diego? He was one of Silvestro's scrapers. But he's made himself scarce.
I saw him with two knights and a box, not so far from here.
You can see the old watchtower from here, right? Go over there, and then towards the castle.
A path leads through the rocks to the right. That's where they went.
So you killed the leader of the pack. And - did you get the claws off that beast?
Yes.
They're certainly worth a lot. There are some fellows who collect this stuff.
If you find the right buyer, you'll get a heap of gold for that.
No.
You should do that. I'm sure they're worth a fortune.
Hey, what are you doing down here? There's nothing here for you.
So, out with it, what are you doing here?
I have come to kill you.
What a marvelous idea. Thought that up all by yourself, did you? Ah, so what. I'll make it short.
I wanted to have a little look around.
There's nothing here to look at. You're walking on dangerous ground, understand?
So leave your weapon where it is and tell me why you're here.
Attila gave me a key. That's why I'm here. So what do you want of me?
Wouldn't you like to know? Keep your cool.
Go see Cassia. You're expected.
I've done in Attila. He had the key to the sewers on him.
(disbelieving) YOU killed Attila?! (scornfully) So what, he was a lousy dog anyway.
But I'll tell you something. If you attack me, I'll kill you.
What are you doing here in this dark, dank hole?
(growls) I live here. One more stupid question and I'll cut a design in your hide.
Take me to your leader.
(laughs dirtily) HA - my leader? I'm sure Cassia will want to talk to you.
Go ahead - and don't try to fool me.
Can you teach me something?
Sure, I'll show you how to sneak - free of charge for you.
You want to learn how to move without making a sound? That'll cost you 100 gold pieces.
OK, I want to learn how to sneak.
Here's the gold.
So, then tell me when you're ready.
You can't learn anything without gold.
Teach me the art of sneaking.
Sneaking is essential for every thief. Above all, when you're moving around in somebody else's house.
Don't just tramp on in like that. Most people sleep very lightly.
Only when you sneak will no one hear you - and you can work unhindered.
You killed my friends. Why did you do that, you murderer?
I'll send you to Beliar's realm.
You killed Cassia, you dirty murderer. But you won't get past me!
I've done more things for Ramirez and collected more cash than you'll ever see.
And you just killed him, you filthy dog! It's time to pay the piper!
Say, would you know anything about Bosper's bow?
You mean the bow from the bowyer? Yeah, I've got it packed somewhere up front in a chest.
But there's rats scurrying around there. You can fetch it, if the critters don't bother you.
Oh, well of course the chest is locked. You just have to break into it. (grins) Hopefully, you still have lock picks.
What's behind that locked door?
(grins) Behind that is the chest - the chest of the master lock picker. Fingers.
He put such an unbelievably complicated lock on it that, till now, no one has been able to open it.
Unfortunately, he got nabbed - they tossed him through the Barrier, where he probably died.
But if you want to try opening the chest, here's the key to the room.
I managed to open the chest.
That's impossible! It looks like we've got a new master lock picker.
Congratulations on this accomplishment.
Hey, thanks, man, I mean, thank you, really. There I was thinking I'd never get out of here...
What are you doing HERE?
I got locked in. The door was open and all I wanted was to have a little looksee - but as soon as I was inside, the watch came and locked the damn door.
This is somewhat embarrassing - I'd be very grateful if it could remain just between you and me.
I understand, that wasn't exactly something to be proud of.
I think I need a drink now.
Everything all right?
Thanks for setting me free.
Hey, what do you know - we have mutual friends. In that case, let me express my gratitude for being rescued.
Here, take these lock picks - I'm sure you'll find them useful.
Hey! What about my money?
You're a convict from the mining colony. I won't sell you anything!
Show me your wares.
Innos be with you, stranger. If you are looking for a good selection for the traveler, then you're in the right place.
But I'm warning you: if you're planning on helping yourself without paying, I'll call the city guard!
Just a moment, do I look like a thief?
(scornful) Bah! You wouldn't be the first one to make off with my things today.
Somebody stole from you?
I can't prove it. The fellow was damned clever. Introduced himself as Rengaru - if that really is his right name.
He's been hanging around the marketplace the last few days.
And every evening he gets plastered at the beer stand down the street. I bet the bastard is drinking MY money!
I only looked away for a moment and my purse was gone!
Listen - if you get my gold back for me from that Rengaru fellow, I'll tell you what I know.
I could get your gold back for you.
(distrustful) Oh? And why would you do that?
That depends - can you help me get into the upper quarter?
(laughs) You've got the wrong man. I'm from out of town - like most of the merchants in the marketplace.
If you want to get into the upper quarter, go talk to the resident merchants in the lower part of town.
I'm looking for clues to the thieves' guild!
I might well be able to help you.
I want part of the gold as a reward!
First see if you get my purse back. THEN we'll talk about your reward!
Why didn't you call the city guard?
The guards only respond if a thief is caught in the act.
And when I noticed my purse was missing, the bastard was already gone!
How much gold was in that purse?
50 gold pieces - that's quite a lot in these crappy times.
I'll see what I can do.
Be careful! If you just knock the bastard down, the city guard will get involved.
Lately, things have been getting really rough here. Since the paladins came to town, the guards have been cracking down harshly on brawlers.
So, think of something ...
I shall.
About the thief ...
Yes, how's it going? Have you caught him - and much more importantly - do you have my gold?
I'm still working on it!
Then see to it that you get my gold back!
He got away from me.
And what about my gold? Did it get away with him?
Yes, I caught him all right. He's going to cool his heels in jail for a while.
What about my gold?
Well, he met with a fatal accident.
Then at least he won't steal from anyone else! The justice of Innos has prevailed.
Where is my gold?
Here's the 50 gold pieces he stole from you.
Innos be praised! There is still justice in the city.
Hey, this isn't 50 gold pieces! Are you trying to steal from me, too?
What do you know about the thieves' guild?
Right - listen up - you haven't heard anything of what I'm about to tell you from me, capisce?
There are shady characters who frequent the dockside pub.
I bet the landlord knows a thing or two ...
If you're planning to track down the thieves, you should go talk to HIM.
You could act like you're up to something crooked, for example. Maybe he'll fall for it.
But be very careful. These people are not to be trifled with.
I want part of the gold as a reward!
But I already gave you a valuable hint.
That should suffice as a reward for you.
If it's gold you want, then hunt down the thieves and collect the bounty from Lord Andre.
Now, I must get back to my customers ...
Alrik says you've got his sword ...
Do you mean that ragged fellow who traded his weapon to me for a few torches and chunks of meat?
That's him.
I still have the sword.
How much do you want for it?
Well - for you ...
Ah, so what! Here, take it. After all, you did help me get my gold back ...
Well - for you - 50 gold pieces.
(grumpy) I don't have it any more! The devil only knows where the thing is now.
Here's 50 gold pieces. Give me Alrik's sword, then.
Here you go - (cunning) that was a good deal.
You don't have enough gold. But don't worry - I'll keep the sword for a while. Come back later, then ...
Hey, you!
I see you belong to the magicians' monastery.
Yes, why?
Can you use another worker there?
Hey you, ever been to the monastery?
Maybe, why?
Are they still taking on people?
I wouldn't know where else to turn.
Have you seen a novice walk past?
Yeah, sure, he went thataway.
He jumped into the water off the bridge and swam like a shark was after him.
If you're headed for the monastery, you should talk to Milten. He'll surely be able to help you.
What do you think, would they let me in there at all?
Perhaps. But the way you look, I can hardly imagine you in a novice's robe.
Enough of that nonsense - novice's robe indeed. It's the grub I'm after, or I'll be forced to eat the bark off the trees next.
Where do you come from?
I used to be captain of a big whaler, my boy. The sea is my home.
My ship, the good old Magdalena, was sunk by pirates a few months ago, and now I'm stranded here.
All I ever wanted was to go back to sea, but since I've come here, not one schooner has called at this accursed port.
The only ship which is anchored in Khorinis is that blasted war galley of the King, and they don't take on anyone.
So what else can I do? There's no work for me in town. I've tried everything.
You had better get off the road.
Don't worry. I've already noticed that the wilderness out here has become damned dangerous in the last couple of days.
How's life in the monastery?
I'm going out of my mind here!
But anyway, thanks for the hint. Milten was indeed able to help me get a place here.
I feel really stupid among those ever-nagging do-gooders.
Well. What's a body to do? Before I starve in town, I'd rather do what the novices tell me to.
You'll be all right, I think.
Just imagine - I'm expected to weed their garden. If this carries on much longer, I'll go bonkers.
What I need is some good old planks beneath my feet.
Maybe I could offer you a job as a captain.
You're not having me on, mate? If what you say is really true, I'm definitely in on it.
Errh... there's only a minor problem. I ate those novices out of half their larder.
They're hopping mad, those fellows. I don't think that head magician will let me leave here just like that.
First, I have to work off my debt with Pyrokar. I'm sorry.
I took care of your bill. You're free.
Really? How did you manage that?
You don't want to know.
Oh well. Not that I really care. Thanks a million, again.
Now what about your offer? Can I still sign on with you?
Great. And now we're out of here!
Be my captain.
I feel honored, but do you even have a ship and a crew?
I should say, we'll need five men at least.
Good. I'll see what I can do. Wait for me at the harbor.
Aye, aye, sir.
Are you ready to take me over to the island?
But certainly. Give me that chart.
Great. Then hoist the sails, and we're out of here.
You had better check your gear first. Once we're at sea, there will be no way back.
When you've done that, you should get some sleep. There's a bed made up for you in the captain's quarters. Good night.
You need a ship, a crew of at least five men, and a nautical chart which I can use to navigate.
We're not going to set sail until I see you've got everything you need.
How are you?
Fine. This is not a bad place.
They still give me idiotic assignments, such as herding sheep, but they're not half as narrow-minded here as they were at the monastery.
I'll have to find another place to stay. Let's see where the winds shall blow me next.
Everything all right?
Sure enough - just as long as all those monsters stay away from us ...
We're not going to survive another orc attack like that. So hurry up - we need to get out of here.
The enemy is dead.
That's good news. Is that all we needed to do on this island?
One more minute. I've still got to take care of something.
All right. But hurry.
How's it going?
What do you want? Have you got anything to say to me? If not, you can just go away.
Otherwise my friend will make mincemeat of you. So what is it?
They say you have some interesting wares to offer...
So what. Esteban wants to jerk me around, eh? I do all the work and hide away here for days in this miserable hole...
...and he just sends someone to fetch the stuff? I'm not a warehouse!
Yeah, and? That isn't my problem.
But I'm MAKING it your problem. You want the delivery - fine, you can pay for it!
Get the gold from Esteban or Raven or I don't know where. I don't care. Whoever wants these goods will pay for them!
I don't come from Esteban!
Oh? Well then... eh ... Just a moment! Hold still for a bit, you have a critter on your shoulder.
What are you doing here?
What are you accosting me for? Who are you anyway?
I, er ...
Say, don't I know you from somewhere?
Not that I remember.
That's funny. I could have sworn I'd met you before.
Never mind, you're obviously gutter scum anyway. You all look alike somehow.
Maybe so.
Don't get snotty! Who do you think you're talking to anyway?
The least you can do is address me in a more appropriate tone.
And now get out of my sight!
How's it going?
You'd better scram, you filthy mercenary, before I call the guards.
Relax. I'm not here to steal from you. I'm looking for work.
Ah. So you want to work for me. Hmm. That is, of course, a different matter.
There is, alas, one minor problem. I don't know whether I can trust you. You will have to prove your loyalty first.
Have I not made it clear that I want no contact with you?
No, not in so many words.
So I certainly hope you get the point now.
Put me to the test.
Mmh. All right. Listen. Bring me the sacred hammer of the Magicians of Fire. They keep it somewhere in the basement of their monastery.
If you pull that off, I might think about hiring you as a bodyguard.
I'm supposed to steal from the magicians? You're off your rocker.
Then go to hell and stop wasting my time.
All right.
Fine. But remember - if they catch you, I've never heard of you.
Here's the sacred hammer of the magicians.
I am truly impressed. You're really serious about this, aren't you? Here's your pay.
Fine. If that's how it is, I have another task for you already.
Some days ago, several prisoners escaped from the local jail.
Those sumbitches have taken off to the mountains. Somewhere in the direction of Xardas' new tower.
The name of their leader is Morgahard. I want you to kill him.
Go hurry before they are gone for good.
Morgahard is dead.
Ah. You're a good boy. Here's your reward.
Is there anything else I could do for you?
Not right now. Maybe later.
Give me a written authorization for the paladins' ship.
(laughs) You've got to be out of your mind. What do you want me to do?
You heard me all right. Give me that authorization, or I'll turn you in to the militia.
(bellows) I shall not be blackmailed. Least of all by you! I shall feed you to the wolves, you miserable piece of scum.
Morgahard assaulted the governor by your order. I am in possession of a document which can prove it.
(bellows) Arrh.
You'll be sorry for this. No-one blackmails me and gets away with it.
Here's your authorization. Now leave. I shall deal with you later.
Get out of my sight.
How are things?
If you want something to drink, you'll have to order it.
I bet you overhear a lot of things ...
So, what's that to you?
I've always got an open ear for news.
Have you got your purse open, then?
Every piece of information I give you will cost 10 gold pieces.
All right, agreed.
You struck a good bargain (grins). I'm always at your service.
I'll give you no more than 5 for your information.
What, 5 gold pieces? Are you trying to ruin me? (thinks briefly) - Let's make it 7.
Forget it - I'll get my information elsewhere.
All right, all right ... I'll go down to 7.
OK, 7 gold pieces sounds fair.
(grins) A wise decision. Well, so if there's anything you want to know, ask me.
No, I don't need your information that bad.
Hey, wait ... (sigh) - all right, 5 gold pieces. But that's my final offer!
Why couldn't you say that right away?
Oh, I'm simply out of shape. But whatever - it's a deal.
No, it doesn't work that way. Let's say 6!
You're a scoundrel, you know that? Well, if you insist, let's say 6 gold pieces for each piece of information.
Give me something to drink.
I need information.
Come back when you have enough gold.
Who counts among the influential citizens in this town?
You won't find anyone down here at the harbor. The only powerful man here is Lehmar.
The moneylender is not very popular, but he has gold, and other influential citizens owe him money.
The merchants and craftsmen also have a lot of influence - too much if you ask me.
Who's in debt to Lehmar?
(laughs) If you want to know that, you should take a look in his ledger.
Only it might be pretty difficult to do that without him noticing.
As far as I know, he always carries it with him ...
Where can I find work?
You're not likely to find work down here at the harbor. You need to go to the craftsmen in the lower part of town for that.
But if you wield a decent blade, you could go challenge Alrik. He fights for gold, behind the warehouse.
What do you know about the missing citizens?
All I know is that some people have vanished during the last few days.
It's especially bad down here at the harbor, they say. Maybe you should ask around here a bit.
There were some cases in the lower part of the city, too.
If you want to know more, you should talk to Coragon.
He has his pub in the lower part of town, and he's likely to hear a thing or two.
Halvor, the fish merchant down by the quay, might know something, too. Many people frequent him.
Who can teach me something here?
There are a few competent people here in the harbor district.
Carl the blacksmith is a sturdy fellow. I bet he can show you how to get stronger.
Alrik knows a lot about fighting. And Lares is a cunning rogue. He's down here at the harbor sometimes as well.
And if you're crazy enough to go see old Ignaz - he knows all about aleche ... almich ... potions.
Where can I find all these people?
(groans) Boy, the King will have won his war against the orcs before I'm done explaining that to you.
Just look around the harbor district, and you're bound to find them. And if you don't know your way about, go to Brahim and buy yourself a map.
HE is easy to find. His hut is right next to my pub. (murmurs) I should have charged double for that one.
Is there any 'special' work to be had around here where I could make some quick money?
Something special, you say? Hmmm ...
... go talk to Nagur then. Maybe he can help you.
Got anything 'special' for me to do?
I've got something for you - but that should only interest you if you're a man of versatile talents.
What have you got?
Well, Zuris, the potion vendor in the marketplace, currently has a guest - Daron the Fire Magician.
And?
He had a new chest made specially for him by Thorben the carpenter.
They say that this Daron has brought a bunch of valuable stuff with him. But you didn't hear that from me, understand?
Where can I buy weed here?
Certainly not here - I've nothing to do with stuff like that.
Certainly not here.
All right, where then?
I'd talk to Meldor if I were you - after all, he smokes all day.
What do you know about a package of swampweed?
Whoever owns such a package is a rich man. And probably a very relaxed man as well!
Don't try to fool me. You know something. So spit it out!
All right, all right - this fellow came to my pub the other day. One of the mercenaries.
He said that he'd sold a package of swampweed at the harbor, but of course he was completely stoned. That's all I know.
Hey you, come over here. I've got something for you.
There was a fellow here who insisted on talking to you.
Since you weren't here, he told me to give you a message.
He wants to meet you. Behind Halvor's fish shop.
This piece of information is free - but that's an exception, kid! Anything beyond that will cost you.
What did the guy look like?
I could tell you that - but you need to pay for it, my friend. (grins)
Every piece of information I give you will cost 10 gold pieces.
What did the guy look like?
Well, rather tall, dark-skinned and strong - but no uniform. Somehow ... menacing.
And his face?
His face? When he looked at me I was glad that it wasn't me he had come for.
There was something scary in his eyes - anyway, I think you should go see him. This is bound to be interesting.
Yeah ... the question is, for whom ...
That bastard tried to kill me!
Hey, how would that be my fault? All I did was pass on some information.
If anyone is determined to step on your toes, I guess he'll have his reasons.
Ah, you're involved with the gang. All right. In that case, I've got something for you.
(quietly) If you ever need some lock picks, come to me. I still have a few around. Just ask me for something to drink.
I still need a few sailors.
Bad times, my friend. You won't find enough sailors in all of Khorinis. Most of them have left the city.
But with a good captain, it shouldn't be too hard to find yourself a few bright lads and make them into a decent crew before too long.
Where can I find a captain?
You're asking the wrong guy. I just run this pub.
Go talk to Old Jack. He's been hanging around this harbor for as long as I can think. When it comes to seafaring, he's your man.
What can I do for you, novice?
What can I do for you, Brother?
The honorable warriors of Innos rarely stray into these rooms.
What can I do for you?
(mistrustful) What are you doing here?
I have come to read the scriptures.
I understand. If you can ever make some time between your tedious studies, come to me.
There is yet another matter for which I could use a discreet novice.
You have an assignment for me?
Yes. It's about this crazy Ignaz. He lives in Khorinis and experiments with various potions and healing draughts. But also magic spells.
And that's exactly what worries me. I ask myself if his magic is pleasing to Innos.
In order to test this, I need some of his spell scrolls.
I want you to go into the city and obtain three of his spell scrolls for me.
But not a word to anyone - is that clear?
Sure.
Here are 150 gold pieces. That should cover your expenses.
Here are the spell scrolls you wanted.
Well done, my young friend.
But now it is time that you devote yourself to your studies.
And take this spell scroll as a reward.
Show me your wares.
What exactly is your job?
It is my responsibility to train mages in the art of spherical manifestation.
What does that mean?
Well, I teach them how to summon creatures or beings from other states or spheres.
This is usually called summoning, although this expression alone is insufficient for the art of calling a servant.
Furthermore, I own some interesting spell scrolls which Gorax does not have.
But I only make them available to members of the Order.
Teach me.
For the moment, there is nothing you can learn from me.
I want to learn the fourth Circle of Magic.
Good. All the signs are fulfilled. Enter now the fourth circle, so that the power of the new magic will be within you.
You have come a long way, and Innos will continue to light your path.
It is still not finished.
I want to learn the fifth Circle of Magic.
Then enter now into the fifth circle of magic. You will command mightier magic than ever before.
Use its power wisely, Brother - for the darkness is still strong and so are your enemies.
I cannot accompany you into the sixth and highest Circle of magic. Pyrokar himself will ordain you when the time comes.
The time is not yet ripe.
Brother, you cannot lose any time. You must hunt down Pedro and return the Eye of Innos to the monastery.
If the Eye is not retrieved, we shall all be lost.
What are you doing here? Shouldn't you be on your way and looking for the underhanded traitor Pedro?
Later. There's something I have to take care of first.
Do you have any idea what this loss means for the monastery? The Eye of Innos is a powerful weapon.
No one can foresee what the enemy intends to do with the amulet, but he is planning something and we must prevent it.
So get moving immediately and track down the thief!
He's not going to get very far.
I hope so for your sake. If he should escape because you've been lollygagging here, I will personally drag you before the tribunal.
What would you accuse me of?
Conspiracy with the enemy. It takes little imagination to picture the punishment for such an offense.
And now see to it that you lose no more time, otherwise the next time we meet, it will be at the stake.
You know everything you need to know. Now be on your way!
I have brought back the Eye of Innos.
I am relieved that you were able to snatch the Eye away from the enemy.
But the danger has not been averted. Evil is making further plans and is proceeding with unusual aggression.
I've already figured that out for myself.
Do not mock me. The situation is serious, very serious, and we don't know whom we can trust.
The enemy has already succeeded in leading the novice Pedro into temptation, and he may have success with many others.
How are your studies coming along?
I have been able to find out something about the Seekers.
And what would that be?
They are quite obviously of demonic origin. Well, at least they are, or were, under the influence of demons.
Be careful if you meet them.
What a novel concept.
I'm sorry, but I don't have enough material to make a more precise statement.
But if you could manage to bring me something of theirs to examine ...
I am still working on the interpretation of the evidence about the Seekers.
As soon as I know something, I will of course inform you immediately.
The enemy has many faces. Which of them presents the greatest danger for the monastery is awfully difficult to determine.
Could the Sleeper be involved in this?
I have heard the story of the Sleeper. But from a distance I cannot say anything about it.
There are countless demons, and any of them could be involved.
Do you want me to bring you a corpse, then?
No, are you crazy? The dangers posed by a demonic being within the walls of the monastery are much too great.
It will be enough if you find some objects which are typical for these beings.
The remains of the demonic aura which clings to them should offer enough clues for an examination.
What kind of material do you need?
What do I know - any objects which specially belong to these beings.
I shall see what I can do.
It would certainly be very useful. In the meantime, I will carry out my own personal research.
I've got an almanac of the Possessed here. Maybe you can find some use for it.
Show me.
Yes, that may do. I will examine the book.
But I'm already sure of one thing.
In my opinion, the Seekers are an utterly perverted life form created by Beliar.
These beings are of partly demonic and partly human origin.
However, I am still unable to tell at this point whether we are looking at a type of spiritual possession, or a purely physical mutation.
Come back later. Then I will certainly know more.
Found out anything new about the Seekers yet?
Yes. Now I know who or what the Seekers really are.
Fire away!
They were once human, like you or I. They made the abominable mistake of devoting themselves to the impure magic of a very powerful archdemon.
Under the influence of this archdemon as well as very powerful drugs, they existed only to serve him until they were reduced to mere shadows of themselves.
Today, they are nothing but tools of evil, without a will of their own, and they will never cease to hunt the followers of Innos.
We must be careful. They still seem to shun these hallowed halls of Innos.
However, if their power continues to grow, I don't know if we'll still be safe here.
Thanks. That was very enlightening.
Indeed? That only raises more questions for me. For example, who were they before, and which archdemon made them what they are now?
I've got a notion. This all sounds like the Brotherhood of the Sleeper. I know those guys.
I hope you know what you're getting involved in. Take care of yourself, my Brother.
But, of course. Here is your almanac. I don't need it any longer.
I'm working on it. Come back later.
Is there a way to protect oneself against the mental attacks of the Seekers?
Indeed. An amulet prepared with stone from blessed soil could have a protective effect.
Unfortunately, I do not have enough of these stones available.
Some of our prayer shrines which we have erected are composed of them.
All right. I shall scare up some of that.
Yes, do that. But don't even think of damaging the shrines, do you hear me?
No idea. I still know too little to answer that. Ask me about it later.
I've got some stone here from blessed soil.
Good. I hope all the prayer shrines are still in their places.
All right. I shall make you a protective amulet against the black look of the Seekers.
Give me some time. I shall get right to work.
So what about the protective amulet you promised me?
I'm finished. Here, take a look. It has turned out beautifully.
Carry it with you always and the Seekers will not be able to drag you down into their mental abyss.
Thank you.
Patience. I'm still working on it.
Those cutthroats are threatening my husband! We are citizens of the town, loyal to the king, and the mercenaries are planning to rob us!
Now don't you just stand there. Do something then! Help us.
Are you all right?
(sobs) My beloved husband is dead! Oh Innos, why do you punish me so hard?
Yes, I'm fine, thank you.
Akil says you've got a meal for me.
We've hit some hard times ever since the Barrier fell and the land is no longer safe.
Here's a loaf of bread, a little meat and some water. That's all I can spare, I'm afraid.
Baltram sent me. I'm supposed to pick up a shipment for him.
Yes, of course. Here, I've packed it all up.
Why don't you defend yourselves against Onar's tyranny?
For us farmers near the city, it makes more sense to stay on the good side of the city militia than to rely on Onar's mercenaries.
On the other hand, there's Bengar and Sekob who would rather give up their farms than work for the king.
Where do I find the farms of Bengar and Sekob?
They're not far from the farm where the landowner lives. Go east from here, and you'll find them.
Haven't you ever considered moving away from here?
It's not easy to get away from this part of the country. All the land is walled in by a high, insurmountable chain of mountains.
The only two ways out of here are the pass to the Valley of Mines, and the harbor.
Since we cannot afford passage on a ship, and the Valley of Mines is a place of no return, we're going to have to stay here.
What do you know about the pass?
I've never been there myself. But it must be somewhere near Bengar's farm on the high pastures.
Look out for your husband.
I shall do my best.
Everything still fine with you?
We can manage. I just wonder how much longer we're going to have to endure these devils in black.
I can't stand it any more. They sneak around the house, making those funny noises.
You train people?
Yes. Once those orcs or, even worse, the dragons attack again, every single hand will be needed.
Can you train me, too?
Sure. I'll train any good man.
But besides your talent, you need a good weapon if you want to survive here.
Ask the knight Tandor. He'll take care of you.
I want to train!
You are very good. There's nothing I can still teach you.
Only a trained swordmaster can help you now.
Let's begin.
What about long-range combat?
What about it?
Can you teach me that, too?
No, but you can ask Udar, he's a good - no, he is the BEST crossbowman I know.
You're pulling such a long face.
(agitated) Damn it to hell. I tell you, you have to watch like a hawk.
If you turn your back for a moment, all your stuff is gone. Dirty scum!
Did someone steal from you?
No. They smuggled 20 gold pieces into my pocket. Of course they stole something, you idiot!
I tell you, when I get my hands on the dirty swine ...
So what are you missing?
My purse, with all my savings in it.
And now it's gone!
It'll turn up somewhere.
When I get my hands on him ...
What scum?
You shabby dragon hunters, of course. Who else?
Those dragon hunting riff-raff, of course. Who did you think I was talking about?
(to himself) You've got to watch out, I tell you.
Calm down! A paladin shouldn't lose his temper like that.
But I don't want to calm down. That was everything I own, damnit!
I think I found your purse.
The pouch is empty. What swine did this?
What? Where? What bastard did that?
How would I know?
Are you trying to pull my leg? It was you, admit it.
I'll find that out yet.
Kiss my ass.
I'll teach you to steal from decent folks.
I suspect one of the dragon hunters.
(angry) I knew it.
(bellows) They never should have let you into the castle.
Just wait, I'll give those swine what for.
Ehm. It was over there, by the smithy.
Where? Near the smithy? It must have fallen out of a dragon hunter's pocket there, don't tell me otherwise.
Just a moment. What about a reward?
That's the last straw. It's been a while since you've had a knuckle sandwich, huh?
Arrh. All right. Here's a few coins. And now tell me, who did it?
I want my finder's fee for your purse.
You can have a punch in the jaw!
Is that your biggest worry? Here's a couple of damn coins, and now beat it.
Relax.
Yes, Master. I'll try.
I can't prove it, but I think you're the traitor who opened the gate.
You'll pay for that now.
You've got your purse back, haven't you?
Don't push me, boy! Clear off!
What's wrong with you?
You have to ask that? Just look around you.
These damned lurkers have spread across the entire river since I've come here.
First, there were only two. Since yesterday, I've counted five at least.
No idea how I'm ever going to get out of here.
Have you tried getting through to the pass?
Do I look insane to you? 20 soldiers couldn't drag me out of here as long as those beasts are out there. I despise those things.
(completely unnerved) I only have to smell them and I break out in a cold sweat. And their constant gurgling makes the blood freeze in my veins.
If you're that eager to have them skin you alive, go right ahead.
But you can't stay here forever.
I've no idea what it is you want from me, but I can tell you this: you're not going to get me to leave here.
What would you give me if I killed the things?
Mmh. Well. It would be enough if those lurkers in front of the cave would disappear.
I found a blank runestone. Since you're a magician, I'm sure you can make use of it.
I found a lump of ore.
I would give it to you in exchange.
Well, I'm off, then.
Sure. I won't keep you.
The lurkers in front of the cave are gone.
Great. Now I can breathe again at last.
Here's what I promised you.
Will you cross the pass now?
Forget it, man. If they catch me, they'll take me back to the mines. I'm staying put.
Everything fine with you?
So - you want to join us, then? Do you even have a decent weapon?
If it's something important, go talk to Lee. Otherwise, leave me alone.
What weapons do you have to offer?
Only the best. Just take a look at them.
Would you mind if I joined you?
Once you have passed the test, I shall vote for you.
I passed it already.
Well, that's all right then.
How did you end up with the mercenaries?
I came with Sylvio from the south. We belonged to an army of mercenaries which fought against the orcs.
What's your opinion of Sylvio?
He's a dangerous fellow! And many of the mercenaries who came with him this far listen to what he says. Better not pick a fight with him.
What's your opinion of Lee?
I think that the only thing Lee is really interested in is getting away from this island.
He wants to go to the mainland. Seems to have a bone to pick with someone there ...
At any rate, he does a far better job than Sylvio ever could.
Moreover, he's a good leader. Most of the time we can do whatever we want here.
Hey, come over here!
What do you want?
This valley is a dangerous place, and without the right equipment you'll find yourself dead in no time.
I assume that YOU've got the right equipment.
You guessed it. I might even sell it to you.
What can you offer me?
Do you sell information as well?
That depends. If the price is right, I'll tell you everything I know.
How much do you charge?
Hmm... hard to say. But I think that 50 gold pieces for every piece of information I give you sounds about right.
I need some information.
50 gold pieces!
That's too expensive for me.
Yes, here.
Now tell me ...
You know, just give me back my money, I changed my mind.
Suit yourself.
Tell me about the dragons.
Dragons are ancient, incredibly powerful creatures. Once there were thousands of them living all over the world.
It's been over a hundred years, though, that any of them were seen.
Their blood is as hot as boiling oil. If they look into your eyes, your heart will turn to stone. So I've heard ...
Tell me more about the dragons.
But all dragons are not alike.
Some of them could cover the entire land with a layer of ice several feet thick.
Others prefer living in swampy surroundings, or in volcanoes.
Tell me about the Valley of Mines.
The Valley of Mines of Khorinis is known all over the country for its magic ore.
These mountains are the only place where the magic ore can be found.
A weapon forged from this ore is virtually unbreakable and will cut through the strongest armor.
Until a few weeks ago, the entire valley was surrounded by a magic barrier. It was impenetrable, and nobody could get out.
Tell me more about the Valley of Mines.
The valley has changed a lot during these last few days.
When the orcs came, other horrible creatures showed up as well, the likes of which have never been seen around here before.
They say that a few lonely hunters are still about, but I'm not sure whether they're even still alive.
It seems like all the creatures of Beliar have flocked together in this very valley.
Tell me about the castle.
It lies pretty much in the center of the Valley of Mines.
Back when the valley was still a prison, the ore barons controlled the entire ore trade from there.
Tell me about the orcs.
The orcs haven't been here for long. At least those orcs in front of the castle, that is.
But I'm wondering about how well they're organized. Orcs usually attack blindly, no matter what.
These orcs are biding their time. They're waiting, but we don't know for what.
Tell me more about the orcs.
The orcs are led by elite warriors. Those warriors are very strong and heavily armored. They are almost impossible to defeat.
I once saw one of them fell a fully-grown oak tree with one blow of his axe.
I killed all the dragons!
(laughs) Sure, and I'm a paladin.
You might have killed ONE, but all of them? Go find somebody else who will believe you.
Hey, you! Fellows like you should watch where they're going.
What are you trying to tell me?
I mean that the air out here isn't good for your health. The place is just swarming with orcs and monsters.
Not to mention the dragons. It's just a well-intentioned warning.
Can you tell me anything I don't know already?
I can give you a good piece of advice, and it's even free.
We can't use anyone here who faints dead away at the slightest dragon fart.
Go home, this is a job for real men.
Are you the boss here?
Do I look like it? Certainly not. We don't need any self-important jerk ordering us around.
When Sylvio tried to act like he was the boss, we showed him and his buddies what we thought of that.
There was a brawl. In the end, they left on their own.
I hope Sylvio wound up in the soup kettle of some orc.
(mocking) So you want to kill dragons?
Smart ass. So do you know how to bring down a dragon?
Do you think the beast will just sit there quietly while you chop off its head?
Something like that takes good planning and decisive action.
I see. And how are you going to go about that?
First we'll scout out where we can find the beasts.
Only then will we think about the best way to attack.
I think you won't even find a blind sheep.
What? Do you want me to push in your stupid face?
How are you going to get past the orcs?
We'll worry about those details later.
I'd love to watch you do that, but I've got to be on my way.
Get yourself back over the pass. Otherwise you may end up missing a limb or two.
Have you seen a dragon yet?
Not so far. But the beasts can't hide forever.
The dragons are dead.
Ha, who's supposed to have killed them then? The paladins?
I did.
(laughs) Hah. You don't believe that yourself. Quit yanking my chain.
Hey, come closer. Take a break and have a sip of cool beer.
Lord Andre is springing for a few barrels of free beer.
Nothing hits the spot like a cool pint after work.
The paladins will set everything right. So take another draught and have a good time.
You can say what you want about Khorinis, but our 'Dark Paladine' is simply the best in all of Myrtana.
I'll see you later, down at the harbor.
I must be crazy, what are you doing here?
Did you SWIM here?
(laughs) That's one way to get past the guards at the city gate.
Have we met before?
Man, don't you remember me? I used to hang around in the New Camp.
The list for the mine... Man, we had a lot of fun. Do you remember Lee?
Hey, Lares, you old scoundrel, how did you get here?
I was able to escape the Valley of Mines just in time, together with Lee and some of the other boys.
You remember Lee, don't you?
I got out of the colony with him then. Just after the Barrier was destroyed.
He and his boys are now on the farm of Onar the landowner.
He made a deal with the farmer. He and his boys defend the farm, and Onar feeds them in return.
Of course I remember Lee!
Lee ...?
You've been through a lot, huh? Lee was the leader of the mercenaries in the New Camp.
Vatras sent me. He told me to come to you when I needed help.
(astonished)  So you've already been to see Vatras. You must have made a lasting impression on him.
Otherwise he certainly wouldn't have volunteered my name. Especially not since the matter with those missing people still hasn't been resolved.
Tell me what you need.
So what's your business with Vatras?
I've got this little agreement with the Water Mages, you see.
What kind of an agreement?
We work for them, and they see to it that our past in the penal colony doesn't get us into trouble.
You're talking about the 'Ring of Water'?
You've heard of it?
Vatras told me about it.
You might have mentioned that right away.
Tell me more about the 'Ring of Water'.
The 'Ring' is to the Water Mages what the paladins are to the Fire Magicians.
But, unlike the paladins, we operate in the background.
The 'Ring' is a mighty weapon in the battle against the dangers that threaten the people of Khorinis.
But this only works as long as we keep the identity of all those secret who belong to the 'Ring of Water'.
So keep this to yourself!
Sure.
I want to join the 'Ring of Water' ...
That's fine with me. But the decision about whether you will be accepted or not lies with the Water Mages alone.
I see.
What did you do to impress the Water Mages?
I protected them for a long time when we were still living with the Barrier.
(smiles) And they have plenty of reason to be grateful to me.
What's it like to belong to the 'Ring'?
We are very different from the usual communities you can join here in Khorinis.
Once you're one of us, we're not going to ask anything of you that you are not ready to do.
The only thing we truly require of you is to keep quiet.
We work in secret and do not want to let outsiders know who our members are.
We shall keep an eye on you. Everything else remains to be seen.
We are going to have a secret meeting soon in Orlan's tavern.
Meet us there as soon as you can. We'll give you your gear there.
I now belong to the 'Ring of Water'.
Great. So can I have my aquamarine ring back?
Sure. Here it is.
I hope it proved useful to you. I'm glad to know you're one of us now.
Hmm. I don't have it on me right now.
Don't mess around with it! I still need it.
I guess you want your gear now. So pay attention.
Here's your aquamarine ring.
Good for you. I thought you'd lost it.
You need to wait a little longer. Everyone's not here yet.
All right, my young friend. We have come together here to celebrate your admission to the 'Ring of Water'.
The boys who are present here will keep an eye out for you from today on.
Of course, there are others who also belong to the 'Ring of Water', so be careful.
Whether you do us a service or mess things up - we are going to learn about it.
Here, take the armor of our community.
Wear it with pride, but never in town or in other inhabited areas.
Remember, we must not be exposed. Nobody must therefore be told who the members of the 'Ring of Water' are.
Nobody talks about the 'Ring of Water'. That's our foremost rule. Stick to it.
Any more questions?
What about weapons, then?
The weapon of the 'Ring' is the quarterstaff, but everyone uses whatever arms he is most comfortable with.
Here's one of our staffs. I never really figured out how to use it, but maybe you can handle the thing.
I've got to go.
Fine, then don't let us keep you.
Now go directly to Vatras and have him give you your first task.
Brothers of the 'Ring'. Let us now return to our duties.
The bandit attacks are still going on. We must see to it that this menace is stopped.
Adanos, preserve the balance of this world.
What kind of help can I get from you?
I can show you how to become more dexterous.
If you need help with wielding close-combat weapons, talk to Cord. He is a master of the blade.
Gaan will gladly show you the proper way to gut animals.
Martin can tell you a lot about the paladins.
Cavalorn will teach you sneaking, one-handed combat and archery.
Orlan will always have a warm chamber and a bed waiting for you.
And for anything related to magic, talk to Vatras.
Have you ever used a teleporter stone?
No, but I've heard of them. The Water Mages aren't too sure about those things yet.
I've given it a try.
(laughs) Of course you have. You're not afraid of anything, are you?
Well. If you want to use the things, go ask Orlan the pub-owner whether he'll let you into his boarded-up cave.
I think he has hidden one of the teleporter stones for the Water Mages near his tavern.
Walk out of the eastern city gate and simply follow the path. You can't miss it.
Vatras gave me this ornament to bring to you. He said it is to be taken back.
(sighs) Of course. It's up to me, as usual. I might have known.
I'll have to walk halfway across the island to take it back to the Water Mages.
I can take the ornament there for you!
(pensively) Mmh. I think I had better take it there myself. But you could come with me.
Only, I can't leave here at the moment. I need to keep an eye on the harbor.
What exactly do you do here at the harbor?
I can't talk about that.
Vatras would have my head ...
I'm doing what we all do. I fulfill the tasks the Water Mages give me.
Some of the missing people where fishermen. They disappeared along with their boats.
That's why I'm standing here, watching the harbor. Maybe something will happen yet.
But you could help me.
Listen. I shall give you my aquamarine ring. It signifies that the bearer belongs to the 'Ring of Water'.
If you wear my ring, the rest of us will know that you're acting on my behalf.
Get someone to take over my duties so that I can take the ornament back.
One of us is always keeping an eye on the marketplace. But I don't know whose turn it is.
You had better go talk to all those standing around there. Once the right man sees my aquamarine ring on you, he will let you know.
Tell him to see to it that somebody else takes over here at the harbor.
I have talked to Baltram. He will find someone to relieve you.
Ah. Very good. Then we can finally leave here.
You had better keep my aquamarine ring for now.
(smiles) I assume it will come in handy for you.
(smiles) Who knows, you might want to join us ...
About those missing people ...
Tell me what you know.
The first was William, one of the fishermen here in Khorinis. One day, he simply didn't return.
At first we thought that one of those sea monsters out there had eaten him and his boat for breakfast.
But not too long afterwards, other people started disappearing from the town and the surroundings. Pretty random events, though.
Everyone's at a loss so far. The way it looks, we'll just have to wait until we finally stumble across a clue.
Isn't this a case for the militia?
The militia is pretty useless, if you ask me.
They're never going to clear this up. The missing people have just vanished into thin air.
I know what has become of all the missing people!
(surprised) Really.
The former ore baron Raven had them kidnapped.
Are you sure? Then we need to get them out of there.
I'm working on it.
All right. But you know, whenever you need my help ...
... then I'll know where to find you. Understood.
I've been able to rescue some of the missing people.
I knew you'd succeed. Then I can finally go about my own business now.
I need your help.
And what exactly were you thinking of?
What about some better armor?
Mmh. Matteo sells armor. But he'll probably charge you an arm and a leg for it.
There is a way you could get it cheaper, though, if you don't mind pulling a fast one on the militia ...
What do you mean?
There's a storage area next to Matteo's house. But all the merchandise has been confiscated by the militia.
Go to Zuris at the marketplace and get yourself a sleeping spell. Then you send the guards off to dreamland.
I'm sure you'll find some decent armor among Matteo's stock ...
I need a better weapon.
There's nothing I can do about that, I'm afraid. Have you tried the marketplace?
I need some money.
Don't we all? Sorry, but I have none to give you. But Lehmar the moneylender still owes me a favor.
Go to him and borrow whatever money you need. I'll take care of the rest. You'll find Lehmar in the harbor district, where it borders on the lower part of town.
That guy is pestering me ...
Not for long ...
I must talk to the paladins, by all means!
What do you want from THEM?
They've got a powerful amulet, the Eye of Innos. I need to have it.
And you think they'll give it to you? You'll never get into the upper end of town.
I'll find a way somehow.
Sure, if you want to ingratiate yourself with the citizens or play errand boy for the militia ...
Do you know why the paladins are here?
Nobody knows for sure ... Lots of people think it's because of the orcs, but I think there's another reason.
It probably has something to do with the old penal colony.
Vatras said you could help me join a community.
(laughs) Getting tired of being the underdog, are you?
All right. I see your point.
I can exert my influence with the mercenaries if you want to join Lee.
And I'm sure we can find a way to get you into the monastery soon.
But the easiest thing would certainly be for you to join the militia.
Which community do you prefer?
I'll have to think about it ...
The mercenaries.
I'm sure that Lee will accept you.
But first you're going to have to pass a test.
Go and talk to Cord on Onar's farm.
He can help you with your test.
Tell him that you 'reside beneath my wing'. He'll understand.
The militia.
(amused) Yes. I can imagine you'd like that, eh? Read the law to other people while you're pocketing their purses.
The paladins have set up their provisions store by the harbor. Their provisions master is a good friend of mine.
Maybe he can do something for you. His name is Martin.
The Fire Magicians.
(laughs) I bet Vatras didn't foresee that, or he wouldn't have sent you to me.
Joining the monastery is expensive.
Those boys won't even let you in unless you pay them a tribute.
And the only one who could do anything about that is Vatras himself. You had better talk to him again about this.
Tell me more about Lee and his mercenaries ...
What do you want to know?
Tell me more about the mercenaries.
Well, if you're as tough as you were back then, you shouldn't have any problems with them.
Most of them are ruffians and if you can't stand up to them, you won't get far.
(laughs) If you're squeamish, you don't have a chance of landing with them...
Why aren't YOU with Lee and his mercenaries?
But I am! Just not on the farm.
You could say I'm our outpost in the city. We don't want the ship to sail without us.
What ship were you talking about?
It's on the open sea harbor, behind the cliffs. Lee and a few of his people really want to get away from here.
But that could take a while...
Why?
You'd better ask Lee about that, if you meet him ... He's got plans.
How do I find the landowner's farm?
It's quite simple. You leave the seaport by the east gate, and then follow the path towards the east.
I can take you there if you want.
Do you know anything about a thieves' guild in town?
The questions you ask ...
Of course, there's a thieves' guild here. Just like in every big city.
And every petty pickpocket or fence is probably connected to it somehow.
Do you know where I can find the thieves' guild?
(laughs) No offense, but even if I knew, I wouldn't tell you anything.
These people usually react VERY sensitively to things like that.
If you want to get involved with them, you should be very careful.
I've got this key here. It's been corroded by sea salt ...
So?
I think it will lead me to the hideout of the thieves' guild ...
Well, it could be the key to the sewers.
Where can I find the sewers?
What do I know... they usually empty into the ocean.
You're in the militia now!
(laughs) I'm gonna laugh myself sick - a former convict in the militia...
So now you're one of the King's paladins!
(mischievously) Only you could pull something like that...
(concerned) You won't blow the whistle on me about working for Lee, will you?
But you know me ...
I don't get it. You entered the monastery. What's it like there?
Different.
I can imagine.
I heard that you have been accepted to join Lee.
Congratulations.
Can you help me get through the thick woods in the east?
Okay. But what do you want to go there for?
Nefarius ordered me to find more ornaments.
One of the places where I'm supposed to look is in the middle of the woods.
I see. And that's still too dangerous for you alone, right?
No problem. Let me know when you want to leave.
Then let's go...Follow me.
Okay, lass uns gehen.
I cannot leave here until we know more about the missing people, or someone else takes over my duties.
Where?
Let us take Vatras' ornament back.
To Onar's farm.
To the dense forest in the east.
So, here we are.
So there you are. I was beginning to think you'd been eaten by wolves.
So, the rest of the way you can manage alone. I have to get back to the city, I've got a few things to take care of...
Just follow this road here, and remember - stand up for yourself and don't take any crap, and it'll be smooth sailing.
Now that we're no longer in town and cannot be overheard, let me tell you a little more.
We are now going to take this ornament that you brought me back to Saturas. You remember Saturas, don't you?
We lads from the former New Camp still have good relations with the Water Mages.
Even Lee will still protect the Water Mages against any danger today if it is within his power.
To keep up the contact with the Water Mages, I'm in town most of the time, working together with Vatras.
And this is the armor that is issued to each of us by the Water Mages. The members of the Ring of Water have been wearing such armor since before the orc wars.
What is Cavalorn's part in this? He wasn't a follower of the New Camp as far as I know.
You are right, our community has grown. Even I do not know how many there are by now.
But let us move on. I want to get further away from the city. We can talk more about it later.
Saturas? Who is that?
He was the head of the Water Mages in the New Camp, back in the Valley of Mines when the Barrier was still around us all.
Lee and I had made a pact with the Water Mages back then. Together, we were strong enough to hold up against the Old Camp.
Certainly. He was the leader of the Water Mages in the New Camp.
What's wrong? Are you still holding up?
That fellow over there has problems with bandits.
(snidely) Too bad for him, but we don't have time for that now.
Don't you break down on me now.
The Water Mages are all beside themselves. They've been digging at an excavation site in the north-east for weeks. It's anybody's guess what they're trying to find there.
It all started when the earth began trembling like it did in the worst times of the Barrier.
Horrible stone creatures emerged from the ground, slaying everyone who went within 100 feet of them.
The Water Mages took the matter in hand and destroyed those hostile invaders. And now they're digging down there, searching for an explanation for these strange events.
But you will soon see for yourself.
Can you still go on?
Right. It could get dangerous here.
We're here.
Here, take the ornament. The Water Mages must be in there somewhere. Take it to them.
If you should meet any beasts down in that hole in the ground that look like they're too much for you, flee forward to Saturas.
He'll take care of the beasts for you. I need to go back.
And one more thing: Don't even think about strolling around for long with this ornament. Go DIRECTLY to Saturas.
See you.
(strictly) Stop goofing off! Take that ornament to Saturas already!
Yes.
All right, my friend. Then follow me. This is going to be gross.
No. You can go.
I guess the matter has taken care of itself? All right. See you.
Do you still want to go into the woods with me?
Have you thought about going into the woods? Do you really want to do that?
There. You should be able to do the rest by yourself. I'm headed back, then.
Hurry up. I don't want to stay here any longer than I have to.
Stop blabbing.
(irritated) Yeah, yeah.
Let's move on.
Keep back a little.
Stay close behind me.
Can you teach me something?
Sure. I can help you become stronger and more dexterous if you like.
Teach me something.
You've already gotten more dexterous.
(appraisingly). Good. Your strength has increased.
Any news?
You're responsible for the best news yourself. They've let Bennet go again, he's back at the farm.
Go to him, I think he'd like to thank you himself.
You could say so. The paladins have arrested Bennet, our smith.
So I've heard. That's a bad business.
You can say that again.
How did that happen?
Bennet went to town to buy supplies. Well, he never came back.
If you want to learn more, you should ask Hodges, he was in the city with Bennet.
Any news of Bennet?
They seem to have taken him to the barracks and tossed him into the dungeon.
How can we get him out of there?
I don't have any ideas so far. I can't get to his cell to talk to him.
All I can do is keep my ears open, but there isn't much to learn around here.
Why aren't you out hunting dragons?
That's not my kind of thing, I'll leave that to the others.
Nah, nah. Fresh sea air - that's what I need now.
Would you fancy leaving this island?
More than anything. What have you got in mind?
I found out where the leader of the dragons is hiding. He's on an island, not far from here.
I intend to get rid of him for good.
Sounds like a blast. If you can use me, I'm in.
Couldn't you use a teacher for dexterity or combat with one-handed weapons on your journey?
The ship's already full, but I'll get back to you if there is a change.
I knew I could rely on you.
We're all going to meet at the ship.
A man of action, that's what I like. See you later.
I appreciate your offer, but I have no use for you.
You must know what you want. If you want to talk about it later, you know where to find me.
It's better if you don't come along.
As you like, but in the future, think about what you promise to whom.
Are you still interested in the voyage?
Normally, I don't let people treat me like that, but since you're one of us, I'll let you get away with it this time.
We'll meet on the ship.
Don't take it personally, but I think you were right.
It's better if I stay here.
How's it going?
Hurry up. The orcs will certainly come back.
Well. This grotto sure is spooky.
Teach me your abilities.
No problem.
You have to bend your front leg a bit and keep the back one straight - then you have a firmer stance.
Keep your hips flexible, that'll help you dodge a counterattack.
The upper half of your body has to act in harmony with the rest.
You always have to watch your footing.
Always use the entire sole of your foot when sneaking.
You don't really seem to care about all this.
Ah, you know, I thought you'd make it.
What are you going to do now?
No idea. I guess I'll follow you for now.
What's your business here? If you want something, make an appointment.
Who are you?
I am Larius, the local governor.
Even if it may not seem so at the moment, I am the most powerful man in the city.
So you're in charge here?
I ... well ... at the moment my hands are tied.
That Lord Hagen is in command here, for as long as he is in the city at any rate.
I didn't mean to intrude.
You have failed utterly at that. So go away!
How's it going?
What business is it of yours? As long as the paladins are in the city, Lord Hagen takes care of all the affairs that concern the city.
The judge hired some thugs to assault you. I can prove it.
Don't talk such nonsense, or do you want me to have you put in chains?
Even if you are a warrior of Innos ...
Even if you are an ordained magician ...
My word still has weight in this city. Do not dare to sully the honorable name of the judge ever again!
Ah. It's good that you've come.
What's up?
I found this in the old chapel.
It's a magic rune. I think it will teleport you straight back here to the farm.
I thought you might be able to use it.
Are you here to bring the money for Onar?
I already told you not to do anything stupid here.
Onar has heard that you've earned yourself quite a record in the meanwhile .
Accordingly, he wants more money now.
How much?
I thought you were smarter than that.
