Then I have good news for you.
Suddenly, there is no one left who saw you commit murder.
None of the people will now testify that they saw you stealing.
There is no one left who SAW how you beat up one of the farmers.
Apparently, all the charges against you have dissolved into thin air.
That's one way of getting around problems like that.
In any case, you no longer have to pay.
But mind your step in future.
One thing is clear: You must, nevertheless, pay your fines in full.
So, what about it?
How much was that again?
Who the devil let YOU in here - (surprised) - YOU are the new fellow who has been causing trouble?
I had heard from Gorn that you were still alive, but that you would come here ... anyway ...
It is good that you have come to me before everything becomes even worse for you.
The mercenaries are tough lads and the farmers here aren't exactly squeamish, but you can't just go around killing people.
To say nothing of the other mischief you've done here.
I can help you get out of this mess with a clean slate.
It's gonna cost you, though. Onar is a greedy man, and only if HE turns a blind eye will the matter be forgotten.
It's a good thing you've come. I have heard that you stole something here.
And knocked the farmers around.
AND killed a few sheep.
You just can't pull that kind of thing around here. In such cases, Onar insists that I bring the culprit to account.
That means: you pay, and he pockets the cash - but then at least the matter is forgotten.
If you get involved in a duel with the mercenaries, that's one thing ...
But if you beat up a farmer, they run straight to Onar. And he expects me to do something.
Not to mention that he isn't exactly thrilled when someone kills his sheep.
You'll have to pay a penalty. Onar pockets the money himself as a rule - but it's the only way to settle the matter.
Onar expects me to protect his farm. And that includes his sheep.
You will have to pay him compensation!
How much?
I want to pay the penalty!
Good! I'll see to it that Onar gets the money. You can consider the matter forgotten.
I don't have enough gold!
Then go get it as soon as possible.
But just don't think you can steal it here on the farm. If you get caught, things will be even worse for you.
Who the devil let YOU in here - (surprised) - What are you doing here? I thought you were dead!
What makes you think that?
Gorn told me that it was you who brought down the Barrier.
Yes, that was me all right.
I never would have thought that a man could survive something like that. What brings you here? You aren't here without a reason ...
I absolutely must talk to the paladins in town. Can you help me get to them?
(distrustful) What's your business with the paladins?
That's a long story ...
I've got time.
(sighs) Xardas sent me on a mission. He wants me to obtain  a powerful amulet, the Eye of Innos.
So you're still allied with that necromancer. I see. And the paladins have this amulet?
As far as I know - yes.
I can help you get to the paladins. But first you need to become one of us.
How can you help me get to the paladins?
Trust me. I've got a plan. I think you're the right man for it ...
I'll take you to the paladins and you'll do me a favor. But first, join us!
What exactly are you doing here?
Quite simple: I'm gonna see to it that we all get off this island.
Onar hired us to defend his farm, and that's exactly what we're gonna do.
But our reward is more than just our pay. By helping the farmers, we cut the city off from its provisions.
And the less the paladins have to eat, the sooner they'll listen when I finally make them an offer of peace.
Too bad that you had to join up with them of all people.
What is your offer going to look like?
Essentially, it will be about our pardons and free passage to the mainland. You'll learn more when the time comes.
I want to join you!
I'd hoped you'd say that! I can use every able man here.
The last mercenaries I accepted have done nothing but stir up trouble!
In principle, you can start right away. Well, first there's one or two things that we need to get straight, but it's no big deal ...
What do I have to 'get straight' before I can join you?
Onar, the landowner, is the one who employs us. You can only stay on the farm with his approval.
And then there's the boys. I can only accept you if a majority of the mercenaries agree that you join us.
But don't go to Onar before everything is straightened out. He's a very impatient fellow ...
How can I convince the mercenaries to vote me in?
By doing what is expected of you as a mercenary, I should say.
Talk to Torlof. He's usually outside in front of the house. He'll put you to the test.
If you can pass that, you should have earned a large part of the necessary respect.
He'll tell you everything else you need to know.
What do you know about the 'Ring of Water'?
(laughs) I might have known. You just have to mingle in everything, don't you?
Come on, tell me.
I'm only marginally involved in this. I know that this secret guild exists here and that the Water Mages are behind it.
Since the fall of the Barrier, I am no longer bound to the agreement that I came to with the Water Mages back then.
Of course, I still help when I can. But most of the time, I have my own problems and barely any time for other things.
If you want to know more about it, you should probably talk to Cord. He's one of them, as far as I know.
I'm ready to join you!
Not before you have passed Torlof's test.
Then you've passed Torlof's test?
Yes.
That's good.
What do the other mercenaries say?
I'm not quite sure whether enough of them are on my side.
Then talk to Torlof, he knows just about everything that's being said here on the farm.
Most of them are on my side.
Good, then go see Onar now. I've already talked with him.
But you'll have to negotiate your pay yourself.
Have you seen Onar?
He agrees.
Welcome aboard, lad!
Here, take some decent armor first!
I'm glad to have you with us.
I already have your first assignment.
It has to do with the paladins. It's time you went to see them.
You wanted to go there anyway.
I see you've placed yourself in the service of the paladins.
You entered the monastery? (laughs) I'd have expected anything but that.
Well, you can't become a mercenary any more now.
But who knows, maybe you can do one or two things for me - or me for you.
We'll see. In any case, I wish you all the best.
But don't even think of pulling the wool over my eyes, got it?
And how can I get to the paladins now?
Very simple. You'll take our peace offering to them.
I know Lord Hagen, the commander of the paladins, from my time in the royal army.
I know how he thinks - he doesn't have enough men. He'll accept the offer. At least he'll listen to you.
I've written a letter - here.
In any case, that should get you admitted to see the leader of the paladins.
I brought Lord Hagen your peace offering.
What did he say?
He said we would grant absolution to you, but not to your people.
That stubborn fool. Most of the men in the KING's army are bigger cut-throats than my men.
What are you going to do now?
I'll have to find another way to get us out of here. If need be, we'll capture the ship. I'll have to think about it.
Pulling my own head out of the noose and abandoning my men is out of the question.
Why do you want to go to the mainland so badly?
As you know, I served the King as a general.
But his sycophants betrayed me, because I knew something I shouldn't have known.
They tossed me into the mining colony, and the King allowed it.
I've had a lot of time to think about it.
I shall avenge myself.
(astonished) On the King?
(determined) On the King! And on all his sycophants. They will all bitterly regret what they did to me ...
I'm going to head for the Valley of Mines.
I didn't think you would stay on the farms for long.
If you go back to the colony, keep an eye out for Gorn. The paladins are holding him prisoner there.
Gorn is a good man and I could really use him here, so if you get a chance to free him, take it.
I have freed Gorn.
Yes, he already told me. Good work.
He's worth more than Sylvio and his boys put together.
Gorn told you about me?? What happened to him?
You remember him, don't you?
Sure.
He got caught by the paladins and was sent back to the Valley of Mines with a penal convoy.
If the road to the Valley of Mines weren't plastered with paladins and orcs, I'd have sent a couple of the boys already to free him.
But the way things are, there's no point. Poor devil.
Let me think ...
Big, dark, bad, with a big axe - he reconquered our ore mine with you back in the colony.
Onar now has a few sheep less thanks to Bullco ...
Oh, leave me alone with that shit! I have enough trouble as it is.
Me too. Bullco seems to have a problem with me. He wants me to leave the farm ...
Yes, and? Assert yourself.
You can tell him he should restrain himself, otherwise I'll deduct the lost sheep from his pay ...
I've come from the Valley of Mines. The castle there was attacked by dragons!
So it's true! Lares said that rumors about dragons are circulating through the city ... I didn't believe it ...
What about the paladins?
They've been thoroughly decimated.
Good! Maybe now Lord Hagen will think again about my offer ...
And if not ... (hard) Then we'll find another way to get out of here ...
Good! Maybe that will make Lord Hagen move to the Valley of Mines with his men ...
The fewer paladins stay here, the better.
What about some better armor?
You fulfilled your assignment.
I have some better armor for you here. That is, if you have the wherewithal.
Torlof has an assignment from Onar that should have been taken care of some time ago.
Take care of that first - then we'll talk about better armor!
Give me the armor.
Here you go. Some good armor.
But it isn't a gift! First I want to see some gold!
Do you have better armor for me?
I sure do.
Give me the heavy armor.
Here. Very good armor. It's the same that I wear.
You know how it works. First the gold!
Don't you have anything else for me to do?
You can't get enough, eh? You're in plenty of trouble as it is. What else do you want, then?
Another assignment. I'm a mercenary, remember?
All right. I've got something. It's just the thing for you.
I have a debt to settle with the judge in town. I'd actually prefer to do it myself.
But the paladins wouldn't let me within a stone's throw of his house.
The thing has to be handled with a bit of consideration. So pay attention. You'll go to the judge and offer him your services.
You'll try to win his trust and carry out some dirty work for him, until you find something to incriminate him.
The swine has done so many dirty jobs that it stinks to high heaven.
Bring me something I can use to blacken his name with the militia, so that he spends the rest of his life molding in the slammer.
But I don't want you to kill him. That would be too quick. I want him to suffer, understand?
Do you think you can do that?
No problem. How much?
Your reward depends on what you bring me. So make an effort.
I'm not going to do that. I won't play doormat for that swine.
Don't make such a fuss. Anyway, he's the one who busted you and had you tossed through the Barrier. Or have you forgotten that?
Do what you want, but I think you'll make the right decision.
I found something to incriminate the judge.
Really? What is it?
He hired a few thugs to mug the governor of Khorinis.
Shortly afterwards, he had them arrested and pocketed all the gold.
I brought you the written order the judge gave those thugs as evidence.
Show me.
At last. That should be enough to make him bleed. I'm impressed.
I'm willing to shell out quite a bit for that. Here's your reward.
And not a word about this to anyone, got it?
That's terrific. But the matter has resolved itself. The judge is dead.
Some idiot blew him away. Oh, well. That's fine with me, too.
Here's a few coins. That's all this note is worth to me now.
What about Bennet?
So you heard about that. The bastards have locked him up, just like that.
As if I didn't have enough problems with my own people - now I have to take care of the paladins, too.
What will you do about Bennet?
I don't know yet. A few of the boys would like to run to the city and knock Lord Hagen's teeth down his throat.
Luckily, we don't have enough people for an operation like that, and besides it's not my style.
Are you going to stay here and see what happens, then?
Certainly not.
Lares is still in the city and trying to find out how we can get Bennet out of there.
Until that happens, I'm trying to calm my people. I only hope that Lares doesn't take too long.
Oh, yes. Before I forget ... Buster wants to talk to you. He wouldn't tell me what it was about. Maybe you should go see him!
Can I help you in this matter with Bennet?
Sure, a bit of intelligence and sanity certainly wouldn't hurt in this matter.
Innos knows, there are enough idiots running around here.
Go to the city and see if you can find a way to get Bennet out of there.
But don't be too long about it, I don't know how much longer I can keep the men under control.
Any news about Bennet?
At least he doesn't seem to have suffered any lasting damage in jail.
Good work.
No, we still don't know enough.
What has happened in the meantime?
Sylvio, the bastard, has heard about the dragons in the Valley of Mines and has made everyone here on the farm totally crazy about it.
He's tried to convince the boys to follow him to the Valley of Mines. He's promised them fame, honor, gold and all sorts of things.
A lot of them have no interest in getting killed for Sylvio, but there were quite a few idiots who fell for his drivel.
The end of the story is that they got outfitted by Bennet and then set off.
(dismissively) Ah. Basically, I'm glad that Sylvio is finally gone from the farm.
Can you train me?
I can show you how to fight with a two-hander.
But I don't have the time to teach you the basics as well.
As soon as you have reached a certain level of skill, I'll take you in hand. Until then, you'll have to find another teacher.
I've heard you're pretty good. But I bet I can still teach you a thing or two.
So, if you want, I can teach you something. That'll cost you a bit, though.
How much?
1000 gold pieces and we're in business.
That's too expensive for me.
Think about it. Teachers of my caliber are hard to find.
Deal. Here's the gold.
All right, I promise you: I'm worth the price.
Let's start with the training.
Now you are a real master in two-handed combat.
You no longer need a teacher.
Now you are a real master in two-handed combat.
You no longer need a teacher.
The lizard people are distributing dragon eggs all over the country.
I might have known. It's time we got out of here.
So what am I supposed to do with them?
Smash them. What else?
Maybe the shells can be used for making armor or something like that.
They look pretty stable. Talk to Bennet about it.
How's it going on the farm?
Well, since Sylvio left, we've finally had some peace around here.
That doesn't sound too bad.
Unfortunately, we don't have less work. The men are becoming more and more discontent, because they now have to do the work of Sylvio's men on top of their own.
But let me worry about that. I can handle it.
Do you have an idea how I could take over the paladins' ship?
Do you think I'd still be here if I did? That thing is better guarded than the ore transports were in the Old Camp.
There must be a way to get on the ship.
Sure. Getting on board is easy.
After all, we have the judge in our power. You should go to him and squeeze a letter of authorization for the ship out of him.
I have a forged letter of authorization here. With that the ship's guards will let you pass.
But that isn't everything. To navigate the ship, you need a captain, a crew and so on.
There's a whole string of requirements involved.
Do you know anyone who could navigate the ship?
As far as I know, Torlof used to go to sea. He knows what's what.
Who should I hire as a crew?
You'll have to decide that for yourself. But I would only take people that I trust. Do you have enough people you can trust?
If you need a smith in your crew, you should ask Bennet. He is certainly the best you'll find.
The written authorization did the trick. The ship's mine now. The judge was very cooperative.
Well. Your long period of humiliation with the bastard has finally paid off.
I want to steal the ship.
And how is that supposed to happen?
Piece of cake - I go there, show them your papers, and take the ship.
If you say so. Here, I hope you know what you're doing.
Would you accompany me on the ship?
Are you kidding? Of course I'm in. I have a few old scores to settle on the mainland.
Besides, I can teach you one and two-handed combat. I could be very useful to you.
The ship is full now, but I'll be back if there is an opening.
Go pack your things, then!
What? Right now?
Yes, I'm planning to get out of here, and if you want to join me, come down to the harbor. We'll meet at the ship.
I've waited a long time for this moment. I'll be there.
I'll let you know if I can use you.
You must know what you want. But you can never have enough good fighters around.
(grins) Unless they're utter morons like Sylvio.
I can't use you after all!
Suit yourself, you know where to find me!
I can use you after all!
I knew you needed me! I'll see you on the ship.
You know what, screw you. First you say I should come, then you send me away again.
Find yourself another idiot!
What job will you take over?
Someone has to watch the ship. I'll stay here and make sure that it's still around when you come back.
How's my ship?
Don't worry. I've got everything under control.
Everything's fine. Those miserable orcs are welcome to come back any time. Then they'll get their next hiding.
I need some training.
What exactly do you want to train?
Your defense is terrible, but it will have to do somehow.
Your wrists are still much too stiff. You have to hold the weapon loosely.
Always remember, the swing comes from the hips, not the wrists.
The strongest blow is useless if it doesn't hit anything. So use your strength wisely.
We can be on our way now. The enemy's dead.
Very good. Then tell the captain to weigh anchor.
You'll take me to the mainland, won't you?
Yes. Khorinis will survive without you.
Then I can finally pay my long delayed visit to the King.
I've waited a long time for this ...
What do you think? Shouldn't patience finally be rewarded?
Patience and some striking arguments.
(laughs) Yeah. It won't work without a bit of armed force. It was an honor going into battle with you.
May our paths cross again some day after this adventure.
How's it going?
(bored) How much do you want?
What do you mean, 'how much'?
I'm the moneylender and you came to me. What could you want from me? Money, of course.
Lend me some money!
Sure! How much would you like? I charge 20 percent!
I'll think about it.
Make up your mind! Don't waste my time!
50 gold coins.
Small fry, huh? I want it back tomorrow, got it?
200 gold coins.
That's a lot of money. I'll see you here again tomorrow, and the money too, understand?
1000 gold coins.
You got a couple of screws loose or something?
I'll give you 100. And don't forget, I want it back tomorrow!
Do you always throw your money at people like that?
(amused) Don't worry. You'll be back. Otherwise I'll find you and kill you. It's that simple.
You've got such a distinctive mug that it wouldn't take long for me to find you.
So don't even think about mucking around with me.
You're overdue, you bastard! Give me my cash! And since I had to remind you about it, it gets more expensive.
That will cost you 30 percent instead of the usual 20.
I'm not giving you anything.
Oh yes, you will.
I'll pay my debts.
Lucky you! And now scram!
You don't have enough on you! Well, fine. I see I'll have to teach you a lesson.
Don't take it personally - I have a reputation to maintain.
Here's your money back!
Don't worry. Lares has already taken care of this for you.
That bastard is a friend of yours, huh? Oh well, none of my business. Have a nice day.
Wonderful! Nice doing business with you.
You don't have enough! Come back when you have it. Your deadline is still open. Remember, 20 percent!
Can I borrow some more money from you?
Do you think I'm stupid? Buzz off!
No more now! I just had a big outlay and I need every coin.
Come back in a few days!
(remorsefully) Some miserable pickpocket has stolen my ledger ...
You didn't have anything to do with this business, did you?
(grins) Me? No.
Yes, yes, all right. Just get out of here ...
Hi.
Hi, I'm Lennar. Welcome to the digger's camp.
Diggers? I thought this was the bandit's camp...
Right, but the bandits are also only here to dig. (shrugging) So...
(naively) Yes?
Do you have any idea who was behind it?
(enthusiastically) Sure!
(hectically) Let me tell you: I bet that Emilio is behind this!
(hectically) He always ran to the mine like a crazy man. He dug as much as he could.
(slyly) But since the attack, he's been sitting on his bench, not budging an inch.
(realizing) It's obvious! To get into the mine, he has to have a red stone from Esteban.
(conspiratorially) I bet he doesn't dare look him in the eye.
What would Emilio get out of Esteban's death?
What do I know? Maybe he has a pal in the mine who would take over Esteban's place then.
(to himself) Yeah, that would make sense...
You really do have a red stone for me.
Excellent. Now I'll work that damned rock to crumbs - I already know exactly where I'll go!
One more thing - if you go mining, watch out that you don't strike too HARD. Otherwise your pickaxe will get wedged in the gold!
Can you teach me anything about gold mining?
Certainly, but if I teach you something, you'll be able to mine more gold.
That's why I'm asking.
Sure. But if you can mine more, it's only fair if I get a share of it.
Well...
You might as well give me my share in advance. Let's say...
Fifty gold pieces.
Teach me something about gold mining!
Good. Regular swings will take you forward. Don't overdo it - but also don't fall asleep swinging.
And don't always strike at the same spot - try to work around a good-sized nugget.
Do that and you're on the way to becoming a master digger.
First I want to see my share!
Everything all right?
Nice and regular - that's the way to get the fat nuggets!
Is that YOU? - Really! Man, am I glad to see you!
Lester! How did you get here?
That was a crazy escape. After the barrier exploded, I wandered around the area for a while in total confusion.
Then I spent days fighting my way through these woods until I finally found this valley here.
Diego, Milten and Gorn are still in the Valley of Mines. At least, I think so.
Am I supposed to know you?
Hello? Anyone home? I risked my neck so you could get that weird stone.
You owe me something ... This time you should remember THAT.
You still remember Diego, Milten and Gorn?
Sure. What about them?
As far as I know, they should have survived the destruction of the barrier.
I have no idea where they are now - those three are probably still hanging around in the Valley of Mines.
If you run into them, let me know.
Diego, Milten and WHO?
Don't tell me you can't remember any of that. The focus stones - the troll - the water mages' enormous pile of ore?
I'm not so sure ...
That'll come back. It took me a while to get my head straight, too.
What happened?
After the Sleeper was defeated, the entire Brotherhood lost their minds.
Without their master, they were all just empty husks.
And you? What about you?
It was the same for me. I had nightmares and even hallucinations. But once my head was more or less clear again, I ran for it.
Once I thought I saw a huge black shadow pounce on a group of fugitives and burn them all up in a giant cloud of fire.
At that moment, I really thought a dragon had come to kill me.
Did you see anything else?
No - I took to my heels and ran!
How long have you been hiding out in this valley?
I don't know exactly. A week, maybe. But there's one more thing:
When I came here in the evening, I took a look up on the mountain - there were only a few trees there.
And when I looked the next morning, that tower was there. I could have sworn it wasn't there before. Since then I haven't left the valley.
You mean Xardas' tower? I knew he was powerful, but creating a tower just like that ...
Xardas the necromancer? He lives in that tower? I don't know if I like that ...
Don't worry, he's the one who rescued me from the Sleeper's temple. He's on our side.
You need to tell Xardas about the shadow, it could be important.
You don't think it was my imagination? You mean there was really a ...
... dragon. Yes.
You're getting into the thick of it again, am I right?
I shouldn't say in the thick of it ... not yet.
(sighs) Well good, if it's so important, then I'll go see him - but not now.
For the moment, I'm going to rest. I'm still exhausted after the escape from the penal colony.
I think you've got big plans. I'll see you later at Xardas'.
I'm on my way to Khorinis! What do you know about the town?
Khorinis? Well, it's a seaport, nothing special.
Why do you ask?
I must go and see the paladins who are said to be in town.
(laughs) Really? Hah. They won't even let you into the town, and certainly not to where the paladins are.
Do you have any suggestions how I could get into town?
I certainly do. I worked for an old alchemist named Constantino some time ago.
He has great influence in the city, and he's instructed the guards at the gate to let anyone through who can sell him rare herbs.
So it's quite easy, really. You collect a large bunch of the plants that grow here all over the place, and then you pretend you're working for Constantino, and in you go.
But don't collect just a mix of this and that. The guards aren't all that bright, and they know nothing about alchemy.
The bundle needs to look good to them if you want to get through.
I think that 10 specimens of the same kind of plant should do the trick.
Thanks for the hint.
The thing with the plants for Constantino worked like a charm. It got me past the city guards.
Just like I said. You should listen to me once in a while, my friend.
What do you know about the area?
If you keep going down that way, you'll come to a farm. The city starts a little way beyond that.
But be careful, there's not just wolves and rats hanging around here, there's goblins and bandits too!
Are you still exhausted?
And how. (yawns) I told Xardas everything. Now I'm going to sleep for a while. Like, a day or ...
... two ... or longer.
Hey, you're finally back! You have to go see Xardas right away, there's a problem.
That I certainly believe.
All hell's broken loose since you left.
Talk to Xardas, he's waiting for you!
Xardas gave me this rune for you. It'll help you get to him faster. We'll meet again there.
You don't look all that hot.
I don't feel all that hot either, man. I'm totally wiped out, and I've got a constant headache.
Every time one of those black hoods shows up it gets worse.
And I can tell you exactly why.
Yeah? I don't think I want to know.
These black hoods - or the Seekers, as we magicians call them - used to be the followers of a powerful archdemon. Does that ring a bell?
Mmh. No. Unless you're trying to tell me that ...
Yes, exactly. The Seekers used to be followers of the Sleeper. The renegade sect crackpots from the Swamp Camp.
They're your people, Lester. The former Brotherhood of the Sleeper. Now they are nothing but soulless minions of evil.
I had a notion, but I hoped it wasn't true. Do you mean he came back? Is the Sleeper here again?
Good question. All I know for sure is that I need to stop the Seekers before they become too powerful.
I don't like it, but I suppose you're right. I'm sorry, but all this crap is getting to my head.
The headaches are still there, but hopefully the problem will have been dealt with soon.
One way or another.
My headaches are getting almost unbearable. And now these lizard people are constantly attacking me, too. I've got to ask myself where they all come from.
These headaches just won't stop. There's something brewing.
(sighs) I think I'll have a rest first.
Where's Xardas?
He's gone, and he left these demonic beings behind in his tower.
I think he doesn't want anyone sniffing around his tower in his absence.
Where did he go?
He didn't say that. He only asked me to give you this letter from him.
I read it. Sorry. I was curious.
And?
No idea, I didn't understand a word, man. But one thing's clear to me: we won't see him again any time soon.
I think things just got too hot for him and he headed for the hills.
I found out where the enemy is hiding.
Don't ask me why, but I feel like I should go with you.
What do you mean by that?
I can't explain it, but I know that I'll only learn the answer if I come along with you.
I'm sorry, but the ship's already full.
Maybe it is, maybe my fate is meaningless compared to the events that are ahead of us.
You know what you have to do. Stand up against evil - don't worry about me.
I'm not important.
Then come with me and get your answers!
I'll meet you at the harbor. I'll go down there once I'm ready.
Hurry up, our time is short.
I can't take you along.
I understand. I probably won't be any great help to you.
No matter who you take along - make sure you can trust them.
And take care of yourself.
I've got no more room for you after all.
I understand you. I'd probably do the same in your situation.
If you need me, I'll help you. You know where to find me.
I need a friend to help me.
I knew it! We'll see this thing through together, just like before.
Evil had better watch out. We're breathing down its neck.
I think it's better if I stay here after all. Good luck.
Is there anything you need to tell me?
Mario slipped off when the orcs attacked. In spite of the chaos here on the ship, I was able to keep an eye on him.
He just marched right through the orcs' blockade, and the orcs let him go by untouched.
I had a funny feeling about the bastard from the beginning. He's in cahoots with the enemy.
That strange guy who calls himself Mario makes me uneasy. He has an evil aura.
Watch your back, my friend.
Not at the moment. Maybe later.
You were right. Mario has betrayed us.
Yes. I may not be too perceptive otherwise, but this case was clear to me.
Be a bit more careful about choosing your companions in the future.
We won't be here much longer.
It's like my headaches just blew away.
How did you do that?
I have destroyed the enemy.
It must have been something very powerful. So what was it, exactly?
An undead dragon.
Your former friends from the Swamp Camp gave me a pretty hard time.
Yes. Faith can move mountains. That's how it's always been. Unfortunately, they served the wrong god.
I'll need some time before I can really get over all this.
Hopefully, nothing like that will ever happen again. There isn't as much swampweed in the world as I'd like to smoke right now.
I don't believe it! The bastard is running around in MY clothes!
Hey, you!
Since you were here the last time, some of my stuff has been missing from my chest!
You should be making yourself useful around here, not sniffing around in my house, you lazy bum!
You give me back my clothes right now!
Here, take them back.
If you want them, you can PAY for them!
(curt) Now go make yourself useful!
I don't have them any more.
You already sold them, huh? (ranting) I'll teach you, laddie!
Forget it!
(ranting) I'll teach you, laddie!
Why are you hanging around on my land?
(appraising) Whose side are you on? The rebelling farmers or the King?
What can I do for you?
I'm for the peasants!
Ha! That damned warmonger Onar will drag us all into the grave!
What do you think, how long will the paladins just stand by?
After what Onar has done, the whole city is in an uproar.
I'm for the King!
(contemptuous) 'For the King!' That's what the city guard said when they took half my sheep.
But where are those bastards when we have to keep the bandits off our backs? Where will they be when the orcs invade us?
I'll tell you: in the city, behind thick walls.
So, leave me alone with the King.
I don't understand ...
What?! Don't mess with me, boy! I want to know where you stand! So, who are you for?!
I need some sensible clothes!
I can give you clean farmer's work clothes.
Can you pay for them, then?
You could work off a part of the price ... if you're someone who is LOOKING for work.
How much for the work clothes?
Well, we'll see ...
You've worked the field for me.
You helped my wife.
Vino says you were a real help to him. And that's saying something - he doesn't usually hold with day laborers.
Maleth says you chased the bandits off. The bastards have caused us a lot of trouble. Thanks to you we're rid of them!
It's not going to get any cheaper.
Give me the work clothes, then.
Well, my boy. Honesty is the best policy. Here you go!
There is a chest in my house where you will find clean things.
But don't even think about taking anything else without asking!
You don't have enough gold!
That's still too expensive.
Suit yourself ...
What's going on here, anyway?
Don't you know what's going on? Boy, where are you FROM? We're on the edge of a civil war!
Up till now all the farmers looked at the tribute to the city as fair taxation.
But since the paladins have come to Khorinis, the city guards visit us more and more often - and little by little, they're taking everything.
If it goes on like this, soon we won't have anything left for ourselves.
Some farmers are starting to rebel! Onar was the first of them!
Tell me more about this Onar ...
You're a mercenary, aren't you? So what else could I tell you about your boss?
Onar is the biggest farmer here in the area. He has broken with the city.
They say he's hired mercenaries to keep the city guard off his back!
Can't blame him.
In any case, no royal soldier dares to set foot on his farm any more.
Who are those mercenaries that Onar hired?
I don't know much about the fellows. Supposedly, a lot of them are former prisoners from the mining colony.
(scornful) Everybody knows what you can expect from them ...
What about you? Whose side are you on? Peasants or King?
I'm too close to the city to really have a choice.
But I'm glad about that. I wouldn't know how to decide.
The King is bleeding us dry, and Onar sets his mercenaries on anyone who won't join him.
That's why most of the other farmers are still undecided, but sooner or later they'll HAVE to choose one side or the other.
I'm looking for work.
I can't use another farmhand. But I could offer some work to a day laborer.
What I mean is, you can lend a hand in the field. And there are certainly a few other things to do around here.
I could pay you with gold. Or give you a few decent things to wear.
The things are worth a fair bit. I can't give them to you for nothing, but I can sell them to you cheap, if you work for me.
By the looks of you, I should say: take the clothes.
But you already have clothes, so you probably want the gold.
Anyway - the small turnip field next to the barn needs to be harvested.
All right ...
Then hurry it up a bit, before I change my mind.
I'm supposed to pull turnips? You've got to be kidding!
Real man's work isn't for such a 'fine gentleman', eh?
Get out into the field or get off of my farm!
I don't have anything else for you to do at the moment.
Here are your turnips!
Hey, you're not all that worthless after all.
Take them to my wife in the house and tell her to cook them.
What about my pay?
I can give you 5 gold pieces.
... or sell you the clothes cheaper, what's it to be?
But that's not even 20 of them!
Did you eat the rest?! I hope not, my boy, otherwise you can forget your pay!
Get out there, and get more! Go back to work or I'll make you!
Give me 5 gold pieces!
Here.
And don't drink it all at once.
Make me a better price for the togs!
Good! I'll give them to you for 10 gold pieces less.
Have you got anything else for me to do?
First get the turnips in from the field. Then we'll see.
I don't, but you can ask my wife or the boys in the fields. Maybe they need some help.
Andre sent me to you. Is there anything I can do for you?
Yeah, sure. Those damned field raiders are making me sick.
Do them all in. I don't care how!
I've done away with the things!
Well done. You're not a bad exterminator. I'll recommend you around. Here, take this as payment.
I think I've done away with the things!
Don't try to fool me. I can still see them. Either you kill the critters, or we can forget the whole thing.
How's your farm?
I can't stand it any more.
All of a sudden these fellows in black hoods showed up and posted themselves on the road, and on my farm.
They spent a long time talking to Vino and then they disappeared with him.
A short time later, my wife took deathly ill again. She spends most of the time just lying in bed. That happens to her frequently.
I'm falling apart here!
Why don't you take your wife to the healer?
We ought to go to the city to see Vatras about it, but I won't budge an inch from my farm as long as things are so chaotic here.
Have you talked to the men in black?
Sure. There was no way to prevent it.
I think they're looking for someone.
Why don't you do anything about those black robes?
I'd surely love to. But I saw how they burned one of the townspeople alive. Just like that.
Why should I risk my life?
What was their business with Vino?
They didn't say. They just took him with them.
Where did they drag Vino off to?
They went up that hill with him.
Vino isn't going to come back.
He is dead.
They drove him insane.
By Innos. Hopefully, this nightmare will be over soon.
Watch out for your farm!
I'll try.
You've got an orc problem.
(ranting) Damnit. Doesn't the stress ever end?
If this goes on, my farm won't be worth 3 gold coins.
I got rid of the orcs on your land.
Don't let anyone say that the paladins don't do anything for us small farmers.
Thank Innos. I can't give you much, but I hope you'll appreciate my gesture of gratitude.
I'll come back later...
(growls) Yeeaah, you just run away. I'll stay here and stop everything that gets too close.
So you did it, hm? Okay, good thing you didn't leave me hanging.
How's it going with you?
Well, at least I'm in now. Lucia brews some wicked liquor.
But Esteban won't let me into the mine. At any rate, not yet. He's given me another job.
And? What does he want from you?
There was an attempt on Esteban's life. He wants to know who's behind it.
(quietly) Esteban thinks that Snaf is involved. I'm supposed to keep an eye on him...
You're looking for the guy who's behind it, huh?
But I don't know anything about it. How could I? I was still in the swamp then...
Look, a new face.
Are you just going to stand around here, or have you come to help me?
Franco sent me. He says you could use some help. So, what's up?
It depends - what do you need help with?
The swampsharks are coming a little too close for me - high time to finish off a few of them.
What do I get for my help?
(growls) Franco will let you rot here if you don't do it.
If you want to get into the camp, you'll have to lend a hand. You won't get any farther here with just words.
Besides, I can show you how to gut the beasts.
But don't think Franco will send you straight into the camp just because we've had a little fun with the swampsharks here.
There are people out here who have been waiting a long time to get in.
And the next one who gets in is me... (growls)... it had better be...
What's in the camp, then?
(growls) The question is what ISN'T in the camp. There are no swampsharks, no swamp holes... no SWAMP at all.
Instead, they have booze and gold. As far as I know, they even have a woman. Got it?
Let's attack the swampsharks.
(growls) You've figured out how to get ahead here. I'm pleased. Psst... do you hear that? Yeeaah, I hear them.
I see - and what do we do now?
They're coming. They've got an appetite for a bite of human flesh. Well, we'll see WHO gets eaten here... Let's go.
The only good swampshark is a dead swampshark. That will be a warning to their brothers!
All right, is there anything else to do? Otherwise, I'll take off...
Do that. If you want to learn anything else - you know where to find me.
Show me how to gut animals...
If you want to learn something about bloodflies, go to Edgor. He knows all about them.
And if you want to gut swampsharks or lizards, you have to know how to remove skins and teeth. I can show you that.
How's it going?
Hey, thanks to you, I did it. I'm in the mine!
I may not know much about digging for gold, but that will come.
I've learned the most important thing. Legs firmly on the ground and always strike solidly!
It's good that you've come. You can pay your penalty right away.
You don't take the city laws very seriously, do you?
The list of your offenses has grown longer.
And don't tell me you didn't know that!
You will pay the maximum penalty.
Well, it appears that the situation has changed.
There are no more witnesses for your murder!
No one will testify now that you have stolen!
There are no more witnesses for your brawling.
All of the accusations against you are no longer valid.
I don't know what happened there in the city - and I don't want to know.
Simply make sure that you don't get into trouble here.
In any case, I have decided to excuse your debts.
See to it that you don't get into any more difficulties.
You will, nevertheless, pay your fines in full.
So, do you want to pay?
How much was that again?
Your reputation precedes you. You have violated the laws of the city.
You have gotten yourself into a fine mess.
Murder is a serious crime!
Not to mention your other offenses.
The guards have orders to execute every murderer on the spot.
Murder is not acceptable in this city. But you can show your remorse by paying your penalty
You are accused of theft!
Not to mention the other things I have heard.
That is a violation of the laws of the city. You will pay a penalty for that.
You have been involved in a brawl. In doing so, you have violated the law.
And what was that thing with the sheep?
A violation of the laws of the city - is a violation of the laws of Innos.
Therefore, you will pay for it.
You have been after our sheep - I didn't want to believe it at first.
Why must I busy myself with such trifles?
You will have to pay compensation!
How much?
I want to pay the penalty!
Good! I shall see to it that every one in the city learns of it - this will restore your reputation to some degree.
I don't have enough gold!
Then see to it that you acquire the gold as quickly as possible
And I'm warning you: if you add to your guilt, things will get worse for you.
I have already heard of you.
Lothar has reported that you wish to speak with me.
You are the stranger who has demanded the Eye of Innos.
I am Lord Hagen.
Paladin of the king, warrior of our Lord Innos and commander-in-chief of Khorinis.
I have much to do. So do not waste my time - tell me, rather, why you are here.
I bring an offer of peace from the mercenaries!
(grumpily) Hm - show me!
I know General Lee. I also know the circumstances under which he was condemned to forced labor in the colony.
I consider him to be an honorable man. I am prepared to grant him absolution - only him!
That does not apply to his men, however. Most of them are dishonorable cut-throats and have earned their punishment!
I shall certainly not offer them absolution. Report that to him.
Was that all?
The hosts of evil are gathering very close to here. In the Valley of Mines.
In the Valley of Mines? We have dispatched an expedition there. We are also aware of reports that say the pass there is occupied by orcs.
But thus far, nothing has come to me of an army of Evil.
Is this merely a trick to make me believe that it is necessary to form an alliance with the mercenaries?
No.
(skeptical) What army is that supposed to be?
An army of dragons who have gathered hosts of their minions around them.
Dragons? According to the old scriptures it is many centuries since dragons were last sighted.
Tell me - why should I believe a word you say?
But the question isn't whether you can believe me. The question is whether you can afford NOT to believe me when I tell the truth.
As long as I have no proof, I cannot afford to send even more men there.
So you want me to bring you proof?
Precisely. Cross the pass and go to the Valley of Mines. Once there, seek out the expedition - and when you have found them, speak to Commander Garond.
If anyone knows the situation there, he will.
If he confirms your words, then I am prepared to help you.
Does that mean you'll hand over the Eye of Innos to me?
The Eye of Innos ... good. Bring me proof, then I shall see to it that you are permitted to wear the amulet.
Then can I say I've got your word in this matter?
You can - for you have it.
What do you know about the Eye of Innos?
It is a divine artifact. (pensive) In the old prophecies it is mentioned in connection with dragons.
However, the scriptures also say that only a Chosen of Innos can wear it.
I AM a Chosen of Innos!
Then perhaps it will be possible for you to wear the amulet.
How am I supposed to get across the pass?
I shall give you the key to the gate to the pass. However, you will have to find your own way through the ranks of the orcs.
May Innos protect you.
I am looking for a metal ornament. It should have been by the stone circle near Lobart's farm.
If you mean this thing here ... we suspected that it might be a magical rune, but it turned out to be completely worthless.
You can have it if you like. I have no use for it.
Why have you come to Khorinis?
We are on an important mission for the kingdom. Our orders come directly from King Rhobar.
I told you that we have sent an expedition to the Valley of Mines. That is the reason for our presence.
What are your men doing in the Valley of Mines?
I see no reason to reveal that to you!
You were there. You should know.
All right, since you are going there anyway, I might as well tell you.
This is all about the magic ore. It can decide the outcome of the war.
Without enough weapons made of magic ore, the king's army does not stand the slightest chance against the elite warriors of the orcs.
And the ore mines here on the island are the last to which we still have access.
As soon as our ship is fully laden with ore, we shall sail back to the mainland.
The war against the orcs is going badly, then?
I have already told you too much.
I'm looking for a swordmaster.
So? You have found one.
Let us begin.
You are now a worthy swordmaster. I can teach you no more.
May your future deeds be guided by the wisdom of a swordmaster.
I want to take up service with the order.
Good, you have proven that you have the courage, the skill and the knowledge to serve Innos.
Your deeds bear witness to a pure heart.
If it is your wish, then I shall bid you welcome to our order.
To be a warrior of Innos means to devote yourself entirely to the cause of Innos.
Only the noblest and bravest warriors are accepted into our order.
If you are truly determined to become a paladin, you must prove that you are worthy.
I'm not quite sure yet.
Then go and free your heart of doubt. Return when you are prepared.
I am ready!
(serious) Then so shall it be!
(serious) Many men have taken this path and given their lives in the name of Innos.
(serious) Do you swear that your deeds will honor their deaths and proclaim the fame of Innos?
I swear!
Then, from now on, you are a member of our fellowship.
I hereby appoint you a warrior of Innos.
I give to you the weapons and armor of a knight. Bear them with pride, knight!
Henceforth, by virtue of your rank, you shall have access to the monastery.
Albrecht will teach you our magic, just go and talk to him.
And, of course, our quarters in the upper end of the city are now open to you.
How can I prove myself worthy?
Your deeds will show whether you are worthy.
We fight for freedom and justice in the name of Innos.
We fight against Beliar and his henchmen, who want to destroy the just order of Innos.
I understand.
You understand nothing at all! Our honor is our life and our life is Innos.
A paladin goes to battle praising Innos, and many of us have lost their lives on the altar of the eternal strife between Good and Evil.
Every single one of us has committed himself to this tradition. If we fail, we tarnish the deeds of our fallen comrades.
Only he who truly understands this is worthy of being a paladin.
How's the situation?
I must find a way to rescue this expedition.
We must do something against the dragons.
(to himself) Perhaps the Eye of Innos can save us all now ...
I shall go mad here. I am a soldier, not a bureaucrat.
With all this paperwork that I must do, I barely remember what my sword feels like in my hand.
I have the Eye - it is broken.
WHAT? By Innos! What have you done? We need the Eye!
Speak to Pyrokar! There must be a way to put it back together.
I bring you news from Garond. Here, he gave me these lines for you.
Our situation is worse than I had feared. But report to me on the situation in the Valley of Mines.
The paladins are holed up in the castle in the Valley of mines, surrounded by orcs.
There were many casualties in the prospecting operations, and there's barely any ore left.
Well, I should say that, without any help, the lads are lost. That's how it looks.
I shall find a way to rescue this expedition. You have done much for us. Innos will thank you ...
I'm not all that interested in his gratitude. I want his eye.
Yes, of course. I stand by my word. Take this letter. It will open the monastery gates to you.
Speak with Pyrokar, the highest Fire Magician, and show him this authorization. He will grant you access to the Eye of Innos.
One more thing, before you go ...
Take this rune as a token of my gratitude. It will take you safely back to the city whenever you want.
I need to talk to you about Bennet.
But that's the mercenary who murdered one of my men.
Bennet could help us to repair the Eye of Innos.
Even if he could summon down the power of Innos himself to earth ...
He has murdered a paladin. He will be executed for that!
How come you're so sure that Bennet is the killer?
We have a witness.
As you see, there is no doubt about the mercenary's guilt.
Who is that witness?
Cornelius, the governor's secretary, saw the murder.
His description fits Bennet, no doubt about that. As far as I am concerned, that settles the matter.
The mercenary will hang for treason.
I believe that Bennet is innocent.
The evidence is clear. He is guilty.
So what if the proof is wrong?
Be careful what you say. You raise some serious accusations.
If you cannot present me with evidence that the witness lied, then you had best hold your tongue.
Cornelius lied.
How do you know that?
Here, I've got his diary. Everything's in there.
(furious) That slimy little criminal!
In view of the new evidence, there is nothing else I can do.
By virtue of the office granted me by king and church, I declare ...
... that the prisoner Bennet is exonerated of all charges and is thereby a free man.
Cornelius is to be taken into immediate custody for perjury.
Save yourself the trouble. Cornelius is dead.
Then he has already received his just punishment. Well done.
He's made himself scarce.
Sooner or later, he will turn up. Then we shall arrest him.
Your deeds would redound to the honor of one of our own.
I carry the Eye!
(reverently) You bear the Eye!
And you have put it back together!
Then you are a Chosen of Innos!
I shall set out and kill all the dragons in the Valley of Mines!
Go with Innos and destroy Evil with his power!
The orcs' elite warriors are attacking the land.
What makes you say that?
I talked to one of them. Your name was mentioned.
Nonsense. My people have not reported a massive invasion of orcs so far.
Perhaps some of their scouts got lost in the nearby woods.
Those were no scouts. I took this ring from one of them.
Show me.
Mmh. That is certainly disturbing.
That is a sign of their strength. So the orcs have left their palisades and are fighting on the open field.
I haven't seen a whole lot so far. Mainly their warlords, and only a few fighters.
So? Then they must be plotting something else. That is rather unlike orcs that their leaders should leave their protective palisades by themselves.
It would be a good opportunity, however, to deliver them a telling blow.
If they lose their leaders, their morale will sink as well.
You have a new assignment, knight. Go and kill the orc leaders you can find here in the area.
Bring me their rings. That will be a tough blow to the orcs.
Ask Ingmar about this. He can give you a few tactical hints for fighting the orc leaders.
The orcs' elite warriors are his specialty. He has often had to deal with them.
Your word alone that you have killed the chief warlord of the orcs is not enough for me.
I need more tangible evidence if I am to respond to this.
There's something else I have to report about the orcish warlords.
Then tell me.
I can give you another orc ring.
I can give you some more orc rings.
I am proud of you. Carry on!
There may still be a few of them out there.
Soon we shall have forced them to their knees.
I would be amazed if you still found very many of them.
You are welcome to keep bringing me their rings, but I think the orcs have gotten the message now.
Here. Let me give you some gold towards your equipment.
The dragons are dead.
I knew that Innos would give you the strength to defeat the dragons!
Where is the ore?
The orcs are still besieging the castle in the Valley of Mines. Garond stands no chance of leaving the castle before the siege is ended.
(furious) Damnit!
If Garond isn't capable of handling the situation, then I shall have to see to it myself.
A few orcs won't stop me! Not me!
I have already informed my men. We are preparing for departure.
We shall ALL go. I shall leave only a minimal guard on the ship.
That should be enough then to finally put an end to the orcs!
I need a ship.
So do a lot of people, soldier.
(laughs) I hear that almost every day, reverend. But ...
You do not even have a captain, to say nothing of a crew.
What about the ship in the harbor?
It belongs to me, and that's that. We shall transport the ore with this ship.
Once that is done, then you can ask me again.
The orcs have stormed the castle in the Valley of Mines!
By Innos! What exactly happened there?
Somehow the gate must have opened ...
Somehow?! How is that possible... There must have been a traitor in the castle!
What are you waiting for?
We are still waiting for our equipment and provisions. Then we set off!
Now that the castle has been stormed, we need even more provisions.
But that will not delay our departure for long.
I've got to go!
Wait! You don't know the new laws of the city yet!
Later.
If I hear ONE more time that you are telling people here about dragons, you will be in big trouble, do I make myself clear?
As long as you are in Khorinis, you can feel safe.
The king's paladins watch over this city now!
Halt, stranger!
I haven't seen you come through this gate.
And?
And the guards on the other gate have orders not to let any unknown persons into the city.
Weeell ...
I shall have to have a word with those two!
But now for us two:
I am Lothar. Paladin of the King and humble servant of Innos, your Lord.
Our commander, Lord Hagen, has entrusted me with the task of explaining to all newcomers the new laws which apply to all inhabitants of the city.
Since people have started simply vanishing all over this town, everybody needs to watch out that they don't suffer the same fate.
I have an important message for the leader of the paladins!
The honorable Lord Hagen is not receiving anyone.
Lord Andre, the commander of the city guard, is responsible for all issues pertaining to the common folk.
I have come to get the Eye of Innos!
The Eye is a matter for Lord Hagen. Speak to him about it.
The sacred Eye of Innos! How do you know about that?! You are not a member of the order!
A magician told me about it.
I don't know what his motives were when he entrusted one of the secrets of our order to you.
But he certainly didn't mean for YOU to get your fingers on it.
But ...
I don't want to hear any more about it!
First you start with fairy tales about dragons and then this - incredible!
Listen - the city is threatened by dragons!
That can't be true!
Another lunatic!
We have enough unrest in the city as it is. And without some dimwit scaring people with fairy tales about dragons!
I immediately locked up the last person who was here telling dragon tales and sent him to the Valley of Mines with the prison transport. So mind your tongue!
We can't use anyone here who spreads panic among the people!
I have often heard that. But it is difficult to believe.
It would be better if you kept that to yourself. We must avoid fear and panic among the people.
Do you know anything about a stone creature from the stone circle at Lobart's farm?
Certainly. We destroyed it. It was a threat to the surrounding farms.
Why do you ask?
Do you think that's normal?
That stone monster, you mean?
As far as I know, the Water Mages are taking care of it.
I don't give it much thought. We have our tasks here in town, and in the Valley of Mines.
I see.
I am looking for a metal fragment of a ring ornament.
It should have been somewhere near Lobart's stone circle.
Yes, there was such a thing. The stone creature was carrying it. I thought it was a rune of magic.
I gave it to Lord Hagen. I've no idea whether he has still got it.
Somebody already reported the dragons here?
Yes. The fellow's name was Diego. I think so, in any case.
(threatens) I warned him - just like you! But the lunatic just wouldn't stop getting on my nerves!
(little sigh) All right - explain the rules of the city to me!
First: The honorable paladin Lord Hagen resides in the upper quarter, along with his troops.
That is why access to the upper quarter is allowed only to honorable citizens.
Second: The town hall in the upper quarter is now the command post of the paladins. Only the paladins themselves and members of the militia have access to it.
And third: Whoever is accused of a crime must exonerate himself with the commander of the militia.
Any questions?
The townspeople are simply disappearing?
Yes. It seems to be more every day.
It's most annoying that the militia have still not been able to discover what's behind these strange occurrences.
Small wonder that the town's inhabitants are very wary of strangers right now.
So don't provoke them when you're in town, understood?
How do I BECOME a citizen of the town?
Only those with regular jobs will be considered citizens of the town!
But don't think that you will be admitted to Lord Hagen just because you are a citizen of the town!
As a citizen you have access to the upper quarter - nothing more!
Only as a member of the militia will you have access to the town hall!
Where can I find work?
You will have to apply as an apprentice to one of the masters here in the lower part of the city.
As soon as a master accepts you, you are a citizen of the town.
However, the other masters must agree to it, that is the custom here in Khorinis.
If you were thinking about looking for work in the harbor district - forget it!
The scum of the city live there. Don't even go there, you would regret it!
How do I get to the upper quarter?
Say, are you listening to me at all?!
You are not a citizen of this town. You can save yourself the trip - the guards won't let you in.
The entire area behind the inner gate is off limits to you!
How do I get accepted into the militia?
By express command of Lord Hagen, only citizens of the town will be admitted into the militia.
I see.
If you want to know more, speak to Lord Andre in the barracks.
What do I have to do to get armor like yours?
(ranting) What? You aren't even a member of the militia!
You're not even a CITIZEN!
How can you even think of being allowed to wear the armor of a PALADIN?
Only a few militia soldiers, those who have performed extraordinary deeds, have been granted that honor so far.
(strictly) If you want to be a paladin, you have a long road ahead of you, my boy!
Where can I find the commander of the city guard?
Lord Andre can be found in the barracks at the other end of the city.
Where can I spend the night here?
If you are looking for a place to sleep, go to the hotel directly across from the barracks.
The paladins pay for the lodging of all travelers who come to the city.
The traveling traders from the marketplace are also lodged there.
You can talk to Lord Andre about everything else!
But I MUST see Lord Hagen!
And as I see, he accepted you into the militia.
Hm - he must know what he's doing.
How many masters are there?
I believe there are five altogether.
Tell me, didn't I make myself clear? No more tales about dragons!
How do you know ...?
That is NONE of your business!
That was the last time, understood?!
Where do I find the commander of the militia?
I am now an apprentice with one of the masters!
You again.
I have heard that you saw Lord Andre?
I told you that you could only join the militia if you were a citizen of the town.
I have reported to Lord Hagen that you wish to speak to him...
And? What did he say?
He has never heard of you.
Of course not. Did you tell him about the dragons?
Didn't I tell you to STOP these stories?!
I have heard that you already have the approval of some of the masters.
You're quite serious about this, aren't you?
You must obey the rules, just like everybody else!
Lord Hagen is not available.
If you have something IMPORTANT to say, go to Lord Andre. He will help you!
Ah! You again!
So you actually managed to get into the upper quarter!
Where did you get that robe?
I have passed the Test of Fire.
Incredible. Then what is happening here must be the will of Innos ...
You haven't joined Onar's mercenaries, have you?
How did you get in here?
I bring a peace offering from Lee ...
Bah! Lord Hagen will never agree to it.
There are some things you must heed here, otherwise you will wind up outside as fast as you got in here.
You are only allowed to enter the merchants' buildings. You can recognize them by the signs over the door - just so there are no misunderstandings.
The other buildings belong to important citizens - there is nothing there for you!
Even if you are now a member of the order of Innos.
As a member of the militia, you also have access to the rooms of the paladins.
But your quarters are still in the barracks.
The important citizens of this town live in this quarter. So treat them with respect.
Do we understand each other?
Sure.
Where can I find Lord Hagen?
He is in the town hall, at the end of the upper quarter.
But you will not be admitted there without a good reason.
I went to see Lord Hagen ...
And? You didn't bother him with your dragon tales, did you?
Yes, I did...
Tell me this isn't true ...
He sent me to get him some proof...
Well then, good luck. (to himself) What a lunatic...
I have the proof! Here is the letter from Commander Garond!
So there really are dragons?
I have done you an injustice. I shall pray to Innos for forgiveness for my behavior.
Has anything exciting happened lately?
Yes, that they let someone like you in here. Such a thing hasn't happened in ages.
You should know that best. As a member of the city guard, it is your task to see to law and order!
No.
And? How's it going?
Listen. If you want something to eat, go to Snaf. If you want something to drink, you're in the right place.
What do you drink here then?
We only have a little beer. The only beer on the island was brought by the paladins.
Just about the only good thing those fellows brought with them...
Otherwise we drink booze. I've got moonshine, grog and white rum -
(appreciatively) hmmm... you should try THAT - I got the recipe from Samuel. The old boy really knows his trade.
Aren't you from Khorinis?
Don't remind me! My life in that city was horrible.
While the ships with the new convicts kept coming in, there was still life in town.
But all those other guys... (laughs) No thanks. Maybe it's because we're on an island... well, those days are over.
I'm finished with Elvrich!
Why?
He's a wimp! When the bandits dragged me off, he didn't lift a finger to help me.
What are you planning to do?
We'll see. For now, I'll stay here with Snaf, Fisk and the others.
Have you already talked to Thorus? (rolls her eyes) Oh, Innos, is that a hunk of a man!
(laughs) Excuse me... let's get back to your question... I haven't set a goal, I'm only drifting.
You're not very fond of the paladins, are you?
Those fanatical murderers in the pay of the Fire Magicians? No.
That Lord Hagen occupies the city with his thugs, and everybody bows down to him.
And I didn't want to do that. I wasn't going to wait until they closed down the Red Lantern and locked me up.
The paladins don't only fight in his name. Innos chooses his warriors.
So? I believe it's the people who choose themselves.
Still, your words amaze me. You talk almost like you were one of them.
Have you ever killed someone?
No, and I'm very glad of it.
Please, let's not be so serious any more.
Instead, let's drink and enjoy every moment the gods give us.
Do you deny Innos then, wench?
How could I? It's just people who misuse his name.
But I never doubted Innos' divine splendor for a second.
The paladins are the warriors of Innos. They aren't murderers.
So? Blood sticks to their swords too - just like the weapons of the pirates or the bandits.
The only difference is they do it in Innos' name and not because they want to survive.
Nothing at all.
Give me something to drink.
Can you teach me something?
(laughs) Only too gladly. You can train your DEXTERITY with me.
I want to become more dexterous.
My name is Lutero. I buy and sell all kinds of things.
What wares do you have to offer?
Well, especially rare and unusual things. So far I have always managed to fulfill my customers' wishes.
Scram, buster! Don't you have anything to do? Then go find work - but elsewhere!
What do you want, novice? Shouldn't you be in the monastery?
Are you looking for anything in particular?
Yes, for my current assignment I need the claws of a snapper.
But not just any old claws. It would have to be something special - the claws of a mighty beast who has killed many men already, or something like that.
Where can I find snappers?
There are a few of them on this island, but most of them live in the Valley of Mines.
And what's in it for me?
I could find you a runestone.
I could get you a ring of invincibility.
I'll see what I can do.
I've got some special snapper claws for you.
My customer will be happy to hear that.
I don't have the runestone here. But I know where it can be found.
On your way from town to the inn, you'll pass under a bridge.
There, in a cave, a friend of mine has deposited a runestone in a chest. Here's the key.
Here's the ring I promised you.
Show me your wares.
What's your task?
My assignment is simple. I'm supposed to make sure that the orcs stay away more than 30 feet from the gate.
If they try to break through the portcullis, I sound the alarm. That's all.
What would one have to do to open the main gate?
For heaven's sake. Why would you want to know that?
I'm worried about the safety of the castle.
So am I, all the time, believe me.
And since I am such a faithful guardian, Garond has finally entrusted the key to the gate room to me.
(proudly) That's a great responsibility. I shall guard it well. I had to swear that to Garond.
Yes. Just imagine someone coming and simply pulling the lever to open the gate, and that rusty, old steel grating getting jammed.
Nobody could close the gate then. I mustn't think about what would happen next. It's a good thing no one knows that I have the key.
Never mind. Just asking.
Don't invite trouble by talking like that. Times are hard enough as it is. Now go. I'm busy.
Everything all right?
Yet another day laborer who doesn't know where to go? No problem. Talk with our farmer Bengar.
Sure.
What are you doing here?
I'm the shepherd here. It's not exactly a demanding job.
But now and then, you really have to watch out. Especially if you get too close to the pass.
What do you know about the pass?
Not much. Just that it leads to the old Valley of Mines that was surrounded by the Barrier until a few weeks ago.
Back then, the only thing we farmers had to be afraid of was the monthly caravan that took all kinds of goods to the Valley of Mines.
Those cut-throats often made life difficult for us out here.
Where can I find the pass to the old Valley of Mines?
Near the two waterfalls on the other side of the high pastures.
What is it they say about the Valley of Mines?
All sorts of things. Some of the boys say they've heard screams at night, some have seen strange lights over the mountains.
But if you ask me, it's all just old wives' tales.
Have you ever been to the Valley of Mines?
No. But I go near the pass once in a while. Then I always see those two paladins who stand around and keep watch.
It looks like they're making sure that nothing comes out of the valley.
Back then the Valley of Mines was a natural prison. If you went in, you never came out again.
Tell me more about the paladins. How long have they been posted there?
A week or two, I suppose. I don't know exactly.
Some time ago there was even a whole troop of them that disappeared into the pass. Since then, I haven't seen them again.
I don't see any women here at all.
You got that right. This is a men's farm, so to speak. Works pretty well, I think.
Don't work too hard.
I'll try.
What are you doing here?
I fled here from Bengar's farm. I didn't want to be butchered by all the creatures coming out of the pass.
You can't imagine what sort of things came out of the pass the last few days.
I can.
You need help.
(weepy) I just want to go home. I'll go back to Bengar. I hope he's still alive.
Leave me alone, magician. I can manage.
What's it like here?
Here I only have to put up with bandits. It's the lesser evil.
Bengar needs you. He wants you to come back to his farm.
I'm not crazy. As long as we have to live defenseless on the farm, I'm not budging an inch from here!
I've hired a mercenary. He will keep an eye on the farm.
That's different, of course. But wait a minute. Who's paying the guy, then?
That's my problem.
(inquisitive) Mmh. No chance to say no, eh?
No.
Good. Then I'll go back. I hope the lad's good for something.
Will you stay on Bengar's farm now?
Sure. I'll have to see this through now. We'll manage somehow.
I need to move on.
Don't let those beasts eat you. This is a very dangerous place.
Hey! When you get to our camp, give Henry a message from me.
The trees around here are damned stubborn.
He'll have to wait for his wood a while longer. Tell him that.
You're not from around here, are you?
You seem to have traveled far.
Busy?
Don't even ask. Henry wants me to chop down all the trees here.
Henry?
He's the leader of our troop.
He's stands around at the camp entrance all the time, talking big.
More dedicated service to the community, and all that crap.
But he doesn't lift a finger himself.
Henry is your leader?
Yes, the leader of our raiding troop.
Our CAPTAIN is Greg.
But he's not here at the moment.
Where's your camp?
Just continue down this path here, to the west.
You'll see Henry standing there soon enough.
Hey, stranger!
I saw how you came out of the mountains.
You can be glad you didn't come by here three weeks ago.
We would have taken you for an escaped convict. And we made short work of those!
You look completely done in.
You looked completely done in when you arrived.
Well, you look almost human again by now!
(distrustful) What do you want here?
I was attacked by bandits in the mountains.
Those filthy rabble! They were probably the same bastards who took one of our sheep last night!
You had terrific luck. Most people DON'T get away alive.
Those bandits won't trouble you any more ...
Why? Are they dead?
They picked a fight with the wrong guy ...
Thank Innos! Here - it isn't much, but I want you to have it!
I'll tell the others about this!
I know the hideout of the bandits ...
Do you want to attack them? Count me out! It's much too dangerous!
Besides, I have to watch over my sheep!
But if you think you can get the riff-raff off our backs, the whole farm would be very grateful to you.
I'm on my way to town.
The way you look, you'll have to bribe the guards to get in.
And you have to know what they want to hear.
They might let you in - if you tell them what they want to hear ...
And that would be?
Well, for example, that you're from Lobart's farm and want to go to the smith in the city.
But that won't do you any good. You don't look like a farmer.
I see.
I need better equipment!
I can imagine. But I'll tell you right now: we don't have anything to give away!
If you can pay for what you want, Lobart will sell you something.
Otherwise, go to him and ask him if he has work for you.
Where can I find Lobart?
Well, on the farm, of course! The farm belongs to him!
And don't try messing with him! He's thrashed a lot of tramps and thrown them off his farm.
Any new developments in the last few days?
Just go down the path to the city.
If you run into a fellow with a black robe, then you'll know what's new.
Have the black robes come to see you yet?
Yeah. They've been here for a few days. If you ask me they come straight from hell.
How are your sheep?
(angry) As if that would interest you at all. You have other problems.
My problems? What would you know about that?
(brusque) Do you belong to the city guard or not? Then do something about these black-robed bastards.
(angry) You filthy mercenaries only think of one thing: how do I get other people's money into my pocket.
You noble lords from the monastery should do something about these hooded fellows.
What's your problem?
I blame that moonshine rotgut Vino palmed off on me a few weeks ago.
I can hardly remember anything at all, man. I only know that my walking stick has been missing since then.
And that's what you're raising such a ruckus for?
That's easy for you to say, it doesn't belong to you.
Hey, watch your mouth, buddy.
All you can do is talk big. The best thing would be if you went away.
I think this walking stick belongs to you.
That's terrific. I ...
Just a moment. First you pay for it.
But ... I don't have much.
Then think of something else.
Okay. How about this? Yesterday I saw some bandits run past with a few bags of gold.
If I tell you where they keep their booty, can I have my walking stick back?
All right.
Okay. You just go west to that piece of woods over there. You'll find a ravine there.
You should find something in the cave there.
Sorry, not interested. I want your gold.
Here's everything I have. That has to be enough.
Don't get all worked up.
(irritated) Beat it.
HALT - in the name of Innos! I am Marcos, paladin of the king. Say what you want, and speak the truth!
A Chosen of Innos always speaks the truth.
Forgive me, reverend magician. I did not realize with whom I was speaking.
Yes, all right, never mind.
If I am permitted to ask - what brings you to this area?
Relax - I am in the service of Lord Hagen.
You're one of the troops. What orders bring you here?
Relax, we're working for the same boss - Lord Hagen.
Since when does Lord Hagen hire mercenaries? Speak - what do you want here?
I need to bring Lord Hagen proof that the dragons exist.
Then you shouldn't lose any time and don't risk your life unnecessarily.
Do you think you're going to find a dragon scale here you can take to him?
Try to reach the castle and speak to Commander Garond.
He must learn that you are on a mission from Lord Hagen! And he will take care of your assignment, too.
I come from Garond - he needs to know how much ore is ready for transport.
Tell Garond that I had to leave the mining site because the orc attacks became too intense.
I tried to reach the castle with a few people, but I am the only survivor.
I have stored the ore safely. There are FOUR chests. Go to Garond and report that to him.
Tell him that I will guard the ore with my life. But I don't know how long it will be before the orcs find me here.
Tell him to send me some support.
I'll let him know.
How's the situation?
I need a strong draught of healing potion!
I shall hold out - and I hope that Garond will send me support soon.
Thank you for your help. Innos will give us the strength to stand firm.
I shall stand firm because Innos is with me!
What's your job here?
I prepare the paladins for their fight against Evil.
Is there anything I can do for you, Master?
For me? No, I do not require your help. Pray rather for the well-being of the warriors of Innos who have gone to the Valley of Mines.
I prayed for the paladins.
You have done well. Now go back to doing your work.
What is 'Evil'?
Evil is everywhere. It is the power of Beliar, the eternal adversary of Innos.
It is the all-encompassing blackness which seeks to blot out the Light of Innos forever.
Beliar is the Lord of Darkness, of Hate and Destruction.
Only those among us in whose hearts blazes the Holy Fire of Innos will bear the radiant Light of Innos into the world and banish the darkness.
But there are only magicians and novices living in the monastery.
That is correct. In contrast to our community which honors the Word of Innos ...
... the paladins honor the great deeds of our Lord, above all else.
We are the representatives of Innos, but the paladins are his warriors, who go into battle in his name and increase his glory.
Is there anything you can teach me?
I am an expert in the magics of ice and thunder. I can teach you their power.
However, I only instruct magicians.
Teach me.
At the moment I cannot teach you.
Welcome, my son.
Since when are you one of the paladins?
Where do you come from?
That's none of your business.
(scolding) A paladin should always be polite and modest. It is your task to protect those who cannot protect themselves.
(scolding) It is a privilege and you should be thankful that Innos offers you this opportunity. Think about that!
(angry) There were times when it was not possible for rabble to enter our holy monastery. You are proof that those were better times.
(warning) I warn you, don't get up to anything here or you will be immediately punished. We shall exercise no false lenience.
Only for a short time.
Then I bid you welcome. In this battle we need every man who has the courage to oppose Evil.
The fate of us all lies in the hands of men like you. May Innos ever give you the courage you need.
I've come from the farms.
Then I bid you welcome in the name of hospitality. I hope that you will appreciate it.
Do not abuse your place as a guest, or you will have big problems.
What can you teach me?
Naturally, I cannot teach you your combat skills.
I can, however, bring the essence of Innos and his gifts closer to you.
Besides, it is my task to prepare you for the Consecration of the Sword.
And the magic?
Here we teach only our magic. You must learn the magic of the paladins in the city.
Maybe later.
You are heartily welcome here any time.
What do you mean by that?
When Innos had to leave our world, he left humankind a part of his divine power.
Only a few of us humans are allowed to use his power, and to oversee justice in his name.
And what do you want to bring closer to me?
I can set you on the right path to recognize the essence of Innos, and follow him.
What's the Consecration of the Sword?
The Consecration of the Sword is one of the paladins' most sacred rituals.
During this ceremony, the holy power of Innos flows through the blade of the paladin's sword and gives the sword undreamed of powers.
A sword so consecrated is a paladin's most valuable possession and will accompany him his whole life long.
I want to consecrate my sword.
If you are determined to take this step, you will first need a magic blade.
With this, you should then retreat to the chapel and pray.
