Good, thanks a lot. If you want, you can train with me.
I already brought the recipe back to Neoras.
Oh shit - I'll probably never get to study here. So what. I'll train you anyway.
I'll get back to that later.
I want to become stronger.
You're pretty strong now. I can't teach you any more.
Who are Agon and Babo?
Agon takes care of the herb garden. He's also a novice, but he acts like he was the Chosen One himself.
Babo came to the monastery shortly before you. At first he helped Agon in the herb garden.
But they must have had a fight, and Babo has been sweeping the courtyard ever since.
Do you know what happened?
Not exactly. You'll have to ask them. But Agon's word has more weight than that of the other novices because he's the governor's nephew.
Look here, I brought Betsy. Can I leave her with you?
Yes, of course. Good-looking animal. I'll take good care of her.
Hm...somehow I seem to have misplaced it. I'll come back later.
About the library ...
That's the locked room to the left, next to the gate.
But you'll only get the key when Master Parlan decides that you may study the teachings.
You lucky duck! You got the key to the library, even though you've only been here for a short while.
Use your chance and study the old scriptures!
Hello. Thank you for helping me. I shall make the most of this chance and learn a lot.
But you certainly don't have time now to talk to a simple novice, Master.
How's it going?
Great. Since I've been allowed to study, everything is wonderful.
I loyally fulfill all of the tasks given me, Master.
Every day, Innos sets new challenges before me. I'll continue to work on improving myself.
How are the sheep?
How do you think they are? They stand around and munch grass.
I'd rather know what's happening outside. The magicians seem to be very nervous.
There are dragons in the Valley of Mines. They are besieging the royal troops together with the army of orcs.
Dragons - I always thought they only existed in horror stories.
They are there, believe me.
But the king's paladins will deal with them, won't they?
We'll see.
Strangers in black robes roam the countryside.
What do you mean? What sort of strangers?
Nobody knows where they've come from. They wear long, black robes, and they cover their faces.
They seem to be some kind of magician. At least they are capable of magic.
That sounds very disturbing, but I'm sure that the High Council will solve this problem.
Pedro betrayed us.
I'd heard that, but I didn't know that you were aware of that, too. That's why I didn't say anything.
Is the enemy stronger than us - I mean, can we defeat him?
We're not dead yet.
What is your task?
I am a strategic officer of the king, and I currently answer to the honorable commander Garond.
We are the last of the paladins here in the castle. All the others have left or fallen.
It is now our responsibility to bring a good end to this expedition. And that we shall do. By Innos - that we shall do.
I have a message for you.
What is it?
Your brother is dead. He got as far as the pass.
(murmurs) ... my brother ...
Innos puts me to a severe test. But he died as his servant ...
This news is like an arrow which pierces my heart. I shall seek new strength in prayer.
I am to go to the mining sites.
This isn't going to be child's play, beware. First of all, seek out the paladins. They are leading the three groups.
If you want to know more about it, speak to Parcival.
How's the situation?
You need to find all scrapers, plus the ore. Then we will figure out how we can leave this valley.
The expedition has hit rock bottom. But we won't give up, for Innos is with us. He will lead us safely from the valley.
Your appearance here is a sign of hope to us.
We need you. Go talk to Garond - he will explain everything to you.
I'm back already.
I never thought we would see you here again, after that scene when you were here a few days ago.
I bid you welcome in the name of our order.
I can see that you have been made a magician. My respects.
Maybe your appearance is a good omen.
Can I help?
At the moment, we seem to have done everything which is possible from here.
There is something, however. Something very important which you could do for us outside of these walls.
We are planning to cut off the serpent's head.
I think you should find somebody else.
I cannot spare a single man - you are our only hope.
What do you mean by that?
We know one of their leaders. His name is Hosh-Pak.
He is one of the most influential shamans among the orcs.
And what is my role?
Kill him.
That's a joke!?
You are the only one that we can spare. All the other knights are needed here.
It is not easy for me to ask this of you, Master. But you would be the best choice for this assignment.
You want to help us, don't you? Well, then ...
Hosh-Pak's tent is situated outside of the siege circle, on a cliff to the south of here.
You can almost see it from one of the windows there.
I still need some equipment.
We don't have much left that we could give you.
Well, I can offer you this.
I'll take the healing potions.
A good choice. May it be of benefit to you.
I'll take the mana potions.
I hope you can use them. May Innos protect you.
I'll take the elixir of strength.
Here, this will certainly come in useful. I wish you luck.
I'll take the elixir of dexterity.
May your arrows never fail to hit their target. Here you are.
I shall not murder Hosh-Pak in such a cowardly fashion.
Can you even begin to imagine how bad our situation is?
We are under siege by a superior army of orcs. Our supplies are nearly used up.
If we do not succeed in getting the ore to the ship, the orcs are going to lay waste to the entire kingdom.
Everything we stand for will be forgotten.
All right. I shall kill Hosh-Pak.
I'm glad to hear that.
Hosh-Pak's tent stands on a small cliff. You must have seen it before.
It is not far from the path to our mine. Directly in the shadow of the big mountain.
Hosh-Pak is dead!
Great, this is bound to unsettle the orcs. Maybe we do stand a chance after all.
I think this is going to win us a reprieve of at least a week.
Any news?
You mean, apart from the fact that the orcs have invaded us?
Yes. You're our hero. Getting rid of all the dragons at once is no mean feat, I should say.
The orcs seem to be unsettled by Hosh-Pak's death.
The orcs are becoming more and more numerous. This is not good.
I need more information about the dragons.
I've already killed one of them. Can you tell me where to look for the others?
I have this feeling that I didn't get to all the dragons yet. Maybe I overlooked something?
A rather large swamp has developed in the last couple of days to the west of the old castle. That's rather suspicious, wouldn't you say?
There is a rock fortress to the south, far behind the volcano.
Our spies have reported that the fortress is heavily guarded. Maybe one of them is hiding out there.
Following the last attack by the dragons, one of them is said to have disappeared near the volcano in the south. You should look for it there.
There is a vast region of ice to the west. It wouldn't surprise me if one of the dragons were hiding out there.
At the moment, alas, I've got nothing for you.
I'm bringing the wine from the monastery.
Excellent. That's what I've been waiting for.
I have already agreed on the price with Master Gorax. I'll give you the 100 gold coins straightaway.
All right, give me the gold, then.
Here you go. It was a pleasure doing business with you.
Are you trying to pull a fast one? The price is 240 gold coins.
So, Gorax warned you, did he? All right, maybe the two of us can do a bit of business. Look - I'll give you 100 gold pieces for the wine.
You tell Gorax that I pulled the wool over your eyes and you'll get FOUR spell scrolls from me.
Hey, just give me the 240 gold coins.
You don't want to do business, eh? -sigh- All right, here's the gold.
All right, sounds fair enough. Give me those spell scrolls.
Here are the spell scrolls and the gold.
What kind of spell scrolls are they?
No idea - I don't know anything about that. They're from a guest who ... eh ... forgot them here, yeah.
Who are you?
I'm Orlan, the keeper of this modest tavern.
What are you looking for, stranger? Maybe a decent sword, or a good piece of armor?
A good swig from the country stills, or just some information?
I can give you all that and more, if your coins ring.
Do you know that fellow with the eyepatch?
I've seen him here before. A nasty piece of work.
Back then, he moved into one of my upstairs rooms, along with a huge crate.
He had to be constantly nagged about paying the rent for his room. And even then, he took his own sweet time about it.
Then, one day, he vanished just like that - along with the crate. I don't want anything to do with the likes of him.
Am I being paranoid, or are you staring at my ring?
I'm not quite sure what to make of that.
It's an aquamarine. Ever seen one before?
Yes, I have. Welcome to headquarters, Brother of the Ring.
... even if you appear to be a few candles short of an altar.
What can I do for you?
Man! I belong to the 'Ring of Water'!
Do you now? Hard to believe they would pick such a moron.
What do you want?
Have you ever used a teleporter stone?
Are you out of your mind? As long as none of the Water Mages swears to me that there's no danger, I'm not going anywhere near those things.
They ordered me to hide one of those teleporter stones, and apart from that I'm staying well away from them.
Can I have a look at this teleporter stone?
I don't care. Here's the key. I've blocked the entrance.
Where is this teleporter stone?
There's a cave to the south, not far from my tavern. That's where the Water Mages found one of those things.
I'm here to join the Ring of Water!
(curtly) I see no ring here. Can I get you a drink?
I heard that the 'Ring' is going to meet in your tavern.
That's right. They should be starting just about now.
I wonder what's taking them so long?
The meeting is today?
Yes, at least that's what I seem to recall.
I hope it won't get so late again.
They should be here before long.
We'll see.
What kind of armor can you offer me?
I have here a very nice piece that is sure to please you.
I'd like to buy the leather armor.
A wise decision.
Sorry. Once you have the wherewithal, we can do business.
I'll think about it.
As you like. But don't wait too long.
Show me your wares.
Certainly, Brother of the Ring.
Of course. It is an honor for me to receive such an important guest.
Of course, sir.
If you can pay.
How much do you charge for a room?
For a brother of the 'Ring'? Nothing.
For a knight of the King, I always have a room available. Free of charge, of course.
I would never dare to take money from one of Innos' earthly representatives for my services .
Here's the key to the upper rooms. Pick one for yourself.
Give me 50 gold coins for a week, and you can choose a room.
All right. Here's the dough.
Here's the key. The rooms are upstairs. But don't get everything dirty and pay your rent on time, understand?
You don't have 50. Money first, then pleasure.
Damn expensive.
Then you'll have to look elsewhere, my friend.
(slimily) I am delighted with your distinguished visit. Stay as long as you like. It is an honor.
When will I finally get my rent?
Here's your 50 gold coins.
Well, it's about time.
Where are you hanging around all day?
You don't want to know.
Mmh. Well, it's none of my business anyway.
Say, are you trying to trick me? You don't even have enough money to pay for that meal. I'll teach you, you ...
Forget it. I'm not paying any more.
Well, I'll teach you, you miserable cheat.
There you are, finally. I've been waiting for you.
What happened?
The drinking contest is finally over.
Who won?
This time Randolph has won. Rukhar must have been having a bad day.
Once again, Rukhar has gotten Randolph pickled. It was only to be expected.
So, well, I hope that was the last time. I don't want that kind of to-do in my house ever again, remember that.
That was a fine mess you got me into. Now I can play lookout for Rukhar again.
Why?
As long as he's holding his little contests in there, it's better if no outsider learns about it. It's not good for business, you see?
How's it going with your tavern?
Times have been better, you know?
People's purses aren't as open as they used to be.
Hopefully these black magicians will move on soon, otherwise I can close the tavern.
Almost nobody dares to come here anymore.
You're selling mine shares?
Sure. You can get anything from me, if the price is right.
How's it look?
Who are YOU? Are you one of the bandits?
Do I look like one?
You're wearing our clothes, but I don't know you.
To be honest, you do.
No. Judging from your clothes, you've come a long way.
What are you doing here?
I'm cutting wood for our camp.
I'm slaving away here, almost breaking my back, and back in camp they're all lounging in the sun.
And?
If I had known all this in advance, I'd never have become a pirate.
Henry is waiting for the wood he needs for the palisade.
First I want to find out what has happened to my buddy Malcolm.
Look, relax. I'll bring him that stupid wood sooner or later.
Go and tell him that.
What's up?
My buddy Malcolm has disappeared.
One of those filthy lurkers attacked us.
So we fled into this cave.
But that lurker came after us.
Malcolm fought with it, and then they both fell into that hole over there.
Seems to be full of water.
The lurker and Malcolm continued to fight down there for a while. Then it went quiet.
I've no idea whether he's still alive or not.
How do I get down into that crevice?
Beats me. You can either climb down or jump, I suppose.
Your pal Malcolm is dead.
I thought as much. Poor devil. I should have helped him after all.
You're really brave, you know that?
I couldn't have done that with the crevice.
Hey you, wait - you look familiar to me.
What do you want?
I've seen your face before somewhere ... ah - right!
Here - we found this picture on some bandits we picked up a few days ago - it looks a lot like you.
Apparently, those guys were looking for you.
No, you've got to be mistaken. Everything's fine with me ...
Whatever you say, stranger.
But if that happens to be YOUR mug after all - and if you have some problems - keep them outside of this town. Things are difficult enough here as it is.
And strangers who bring trouble into the city don't stay here long - I hope I make myself clear.
Gee, I'd never have thought of that myself.
Very funny ... what did those fellows want from you?
Ask them yourself. You've got them safely locked up, haven't you?
No - they're dead.
I guess we'll never know, then.
If you're in some kind of trouble - go talk to Lord Andre. Maybe he can help you. You'll find him in the barracks.
What do you know about the bandits?
They've all come from that blasted mining colony. But there are several splinter groups.
Some have holed up in the mountains, and others have joined up with Onar, the landowner.
But it's the bandits outside of town who cause the most problems.
They're the reason that none of the merchants venture beyond the city gates now.
What do you know about the bandits who robbed Hakon the merchant?
Oh, THAT matter. Don't remind me ...
As far as we know, they're responsible for a lot of the attacks on merchants.
Those rats have crawled into their holes and don't dare come out again.
Once, we were able to track them down and follow them. But we broke off pursuit in the woods outside the city.
There's too many beasts roaming around there, it's much too dangerous.
But there's one more thing ...
A few of the stolen goods have shown up in Khorinis.
This means that they know how they can smuggle the wares into town and sell them ...
Yeah, we suspect they have a fence in the city. But we haven't been able to catch the guy yet.
If you find out anything about the business, remember Lord Andre has posted a bounty for the fence.
Where did the bandits who had my wanted poster come from?
A-HA! So it IS your mug after all. Why didn't you admit that right away, huh?
(demanding) What are you wanted for?
I don't know - honest!
Yeah, yeah. I know. Let me tell you something. If I thought you were in cahoots with these bandits, you'd already be cooling your heels in the slammer, understood?
Still, I had better report this incident to Lord Andre ...
But - to answer your question ...
We picked them up near the landowner's place.
But they don't look like Onar's people.
I think they're part of a smaller group which has holed up in the mountains near Onar's farm.
But if you intend to go there, let me warn you. Those cutthroats make short work of everyone!
I'll remember that.
How's the situation?
I've always said that these mercenaries can't be trusted.
It's high time we taught that scum a lesson. Bennet didn't think this up all by himself.
I am deeply shaken by the murder of the honorable paladin Lothar.
But I know that the church will find a just punishment for the villain.
What are you doing roaming around here? If you're trying to free your mercenary friend, you can just forget it.
It's pathetic. Now they're stirring us up against each other.
If you hadn't managed to find the real culprit for the murder, the orcs wouldn't have had to lift a finger.
I'm worried about what will happen if the paladins leave now.
You can count on us, we will use every available means to make sure that this city doesn't degenerate into a sink of iniquity.
Just mind your step here. We watch rogues like you very closely around here.
At the moment it's quiet. Only the bandits outside the city are causing us problems.
What can you tell me about the scrapers?
I assembled the three groups.
Marcos, Fajeth and Silvestro are the paladins who each lead a group.
Marcos' group set out in the direction of an old mine - led by an old digger named Grimes.
The other two groups set out together.
Jergan, one of our scouts, has reported that they set up camp near a large tower.
Which group of scrapers did Diego go with?
This convict - Diego? He's with paladin Silvestro's group.
Do you know how to get to the mining sites?
There's no safe way into that valley. But it seems to make sense to me not to take the direct route.
Keep away from the orcs and the woods - and may Innos protect you.
How's the situation?
The camp is surrounded by orcs. They've really dug themselves in.
But even more alarming are the attacks by the dragons. They have destroyed the entire outer ring by now.
Another dragon attack and we'll take heavy losses.
How many dragons are there?
We don't know how many there are all in all, but it's more than one.
But that isn't all. The whole Valley of Mines is full of evil creatures that support the dragons.
Let's not kid ourselves - without reinforcements from outside, our chances of getting out of here alive are slim.
Everything is still quiet. But that can change quickly.
We'll stand firm for as long as we can.
Innos will aid us. His light illuminates our hearts!
Hey! Don't you have anything better to do than constantly chatter at me? Beat it!
Everything all right?
Up to now!
Yeah, damnit.
(laughs) Ah. Now I understand what you've got in mind. No, my friend. Not this time.
Don't bug me.
Did anything important happen?
You belong to those scum who call themselves DRAGON HUNTERS?
Really, I had expected that you had more honor in you than to join up with those people.
I'm worried. Very worried.
What for?
Recently these men showed up. They call themselves dragon hunters.
As far as I'm concerned, they're nothing but idlers and criminals.
If it were up to me, I'd chase them all out of the castle. Let the orcs take care of them.
Unlike Lord Hagen, they are here.
(laughs bitterly) Yes, unfortunately they're all we have.
Innos is putting us through a very hard test indeed.
You should give them a chance.
They're getting one. Unfortunately.
Garond is convinced they can be of help to us.
But I'll keep an eye on them. We have enough problems with the orcs, we really don't need more trouble.
Don't you think you're exaggerating?
Absolutely not. In our situation we need men who set a shining example.
Warriors to wake the fire of Innos in our fighters' hearts.
Instead, these scum destroy the morale of my warriors.
I need to talk to you about Jan.
Jan? Who's that?
A dragon hunter. He's a blacksmith.
Oh, yes, I remember. What about him?
He wants to work in the smithy.
Out of the question. He isn't one of us and I don't trust him.
Can't you reconsider the matter with Jan?
No, my decision is firm.
Garond wants Jan to take over the smithy.
Mmh. If that's so, then as far as I'm concerned he can have the smithy.
Even if I do think it's a mistake to trust this Jan.
And apart from that?
Aah, leave me alone!
Traitor! I know for certain that it was YOU who opened the gate.
You'll pay for that.
How are you holding up?
(wearily) I'm beat ... completely worn out. Is it a glorious sunny day, or one of those clear nights where a thousand stars are twinkling?
(even more weary) I don't know ... where's the gentle rain of summer ... the cool evening breeze ... I can feel them no longer ...
(resignedly) It's the eyes that go first in here ...
Hang in there. Your rescue is near.
(wearily) Thanks. Thank you for your words.
Here, drink that.
Thanks, that does me good.
Here, have some meat stew.
Thank you, I feel a little stronger now.
How are you now?
Better, thanks to you. I can feel my strength returning.
How's it going with you?
(grins) Hey, if it isn't my rescuer. Thanks again, now I can just relax all day.
All right, I'll be moving on, then.
Hey, how are you?
How do you think I'm doing? I spend the whole day at the grindstone, sharpening blades.
And yesterday Engor shortened our rations again. If it goes on like this, we're all going to starve.
Or we'll all be killed by orcs. Not a pleasant prospect.
Who is Engor?
Engor manages the provisions and shares out the rations. And they get smaller every week.
Sure, you can bargain with him, but only for cold, hard cash.
And you can't afford that?
The most I can get for the lousy pay we collect is a couple of turnips!
Where can I find this Engor?
In the knights' house. Just go through the open entryway next to the smithy.
What's up?
That damned Engor should hand out more rations!
What's up?
Engor handed out a new ration of meat. Man, was that badly needed.
Your arrival is the only news that's really new.
(severely) Wait a moment, my son.
Rumor has it that a valuable artifact has 'disappeared' from the sanctuary.
I do not even want to know more about it - I expect that it will return to its place.
You have violated the rules of our community.
And although you were already accused, you have laden more guilt upon yourself.
Your guilt can only be purged by a larger donation to the monastery.
How much?
Who do you think you are? Pray to Innos for forgiveness for your deeds!
Your situation has changed.
There are no more witnesses for your murder!
No one will testify now that you have stolen!
There are no more accusers who will testify to your brawling!
All of the accusations against you have been dropped!
Perhaps you can fool me - but Innos knows your deeds!
Your sins are now forgiven.
Take care that it stays that way!
You will pay your penalty - as is the will of Innos!
Free yourself of your guilt!
How much was that again?
We have not yet spoken with one another, and already you have incurred a burden of guilt!
You are guilty of the worst of all crimes! Murder!
And you have burdened yourself with even more guilt!
If it were up to me, you would be condemned on the spot, you murderer!
If you pay the penalty for your crime, however, I will absolve you of your guilt.
Theft is a violation of the rules of the monastery!
Apart from that, you have also broken other rules.
These transgressions must be punished. Thus is the law of Innos.
You will pay an appropriate penalty to the monastery.
We do not tolerate brawling in the monastery. Such behavior violates our rules.
And why are you killing our sheep?
We live here according to rules. And they also apply to you.
For your crime, you will make a donation to the monastery.
You have killed our sheep. You will pay compensation for that!
How much?
I want to pay the penalty!
I accept your donation. Your transgressions are forgiven. May Innos give you the wisdom not to make the same mistakes again.
I haven't got enough gold!
You could have thought of that before you committed those transgressions.
Perhaps you have learned from this. Cause no more trouble, then you will not have to pay.
When you have done that, we shall speak about your work here in the monastery.
Take your tribute to Gorax at the monastery at once. He will handle it further.
Welcome, new novice, I am Parlan.
I am ...
(interrupts) ... a NOVICE. It is not important who you were before. Now you are a servant of Innos. That is all that matters.
And with the acceptance into the Brotherhood of Fire, all of your previous transgressions will be forgiven.
May Innos bless this man, who places his life in his service, and wash away his sins.
And now?
First you will fulfill the duties of a novice. You will work and serve the Brotherhood.
But take your sheep to Opolos first, he will take care of it.
You can give your gold to Gorax, our steward. You will find him in the winery.
I'm looking for the Eye of Innos.
I don't know who told you about that - but the divine artifact is not accessible to anyone.
Where is the Eye of Innos kept?
The fewer people know this secret, the better it is protected. Seek for it - and you will not find it.
Tell me about the Eye of Innos.
All right. The Eye of Innos contains a part of the divine power of Innos. Only ONE chosen servant of Innos is permitted to bear the amulet.
It was created to protect us from the powers of Evil when the time has come.
I need to talk to the leader of the paladins!
Lord Hagen does not receive novices - only we magicians are permitted to see him.
How can I serve the community?
First you will fulfill the duties of a novice. You will work and serve the Brotherhood.
But take your sheep to Opolos first, he will take care of it.
You can give your gold to Gorax, our steward. You will find him in the winery.
When you have done that, we shall speak about your work here in the monastery.
It is the time of peace. The work of the novices begins in the morning and continues until darkness.
You should sleep, too. Come again when the time of work begins.
Speak to the other magicians. They will give you tasks.
I will oversee your work, and when you have fulfilled your duties adequately, you will receive permission to enter the library to study the word of Innos.
Can I have access to the library?
You have obtained fire nettles for Brother Neoras.
You have found Brother Neoras' recipe.
You have vanquished the black wolf which threatened the shrine.
You have succeeded in finding four novices and thus cleaned the chambers.
You have distributed the food to the novices fairly, as Brother Gorax instructed you.
Gorax was not satisfied with you, because you did not hand out the food fairly.
You have sold the wine to Gorax's satisfaction.
The less said about the matter with the wine, the better ...
Yes, you have worked enough. Now it is time for you to study the teachings of Innos. Speak to Master Hyglas in the library.
I hereby give you the key.
You have certainly worked, but it is your duty to continue serving the community.
First fulfill your duties in service to the community. When you're done working, we shall speak about this again.
Do you have an assignment for me?
Hmm ... Yes, there is indeed something you can do for the community.
The novices' chambers could do with a good sweeping. Take care of that.
But that will take forever ...
Then you had better start right away, hadn't you?
About the novices' chambers ...
You actually managed to find four novices to help you. I think they can now return to their daily work.
Well done, novice. You have accomplished the task I set you.
Indisputably - it is not a simple task. But with the help of Innos you will manage.
How can I learn the art of magic?
You are not here to receive the gift of magic - you are here to serve Innos.
But I can show you how to increase your magic power.
I want to undergo the Test of Fire.
What ...? Hm ... (insistently) Are you really serious?
I insist.
You are an exceptional novice. All right, if you are serious, then speak to Master Pyrokar.
I want to increase my magic powers.
Your magic power has grown. I cannot help you to increase it more.
If you want to learn more, ask Pyrokar.
You have sworn your oath, Brother. Welcome to our ranks.
I will instruct you in the Circles of Magic when you have enough experience.
Take this runestone as a token that the power now lies in your hands.
Teach me the first Circle of Magic.
The first Circle of Magic allows you to use the runes which you have created.
You can now learn the formulas of the spells to create your own runes.
Each of us specializes in an area of magic. So consider well what sort of magic yours shall be.
Teach me the second Circle of Magic.
Enter now the second Circle and learn to work even more powerful magic.
But also remember that you bear a responsibility. Not to me and not to Pyrokar - but to Innos.
He shows you the direction - but your deeds form the path.
The time has not yet come.
Teach me the third Circle of Magic.
Yes, the time has come. Enter now the third Circle of Magic. New spells await you.
You will need them, for Evil draws nigh and it can be thwarted only with the power of Innos.
I have now taught you all of the Circles that I can pass on. Karas will instruct you in the higher Circles.
It is not yet time for you to learn the third Circle.
Teach me!
I cannot teach you more formulas at the moment.
May Innos protect you.
I see that you have decided to fight on our side. I am glad.
We can use every man. You should go speak directly to Marduk, he is responsible for you paladins.
I do not know why you were allowed to enter the monastery. I am Parlan, and I am responsible for our novices.
I do not want you to keep them from their work with stupid questions. Is that clear?
I shall do what I please.
There must be reasons why you are tolerated here, but there is a limit to everything.
If you cause trouble, you'll pay for it. So stay away from the novices.
Sure.
I certainly hope so.
Have you got anything else for me?
Yes. As a member of the library, you are given the key to the library. There you will find Brothers Karas and Hyglas.
If you like, you can speak with them there.
But leave my novices alone!
(threatening) I do not like to repeat my self. Leave the novices alone.
They are supposed to purify their spirits with physical labor and prepare themselves for life in the monastery.
(energetic) I will not tolerate further distractions!
Where can I find ...
... the church?
Lord Almighty! Has Innos stricken you blind?
(cynically) Where is the church? Oh my, where could it possibly be?
... the library?
The library is at the end of the colonnade to the left, directly across from the church.
... the chapel?
The chapel is the room halfway along the left colonnade. That's where the paladins pray to Innos.
... the cellars?
The entrance to the cellars lies halfway along the colonnade on the right.
I've been sent by the Water Mages. I've come to free you.
(warily) Really? And why should I believe you?
Do you want to get out of here, or not?
Of course I want to get out - but ...
Vatras sent me. If that's not enough for you, you can all rot in this hole for all I care.
(hastily) All right, I believe you.
(baffled) Really? Wow, that went faster than I thought. Okay, now all we need is a plan.
Trying to flee poses a great risk. William tried, and he bought it.
The prisoners are peasants and workers - they trust me, but they won't dare to mount an escape.
But that can't be the plan.
Just see to it that the guards don't attack us, and then we'll get out of here.
Okay, I'll handle that. Tell the others to get ready.
What do you want me to do - get you a pardon from Raven?
(grinning) Not a bad idea.
Will I have to kill all the bandits before you'll budge at all?
(scared) But that would be insane!
All's well, you can make yourselves scarce.
Great. I know a cave in the swamp where we can gather for now. But then what?
Leave the swamp towards the south-west. The Water Mages have set up their camp near the ruins of the old temple.
They're going to show you the way out of this valley.
Thanks, thank you so much. (commencing) We are all very deeply ...
Never mind.
The guard is done for, you can go now.
And what happens once we leave the mine? The other guards will slaughter us then. No, that's too risky.
Don't you want to leave?
Of course we do. We're only waiting for the right moment.
So? Everything okay with you?
All's fine. The Water Mages led us safely out of this accursed valley.
And what will you do next?
I'm going to continue to fight for Lee. And some day we're going to leave this island ...
And then?
We shall see. If the war is still raging, we'll go up against the orcs. But that remains to be seen.
Do you deal in smithy equipment?
Huno has steel. I only have a few lumps of ore.
But I won't give that up. It's the only thing I have of value.
Do you work for Huno?
I wanted to make a bit of gold and took up with Huno. But since then, Esteban hasn't given me anything at all.
He said he can't use me any more.
What else can I do but continue to slave away for Huno?
Nothing, man! I didn't have anything to do with it! What do you want from me?
Huno is suspected of having something to do with the attack...
I don't know anything about it!
But you work for Huno! So you do know something!
(despairingly) I know nothing - honest! I have to go now!
Do you know what Esteban will do to you when he finds out you're covering for Huno?
Man! Leave me alone. I don't have anything to do with that business.
(friendly) Tell me what you know now or I'll slam you into the wall, Paul!
You can't rough me up just because you work for the boss.
(nicely) I can!
Cut the crap!
(impatient) Paul...
(hectically) All I know is that Huno has a bone to pick with Esteban.
(hectically) He's constantly going on at me about that Esteban. That he screwed up business for him and so on...
I only listened and never said anything.
Exactly! You see. That wasn't so bad.
Finally! Here, I want you to have my ore for that.
Everything else all right with you?
Yes, I'll get a heap of gold out of this rock!
I told you everything I know!
I just want to do my job, man!
Hey, what's up?
Man, I'm busy. Leave me alone.
Hey, it's time to hit the road.
What do you want? Can't you see I'm busy?
I need a weapon, so come back to the barracks.
Damnit, your weapon can wait.
Come on, Andre's already missed you, too.
Hmpf ... damn. Okay, I'm coming already - but when you report back to Andre, don't tell him I was here.
I've come to get myself a weapon.
First go to Andre and report back to him.
Well, look who's here. Our new comrade. And he wants a sword.
You didn't tell Andre I was in the Red Lantern. You seem to be okay. Here, take your sword.
It's the best that I have.
I haven't forgotten you. Who told Andre that I was in the Red Lantern, then?
And now you want a blade from me ... all right, you'll get a blade. Here. And now drop dead.
If you want a better weapon, then go to the merchants in the market.
Kiss my ass!
Do you have a better weapon for me?
I haven't forgotten that you ratted me out to Lord Andre.
Not at the moment ...
Good thing you asked. We got a few pretty good blades from Onar's mercenaries.
They had no further use for them. (laughs dirty)
Here, take it.
Everything all right with you?
Yeah, and with you?
Not really. I'm worried about the mercenaries, I mean, they're bound to try and break their friend out of jail now.
I don't want to go up against a bunch of experienced fighters.
Of course! We're all keeping our eyes open. The magicians can rest assured that the prisoner has no chance of escaping.
I know what you're planning, but you won't succeed in getting away with the prisoner.
I'm very glad that business with the murder has been cleared up.
Why?
The mercenaries wouldn't have just stood by without a fight and watched us take one of them to the gallows.
At worst, they would have just attacked us. I don't even want to imagine what would have happened then.
Welcome to the monastery of Innos, stranger.
I am Brother Pedro, a humble servant of Innos and the warder of the gate to the holy monastery.
What is it that you require?
Here, have a sausage, Brother!
Good of you to think of me. Usually, I am forgotten.
You could let me have another sausage.
Forget it, I won't have enough then.
Hey, one sausage - nobody will notice that. You'll get something for it - I know a place where some fire nettles grow.
If you take them to Neoras, he'll surely give you the key to the library. What do you say?
OK, have another sausage.
All right. Some fire nettles are growing to the left and right on the other side of the bridge.
No, forget it.
You want to get in good with Gorax, huh? It's always the same with the new novices ...
I want to enter the monastery.
Only the servants of Innos are allowed to enter the monastery.
If you want to pray to Innos, go find one of the roadside shrines. You will find the tranquility to pray there.
What do I have to do to be accepted in the monastery?
Acceptance into the monastery is denied to you - you have already chosen a path.
If you want to be accepted into the Brotherhood of Innos, you must learn and obey the rules of the monastery.
Also, we demand the gifts to Innos from each new novice.
A sheep and 1000 gold pieces.
That's a whole lot of gold.
It is a sign that you are beginning a new life as a servant of Innos. When you are accepted you will be forgiven all your previous transgressions.
And consider - you cannot take back the decision to become a servant of Innos.
I've got this statuette here. I think they're missing it in the monastery.
Can I come in now?
Well, under these truly exceptional circumstances you are free to become a novice.
I can't let you in even with this precious gem, I'm afraid.
You have already decided upon a different path. The way into the monastery is closed to you.
Can I just hand the statuette over to you?
Of course, I shall take care of it. Thank you for this unselfish deed.
What are the rules you live by?
Innos is the god of truth and law and thus we may NEVER lie or commit a crime.
Should you transgress against a brother of the community or steal our property, you will pay a penalty for it.
Innos is also the god of rule and fire.
As a novice you must show OBEDIENCE and RESPECT to all Magicians of Fire.
I see.
Furthermore, it is the DUTY of a novice to carry out all the work in the monastery for the good of the community.
If you are prepared to follow these rules and have the offering to Innos, we are willing to accept you into our monastery as a novice.
I want to become a novice.
You have already chosen your path. The path of magic is closed to you.
Is that really what you wish to do? For you must know that there will be no turning back for you then.
I see that you have brought the required offering. If you are truly willing, you are now free to become a novice.
However, if you make this decision there is no going back - consider well if this is your path!
You did not bring the required offering with you.
Yes, I want to dedicate my life to the service of Innos.
Then be welcome, Brother. I give to you the key to the monastery gate.
As a sign of your free decision, it is up to you to open the gate and step through.
You are now a novice. Wear this robe as a sign that you are now a member of this brotherhood.
When you are in the monastery, go to Parlan. He'll see to your needs from now on.
Will my transgressions be forgiven now?
Not yet. Speak to Master Parlan. He will bless you and wash you clean of your sins.
I'll think about it some more.
Come back when you are ready.
Tell me about life in the monastery.
We live in the monastery in order to serve Innos. We novices perform the work and study the scriptures when we have the opportunity.
The magicians watch over us, and they explore the arts of magic.
Traitor! So I've found you at last.
You needn't think I'll have mercy on you just because I am one of the paladins.
Many of us mercenaries have sold their souls to Beliar, and often I still felt bad about slaughtering them just like that. For you, scummy swine, I'll make an exception!
Of all the soulless bastards I've met in my life, you're the worst by far. You are a disgrace to our order.
I ought to just kill you on the spot.
Stop. I beg you. They have put a spell on me. I would never have betrayed the monastery of my own free will.
You have no idea what I've been through in the last few days. They put this voice in my head. I couldn't defend myself against it.
The Orcish colonel questioned me for days. He beat me constantly. Spare me. I'm not guilty. You must believe me.
Give me just one reason why I should believe you.
(pleading) Let me live. I can also give you information that will help you to get out of here again. You have to listen to me.
I don't have to do a thing. I'm going to kill you now.
By all the gods...
Serpentes gave me the order to kill you, and as a matter of principle, I do what I am told.
(pleading) Please, no. You can't do that. I could still be of great use to you. You have to see that.
Tell me what you know, then.
(relieved) Yes, of course. I'll tell you everything you want to know. Under one condition. You have to get me off of this accursed island, do you hear?
All right. Follow me, I'll take you to the ship.
Thank you. You won't regret it.
Here we are!
An impressive ship you have there. You truly are a great general.
Stop babbling. Just tell me what I want to know.
Eh, of course. Where should I begin?
What about that orcish colonel?
He took away my last spark of hope of ever seeing my homeland again.
Since I came here, he has been questioning me about the strategic placement of the paladins in Khorinis.
Of course, I couldn't tell him much about that. How could I, damnit? I am a novice of the Fire.
What other monsters are haunting this island?
During the day, you often see the lizard people walking towards the coast. They usually carry very large eggs with them.
I didn't catch a lot of this in my cell, but I think they're getting ready to leave the island.
How can I get to the interior of the island?
There is a secret passage in the orcish colonel's throne room.
They dragged me there every time he wanted to question me. I saw it there.
One of the shamans started a mechanism by pulling on the torches that hang on the walls of the hall.
Mmh. I think he first pulled on the left torch and then the right, but I can' remember it exactly.
In the rear area, a secret passage suddenly opened that led deep into the mountain.
Where this passage ends, I don't know.
The orcish colonel is dead.
Dead? Innos be praised. I shall never forget his hideous face.
I've heard enough. Go find a place on my ship. I've still got a job to do.
May the power of Innos go with you. I shall pray for you.
Tired?
Would you like me to bring you a pillow, then?
Spare me, please. I'll sit here very quietly and I won't make a sound.
Mmh.
I'm completely done in.
Go hit the sack. We'll soon be at sea again.
Thanks, man. I already thought I'd fall right off this bench. Good night.
It's all right. Thanks.
Please. Let me live!
What are you doing here?
(bored) Guarding sheep! (sighs) And if possible, staying out of trouble.
Doesn't always work, does it?
Nah, especially not with the mercenaries. I'm really glad to be out here on the pasture. Although that can be dangerous too.
What's so dangerous in the pasture?
There's a small pack of wolves that roams the area. Lately the damn beasts have come by and eaten one of my sheep almost every day.
A few days ago, I had almost twice as many sheep. I don't want to think what Onar will do to me when he finds out.
Why didn't you tell the mercenaries about the wolves? I thought they worked for you.
Yeah, I know. I should have done that. But I didn't, damnit.
And now, with so many sheep gone, I'm afraid to tell anyone about it at all.
But you just told ME ...
(irritated) I'm already regretting that, too.
What if I kill those wolves?
(mocking) You, by yourself? Ha ha. I don't believe it. I'd sooner trust my bellwether to do that.
Forget it. It was just a suggestion. I'll go over to the boys and see what THEY say about it ...
(scared) Wait a minute. Okay, okay! Ehm ... you're the greatest and you can take on a hundred wolves at once. No problem!
Mostly they lurk between the trees near the pasture. (incidentally) I think there were only four ...
I've done in the wolves.
(amazed) You did it! Thank Innos!
But now I still don't know how to tell Onar that all those sheep are gone.
(to himself) It's all that damn Bullco's fault!
I don't need you to make a fool out of me. The beasts aren't all dead.
What did you say about Bullco?
He's one of the mercenaries. It was actually his job to guard the pasture.
But instead he and his pal Sylvio hang around Thekla in the kitchen all day.
It's that bastard's fault if I don't get paid for weeks because of the lost sheep.
I wish I could at least punch him in the mouth for it. But nobody stands a chance against him. The guy's a killer.
Bullco got what was coming to him. I've taught him a lesson.
The swine deserved it.
How are you, and how are your sheep?
I'm fine. And so are the sheep. That is, the ones that are still here are doing all right.
Good. But the wolves are bound to come back some day. And then there will probably be more of them!
I heard the strangest things. Some sinister characters are said to have shown up at Sekob's. They're laying siege to his house.
I heard that some thugs have made themselves at home on Lobart's farm. Maybe someone should help him.
Can I buy a sheep?
Any time, if you can pay the price. A sheep will cost you 100 gold pieces.
If you pay, you can take a sheep. But you have to treat it well.
Here's 100 gold pieces. Give me a sheep, then.
Good. Then take Betsy - you'll find her in the pasture.
Just tell her she should follow you. She's pretty smart for a sheep. Treat her well!
Again? Okay. Take Betsy.
Betsy? But the last sheep was called Betsy ...
All the sheep are called Betsy.
Except for the rams, of course.
And what are they called?
Bruce.
You don't have that much gold. I can't give you a sheep for less.
So you're the new novice. Well, I assume you have already been given a task by Master Parlan.
(slightly reproachful) You know that everyone within the Community of the Fire must carry out his duty according to the will of Innos.
I must talk to the paladins. It's urgent.
And are you going to tell us why you want to talk to them?
I've got an important message for them.
What message would that be?
An army of evil is assembling in the Valley of Mines, led by the dragons! We must stop them as long as we still can.
Hm. We shall ponder on your words, novice. When the time has come, we shall let you know what our council decided.
In the meantime, you had better see to your duties as a novice.
Well, we don't want to keep you from your work any longer - you can go now.
I'm looking for the Eye of Innos.
Anyone who thinks he could not only find the sacred amulet, but wear it as well, is a fool.
The amulet itself chooses its bearer - no one save the one who is destined for it, will be able to wear it.
I'd be willing to give it a try.
The duty of a novice is to show humility - not desire.
Well, we don't want to keep you from your work any longer - you may go now.
Some citizens of Khorinis have mysteriously disappeared.
That fact is known to me, and very regrettable. But we have agreed with the Water Mages that they shall handle this matter.
The same is true for the investigation of the unusual earthquakes in the north-eastern regions of Khorinis.
So far, I have not received notice that our intervention would be required. Therefore, we are not going to take any steps in this matter.
Yes, but ...
No buts! We shall proceed as we see fit, and I hope even YOU are going to respect that.
(annoyed) Obedience is a virtue you are still going to learn. One way or another.
I want to undergo the Test of Fire.
(surprised) So you know about ... you want to pass the Test of Fire?
Yes, I refer to the Law of the Fire, which says ...
(interrupts brusquely) We know the Law of the Fire. We have also seen many novices die during the test. You ought to reconsider this decision.
Yes, I have. I want the test - and I am going to pass it.
(warning) If you absolutely insist, then the High Council will put you to the test.
I insist on being given the Test of Fire.
In that case - so be it. When you're ready, each magician from the High Council will give you a mission which you have to fulfill.
May Innos have mercy on your soul.
I am ready to face your test, Master.
And only Innos alone knows whether you are going to pass it. You shall be put to the same test which is given to the chosen novices.
The Test of Magic. (aloof) You probably know that only ONE of the novices can pass the test.
I see. Who are my competitors, then?
Innos in his wisdom has chosen three novices who are also going to be put through this test: Agon, Igaraz and Ulf. They have already started the search.
(curtly) But enough of that! Hear the words of the test: 'Follow the signs of Innos and bring us what the believer finds behind the path.'
You are going to need this key.
That is all we have to say to you.
As long as you are engaged with the test, we have nothing to tell you.
What are you standing around here for? Go and face your test!
The time has come to follow up your great words with deeds. Do you not think so, novice?
I found the runestone.
(incredulously) You ... did it?! You followed the signs and discovered the hidden portal ...
... and I defeated all those monsters who had already marked me down as a snack.
And the other novices, then? What about Agon? Did they not succeed before you?
They have failed. I suppose they weren't destined to pass the test.
Well, then we declare that you have passed this test. And the runestone shall be yours to keep.
You have passed the test which I set before you.
But ...
... you still have to pass Ulthar's test.
... you still have to complete the test for Serpentes.
Will I be accepted into the Magicians' Guild now?
You did it. You have passed the Test of Fire. We were certain all along that you would succeed in doing this.
(insistent) Just as certain as we are that you will continue to give your best to become a WORTHY servant of Innos.
So, if you are ready to swear the Oath of Fire, you shall be accepted into our ranks as a magician.
I am ready to step into the Circle of Fire.
Right, then swear the sacred Oath of Fire.
(solemnly) Do you swear, before Lord Innos the Almighty, his servants and the Holy Flame ...
... that henceforth and forever, your very life shall be united with the fire ...
... until your body and soul find rest in its sacred halls and the flame of your life dies away?
I swear.
By speaking the words of the oath, you have entered the pact with the fire.
Wear this robe as a token of the eternal bond.
Now that you have been accepted into our ranks, you can talk to Lord Hagen, the high commander of the paladins.
We are also very interested to hear how he assesses the situation. So you are free now to go to Khorinis.
We expect you to bring us his answer immediately.
What all can I learn now?
First of all, you are now entitled to learn about the Circles of Magic. They will give you the power to use the runes.
The higher you rise through the six Circles of Magic, the stronger the spells become that you can work.
You can learn the formulae from the brothers in the monastery. Each of them has specialized in a certain area which he will teach you.
Karras, for example, is a master of invocation and summoning, and Hyglas will teach you the magic of fire.
Nobody knows more about the powers of ice and thunder than Marduk. Parlan can teach you various other incantations - and he will initiate you into the first circles.
But each of them will only teach you the formula - the runes you will have to create for yourself.
I'd like to express a wish ...
After he has been accepted, each magician has the right to his first act.
So, what will your first act as a magician be?
None.
(astonished) So be it. The new magician foregoes his act.
Let the novice Dyrian stay in the monastery.
So be it.
The novice will be allowed to remain in the monastery, and he will fill the position of gardener which is now vacant.
Let the novice Babo be head of the monastery gardens.
So be it.
Effective immediately, the novice Babo will be in charge of the monastery gardens.
Let the novice Opolos have access to the library.
So be it.
From now on, the novice Opolos will study the scriptures of Innos.
I carry news of Lord Hagen. He wants proof for the presence of the dragons and the army of evil.
So I shall go down to the Valley of Mines and get him his proof.
Good. You will follow this order, then. The paladin Sergio is to escort you to the pass.
May Innos protect you.
So I headed right down to the Valley of Mines.
Good. Since you already know the way to the valley, you are not going to need an escort.
Take care of this matter for Lord Hagen - may Innos protect you.
Teach me the last Circle of Magic.
A lot of time has passed since you have entered the bond with the fire. Much has happened, and we find no rest.
You are the Chosen of Innos. Therefore you will need all your strength to prevail in your battles.
I shall now consecrate you, Chosen One. You are entering the sixth Circle - may you bring light and disperse the darkness.
You can now learn the magic formulae for the last circle from me, if you so desire.
Oh - and one more thing. It took me a while to recognize you.
You got that letter from me back when they threw you into the Barrier.
Yes, you spared me the judge's blathering that way.
And you are the Chosen of Innos.
Receive now my blessing, oh Chosen One!
Innos, light of the sun and fire of the world, bless this man, your chosen servant.
Give him courage, strength, and wisdom to follow the path which you have ordained for him.
The time for this has not yet come. Once you have walked a little farther on the path that Innos will show you, I shall instruct you.
Instruct me.
There is nothing more that I could teach you.
Parlan sent me. I want to increase my magic powers.
Well, you have learned a lot, and your strength has grown. From now on, you will learn from me.
I want to increase my magic powers.
I can feel that the magic power flows through you well and truly. Even I cannot show you how you could increase it further.
Bless me, Master.
What about a little blessing? I could surely use it.
May your final battle against our archenemy be crowned with success. Innos be with you.
May Innos stand between you and harm on all the unholy paths you will have to walk.
I've come from the old Valley of Mines.
What do you have to report?
The enemy has formed up there with an army of orcs and dragons.
We have already learned that from Milten - but what about the king's shipment of ore?
The mine they are digging for Garond in the valley cannot satisfy the demands of the king.
The days are becoming grayer, and the light of the sun is ever weaker.
I was attacked by men in black robes.
I know. Those are the Seekers. Henchmen from the nether realms of Beliar. Beware of them. They will try to take possession of you.
Once possessed, you will no longer be yourself. Only here in the monastery could you find help then. So be careful.
I have asked Karras to look into this matter. He will certainly win some further insights soon which can make us see clearer.
Here - this rune will bring you directly back to the monastery if you need our help.
Remember, we must offer resistance, or we shall all be doomed.
I have come to take the Eye of Innos.
I see that you have received an authorization from Lord Hagen himself to bear the Eye of Innos.
I am afraid that I have to disappoint you. We have fallen victim to a treacherous plot of the enemy.
The Eye of Innos has been violently taken from these sacred walls.
Who could be so impudent, Master?
Who did this?
Evil is cunning and usually works in secret. Only rarely do you see it emerge to pursue its evil machinations in broad daylight.
But these days, it's a different matter. The enemy now shows himself openly in the street, in every home and every public square.
This can only mean that he no longer fears any adversary, and is not going to shrink back from anything.
One of our most faithful followers, a candidate for the high robe of the Magicians of Fire, has changed his allegiance unexpectedly, and in an alarmingly evil manner. Pedro.
The enemy has taken possession of him, thus inflicting a terrible defeat upon us.
Pedro has forced his way into our most sacred halls, and stolen the Eye.
I fear that he simply spent too much time by himself, outside of the gates and thus beyond the protective walls of the monastery, exposed to all lurking dangers.
Where did the thief flee to?
Pedro knocked down some of the other novices who tried to stop him, and disappeared into the morning mist.
Many novices have gone after him to bring the Eye back to its place unharmed.
If you want to catch up to them, you need to hurry before Pedro disappears out of your reach.
I have found the Eye of Innos. It's broken.
But ... that cannot be. What happened?
Some really nasty customers had it. Anyway, I came too late.
They were performing a strange incantation on a crescent-shaped ritual site up in those woods.
Innos be with us. They have desecrated our Circle of the Sun.
Even in my worst nightmares I could never have imagined they would possess this kind of power.
What can we do now?
The enemy has become very strong. Still, this ancient artifact meant a powerful threat to him.
We must heal the Eye and restore its old power. But time works against us.
I cannot begin to imagine what is now going to become of us all. Without the protection of the Eye, we are helplessly at the mercy of the enemy.
Go to Vatras, the Water Mage in town. In this terrible situation, only he will know what is to be done. Take the Eye to him, and hurry.
Why Vatras?
The privilege of the robe does not authorize you to question my instructions, Brother.
Vatras is a servant of Adanos. The knowledge of the Water Mages alone will bring us clarity in this dark hour.
That is all you need to know.
What is the Circle of the Sun?
Every year, all the magicians and novices of the monastery travel to this place at the time of the solstice to mark the beginning of a new cycle.
The place is filled with the immeasurable power of the sun.
Never have I entertained the slightest notion that its power could be reversed. And yet that is what happened.
I have talked to Vatras.
Ah, good. Where is he?
He's preparing a ritual at the Circle of the Sun in order to heal the Eye of Innos.
If that is true, then maybe there is hope after all.
Vatras wants Xardas and you to help him with that.
WHAT? Xardas will be there, too? You cannot be serious.
Hey. This wasn't my decision. Vatras insists.
It is always that Xardas. I am tired of it. Things could hardly get any worse.
So how do I know that Xardas is not in league with the enemy?
I cannot trust Xardas, no matter how much we may need him.
I am sorry, but I cannot help Vatras under these circumstances.
It can't be done without you. Vatras wouldn't be able to perform the ritual otherwise.
You will have to trust Xardas.
There is nothing that I have to do, you hear? I do not have the slightest proof that Xardas is not working against us. I cannot do this.
What if I could bring you some proof?
That is impossible, I fear. It would really have to impress me.
As far as Xardas is concerned, I have my doubts whether he can still impress me at all.
I brought this book from Xardas.
It's a token of his trust.
Show me.
(amazed) But this is incredible. Do you have even the slightest notion what it is that you just gave me?
Ehm. No.
(irritated) This is an ancient, long-lost tome from days gone by.
We all thought that it was lost for good, and now I learn that Xardas knew all along what had become of it.
So will you be there for the ritual?
Yes, I shall depart for the Circle of the Sun, but certainly not because I am convinced of Xardas' good intentions.
In fact, I am going to make this jackal explain where he has kept the book hidden for so many years. He has definitely gone too far this time.
I shall see you at the Circle of the Sun.
Do you think you can patch the Eye up again?
Hard to say. Let us wait and see.
You did it. The Eye of Innos is healed.
I would hardly have believed it possible.
Yes, Master.
You have proven many times over that you are ready for the High Order of the Fire Magicians.
As of today, you are a member of the Council and will represent our order in the world. You are now one of the high Fire Magicians.
Wear the high robe with dignity and bring the order honor and wealth, my brother.
What remains for me to do here?
Do not waste your time on trivial things. Go and vanquish the dragons. Here, take the Eye.
Bear in mind that you need to talk to a dragon first before you can attack it.
The power of the Eye will force the dragons to speak to you and tell the truth.
Furthermore, it offers protection against their attacks when you wear it.
However, its power does not last. You will have to fill it up again with magical energy.
To do that, you need the essence of a dragon's heart which you join with the Eye at an alchemist's bench.
Only then can you dare face another dragon.
Thanks. I'll remember that.
You now have everything you need. Go, then. You do not have much time left.
I have found a strange almanac.
Really? What kind of an almanac is that?
I'm not sure. I thought you would know what to do with it.
Forsooth, that is very disquieting. I am glad that you brought it to me. That was very wise.
I assume that there are more of these. Go and find more of these books of damnation.
I suspect that it is an instrument of the Seekers' power.
They use it to control the lost souls of their victims.
They obviously write down the names of those whom they are planning to possess in these books.
Listen. I am giving you this magical letter. It will show you the names which are written in the books.
Find those victims and bring me their books. I shall dispose of them.
But first, you ought to show at least one of them to Karras. Maybe that will help him in his studies.
Do not make the mistake to try and destroy them yourself. You are not yet ready to withstand their power.
Do not get to close to the Seekers, or they will take possession of you.
If you still find yourself unable to resist their call, come back to me as fast as you can.
Only here in the monastery can your soul be saved.
Is there no protection against their mental attacks?
That is possible. Karras could know something about that.
Heal me, Master, for I am possessed.
So be it! Take this potion. It will relieve you of your nightmares.
May the mercy of Innos be your salvation.
Act on his behalf and beware of the evil eye of the enemy.
But be forewarned - if you expose yourself to their power too often, at some point there will be no turning back for you. Always remember that.
I think I am possessed. Can you heal me?
Not without a token of your respect for this monastery, my son. 300 gold coins.
But you only just had your healing potion. Don't come back to me until you really need my help.
Great. Here's the money.
Here, drink this. May the mercy of Innos be your salvation.
Bring me the money, and you will be helped.
That's too much.
I can tell you even more about those possessed.
Speak, Brother.
I have found another almanac.
I've got even more books of the Seekers for you.
That is good. I am afraid, however, that there are more of these to find. Go on searching.
Many have been found already. But I do not think that we have all of them.
You have already brought me a great number of the enemy's books.
I should be surprised if they had many more in circulation.
Take this. It is a gift from the monastery which will help you when you face evil.
And remember to have a look in my magic letter once in a while.
It is possible that they may try the same on others whose names were not yet found in the almanacs.
All the dragons are dead.
That is good news indeed. But it does nothing to change our situation, which seems hopeless.
The Seekers still have not left. On the contrary. I hear more and more reports that, during these last few days, their numbers have even increased.
Killing off the dragons has dealt the enemy a blow, but it did not suffice. We need to dig this evil out by the roots.
I talked to the dragons.
What did they say?
They kept talking about the power of their master, and how he settled in the Halls of Irdorath.
Innos be with us. The Black Temple has regained its power and is now sending its henchmen into our world.
What are these halls of Irdorath?
The eastern invocation temple of the god Beliar. There are four of them in the land of Myrtana. But this one is probably the most terrifying temple of all.
About 40 years ago, the northern and western temples of this horrible deity were destroyed.
The brave knights of that time gave their all to raze those mighty constructions to the ground.
Back then, the black hordes of the enemy were helpless against the superior numbers and the heroic courage of the knights and paladins.
It would have been easy to destroy the other two temples as well and rid the land of evil forever ...
... but after the second temple fell, they simply disappeared.
(mocking) Disappeared. An entire temple. Yeah, right.
Do not mock me. The situation is serious. If the Halls of Irdorath have indeed regained their power, then it will not be easy to defeat the enemy.
For that, you would have to find it first, and I think that this will be your next, and hardest, task.
We shall see.
Xardas' book which was believed to be lost - where is it?
I have been expecting you would ask that. But I fear that it will be of no help to you.
It has been magically sealed. I took it to one of our lower vaults, and even we have so far tried in vain to open it.
That accursed Xardas has played a dirty trick on us.
Can I see the book?
Be my guest. I cannot imagine you being successful where the greatest masters of our monastery have failed.
But go ahead and give it a try, Talamon is not going to stop you.
I've been able to open Xardas' book.
What? How did you do that? It well-nigh drove me to despair.
Just dumb luck, I suppose.
Don't talk nonsense. Luck!
When not even I succeed in opening the book, and then someone like you comes waltzing in ...
... that gives me something to ponder about.
Anyway. Since you were obviously the only one who was able to open the book, then may it be granted unto you to carry it. At least until we have weathered this crisis.
Xardas told me the trick.
Ah, is that it. How interesting. I can only hope for you that Xardas' bad influence is not going to spoil you.
I am warning you. Do not fall for the tricks of that old devil. You might come to regret it.
The book mentions a secret library.
Whatever are you talking about?
A library beneath these walls here. Does that ring a bell?
No. Where is that library supposed to be, did you say?
I see. You have no idea. Mmh.
I know where to find the Halls of Irdorath.
The temple is on an island. I've found a nautical chart which shows the way.
That is great. Then you will need a ship and a crew in order to face the enemy.
But remember you need to be well prepared if you want to vanquish the Master of Irdorath.
Where can I find a crew?
Your crew should consist of men you can trust.
Talk to your friends and think about who could be useful to you once you are on the island.
You are going to need a magician as well. But alas, I cannot spare a single man from the monastery.
You will have to ask a magician who is not working within the monastery.
Jorgen is an experienced sailor. He could help me get to the Isle of Irdorath.
That will not be so easy, I fear.
He has signed on to work for the brotherhood. He has neither paid the tribute, nor brought us a sheep.
Jorgen must finish his work first, then you can take him if you like.
How long will it take?
He used up the provisions which would have lasted a novice three weeks, and all on the first day.
So I cannot let him go before he has worked hard in our gardens for three months.
What do I have to do so I can take Jorgen with me NOW?
Mmh. There is indeed one thing you could do for me. Your good rapport with Xardas could help you with that.
It has come to my attention that, during these last few days, strange things have been going on in his tower.
Many of the town people hear loud screams at night coming from there, and see strange lights dancing over his tower.
As if we didn't have our plate full already. Go check what is going on there, and make it stop.
Then you can have Jorgen.
The thing with Xardas' tower has resolved itself.
So what was going on ... no, wait, I do not even want to know.
If you still want Jorgen, then go ahead and take him on your journey.
May Innos protect you.
The prophesy mentions the sacred Aura of Innos.
The Aura of Innos is an amulet which only the greatest magicians of an era are destined to wear.
Can I have it?
What? What do you want to do with that?
Go up against the dragon.
Yes, of course. I shall give you the amulet, but handle it with care.
Yeah, sure.
I do not wish to have to buy it back from a merchant later.
Use it well, and may Innos guard you at all times.
What sort of amulet is that?
They say that Innos himself forged it and gave it as a present to humankind.
It protects the one who wears it from all kinds of damage.
What are the Tears of Innos?
The Tears of Innos are nothing but an old children's story. It tells of how the battle between Innos and Beliar started at the beginning of time.
I see.
I do not know whether you are fully aware of our situation, but I hardly believe that our enemy can be vanquished through an old children's tale.
I found this potion.
That cannot be. I cannot believe it.
What's the matter?
If these are really the genuine Tears of Innos, then ...
(interrupts) Hardly.
Do not interrupt me. If these are the real Tears of Innos, then we have a powerful weapon against the enemy.
So what are the Tears of Innos?
When Innos realized that he had to fight Beliar, his own brother, in order to preserve creation, his sorrow was great.
He started to weep, and his tears fell down onto the world. There were many of them, for his heart was so full of grief that he wept for 13 years.
Get to the point.
The people who found his tears and tasted them were filled with supernatural strength and clarity. They recognized the wisdom of Innos' creation and began to serve him.

They were the first members of the Community of the Fire. The tears gave them strength, courage and wisdom. But that is all very long ago, and it has been more than 250 years since anyone last set eyes on a Tear of Innos.
What do you mean by 'weapon'?
Legend has it that, under the influence of this substance, the warriors of Innos were able to perform almost superhuman deeds.
They were immune to all kinds of exhaustion and had the strength of two bears.
The greatest heroic feats of the olden days were only made possible by the Tears of Innos.
I understand.
But the tears can bring suffering and death as well. Only the members of our order may drink this draught.
Anyone else - even the paladins of our Lord - would face a cruel death.
Why do you disturb my rest, guardian?
(angry) Tell me, what do you desire?
Bengla anthani, Osiri?
(loudly) Bengla anthani?
The land is plagued by earthquakes. We must do something or the entire island will sink into the sea.
There is nothing left for us to do.
The wrath of Adanos has fallen upon Jharkendar to punish the unbelievers.
Someone has forced his way into the temple of Adanos.
Nonsense. I myself sealed the door. It is impossible to pass.
Indeed?
Grant me access to the temple of Adanos.
The temple will remain closed for all eternity. Thus did we in the council decide.
What is there in the temple of Adanos?
My greatest sorrow, my greatest disappointment.
The praised wisdom of the ancestors is truly overwhelming.
A man of your standing does not speak to me thus.
I cannot free myself of the impression that you are not the one you pretend to be.
If you require my aid, you must first prove yourself to me.
Answer my questions, so that I may be sure that I do not reveal myself to strangers.
Your wrong answers reveal your evil intentions.
I shall not help you.
I do not believe you.
I think you should only return when you have decided to tell me the truth.
(thinking) The abilities of a guardian of the dead would have allowed you to waken me, that is true.
If you are truly the one you claim to be, you will be able to answer all of my questions.
Except for one...
Who sealed the portal to guard the world from Evil?
Who alleviates suffering and attends to the ill?
Who has the final word in the Council of Five?
Who brought the Evil upon us?
Who can give me a direct order?
Who once protected the people of Jharkendar from enemy attacks?
Ask away.
I am Quarhodron, the old warlord of Jharkendar.
You have woken me.
To which caste of Jharkendar do you belong?
The warrior caste.
The priests.
The scholars.
The guardians of the dead.
The healers.
I don't know.
Good. I trust you and shall grant you my aid.
Then do not waste my time.
Now listen here. A truly evil fellow has gained access to the temple of Adanos.
If you don't let me into the temple right now, it will probably be too late and everything will go down the drain.
That cannot be! The high priest KHARDIMON and I are the only ones in Jharkendar who know how to open the gate to Adanos' temple.
Well. Then your pal KHARDIMON must have blabbed.
I'm telling you, the gate was open. I saw it myself.
Well. There is truth in your voice. I shall no longer doubt your words.
I should hope so.
Take, then, the password. It is written on this stone tablet. Speak the words at the sealed gate of the temple and it will open.
(already half dead) My time is done. Alas, I can no longer help you.
(already half dead) But remember: beware the chambers of Adanos. Else your death is certain.
Wait. What ABOUT the chambers?
(already half dead) My strength is failing. Farewell. We shall meet again in the realm of the dead.
Well, well, you know the sign. (yawns) I'm impressed.
Have you lost your way? I don't think this is the right place for you.
If anything happens to you here, no one's going to help you. So be careful. (broad grin)
So you're in. Well, I wish you success then - and be careful, whatever you do.
Oh, and one more thing - I don't care who you are up there, and with whom you work.
Here below, you're only one of us. A thief. No more and no less.
Listen, you can't be serious, can you? You're bagging our gold ... you're trying to steal from us?
Don't get all worked up over a couple of coins.
I mean, this bit of stuff here - is that ALL of your booty? That's all the thieves' guild of Khorinis has to offer?
Who says our booty is stored down here?
I couldn't quite believe that, either. So where did you hide your treasures?
In a very safe place.
I see.
All right, you can keep the gold. But I'll keep an eye on you. So don't overdo it.
Can you teach me something?
I can't teach you anything. You already know everything about picking locks.
Now you only need to improve your dexterity ...
I can show you how to pick a lock. That'll cost you a mere ...
OK, I'll pay ...
... here's the gold.
Great. I'm at your service.
Get the gold, then, and come back.
Show me how to pick a lock!
Lock picking is the high art of thieves.
You need a lot of feeling and intuition. And a couple of good lock picks.
Some chests, however, are fitted with special locks which can only be opened with the corresponding key.
So, kneeling in front of the lock, turn your lock pick to the left and right.
If you twist it too fast or too hard, it will break.
But the more adept you become, the easier you'll find it to handle the tool.
Where is it worth the trouble to break in?
In the upper quarter of town, of course.
But if you want to break in somewhere up there, wait until night - everyone's asleep then - except for the city guards.
They patrol at night. I know one of them - Wambo. He's the only one interested in gold.
He's expensive, but once you've paid him you don't have to worry any more.
Have you got a job for me?
Hmm ... there is a thing that I'd like to have. But I haven't found one so far.
What can I get you?
A sextant. Bring me a sextant - I'll pay you a good price for it.
I've got a sextant for you.
Incredible. You actually managed to find one.
Here, you have really earned your pay.
Hey, what happened down there?
I flattened Franco.
So? Then now it's YOUR job to make sure the lazy dogs do their work every day.
Hey, I'm not here to be bothered with the hunters. I want to enter the camp.
Forget it. You did in Franco - now you're the leader. So do your job.
If I'm the leader, then I decide who goes in next.
And I decided that I'M next.
(laughs) It isn't that easy. We haven't asked for ANYONE, so NO one gets in.
Thorus can send a new leader for the hunters, then there will be a vacancy inside for me.
(laughs) You don't give up, do you? Okay, then move your butt inside.
Thorus will make sure that the hunters won't have to live without a leader.
What are you waiting for? And get yourself a pickaxe.
Hey, what do you want? I can't imagine you have a permit for the camp.
Franco sent me. He wants to know if anyone is needed in the camp.
Yeah, we need someone. Another one of the guys kicked the bucket yesterday.
That idiot tangled with Esteban.
Who is Esteban?
The leader of the lower camp. He decides who gets into the mine.
So tell Franco that Thorus wants a new man. Got it?
Hey, slow down! You aren't getting in there - so beat it!
Thorus? THE Thorus?
Yes. THE Thorus. THE man who calls for new people.
The man who decides if and when a new guy gets out of the swamp and into the camp.
You aren't trying to tell me that you know him from earlier?
Well... yes...
Listen - EVERYONE knows Thorus.
Nevertheless, you aren't getting in - and I WON'T give him a message!
Thorus? Never heard of him...
Oh man, you don't know him? He was the chief of the guards in the Old Camp.
He's the man everybody trusts.
He calls for new people, and he decides if and when a new man gets into the camp.
If you live long enough, you'll get to know him.
One more step and it'll be your last!
Some people never learn...
I'm the new man.
Hey, don't try to fool me. It's still Franco who decides which of you gets into the camp.
Franco sent me...
He did not. So beat it, otherwise I'll break your bones...
Everything under control?
Everything is fine here - as long as no one tries to get in who SHOULDN'T.
Everything all right?
Hmm ... as soon as anyone says anything wrong around here, the dance starts ... so watch your step, or there'll be a slaughter.
Will you join the fight?
I'm not going to just stand here when the ruckus starts. But I'm not going to push it either.
Everything all right?
Now that Kati and Akil have been taken to the realm of Innos, I'm going to run the farm.
Yes, I'm fine. That Alvares has become bolder and bolder lately. Good thing that's over now.
What I could use now is a good drop in the tavern.
Baltram sent me. I'm supposed to pick up his shipment.
Good. I've already prepared everything. Here's your package.
You're not from around here, right?
I come from the southern isles. At some point they said they needed people in Khorinis, because of that magic ore.
