Here's your 50 gold pieces.
Well thanks, that'll do.
Don't mess with me. 50 and not one piece less, got it?
Gimme back my gold!
Now that I've given you my vote?
You rotten little beggar!
Relax! I'll only keep an eye on it for a while...
Say, is that a face you have at the front of your head, or is it a butt?
(laughs angrily) Okay, that's the way you want it...
It's thrashing time once again!
If you say so...
And, how are things?
Not many people come this way, but up to now every one of them has paid my toll.
Except you. (grins)
You know what you have to do...
(sneering) Then what do I still need you for, you bum?
(calls) Hey, people, look who we have here!
How much do you want?
(playing hurt) Oh, no, please. I don't want to extort gold from you. I wouldn't dream of it.
Then what do you want?
Recently somebody tried to get Esteban out of the way. But he ran into the bodyguards.
Go to Esteban and talk to him. Afterwards we'll talk again.
Ah! Who have we here then?
Looky, looky. There you are. I've got good news and bad news for you.
I want to hear the good news first.
And what's the good news?
Well, I don't really know why, but you've made yourself a couple of powerful enemies.
You can count yourself lucky that I recognized you and no one else.
Because I am understanding and sociable.
First tell me the bad news.
And what's the bad news?
Raven is looking for you. So are his guards. Actually, all the bandits are looking for you...
And if they find you, they'll kill you.
A lot of people have already tried that.
Then your combat skills are as good as your craftiness. Coming into the camp with some of our armor is like...
...the sheep coming to the wolves. Your life is hanging by a thin thread, son of danger.
About Esteban...
Have you already talked to him?
Not yet.
Well, you should do that soon.
I've talked to Esteban.
And did he tell you about the attack?
He ordered me to find out who sent the assassin. Do you know anything about that?
No more than you do. I'm also on the hunt for the guy behind it. And now we come to the interesting part.
Let's hear it.
I want you to do your job well. I want you to find the traitor.
(coldly) And when you have found him - I want you to kill him for me.
Then I will pocket the reward.
I have your wanted poster - don't forget that. Do your job and do it well. You can figure out will happen otherwise.
Forget it!
I don't really have a choice...
I knew we would come to an agreement.
(curtly) When you find out who the guy is - we'll kill the tick together. And now beat it!
I've changed my mind. We aren't working together any more!
I found the traitor. It's Fisk.
(furious) You haven't kept our agreement.
May Innos illuminate your path.
Innos be with you, what can I do for you?
You have prayed for my brethren. I want to thank you for that. Tell me what I can do for you.
What about a little donation?
May this gold be of use to you.
Let me share your fighting experience.
When you fight, always make sure that no one can attack you from behind.
I need access to the library.
Well, I cannot grant you access. For that you must first fulfill your tasks.
But I can help you. Go to Master Isgaroth and talk to him. I have heard that he needs help and would go to him - but I pass this task on to you.
What are you doing here?
I am praying to Innos that he strengthen my arm and my will.
Thus, I am armed against all dangers and shall destroy all his enemies in order to do him honor.
What enemies?
All those who oppose the will of Innos. Whether they be human born or summoned creature.
Can you go through a few exercises with Babo?
Why doesn't he ask me himself?
I think he's shy.
I see. Good, if it means so much to him, I shall train with him every morning for two hours. We begin at 5 o'clock. Tell him that.
Why aren't you with the other paladins?
It may seem unusual that I am here, however we paladins also serve the magicians, for they preach the will of Innos.
We paladins are warriors in the name of Innos. His will is our law. At the moment, I am waiting for new orders from the magicians.
And do you already have new orders?
Until then I still have time to find strength in prayer.
You are to escort me to the pass.
Good, then I shall do that. I know the way, so follow me.
How's it going?
I shall take you to the pass. But the dangerous part of the journey only begins there.
But let us waste no time. We need to be on our way.
We are there. Whatever awaits you in the Valley of the Mines, I hope that you find your way back.
Don't fear - I shall return.
Go with Innos. May he always protect you.
For Innos, Brother. If you have come to learn something about the Consecration of the Sword, then ask Marduk.
I have heard of you. You are the fellow from the farms who was in the Valley of Mines. My respects.
(scolding) You dare to address me, novice? Return to your work.
I've got one more question ...
(furiously) You do not seem to want to understand. I decide when I see fit to talk to you. Who do you think you are?
And now get back to work!
Your presence here demonstrates not only your lack of respect, but also your stupidity, novice!
I heard that you passed the Test of Fire.
(smugly) In all humility, I can tell you this. Everyone else who has attempted this is dead.
(condescendingly) You really should not attempt to take this test. Your spirit is weak. Better to serve in the monastery and perhaps you will be chosen in a few years.
I am going to pass the test.
If it is the will of Innos, then you shall. But if not - then you will fail.
I am ready to face your test, Master.
So, you want to put yourself to the test. Only a courageous novice demands the test. But courage is not all that you need.
Are you clever enough to pass the test? Are you strong enough to meet the dangers that await you?
If not, you will pay for it with your life.
And now hear your test: In the Place of Stones, seek the one who was never born - find him who once was summoned.
Overcome the one who cannot be overcome - measure yourself against the living rock, fight with the undying stone - and destroy it.
Living rock ... ? What kind of a creature would that be?
I have told you everything. (mockingly) Or do you find this test too difficult?
Now you will learn what it means to take the Test of Fire - I will answer no more of your questions.
(contemptibly) Go and carry out your task, novice!
I have defeated the golem.
What? You have actually done it? But without the hammer of Innos, you would never have been able to destroy the golem.
(triumphantly) But now you have betrayed yourself! It was you who killed Garwig!
RECEIVE THE PUNISHMENT FOR THE MURDER OF A SERVANT OF INNOS!!!
(regretfully) Nevertheless, I must admit that you have fulfilled the task I have given you.
And I had best take the hammer myself.
Is there anything else you want to tell me?
No. Not at the moment, Brother.
Dismissed. You know what you have to do.
Not so fast. I have another task for you.
(sighs) And that is?
Now that you belong to the Brotherhood of Fire, you must also fulfill the duties that come with being one of us.
The church is not only concerned with the affairs of magic - it is also the final authority in the administration of justice, as you know.
The latest case brought before opens up a bottomless abyss and must be dealt with once and for all.
A mercenary for hire of your stripe could be of use to us in this matter.
Isn't that the militia's business?
The militia is responsible for the city alone. This affair has farther-reaching consequences.
I've got enough on my plate as it is. Go find somebody else.
(angrily) That is outrageous. You will never reach the upper circles of magic if you are not willing to do the Brotherhood a service.
I hereby reprimand you. I hope this will not happen again - else it will go badly with you.
What's this about?
There is someone in the city who has sold falsified shares in the ore mines of the former penal colony.
These papers are utterly worthless and of no importance, really. Still, they have the potential of stirring up trouble among the people, which we cannot afford to happen right now.
The swindler is supposed to have approached all the most reputable traders in the city and the country, and has evidently even managed to sell his counterfeit mining shares to some of them.
Find this evildoer and bring him before this panel. In such hard times we must not suffer swindlers and plunderers.
We must make an example of him in order to deter the rest of the mob.
I shall try to clear up the matter.
One thing more. When you visit those traders, do not let them know that you are looking for mining shares.
I think they probably want to sell them on and certainly would no longer offer them to you if they realized that you are dealing with them on behalf of the church, you see?
Yes.
Then get to work. I wish you much success, Brother.
Whom should I kill?
For Innos' sake. No one, of course. This business demands a bit more finesse, you rude lout.
Salandril, the alchemist from the upper end of town, is guilty of a serious crime and must be punished for it.
However, he has refused to come to the monastery to be judged. Bring him here.
How you accomplish this does not matter to us. You will, of course, be rewarded.
No problem. I'll take care of it.
Good. We expect to hear from you in a few days.
I've been able to retrieve a mining share.
I've been able to retrieve a few mining shares.
Very good. You must remove them all from circulation. This is poison for the people. Bring them all to me.
Here. I will give you the necessary means.
Those were all, I think.
Well done. You have earned a reward.
Take this protective amulet. It will help you along the paths you have yet to tread.
This is really the last one now, right?
I know who brought those mining shares into circulation. Salandril did, the alchemist from the upper quarter of town.
Then bring him here. We have things to discuss with him.
Salandril is here, in the monastery.
Well done. We shall deal with him later.
Here is your reward. And not another word about this, understood?
Salandril is dead.
Well, then his deed has not gone unpunished. May Innos have mercy on his poor soul.
Why did you wake me, eh? I bet you don't even know...
No - don't say anything. It's too late for excuses.
Now you have two choices. You can fight me and my Betty. Or you can try to run away.
In your place, I'd run...
About the attack...
What do you want?
I want to get Esteban out of the way.
Super.
I want to track down the traitor.
Shit.
(annoyed) There you are at last. I've been waiting here for hours.
(confused) Just a moment. You're not a merchant from town, are you?
(angrily) Where is Baltram?
Who are you?
I don't see how that's any of your business. But if you must know, my name is Skip. Does that ring a bell?
(pretending he didn't understand) Who?
Are you telling me you've never heard of Skip? Holy shit, where do you live?
I'm one of Khorinis' most wanted criminals. Me and my boys have been the scourge of the waters around this crummy island for years.
(indignantly) Come on, you must have heard of me.
But of course. It's all coming back to me now.
(perplexed) Honestly? You've really heard of me before?
Oh shit! And I had been thinking of strolling into town.
Good thing I didn't.
The militia would have put me in the slammer right away.
You haven't come to put me away, have you?
Weeell ...
Good for you. Pick a fight with old Skip, and you're history.
Should I know you?
Mind that mouth of yours, lad, or old Skip will give you what for.
You're a pirate.
(irritated) Yes, damnit. That's plain to see. And a cross one at that.
I'm so bored I could chew up the planks of my cog.
Baltram? You're waiting for a merchant?
Smart kid, are you?
That's what I just said, isn't it?
That good-for-nothing junk merchant seems to have forgotten me.
If only I could get my hands on him ...
I've got a package for you - from Baltram.
What? He's sending me an errand boy?
Scared shitless, is he? Oh well. What can you expect from such a puny penny-pincher.
He says he wants 3 bottles of your rum in return.
(laughs) Wouldn't he like that. First he makes me wait forever, doesn't even show up in person, and then he has the nerve to make demands.
Here, give him 2 bottles. That's enough for him.
Where do you come from?
You want to know where our hideout is?
That's the last thing I would tell a member of the militia.
If I tell you that, I might as well invite the militia to arrest me.
And, in case you would like to pay us a visit, it wouldn't help you in the least.
The island of Khorinis is large, and no-one ever gets to where we are anyway. Unless they have a cog or some other ship.
And then you'd have to find your way through the cliffs as well. Nobody gets through there, unless they know the secret path.
There are only two people who know the path, and you're not one of them.
Do you know anyone with an eyepatch?
I know plenty of men with eyepatches.
There's someone roaming the land of Khorinis who seems to know you rather well.
Can't imagine who. I have no dealings with landlubbers.
But ...
Leave it be, I'm really not interested.
A lot of citizens are missing. And everything seems to indicate that you're not quite innocent in the matter.
(feels caught) Er ... damnit, it's not what you think it is.
Do I look like a slave trader to you? No, I only transport goods. What they are and where they come from is no concern of mine.
We have shipped all kinds of things for those swine.
First it was just regular stuff. Well, sometimes it may have been contraband.
But then they started to kidnap the inhabitants of the city. No idea what they're planning to do with them.
All we did was ferry them across.
Who are you talking about?
The bandits, of course. Who else? The filthy scum who are making themselves at home all over the island.
And not just here, around Khorinis.
I remember his name now. Dexter. Yes, I think they called him Dexter.
Just 'bandits' isn't good enough for me. I want a name ...
A name? You want to know who's leading the bandits? Damnit, what was that bastard's name again ...
Mmh. I just can't recall his name. Even if it wasn't all that complicated.
But I can show you where to find the boss of the gang in this part of Khorinis.
Have you got a decent map?
I've got a map right here.
But someone's scribbled all over it already. So where's the fun in messing it up for you?
No.
Then I guess I'll have to give you a description.
There's a very big farm far to the east. The farmer's name is Onar, I think.
He's got some fairly large fields. To the south of those fields, there's a small fortress on a high cliff.
That's where you'll find your man.
Here. I've got a map of Khorinis.
That's good. Let me draw in the hideout of this fellow.
Here's your map.
Where did you take those people?
I already told you - I'm not going to tell you where our bay is.
What have we here, crossing the path of old Skip again?
(exaggerated) I know you!
The bay near the city, remember?
Skip! Right?
(proudly) I see I made a lasting impression.
But I've seen your mug ELSEWHERE in the meantime ...
But of course!
Oh well. Not a great likeness, but it's certainly YOU.
Don't let it get to you. My own wanted poster looks just as daft.
I've got a package for you, from Baltram.
(grinning) That guy must be really keen on our rum if he sends his goods after us all the way HERE.
Here, give him these 2 bottles of rum. I quaffed the third one while I was waiting for him.
What are you doing here?
I've just come back from Khorinis and now I'm waiting for Greg to return.
I saw Greg in Khorinis.
Really? Damn! Something must have gone wrong then.
He should have been here with our ship some time ago.
(pensively) I suppose I should go back to Khorinis and wait for him there ...
(sighs) But certainly not today. I only just arrived here.
Can you take me to Khorinis?
No way. I'm not leaving now. I'll find myself a decent swig of grog first.
Are you out of your mind? We've lost our SHIP, man!
I'm not taking our last boat out for a spin just because you're too lazy to get your butt over to Khorinis BY YOURSELF!
For the last time: NO!
What can you tell me about the bandits?
The bandits?! They're ATTACKING us!
Why do you think we're building this palisade?
We brought those scumbags over here ourselves.
We used to trade with them. Boy, let me tell you, they've got more gold than they'll ever know what to do with!
They were prepared to pay any price for a bottle of rum.
But those times are past. It's war now!
What happened?
Those bastards hadn't paid for their last shipment.
So I went there to see what had become of our gold.
But when I got to the swamp, the swine attacked me!
And that's not all. They killed Angus and Hank! Two of our best people.
Just stay away from that swamp, I tell you.
They'll go after anyone who doesn't look as shabby as they do.
I need bandit's armor.
You want to go in there? Are you insane?
Once those guys find out you're not one of them, you're sausage meat!
Do you have any idea where I could find armor like that?
(sighs) You don't give up easily, do you? All right. We used to have a suit.
Greg's probably still got it somewhere up in his hut.
Maybe you can buy it from him when he gets back ...
Can you tell me how to get into his hut?
Whoa there! Not so fast!
You weren't thinking of ransacking Greg's stuff, were you?
When he left, he gave the key to Francis and told him not to let ANYONE into his hut.
What can you tell me about Francis?
Francis is our treasurer.
The Captain trusts him. That's probably why he left him in command.
But none of the boys here really take him seriously.
If you want to know more, talk to Samuel.
He's got his still in the little cave north of here.
There isn't a soul in this camp Samuel DOESN'T know all kinds of things about ...
Have you ever met Raven?
Certainly. When I was with Henry, up at the gate, I watched Raven place some of his boys at the tower to the south.
Just a stone's throw from our camp. (laughs) I guess they're supposed to spy on us.
I've also seen how he treats his people when they don't do his bidding.
He'll make short shrift of anyone who doesn't obey his orders to the letter.
Mark my words: stay well away from Raven.
Tell me more about Angus and Hank.
Angus and Hank were supposed to meet with some bandits in front of the camp.
They were carrying all kinds of supplies. Everything those bastards had ordered from us.
Forged steel and lock picks and whatnot.
But they never came back. The bandit swine must have done away with them!
Morgan and Bill went out to look for them - without any success.
Bill was pretty devastated. They were both friends of his.
He's still young, these things really get to him.
The rest of us took it in our stride. The goods we can afford to lose. (sighs) But the grog they were carrying ...
(angry) We're talking at least 20 bottles!
About Angus and Hank ...
What?
I found them.
They're dead.
(to himself) Dead as doornails - poor devils!
Well, it was only to be expected.
You should tell Bill if you haven't done so yet.
But break it to him gently - he's still young.
I know who murdered Angus and Hank.
Good for you. They're both dead. So who cares now?
No pirate ever got rich through vengeance.
Just as long as I have my grog back.
I don't care who murdered them. What about my grog?!
About that grog ...
You're missing 20 bottles, right?
Yes, damnit. My entire stock.
Here's your 20 bottles.
What? Really? Just like that?
Weeell ...
Okay. I'll pay for them.
Haven't you got anything more interesting than gold?
Mmh. Let's see. I've got this ring here.
I won it gambling in a filthy dockside pub years ago.
Back then, the guy told me it was magic. No idea whether that's true.
Maybe you want that instead of money?
Give me the ring.
Here you are.
Give me the money.
All right.
Have you got anything to sell?
If you want to trade, go to Garett. He's in charge of our supplies.
You're supposed to help me.
With what?
The canyon awaits.
I see you're taking some of the lads along. Good thing!
You'd better bring some of the boys!
That canyon is dangerous as hell!
Come with me.
Wait. Let's go back into the canyon first ...
Let's go!
I no longer need you.
Well, that was that, then. You'll find me in the camp.
This is far enough!
If you insist on going further, count us out!
If you insist on going further, count me out!
If we lose track of each other, let's meet up here at the watering hole.
Let's move on!
Orcs! I hate those things!
Looks like we got all of the razors.
We could roam around a little longer if you want to.
Just as long as we stay in the canyon.
Hey, where are you going? Do you want to go into this passage?
Well sure, why not?
There are even more slaves back there. As far as I'm concerned you can go in, but don't hit them so hard they can't work any more.
After all, we certainly don't want them just sitting around. They have to dig for gold.
I see. And who ordered that?
That is a direct order from Bloodwyn.
I thought Raven was the boss here.
Right - but he gave the slaves to Bloodwyn. He doesn't have any more use for them.
Let the slaves go!
Listen. Bloodwyn is in command here. The slaves belong to him, so he has the right to set them free.
Besides, Thorus also has a say in that. And what about you?
Do YOU have any say?
I decide WHO goes into the mine.
You're doing Esteban's old job. Then you have ABSOLUTELY NO say here. Buzz off.
Here, is that enough?
(gags) Put that away. I don't want to see THAT.
It would be better for you if you let the slaves go NOW.
Wait a minute. Bloodwyn isn't the only one who has a say here. So long as I don't have an order from Thorus, no one will be set free.
But you just said that the slaves belong to Bloodwyn.
Yes, but I also said that I won't set anyone free without an order from Thorus.
You're one of those guys who won't take a leak without orders, eh?
Yes, but I also said...
...all right, spare me the rest.
I talked with Thorus. He ordered the slaves to be set free.
Okay, if Thorus ordered it. But I have to ask myself why he decided on something like that...
...but you aren't being paid to ask questions.
All right, all right. I'm obviously not needed here any more, so I'll go get me some stew.
Do you want to eat or chatter? What'll it be?
What's on the menu?
I want to try out a new dish - 'Fire strips in Hammer sauce'.
Fire strips?
Crisp, delicately roasted meat, mixed with pickled fireweed.
But don't worry - I already have the ingredients for that.
Hammer sauce?
A sauce made from a hammer-hard booze. I have a recipe from a guy called Lou.
You get the ingredients and distill the booze up on the alchemist's bench, then I'll make a sauce out of it. What do you think?
I don't have time for that.
Then forget it.
Okay, I'll do it.
All right. Here's the recipe.
I distilled the booze.
Excellent, then I'll finish it.
Here, you can try a portion right away. That'll put some strength in your arm.
Oh, and if I can help you again... For you, all information is for free from now on.
What do you know about the attack?
The thing with Esteban?
You know how it is. The barkeeper hears everything, but never takes sides...
So do you know something?
I didn't say THAT.
At least tell me who I can go to.
Oh, man! Where's the difference? Forget that!
If you were in my place, what would you do?
I would think about what I know about the guy behind it.
First, it was probably one of the bandits, that means he is here in the camp.
Second, that he's here in the camp means that he is watching you.
Third, as long as he thinks that you're on Esteban's side, he'll never reveal himself to you.
So the INTERESTING question is: what are your chances of finding your man?
What are my chances of finding my man?
Hmmm...
They're pretty dim. Some people have noticed that you're involved with Senyan.
You'll have to break off your connection with him, otherwise you'll never have a chance of finding the one responsible for the attack.
You bumped off one of Esteban's people. The man you're looking for will believe you are on his side.
But he won't just reveal himself to you. You will have to find out more.
Finn seems to be really agitated since you talked to him.
And everyone here knows that he's in good standing with Esteban.
That means you probably told him something he didn't want to hear.
That will please the man you are looking for...
However, there is the danger that he will run to Esteban with it - (ironically) but you know that yourself...
They say you told Finn that you work for Esteban.
I don't know what you're really planning, but the man you're looking for will certainly be more careful from now on.
So far everything is still open.
Thanks.
(curtly) Hey! I didn't tell you anything you didn't already know, got it?!
I knew that...
Exactly.
Huno sent me.
Looks like you found your man.
Go on up to the next floor, someone's waiting for you.
What do people here think of Esteban?
You'll have to be a bit more precise...
Each piece of information will cost you...
How much?
10 gold pieces!
You don't have enough gold, boy!
What about Paul?
I don't think he particularly likes Esteban. Since he's been working for Huno, he'll never get into the mine.
What does Huno think of Esteban?
Ah! Huno. I know almost nothing about him.
(grins) That information is, of course, free.
What about Fisk?
Fisk is Fisk. He pays his share to Esteban and distributes the goods he mostly gets from the pirates.
I don't think he really cares about Esteban.
Emilio. What does he think about Esteban?
I don't think he'd bring any flowers to Esteban's grave, if you know what I mean.
What about Senyan?
Senyan is one of Esteban's boys. He's been working for him for quite a while.
What does Lennar think about Esteban?
As far as I can tell, Lennar doesn't think AT ALL.
What about Finn?
A good digger. He has a nose for gold.
Esteban favors him because of it. I think he's in pretty good standing with him.
What do YOU think of Esteban?
Whoever talks about him is soon dead...
How's business?
Good! Esteban's death is a reason for some here to celebrate...
Talk to Bromor if you want to have some fun.
The problem with you guys is that you'd rather slaughter orcs than screw.
If it's talk you're after, go find yourself a woman and marry her.
Well, I'll be damned. Looking for profit, huh? I knew it! You've got the soul of a mercenary.
Listen, if you think you can make a pile here, you're thoroughly mistaken. I was here first.
Hey, you! Magicians make me nervous! Go somewhere else! There's nothing here.
Hey, you, paladin! Go back to your ore mine. There's nothing here.
Understood. Nobody likes to part with his booty.
You said it. Disappear.
And what if I won't go?
Don't play the big man here, squirt, otherwise you'll wind up just like those poor swine lying dead back there in the snow.
Those were your people?
Not any more. No big loss. Those idiots weren't worth much anyway.
What happened to them?
They weren't able to get past the big ice giants back there and got stamped out by them.
If you're such a tough guy, why don't you give it a try?
Why don't you get rid of them yourself?
Come, come. Don't puff yourself up like that.
If you ask me, you're scared shitless.
What's in it for me?
Dunno. Let's say ... 1000 gold pieces. How's that sound?
How would it help you if I did it?
It's all the same to you. But to answer your question, I want to go into the ice region.
Unfortunately, those damned things are in my way.
I'm not playing your little games.
Ahh. Then get out of here, you coward.
What do you want to do in the ice region?
You don't stop with the questions, do you? All right, I'll tell you.
Here, behind these cliffs, is a wasteland of ice like you've never seen before.
A jewel of an ice dragon is hiding there with his fat hoard.
I want it. So, what's it to be? Yes or no?
All right, then. Why not?
Then hurry up. I haven't got all day.
Your path is clear! Your ice giants are no more.
Good work. Let's see what we have.
Just a moment. What about the money?
All in its own good time.
What next?
Well. I'd say it looks pretty bad.
The best thing is you go ahead and I'll just follow you.
Are you afraid?
Nonsense, cut out the drivel. Now move.
All right, then.
Well, go on. Hop to it.
I won't do the dirty work for you.
Coward!
First, I want to see my money.
Once we've got the dragon, you can have as much gold as you can carry.
I want my money now.
Either you go in front or you'll have me to deal with.
I thought you were headed for the ice region.
Go ahead in front. I'll be right behind you.
I could use some help.
Nonsense. You're doing great.
The ice dragon is dead! And now give me everything you have on you!
No way in hell!
It's me who's going to be famous for slaying the ice dragon.
Your small role in this matter is over!
It's time to settle the score.
How's it going?
Have I given you permission to address me?
Thekla has a problem with you.
So? What is the dear lady's problem? And why doesn't she come herself?
You know that damn well ...
(cynically friendly) Why don't you go discuss that with my friend Bullco for a while?
A lot of people talk about you ...
A lot of people talk too much.
What do you think of Lee?
(lightly ironic) Oh, he's a good fighter. I wouldn't ever want to pick a fight with him.
(cold) Unless, of course, it couldn't be avoided.
It has come to my attention that you have it in for my boys!
And as far as I know, you're one of Lee's prot�g�s.
I'm warning you! A few things are going to be different around here soon, and we'll talk about this again then!
Hey, asshole ...
You don't actually think I'd get involved in a duel with you?
Go crawl back under your rock.
You are not permitted to go farther. Turn back!
Innos will turn his wrath upon you if you do not turn back!
You are not permitted to go farther. Turn back!
Pyrokar says I'm allowed to examine Xardas' book.
So, he says that. All right, you may enter. The book you are looking for is over there on the alchemist's bench.
I found a secret door.
(surprised) What? Where?
Behind a bookshelf.
What's behind it?
It looks like an old underground vault.
That is important news, I shall inform Pyrokar of it immediately.
Meanwhile, you must find out what is in this cellar.
I've been to the vault.
And what did you find?
There was a skeleton warrior down there, guarding a door. I killed him.
Well done.
We shall deal with the vault once we have conquered Evil.
It's teeming with monsters down there.
There must be something, keep looking. And show no mercy to those beasts.
Halt! Stop right where you are!
Ack! No problem!
Really! Another lost little lamb, huh? At first, I took you for one of those evil bastards who are haunting the area.
I can see you're probably not one of them. You look much too harmless!
You look like a hunter who doesn't know what to do with his time.
Ha-ha! Yep - you've got a point there. But what am I to do - I cannot get back across the pass!
So I'm just staying here, doing what I do best.
I'm sorry, though, for my pal Engrom.
Come close to my fire and warm yourself up.
Are you a former prisoner of the Barrier?
No, no! What are you thinking? I actually meant to strike it rich out here.
Someone from around here told me that these are the best hunting grounds there are.
Rich pickings, if you know what I mean.
The only thing that is to be had here since those orcs have shown up is a punch in the face if you venture out too far!
And I let those idiots put a flea in my ear.
I know those jokers!
You seem to be doing all right, though.
Oh well! I guess I can't complain. In spite of those blasted orcs, the areas by the river are the least dangerous.
It looks like they don't dare go near the water. Mmh. Just a coincidence, maybe.
Why are you sorry for Engrom?
Because he simply followed me without asking any questions.
And now we've gotten ourselves into this mess. Greed doesn't pay after all.
What are you hunting here by the river?
What a question! Just take a stroll along the river and you'll know what I'm hunting here. Lurkers, of course!
Those things aren't easy to catch, but they taste all the better for it.
Once in a while, I stumble across a scavenger, too. I don't turn up my nose at those, either!
I think your buddy is a little stressed out!
Just cut it out. Don't provoke him any further, or he'll have my head. At this point, there's nothing I can do about us being here.
I'll make up for it some day!
Can you teach me something about hunting?
I see! So you've acquired a taste for it now. All right. But it'll cost you!
What do you want for it?
Would you happen to have anything to eat other than lurker meat? Maybe a hunk of cheese. Yes, a hunk of cheese. I could die for a hunk ...
I'll see what I can do.
Here's your cheese. Will you teach me now?
Really, you've got some? Oh man, it's been ages since I ate something like that. Thank you. Er, what about ... oh yeah. Sure!
I don't have any cheese at the moment!
It would just have been too good to be true. Tell me when you've got some!
What can you teach me?
What do you want to know?
I'll have to disappoint you there. You already know everything I could teach you. Still, thanks again for the cheese!
Chopping off claws is quite simple. You just grab the claw directly at the joint and press it down to the ground.
Then you take your knife and carefully cut off the claw.
The easiest way to skin a lurker is to make a cut along the length of its belly ...
... then tug on its hind legs and thus pull off the skin in one piece from back to front.
Shadowbeast horns are very hard and can be used to create statues or tools.
Hearts of magical beings are very rare and hard to obtain. Be careful when you try that, especially with any kind of golem.
Have you seen anyone come by here?
Yes. There's been some mighty funny fellows running around here lately! They strut about in spiffed-up armor and act all important.
What did those 'funny fellows' want here?
They asked me about provisions and equipment. Man, I've barely got enough for myself!
They were going on about killing dragons and such. Lord knows where those boys came from, but they didn't look particularly trustworthy!
Are you alone here at the moment?
Yes. My buddy Engrom has up and left. Yesterday he said he was having a vision - someone speaking to him very softly.
I didn't hear a thing. I just thought to myself, he's gone off the deep end ...
... and then he was suddenly gone. I've no idea where he went.
If you should see Engrom anywhere, tell him he still owes me a lurker skin, the bastard.
But I was under the impression that he didn't even want to leave here until the orcs are gone.
Like I said - something's wrong with him.
I found your buddy Engrom.
Yes? Where is he?
He's dead.
I don't think you'll see him ever again.
Here. I found this lurker skin on him.
The Seekers have taken possession of him.
The Seekers? Who's that supposed to be?
Henchmen of the nether realms. They are the true leaders of the orcs.
By Innos. I need to get out of here, even if it kills me. Now or never!
Where will you go?
Take me across the pass. Please!!
I must get out of here, across the pass. Out of my way!
All right.
Thank you. When you cross, I'll simply follow you.
Just go ahead and cross.
It's so dark in there. No way am I going in there by myself.
I don't have time for you.
Simply leaving me here to croak. You'll fry in hell for this!
Hey.
Get lost. I can get along without you, scumbag!
The pass wasn't all that bad, was it?
Thanks for rescuing me.
Here. I found this raw stone on the pass. I think it may be of use to you.
I assume it's a runestone.
I assume it's a piece of ore.
May Innos protect you.
Everything all right?
Yes, thank you. Just go now. I'll be OK.
You came over the pass? Well done. We have already lost a lot of men out there.
I know myself what it's like out there - I accompanied a reconnaissance unit for a while.
Do you have a weapon? If you need a good weapon, I'm your man.
What became of the unit?
We scouted the area and wanted to advance to the coast. We set up our camp in a cave.
It was late at night when the orcs came. They charged up the slope with torches and drums - and discovered us.
We tried to flee, but I was the only one who got through ...
Soon after that, the orcs erected their big palisade and we pulled back into the castle.
Show me your wares.
Garond sent me - I need some gear.
Close or long-range combat?
Close combat.
One-handed or two-handed fighter?
Long-range combat.
Bow or crossbow?
One-handed.
Then take this stonebreaker. A good weapon.
Two-handed.
You are well-armed with this two-hander.
Bow.
This hunting bow is exactly right for you. And I'll give you some arrows, too.
Crossbow.
Then take this light crossbow. You can also get bolts from me.
Do you have any news?
The only thing that's happened recently is you dragon hunters coming here.
The dragon hunters have arrived.
They strike me as tough bastards - and I hope they are, because otherwise they won't survive for long.
That's not a happy face you're making.
The orcs will keep on coming. Until we're all dead.
No decent food for weeks. I'm starving.
Hey, I'm all right.
But Pardos is pretty much down and out.
Thanks for helping Pardos.
If there's anything you want, talk to Patrick. He's our spokesman.
So, back to working in the fields?
Hey, the guy who saved my life! Yeah, it's more hard labor for me now.
Especially with those two nutty brothers. Oh man, the bandits weren't THAT bad ...
What are you doing here?
I am traveling by order of Lord Hagen.
You absolutely must try to reach the castle and speak to Commander Garond.
May Innos be with you! Do you bring news from the castle? Are reinforcements coming soon?
I haven't come to bring news, but to get news.
Then speak to Fajeth. He's in command here. But if you have news from the castle, then let me know.
About the news ...
Yes - what's the situation in the castle?
It is still besieged by the orcs, and also still open to the dragons' attacks.
Damn, I hope the boys will hold out.
Listen, a friend of mine is in the castle. His name is Udar. We've known each other a long time and fought a lot of battles side by side.
I want you to take him this ring. He is to keep it safe for me. Tell him I'll get it when I come back.
I've got no time for that.
I understand.
No problem. When I get to the castle, I will give the ring to Udar.
Good. The magic of the ring will give Udar new strength. And tell him that I'll get it back from him.
How's your situation here?
We are surrounded by monsters and have hardly mined any ore so far. Plus we've lost a lot of good men.
I don't know how long we can hold out, but we won't give up!
I could use your help. Fajeth wants me to hunt the lizards, and ...
I take orders ONLY from Fajeth. And my orders say to guard the mining site. And that's exactly what I'm doing.
Maybe someone else will help you.
What are you doing here in my kitchen?
Something smells delicious here!
Oh yes! I know the likes of you! They're swarming all over the place.
First they try to get on your good side, and then, when you need them, they're nowhere to be seen!
I'm hungry!
I don't dish out food to tramps. I only feed people who work.
(contemptuously) And that mercenary riffraff, of course.
Here, your grub.
We don't serve militiamen here.
How could I refuse the request of a representative of Innos?
I'm looking for work ...
You want to work here on the farm?
Only Onar can decide that. The farm is his, and so's the entire valley.
Actually, I was planning to join the mercenaries ...
So you're another of those felons from the penal colony?
I might have known! Just leave me alone! There's already enough of your kind around here!
I need a place to sleep.
Don't even think about sleeping in my kitchen. Go find yourself a place in the barn.
What's your problem with the mercenaries?
Ah, those morons really get on my nerves! Especially Sylvio and his fat buddy Bullco.
The two of them have been sitting in their corner for days now, making life miserable for me.
The soup is too hot, the meat is too tough, et cetera and so forth.
Then why don't you do anything about it?
And what am I to do, Mr. Smartypants? Whack them with my rolling pin? I can do that to the farmers, but these lowly bastards just hit back.
Want me to teach the two of them some manners?
You had better not try that, honey. As far as I know, Sylvio has magic armor. He can't be defeated.
And what about Bullco?
That guy is strong as an ox. So far, he has flattened anyone who tried to mess with him or Sylvio.
You really let Bullco have it, honey.
Must have been an exhausting job to thrash that fat swine.
That's quite a licking you took there, honey.
Didn't I tell you? Now you know what I mean.
I'm happy to see you're having fun.
Now don't you pull a face like that. You're not the first one who got beaten up by that scum.
Here, have a bite to eat so you'll gain back your strength.
Here's the package from Sagitta.
Thanks a lot. So you can make yourself useful after all.
Can I have some more of your stew?
I haven't got any now.
Not even a tiny bowl?
No.
Can I lick the pot, then?
Will you cut it out!
If you're so keen on my stew, you'll have to do something to get it.
What?
Go see Sagitta, the healer who lives behind Sekob's farm, and bring me a package of her herbs.
If you bring me the herbs, I'll make you some stew.
All right. I'll be nice, then. Here. So you won't starve before my very eyes.
Hey, hey, hey, not so greedy! I'll let you know when I have anything else for you to do.
And THEN you can have more stew, got it?
I heard you helped Bennet get out of jail. Good job, kid.
These militia bastards threw Bennet in the hole.
Do me a favor and get him out of there, will you? In the meantime, I'll cook you some yummy stew.
I've got nothing left. Come back later.
You're always hungry, aren't you? Just what is it you do all the time?
I've done in a few dragons.
Oh! I guess it's time for a hearty bowl of stew, then.
That was it. No more stew left over.
No herbs, no stew - understood?
You have murdered my Gritta. I shall never forgive you. Out of my sight, you murderer!
Ah! A fresh face. You're not from Khorinis, are you?
This is not a good time for travelers. Bandits everywhere, no work, and now the farmers have risen up, too.
What winds have blown you here?
I'm looking for work.
Do you know anything about carpentry?
The only thing I can make out of wood is a fire.
And what about locks?
Weeell ...
I'm sorry, but I can't use you if you know nothing about my trade.
And I have no money to pay for an apprentice.
What if I want to start an apprenticeship with one of the other masters here?
All right, I shall give you my approval.
But you had better get yourself the blessing of the gods first.
Say, are you a man of faith?
Then go to Vatras, the priest of Adanos, and have him give you his blessing.
He will tell you where you can find a priest of Innos. You should get his blessing, too.
Once you have received the blessing of the gods, I shall vote for you.
Yes. A most humble servant, Master Thorben.
Well, if you mean, do I say my prayers regularly ...
I see!
A man who does not ply his trade with the blessing of the gods will never receive my approval.
Ask the gods for forgiveness for your transgressions.
How about your approval, Master?
Has Vatras given you his blessing?
Yes.
And did you also get the blessing of a priest of Innos?
Yes, I did.
Then you shall have my blessing as well. No matter what path you decide to take - take pride in doing a good job, my boy!
No. Not yet ...
You know my terms. You should only ply your trade with the blessing of the gods.
Not yet ...
Then I don't know why you're asking me again. You know my terms.
So you know a lot about locks?
What good is a fine chest without a fine lock?
I make my own locks. That way, I can at least be sure that I haven't built my chests that sturdy for nothing.
A poorly made lock is easy to break. And there are plenty of thieves about in Khorinis. Especially lately!
I've got Lehmar's ledger right here ...
(suspiciously) Where did you get that?
That shouldn't interest you so much as the fact that your name is in it.
Give it to me!
What will you give me, then?
I have no money to spare and can give you nothing but my heartfelt gratitude.
Can you teach me how to pick locks?
If it weren't for you, I'd be paying Lehmar for the rest of my life.
I shall teach you what you want to know.
You have brought me the 100 gold pieces. That was very decent of you.
I am almost embarrassed, but I must ask even more of you.
If I cannot pay back my debt to Lehmar soon, he's going to send his thugs after me.
Give me another 100 gold pieces, and I shall instruct you.
You have paid Gritta's debt with Matteo. You seem to be a decent fellow. I shall teach you what you want to know.
However, I cannot do it for free. I still have a mountain of debts, and I need the money.
How much do you charge?
200 gold pieces.
Hmm ... I don't know whether you can be trusted or not.
For all I know, you might be one of those layabouts who only come to town to empty the chests of honest people.
I'm not going to teach you anything before I'm convinced that you are an honest fellow.
Fine. Here are 200 gold pieces.
This money will really help me. We can start as soon as you're ready.
You're still a few coins short of 200. I need that money.
Fine. Here are 100 gold pieces.
In that case, we can start whenever you're ready.
Hey, you're still a few coins short of 100.
Maybe later ...
Teach me how to pick a lock!
All you need is a lock pick. If you move it carefully left and right in the lock, you can unbolt the mechanism.
But if you move it too much or too fast in the wrong direction, it will snap right off.
The more adept you become, the fewer lock picks you are going to need. That's all there is to it, really.
Can you sell me some lock picks?
If I have any left...
Well, all right. But they won't be of any use to you as long as you don't know how they work.
Have you had an apprentice before?
Yes, and not too long ago.
And? What happened?
His name is Elvrich. He's my nephew.
I was quite pleased with him, actually, but one day he simply didn't show up for work.
How long has it been since you saw him?
I guess it must be about 2 weeks.
Where is Elvrich now?
How would I know? He kept hanging around that filthy brothel by the harbor.
I wouldn't be surprised if he's still warming the bed of some whore down there.
Have you reported that to the militia?
Of course I have. They were supposed to catch him and see to it that the lazy-bones does his work. But I already regret that.
He can do whatever he wants. Sooner or later he'll realize that he'll get nowhere in Khorinis without a decent job.
(cynically) Is that so?
Elvrich will work for you again from now on.
I can only hope that he won't disappear again when the next little tart waves her skirts at him.
Take this gold as a reward for bringing back my apprentice.
What do you know about the paladins?
Not much. They arrived by ship two weeks ago from the mainland.
Since then, they have withdrawn to the upper end of town.
Nobody here really knows exactly why they have come.
Many are afraid of an attack by the orcs.
I suppose, however, that they are here to quell the farmers' rebellion.
Do you know anything about the peasants' rebellion?
Rumor has it that Onar the landowner has hired mercenaries to keep the King's troops from breathing down his neck.
He was probably tired of having to throw his harvest along with his livestock at paladins and militia.
All we notice of this in town is that the food prices keep rising.
Onar's farm lies far to the east of here. We wouldn't know if there's any fighting going on there.
If you want to know more, ask the merchants in the marketplace. They get around the island more than I do.
I've come about Gritta ...
My niece? What's your business with her? This isn't about money, is it?
She owes 100 gold pieces to the merchant Matteo.
Tell me this isn't true. Ever since that little piece of work moved in with me, I've had nothing but trouble!
She's in debt with practically every single merchant in town.
I had to borrow 200 gold pieces from Lehmar the moneylender just to settle her debts! And now this!
Gritta should be in the house.
Go ahead, ask her. But I can tell you this: she doesn't have a SINGLE gold piece.
We shall see ...
Your niece had 100 gold pieces.
WHAT? The brazen little serpent - that was MY gold! She took it from my chest.
Give it back to me! I have to pay off Lehmar first. Matteo can get his money later!
From what I know of this little viper, I'm sure she'll run straight to the city guard and accuse you, too!
I shall see to it that the matter is settled.
I've already given Matteo his gold!
Damn! Oh well - a debt is a debt. At least you didn't keep the money. I guess I should thank you for that.
No. Matteo will get his money back from me.
You're getting me into a right old mess that way. Lehmar is not terribly generous when it comes to debts.
But at least you are planning to pay my niece's debts. I guess I ought to thank you for that.
Here's your gold.
Thanks! Now I have at least part of the money I owe Lehmar.
I can't believe she had the audacity to take my gold!
You know the rule. No one goes into the mine without a red stone tablet.
Forget the mine - I have to see Raven.
Even then. We have rules here and they apply to everyone. Even to you.
Go back. If you try to enter the upper square without permission, the other guards will kill you. THOSE are the rules.
If you have a problem with that, go talk to Esteban. He's responsible for the camp.
It's important that I get to Raven...
Oh, yeah? Do you really think you can make it through to him?
His guards have orders not to let ANYONE in. You'd be dead before you even saw him.
So knock that idea out of your head.
Don't you remember me? From the Old Camp...
You were one of the prisoners?! Maybe you were one of my guards. And? Does that make us allies now?
No, it doesn't.
Maybe you're the guy who brought down the Barrier - maybe you also killed my pals.
So what?
Those times are over.
You want in? Then get yourself a red stone and don't waste my time.
Come on, let me in. For old times' sake.
Let me explain something to you. Do you know why I'm still alive?
Because I've always been loyal to my people.
I don't have to agree with everything Raven does. But I'll stick to the rules.
And so will you!
(firmly) No!
I have a stone tablet for you here...
You don't have the right stone. Only the red ones are important.
I have a red stone tablet here...
Okay.
You killed Esteban - so YOU will do his job now.
They have a few problems with minecrawlers in the mine.
Three diggers have bought it already. It's your job to provide replacements.
And when can I finally get into the damned mine?
Do your job - afterwards you can do what you want.
I sent out three guys.
All right. Then as far as I'm concerned you can go in.
Hey, what's with your armor? Where can I get armor like that?
You can't. This armor is reserved for Raven's guard.
I hardly think there's an entrance exam for new candidates. But the ultimate decision isn't mine, it's Raven's.
How are the prisoners?
Mmh, they've done their job. As far as I know, they're supposed to be digging gold now.
And if they escape...?
...Bloodwyn will send his guards after them. But I hardly think they would be crazy enough to try to escape.
Unless...
Unless, what?
...someone else put them up to it. But I don't know anyone stupid enough to do that... at least, so long as Bloodwyn is here.
What are you planning?
What??
Now you've cleared Bloodwyn out of the way, too. I'm just asking myself who's next. Raven? Or me?
Are you afraid?
I'm not afraid of a fight. But I am afraid of the consequences of your actions.
This camp is the only thing we have left.
It may not have always run to perfection, but it DOES run.
And with every person you kill, another piece of our community breaks up.
We are bandits. Outcasts, lawbreakers, desperados.
Wherever we go, we're hunted, locked up and killed.
There is no better place for us than this, no better time than now.
What are you getting at?
These men need someone to lead them. Who should that be? You? You, who is constantly roaming from place to place?
Then you take over the leadership of the camp.
Okay, but what about Raven?
Raven will soon have other worries. I'll take care of him.
Oh, yes, and make sure that the prisoners can leave the camp in peace.
All right. I shall take care of all the guards out here.
I did it. Raven is finished.
That means you've given Beliar a swift kick.
Then you'll be moving on?
My job in this valley is done. I could use a few days' rest.
(laughs) Yeah, you're constantly on the move, aren't you? (seriously) Have a good journey.
Who knows, maybe we'll run into each other again.
Who knows. There will be lots of gates and passages for you to go through. And you're bound to find me on one of them...
Well, kiddo?
That's no way for a farmhand to talk to me - just how often do I have to remind you?
Are you in charge here?
(intimidated) Eh. No, I'm only Sekob's son. But once my old man is no longer with us, then all the land you can see here will belong to me.
Amazing!
I'm not a field hand.
And what do you want here? We have nothing. So you can just leave right now.
Is that how you always treat your field workers?
Of course - they need that. Whoever doesn't toe the line here gets thrashed, that's the way it goes.
I need to talk to your father.
He hasn't got time. But I'm his deputy. What can I help you with?
By introducing me to your father.
You're a real tough guy and a good fighter, huh?
The best.
I think maybe I'd better get him then.
Never mind, boy. I'll find him, I'm sure.
If you say so.
So what do you do when you're not busy playing ruler of the farm?
Stand guard.
The filthy militiamen from the city are coming onto our land more and more often and stealing everything they can get their hands on.
Only last week the bastards were here, and they just took some of our sheep.
If I could get my hands on one of them, I'd make short work of him.
But of course!
Why don't the mercenaries help you against the militia?
Before they even get warmed up, I've long since driven them off.
There's this guy who demands a toll from every passer-by, claiming HE's the farmer.
(sheepish) Eh. Yes. I know. That's Bronco. He does whatever he wants.
Not that I haven't pounded it into him a thousand times that he should finally get back to work.
But?
He just doesn't do it.
My father is quite annoyed with me that I still haven't managed to persuade him to go back to work.
Maybe I can help you.
Do you mean that? Okay, listen, if you get Bronco to go back to work, I'll pay you, shall we say 10 gold pieces. What do you say?
I'll think about it.
Suit yourself.
All right. I'll see what I can do.
But hurry up about it.
I want more.
No problem. But I want more money.
All right. 20 gold pieces, then.
Maybe ... 50?
All right. 70?
Okay, okay! I'll give you 100 gold coins. But that's all I have.
Bronco is back at work.
Really? That's terrific.
Yes. And now I want my cash.
(hesitantly) Mmh. Well. Business is business, right?
Unfortunately, I don't have that much money. But I'm very grateful for your help.
Far away from home, are you? Daddy won't be able to help you here.
One of these days I'm going to shut your big mouth.
You loser, count yourself lucky if I let you keep your life.
Then just leave me alone.
Maybe you should eat more so you'll grow big and strong.
One day I'll show you.
You miserable little ...
Just go away.
Has anyone blown your nose for you today?
Leave me alone, you idiot.
Why are you sitting around here?
I've got problems. At the moment, it's better for my health if I'm not seen in the camp.
What's wrong?
I had really good relations with some of the pirates, you see?
I was always meeting the boys outside their camp and trading.
Man! I bought stuff for half the camp. 'Tom bring me this - Tom bring me that.'
And then that bastard Esteban got in between.
What happened?
Esteban sent Juan - one of his boys. The bastard waylaid us.
I was just about to make a deal with the pirates when he came out of the dark and knocked me down with two blows!
Man, that guy is fast! But not fast enough. I was able to get away from him.
And since the ambush you've been hiding here?
First I went back to the camp and let Fisk, Huno and the others know that they could forget their delivery.
And that Esteban was behind it.
If Esteban finds out that I told the others that HE was responsible, I'm dead.
That's why I can't go back to the camp.
Esteban is dead.
Really? Man, THAT'S lucky!
Who did it?
(mischieviously) Let's just say, someone you know...
Thanks for coming to me. Now I can go back to the camp...
What else?
Now I can down Lucia's booze in peace again.
Now I can finally show my face in the camp again!
Else? Else I'll sit here counting rocks...
What do you want? I'm just an imprisoned worker. I haven't done a thing.
So, back to working in the fields?
Hey, the guy who saved my life! Yeah, it's more hard labor for me now.
Especially with those two nutty brothers. Oh man, the bandits weren't THAT bad ...
(grumpy) What do you want from me?
I want to join the mercenaries!
Oh? And why do you think I should be in favor of you being accepted here?
Put me to the test!
Did Lee send you to me?
He said you would help me.
(sigh) Fine. So here we go: There are two things you have to do before you can join us.
First: You have to prove that you're capable of mastering the tasks that you will have to fulfill as a mercenary. I'll put you to the test.
And second: You have to earn the respect of the other mercenaries.
No.
Then what are you blathering at me for?
How can I earn the respect of the other mercenaries?
For most of them, it will be enough if you fulfill your task and pass my test.
But you'll have to find some other way of convincing some of them.
Some will try and exploit your situation, and others may not like your mug.
You should try to get along with as many of the boys as possible - but if nothing else helps, you can always take part in a duel.
If you win, you'll earn the respect of most of them. But watch out that you don't kill one of them by accident. Because then you'll have a big problem.
What are the rules for a duel?
Quite simple. Both opponents have to have the opportunity to draw their weapons before the first blow.
You can't just go and belt one of the men without warning.
There has to be some sort of spoken challenge. An insult, or another reason to fight.
None of the other men will interfere in a fight like that. Unless one of the two gets killed in the duel.
What about you? Will you vote me in?
If you can prove that you can fulfill the duties of a mercenary, yes.
How's my reputation among the mercenaries?
Let's see ...
Wolf says he has nothing against you joining.
Jarvis thinks you're on the right side.
Jarvis still isn't sure if you're on the right side.
He doesn't want more people dancing to Sylvio's tune. For that matter, neither do I.
Cord thinks you would be good enough to join.
It's Cord's opinion that you first need to learn how to handle weapons better.
Cipher says that for him it was crystal clear that you'd get to join. Something seems to have made him really happy.
Cipher says you owe him a little favor, and that you know what that's all about.
Rod just wants to have his sword back.
You seem to have convinced Rod that you're strong enough.
Rod thinks you're a weakling.
Sentenza will vote for you. He says you were a very reasonable man.
Sentenza won't vote for you. He says you still owe him 50 gold pieces.
Raoul is against you. I think he can't stand you.
I don't need to say anything about Sylvio and Bullco. Those two morons are against everyone.
Buster says you're okay.
Although you lost to him.
Buster said you chickened out when he challenged you.
That's not a good idea. Maybe you should go back to the outpost and challenge him.
And Dar says you're a blabbermouth. But his vote doesn't count for very much here.
The rest of the mercenaries haven't said anything.
Most of them are just waiting to see if you pass the test.
You convinced most of them by passing the test.
(grins) Even if Cord had a little hand in it ...
Although a lot of them say that getting a farmer to pay his rent was too easy for a test.
You have my vote, in any case.
And you won some fair duels.
A lot of mercenaries respect that.
At any rate, you won some fair duels already.
Most of the mercenaries are for you - as far as we're concerned, you can start with us any time.
Go to Lee. He'll explain everything else to you.
That's quite a lot, but it still isn't enough.
You'll have to keep fighting with the boys for a while.
You're far from done, kid. If you want us to accept you, you'll have to do something for it.
What are my duties as a mercenary?
Onar hired us for two reasons: He wants us to keep the militia off his back, and he wants us to keep things in order on his farms.
That includes collecting the rent when the small farmers won't pay.
So, what'll it be?
Good. Listen. The farmer Sekob hasn't paid his rent to Onar for weeks.
Onar wants him to cough up 50 gold pieces. Any questions?
Where is Sekob's farm?
In the north of the valley. Looking from here, that's to the right at the big crossroad.
If you have problems, the farmers in the fields will help you find your way around the area.
The farmer Bengar has complained that lately the militia from the city has been getting on his nerves.
They're pressuring the farmer - probably trying to make him break with Onar.
I want you to go to his farm and make it clear to the militia that they have no business there! Questions?
How can I find Bengar's farm?
In the southwest of the valley is a big stairway that leads to a high plain. That's where Bengar's farm is.
If you get lost, ask the farmers in the fields how to find your way around the area.
Let me collect the rent!
I'll deal with the militia, don't worry!
You took an awfully long time there. Onar won't be very happy.
And it's all the same to him if the paladins get eaten in the Valley of Mines or not ...
Well done! When I have something new, I'll let you know.
I collected the rent from Sekob.
And? Did he pay willingly?
Well, he had a deadly accident ...
I had to convince him first.
Well done! You passed your test. That will convince a lot of the mercenaries that you have what it takes.
And? Did you blow it on booze? Bring me the money! And be quick about it!
I took care of Bengar's militia problem.
Did you make sure that they won't be standing on his doorstep again tomorrow?
They'd have a really hard time doing that ...
Well done!
You passed your test. If you can handle the militia, most here will respect you.
Welcome to the mercenaries, kid!
Thanks!
As soon as I have something for you to do, I'll let you know.
Where have you been?
I was in the Valley of Mines! There are dragons there! They gave the paladins a pretty hard time!
So? Then there really is something to the stories!
Lee will be interested ...
Good thing you're here. I've got something for you to do ...
What is it?
And see to it that you finish by tomorrow!
Can you help me improve my abilities?
I could show you how you can use your strength better in close combat.
A lot of fighters are very weak because they don't have the technique to use their strength properly.
The same is true for dexterity and ranged weapons.
I want to improve my abilities!
I said I COULD help you, not that I WOULD.
As long as you aren't one of us, you can find someone else to instruct you!
Good! Now you can use your abilities better!
Have you got something for me to do?
Have you seen those black-hooded guys creeping by here? Those people give me the willies, I'll tell you.
When I was at sea, I saw some pretty curious things, but those fellows really scare me.
They went in the direction of the bandit camp in the mountains at the southern end of the valley.
Maybe you should go there to check on those guys, and do away with them!
The black-hooded men in the mountains are no longer with us.
You were able to deal with them? Good man!
I didn't trust those guys one bit. They were bound to cause a lot of trouble ...
Some of the mercenaries have left?
Sylvio took a few of the boys and disappeared over the pass.
It's rumored that some dragons have shown up there. When he heard that, there was no stopping him.
Who knows? A dragon trophy is sure to bring a ton of money on the open market.
That's nothing for me. I'm a sailor. I belong on the sea and not in a stuffy dragon's den.
You're a sailor?
Did you finally catch on to that? Aye, damnit, I'm a sailor. Why do you ask?
I could use your abilities. I need to go to an island.
(laughs) To an island? You don't even have a ship, let alone a crew to man her.
No, my boy. If you want to engage my services as a captain and strength teacher, then first you'll have to prove to me that you know what you're talking about.
Besides which, I already have other worries. The paladins haven't pulled out of the city as expected.
Something serious will have to happen to get them to clear the field.
Go to the castle in the Valley of Mines. Steal the key for the main gate from the gate guard and open it. The orcs will take care of the rest!
The gate to the castle in the Valley of Mines is open and jammed. There's nothing to keep the orcs from storming the castle now.
The paladins in the castle have suffered some heavy losses against the orcs.
It won't be long now, I guess, before the paladins from the city advance to the Valley of Mines to get their boys out of the castle.
That's pleasant news. So now there's nothing to prevent me from escaping from this accursed region.
Now will you help me get to the island?
Oh, yeah. You wanted to go to an island. Mmh. I'll make you a suggestion.
You pay me 2500 gold coins and I'll captain your ship.
For that, I'll also teach you strength and dexterity wherever you want to go.
That's an awful lot of gold.
Well. Good help is expensive. You don't have any other choice. You won't find anyone else in this area to captain your ship.
So pay the money and don't make any trouble.
All right. Here's your gold.
Wonderful. Now you just have to tell me exactly what I'm supposed to do.
Are you trying to fob me off with a few coins? First get the money. Then we'll see.
Be my captain.
All right. Get me a ship and a sufficiently strong crew, and I'll take you to your damned island.
Do you have a nautical chart? We won't get far without one of those things.
I'll take care of all that. I'll see you at the harbor.
I can't wait to see how you do that.
Let's set out for the island.
All right. Give me the chart and we're off.
(calls) All hands on board.
Make sure you really have everything you might need with you. There's no way back.
If you're sure, then go bunk down in the captain's cabin. The journey will take a while.
No ship, no crew, no sea chart, no trip, my friend.
I want to see at least 5 men, willing and able to sail a ship.
I've decided on a different captain. You can return my money now.
Wouldn't you like that. Nothing doing. If you pay me first and then don't want my services after all, that's your problem.
Everything quiet?
So far. But that could change in an instant. Watch your back.
If those miserable orcs stay where they are, I don't see a problem.
I want to improve my abilities!
I've eliminated the enemy.
I didn't expect anything else. How's it look? Can we finally leave now?
I'll need another minute or two.
Hurry up!
What's going on here?
What do you mean?
You're the second fellow to rush past here like he's been stung by bloodflies.
Where did the other one go?
He ran up that way like lightning.
Who was the other guy?
He looked like one of those brainy novices from the monastery back there.
You can say what you like, but somehow those guys aren't quite right in the head.
Just look at their silly clothes. I wouldn't want to be caught in the street at night in those. (laughs)
Be careful what you say. I used to be a novice in the monastery myself.
(laughs) You poor swine. That certainly explains a few things.
No offense. Be on your way. You're a busy man, don't let me keep you.
Somebody should teach you some manners.
Now don't be offended. All right, if you absolutely want a fight, you can have one.
So show me what you've got, novice.
I need to get going.
Hey. No problem.
What's your business here?
You ask a damn lot of questions for such a young whippersnapper.
Name the goblin cave we crawled through together, and I'll tell you my secrets.
Otherwise, mind your own business.
What are you doing here?
What's it to you?
I'm looking for a novice.
That's very interesting. We're looking for someone, too.
Just asking.
Understood. But what are YOU doing here?
Anyway, this is our road and we don't like it when someone bothers us here.
I'm looking for a novice.
That's very interesting. We're looking for someone, too.
And who would that be?
You!
That's none of your business.
What do you mean? Are you looking for trouble?
No, never mind. No trouble.
I understand, you filled your pants. Now scram.
If you insist.
Ho ho, you've got a big mouth.
It's time I shut it for you.
I'm only having a look around.
Do that, but stop bugging us.
That's it for you.
Who are you?
What is this? An interrogation?
I have nothing to tell you, but you might want to talk to my buddy here.
But be careful, he doesn't take to strangers.
All right, buddy. You're in for it now.
You had damned luck when you came in. I very nearly shot you.
Then I guess I should be glad that you have such keen eyesight.
Save your breath. Talk to Sengrath if you want something.
I heard that you are the BEST crossbowman far and wide.
If they say so, it must be true. What do you want?
Teach me how to shoot a crossbow..
Scram! There are enough targets running around outside the castle. Practice on them.
I am the greatest.
(laughing) You're all right!
Well, if you want to learn, then I'll help you.
I want to learn form you.
Okay, fire away!
You already know the basics - we don't have time for more.
To improve your handling of the weapon, you should look for a proper teacher.
How are things in the castle?
A few of the boys are practicing, but in principle we're all just waiting for something to happen.
This uncertainty is wearing us down. That's the strategy of those blasted orcs. They'll wait until our nerves are shot.
Here, I bring you Tengron's ring. It's supposed to protect you. Tengron sys he'll come and get it once he's back.
What? Do you know what ring that is? He got that ring as an award for his courage in battle.
You say he wants to get it back? If it's the will of Innos, he is going to. If it's the will of Innos ...
It's good that you've come. All hell is breaking loose here.
What happened?
The dragon hunters are strutting around here in the castle and bragging that they can solve the dragon problem.
But I'll tell you what, the way they look, they won't even kill a sick, old snapper.
A lot of us are getting really worried by now and no longer truly believe that we'll ever make it out of here alive.
Weren't there two of you sentinels up here?
Not any more. Sengrath stood here on the battlements when suddenly he fell asleep.
His good crossbow fell down when that happened.
We could only just see one of the orcs snatch it up and disappear with it into the darkness.
Sengrath woke up then and just ran into the night towards the Orc palisades. He hasn't come back since.
Innos be with us!
I've found Sengrath.
Really? Where is he?
He's dead. Here's his crossbow. He had it with him.
He must have gotten his crossbow back, but then the orcs seem to have slain him after all.
Damn fool. I knew it. We're all going to die.
Another underhanded attack like that and we're history.
The orcs are very worried. Something's given them a hell of a scare. I can feel it.
I've got a really bad feeling about this.
What are you doing here?
I'm trying to fulfill the tasks the monastery has set me to your satisfaction.
I am a novice from the monastery. I run errands for the magicians and also the paladins.
I have provided the three innkeepers in the city with wine from the monastery.
Who are the three innkeepers?
One of them is the good man here behind the bar.
Then there is Caragon, who has his tavern on the temple square, and Kardif, the owner of the pub in the harbor district.
What can you tell me about the monastery?
We novices seek enlightenment in prayer to Innos and learn the principles of faith from the magicians.
We serve them as we serve Innos and prepare ourselves for the union with the Fire.
Take me to the monastery.
Forget it. Do you know how many creatures I had to evade on the way?
When I think of all those bloodflies, wolves and goblins, I'm glad that I don't have to leave here any more.
Besides, you can't enter the monastery anyway.
Why not?
Entrance is only permitted to magicians, paladins and novices.
How can I become a novice?
If a man feels the deep desire ...
Hey - just tell me what the conditions are.
You need the offerings. A sheep and ...
How am I supposed to get that much gold?
Since you obviously don't know anyone who would pay that for you, you'll simply have to go to work.
Where can I find a sheep?
From the farmers, of course. But you won't get one for nothing.
Hey, do you know what happened?
You have been chosen.
Right. Just as I was about to have a cool sip of beer - Daron comes around the corner and tells me that I've been chosen.
Who would have thought? The will of Innos is unfathomable. And what brings you here?
I have demanded the Test of Fire.
It's not possible?! Boy, you are damned brave. Does that mean that you will also seek 'that which the believer finds behind the path'?
Looks like it.
Have you found out anything yet?
Well, I just followed Agon - but in the meantime I lost him.
And now ... what do they say? Follow the signs of Innos. But I don't understand that bit with the path ...
So what, I'll keep searching.
Hey, are you following me?
Nonsense. I just happen to be going the same direction as you.
Stop running after me!
I'm not following you. But please, if that's what you think - then I'll take a different path now.
So we meet again. I've been thinking, you know. I believe that the desire to be a magician is strong in me.
Oh man - don't do that ...
I have no choice. A novice's life is not for me.
I just have to be a magician. Then everything will go well with me. And now I shall take what I'm entitled to.
Do you have any last words?
Cut it out, I don't want to kill you.
Big talk. But you know you don't have a chance against me! Let's go!
Let's get straight down to it - I need to go back to the monastery.
You're not going anywhere ever again!
Have you got anything to smoke?
You're lucky. I've actually got something right here.
Let's get it over with.
Hey, do you really think we're going the right way? A troll lives back there somewhere.
I think I'd rather look in a different direction.
Look, the new novice appears before the High Council. Innos be with you, son.
What exactly is the task of the High Council?
It is our duty to proclaim the will of Innos. Thus, we name the chosen novices who will be put to the Test of Magic.
Even though we lead a retired life, we turn our gaze upon the events of the world, for the church of Innos represents the highest earthly law.
Ah, so you're interested in what's going on in the world ...
So what do you think of those dragons squatting in the Valley of Mines, with their army growing every day?
I understand that you are angry, but we must first weigh your words before we take any steps.
If we allow ourselves to be carried away and act rashly now, we will achieve nothing. Therefore, fulfill your tasks - and we shall discuss what is to be done.
Tell me about the Test of Magic.
It is the chance for the chosen novices to enter the guild of magicians. But only one can pass the test.
And Innos alone chooses the novices for it.
When's the test going to take place?
As soon as we have heard the will of Innos. We inform the chosen novices, and put them to the test.
I am ready to face your test, Master.
I am not surprised that you know the old law.
But I suspect that you do not realize what risk you are taking. Bear in mind that an impatient spirit will not withstand the Test of Fire.
It has been a long time since anyone took this test. And there is only one man who ever survived it, and passed.
A young ambitious novice then, he has long since found his place in the High Council - I speak of Serpentes.
He won't be the only one who ever passed that test for much longer.
Then I shall not keep you waiting any longer. Hear my test for you:
Create a fire arrow rune. That is all - may Innos help you.
You know your task. Attend to it.
I have created the rune!
Well done, novice. You shall keep this, your first rune.
Once you have reached the first Circle of Fire, you will be able to use it.
You have fulfilled this test to my satisfaction.
But the dangerous task which Serpentes has assigned you still lies before you!
Any news?
Not at the moment. Go and complete your tasks. You still have much to do.
No. Nothing which you do not already know, Brother.
One more thing. Some of the roadside shrines dedicated to Innos have been desecrated by the enemy. They have lost their magical consecration.
I see. And now?
It is up to you to purify these shrines, so that the situation does not escalate.
Take this holy water and trickle it on the base of the shrine.
With the holy words of purification, the shrine will regain its old power.
Gorax can sell you a map on which our shrines are marked.
Here's a map for you. The shrines which we have set up are marked on it.
Now go and perform your tasks.
One more little thing. Stay away from the roadside shrines. We have heard that some of them have been desecrated.
No one can say what effect they now have.
It is not your task to solve this problem. The paladins will take care of this matter.
I have purified all the shrines.
Excellently done, my son. I am proud of you. May Innos watch over you.
Take this Amulet of Strength, that it may be of use to you in battle against the enemy.
Good news. The roadside shrines have been purified. The strength of Innos has helped the paladins to remove this problem from the world.
You may once again make your donations to Innos without reservation or regret.
Well, what have we here?
My name is Valentino. I'm trying not to profane this day given to me by Innos with work.
Mind your words.
Oh, pardon me, I meant no offense to our Lord. Please forgive me, sir.
Have you no manners? That's disgusting!
Always this filthy rabble. Haven't you a job where you ought to be?
But I suppose no one would miss a down-at-the-heels fellow like you, hey?
Well, if you had as much gold as I do, you wouldn't have to work either. But you'll never be that rich.
I see I'm going to have lots of fun with you.
I asked you who you are!
I am Valentino the handsome. Bon vivant and ladies' man.
Poor in cares, rich in wisdom and gold, and the women throw themselves at me.
If you have problems, keep them. I don't need them.
Looks like I'm going to have to teach you some manners!
Doesn't matter to me! Thrash me all you want. When I get up tomorrow, I'll be fine again.
But you'll have to run around with that mug of yours for life.
(calmly) Do you have anything else to tell me?
Make yourself popular, never promise anything to anyone, take what you can, and watch out that you don't get into a quarrel with the militia.
Or with jealous husbands, of course - they're the worst, let me tell you.
For a man in your position, anything is possible. You simply have to recognize when it's time to act.
So don't waste any time, and act.
I've told you everything you need to know - the rest is up to you.
I'm busy.
Where can I find myself some weed?
No idea. Better keep your fingers off of that stuff.
