Because, if you keep asking about it, you might burn them ...
There are many rumors about you in Khorinis.
They say you were involved in the murder of innocent people.
If that's truly the case, I can only warn you, son.
Do not leave the path of balance and preservation of this world, or you will have to bear the consequences.
Tell me. What can I do to help you?
What have you got to say for yourself?
Get stuffed.
There isn't a trace of remorse in your words.
You leave me no choice.
I'm sorry. I didn't know what I was doing.
I shall pray for you and hope that you will come to your senses again.
Woe betide you if I hear of another murder that you've had a hand in.
Your words are as false as your deeds.
You just won't cease your pointless killing.
You leave me no choice.
Wait!
If you see Lares ...
I'd like you to do me a little favor.
Go down to the harbor. You'll find a man there named Lares.
Give him this ornament and tell him that it needs to be returned. He'll know what to do with it.
Adanos be with you.
Who are you?
I am Vatras, a servant of Adanos, the guardian of the divine and earthly equilibrium.
What can I do for you?
Here, I've got a letter for you.
For me?
Yes, but ... it's been opened. I hope it didn't fall into the wrong hands.
Indeed. This is an important message you're bringing me.
I wonder how you got hold of this letter.
I took it from some bandits.
(worried) By Adanos. That's not good. That's not good at all.
If what you say is true, we've got a huge problem.
I shall have to take care of it as soon as possible.
I got it from Cavalorn, the hunter.
(surprised) Cavalorn? Where is he?
He told me to tell you he couldn't make it and is headed for the meeting point. Whatever he means by that.
I see that you've gained Cavalorn's trust. That speaks in your favor.
Cavalorn sent me to you!
(cunningly) And what did he tell you?
He said you're in dire need of more good people.
(smiles) Aha ... So you want to JOIN us, son?
Tell me about the Ring of Water.
(expectantly) And why would I do that?
Since you are not yet a member of our community, I cannot tell you EVERYTHING, of course.
But I shall tell you what I may.
What exactly is it that you do?
We stand between the order of Innos and the chaos of Beliar.
If one of the two sides should gain the upper hand, it will mean either total loss of freedom, or deadly chaos.
Therefore, we guard the balance between the two. That's what makes life in this world possible at all.
(frowning) And what does that mean in concrete terms?
The fall of the barrier has evoked numerous threats.
The bandits are probably the most obvious one.
Not only has it become all but impossible to travel the island without being attacked ...
... there's somebody in town, too, who supports the bandits!
We have found out that the bandits receive regular deliveries from a weapons merchant in Khorinis.
We try to find such people and keep them from endangering the city.
If you can find out anything about this, let me know.
Where are the other Water Mages?
They are exploring the ruins of an old culture north-east of Khorinis.
We suspect that those ruins might contain a passage to a part of the island which is as yet uncharted.
Tell me more about that uncharted area.
If you're interested in joining the expedition, I could send you to Saturas with a letter.
You can only participate, of course, as long as you're one of us.
Of course.
Who are the members of the Ring of Water, then?
I cannot tell you that until you join the Ring.
But you will certainly already have met some of them by that time.
I want to join the 'Ring of Water'!
You do? That means you have already fulfilled the first requirement.
What do you mean by that?
I mean that there must be someone among us who trusts you. Otherwise, you wouldn't even know about it.
But I know nothing about you at all ...
What do you want to know?
Well, you could tell me where you come from and why you have come to the city.
I carry an important message for the leader of the paladins.
What is this message?
A large army is gathering as we talk, led by dragons and determined to conquer the country.
If that is indeed true, the balance of the earth will be disturbed. Who told you this?
(considering) Dragons? You speak of beings which, until now, have only been mentioned in legends. How do you know this?
Terrible things are bound to happen soon.
(angry) Aha. And who has told you this?
Terrible things, hm ... how do you know this?
Xardas the magician told me. He sent me to warn the paladins.
I know this man as a wise and mighty master of magic. And where do you come from?
The necromancer ... So he lives ... (considers) and he sent you? Who are you really?
Oh, I heard rumors somewhere ...
(annoyed) Do you at least remember where you come from?
Aha. And that is why you have made this journey. Who are you really?
Gut, fassen wir mal zusammen:
You are a former prisoner, ...
You are an adventurer from down south ...
... who has been told by Xardas the necromancer ...
... who heard rumors ...
... that dragons have come to conquer the country.
... that terrible things are going to happen.
And you have come to report this to the paladins ...
That all sounds rather fantastic, but I cannot perceive that you are lying to me.
Therefore I must assume that your motives are honorable.
I want to give you a chance to join the Ring of Water.
I think there's something you're not telling me.
If you're worried I might pass on what you tell me, then let me reassure you.
I have sworn to keep all secrets I am entrusted with to myself.
And what about all the people here?
They only understand half of what I PREACH to them. So don't fret.
Let's start over at the beginning. What's that message?
I'm a former convict from the penal colony of Khorinis.
I'm an adventurer from down south ...
What must I do in order to join the Ring?
Know that you take on great responsibility by joining the ring.
I do not let just anyone join who comes to us and asks.
If you want to join the Ring, you will have to prove that you act like one of us.
And that means?
Before we let a young man join our ranks, he must have done a great deed for the Ring.
Only then can I begin to consider letting you help preserve the balance of forces on this island.
I have vanquished the Sleeper. Isn't that a great enough deed?
My ears hear many a tale these days.
Including the story about the banning of the beast called Sleeper.
I have not heard that this was achieved by a single man, although your eyes tell me that you are convinced you did this.
That confuses me slightly, but I cannot be sure that my senses might not deceive me sometimes.
I have freed many people. The barrier is gone.
Even if you can REALLY claim responsibility for that ...
The great event in the Valley of Mines has not only set free the Water Mages and other upright citizens.
All the criminals of the entire country are roaming Khorinis these days, harassing the population.
The bandits have already taken over large areas of land outside of the city. It has become all but impossible to leave the town and return unharmed.
So what would be an appropriate deed that might convince you?
Khorinis is facing a great enigma these days.
The number of people missing from the town seems to increase almost daily.
If you can explain to me what happened to them, you shall have your place within the 'Ring of Water'.
However ...
Yes?
... you should take your message to the paladins first.
I consider it a matter of utmost importance!
Talk to Lord Hagen.
But Lord Hagen is not going to receive me!
Yes, he will, no doubt about it. PROVIDED you become a member of a powerful community first.
The Ring has far-reaching connections.
We shall assist you in conveying your message as soon as possible.
You should talk about this to Lares, whom I trust. He will help you.
I shall do that.
What community should I join?
There are only three communities that have enough influence.
These are: the city militia, the monastery of the Fire Magicians, and the troop of mercenaries on the landowner's farm.
The choice is yours, son.
Lares can certainly assist you with this difficult decision. Talk to him about it.
I am ready to join the Ring of Water!
So you delivered your message to Lord Hagen?
Yes.
But he sent me to the Valley of Mines so I could get him proof for my words!
YOU must decide what you want to do next.
To me, it was important that he should get the message. Now it's up to him to act, or to wait for your proof.
As far as you are concerned ...
Good.
You have proven that you are indispensable to us. You shall be one of our children and go forth into the world in our name to do the bidding of Adanos.
I consign to you this Ring of Water. May it help you find your allies and, together with them, preserve the balance of this world.
You are the first Fire Magician among our children. I am especially happy about that.
May Adanos protect you. And now go and meet your brothers.
They will await you in the tavern 'The Dead Harpy' and accept you into our community.
You probably know the tavern. It lies on the way to Onar's farm.
Do not forget to wear your ring, so your brothers will recognize you as one of their own.
No. Not yet.
Make haste, then. Go to him. I think your message is very important!
The brothers of the 'Ring' have sent me to you.
Good! I've been awaiting you!
I shall send you through the portal together with the other Water Mages.
You are to track down the former ore baron Raven and find out why he has taken the citizens of Khorinis.
We here shall continue to try and deal with the threat posed by the bandits.
Bring this letter to Saturas. He will set your tasks from now on.
Lares will take you to him if he hasn't already delivered the ornament.
May Adanos guide you.
About those missing people ...
Yes?
Where should I start looking for them?
Most of those people disappeared down by the harbor. That's probably where you should start your search.
Let me tell you what I know ...
The farmers have lost some people as well.
I have found out that the bandits are responsible for the disappearances here.
Elvrich, Master Thorben's apprentice, told me that the bandits take the kidnapped people out of Khorinis by sea.
Some pirates are involved in this somehow. I haven't quite figured out their role yet.
I rescued Elvrich from the bandits.
The bandits dragged off a girl named Lucia.
Lucia, the girl that was kidnapped by the bandits, has decided to join them.
It certainly looks like she did this out of her own free will.
The leader of the bandits is named Dexter. He is responsible for the kidnappings.
I knew Dexter back in the penal colony. He was working for the ore baron Gomez then.
He will certainly remember you. You should be careful.
I think you're on the right track. Carry on.
What have you found out?
Nothing important so far.
I know where the missing people are.
What have you found out?
A man named Raven dragged them off to a remote part of Khorinis.
What makes you so sure?
I read his orders. He's got the local bandits working for him.
Here.
Good. You did a great job. I had feared that we might have to resign ourselves to never knowing.
The missing people have come back.
Yes, you did it. Their journey has come to a good end.
But your own journey must go on. So go with the blessing of Adanos.
(praying) Adanos, bless this man. Light his path and grant him the strength to withstand all dangers.
About this weapons dealer ...
How much do you know about the weapons dealer?
Ask Martin, the provisions master of the paladins, about this. He should be able to tell you more.
He has been tasked with unmasking the weapons dealer.
You can find Martin in the harbor district. If you see a heap of crates, provisions and paladins, Martin won't be far.
I know the dealer who's been selling weapons to the bandits!
His name is Fernando.
Very good. Has Martin taken the necessary steps to stop him from delivering any more?
Yes. Martin will see to it that he won't be leaving the dungeon any time soon.
Well done, son.
(cheekily) Does that mean that you're going to let me join the 'Ring of Water' now?
(smiles) THAT was not what we agreed upon - and you know it.
May Adanos light your path.
Not yet.
Then make haste and report to him at once. It must be stopped right now.
Is there anything that could help me with my search?
You are very persistent, young man. But I actually can think of something that could make your tasks easier for you.
I shall give you this ore amulet. You'll certainly be able to use it.
It is an amulet of the searching will-o'-the-wisps.
There are only very few of them. The will-o'-the-wisp that inhabits this amulet has very special properties.
It can help you find things that normally elude the naked eye.
You summon it by simply wearing the amulet.
If it loses its power or you cannot find it, simply put on the amulet again, and it will reappear.
The will-o'-the-wisp can detect weapons.
It could be very helpful to you in investigating the weapons deliveries to the bandits.
Treat it well, and it will never fail you.
Thank you! I shall take good care of it.
Can the will-o'-the-wisp do more than that?
More than look for close-combat weapons? Not unless you teach it.
I think Riordian knows how to teach these beings. He is one of us, currently traveling with Saturas.
Perhaps he can tell you more.
A will-o'-the-wisp in an amulet?
Will-o'-the-wisps are admirable creatures. They consist of pure magical energy.
They are bound to the magical ore in this world. It is their origin. It gives them their strength.
I am not surprised that you have never heard of them. They only appear to the person who bears the ore to which they belong.
Will-o'-the-wisps living in the wild have been forcefully removed from their sources. They will attack anyone who approaches them.
There is no way to help those pitiful creatures. You had better stay away from them.
I've got this stone tablet. Can you tell me more about it?
Those are artifacts from the old culture which we have been investigating for some time.
There are several kinds of them. Some contain information about the history of the ancient people.
And that is the kind I am interested in. Bring me all of those that you can find.
I shall give you an appropriate reward.
I've got another stone tablet for you ...
Great!
I shall increase your magical power!
Here, take a few spell scrolls as a reward ...
Here, take a few potions as a reward ...
Lares said that you could help me get into the monastery of the Fire Magicians.
Is that your choice? The Way of the Fire?
Yes. I want to become a Fire Magician.
As far as I know, they gladly accept novices in their monastery. So why would you need my help?
The novice in front of the monastery wants me to pay a tribute to enter. A sheep and a load of gold.
Lares mentioned that they demand a tribute before they let anyone into the monastery.
I cannot grant you entry into the monastery myself. I am a Water Mage, as you know. But I am very well acquainted with Daron the Fire Magician.
He spends most of his time in the marketplace, collecting alms for his church.
But I have heard that he is not only in town to raise some funds.
He told me about a statuette that was stolen from him.
It was very important to him. He will surely allow you to enter the monastery if you can get it back for him.
Of course, if you should decide to join the Circle of Fire, you can still become a member of the Ring.
If you prove yourself worthy, that is.
I am asking your blessing.
Why should I give you my blessing, stranger?
I want to start an apprenticeship with one of the masters in the lower part of town.
Go with the blessing of Adanos, my son!
Where can I find a priest of Innos?
The best thing would be to look around the marketplace. You will find an emissary of the monastery there.
I want to make a donation to Adanos!
A donation to the church of Adanos would alleviate a part of the sins which you may have committed, my son.
How much can you give?
I haven't got anything to spare right now ...
That is not a problem, you can act upon your good intentions later, my son.
I've got 50 gold pieces ...
I thank you in the name of Adanos, my son. Your gold will be distributed among the needy.
I've got 100 gold pieces ...
I bless you in the name of Adanos for this generous act!
May the path you follow be blessed by Adanos!
Can you teach me something about magic?
Only the Chosen of Innos and the Chosen of Adanos are permitted to work rune magic.
But common mortals can also work magic with the help of spell scrolls.
I can show you how you can channel and expand your magic powers.
I want to increase my magic powers.
Your magical power has grown beyond my ability to teach you.
Tell me about the gods.
What exactly would you like to know?
Tell me about Innos.
Very well. (preaches) Innos is the first and highest god. He created the sun and the world.
He commands light and fire, his gifts to humanity. He is law and justice.
His priests are the Magicians of Fire, the paladins are his warriors.
Tell me about Adanos.
Adanos is the god of the center. He is the scales of justice, the guardian of the balance between Innos and Beliar.
He commands the power of change, his gift is the water in all the oceans, rivers, and lakes.
His priests are the Water Mages, just as I am a servant and priest of Adanos.
Tell me about Beliar.
Beliar is the dark god of death, destruction and all things unnatural.
He is in eternal battle with Innos, but Adanos guards the balance between the two.
Only a few humans follow the call of Beliar - however, he grants great strength to those who do.
Can you heal me?
(devout) Adanos bless this body. Free it of its wounds and strengthen it with new life.
You do not require healing magic at this time.
I have a message for Master Isgaroth. He guards the shrine in front of the monastery.
If you run this errand for me, you get to choose your own reward.
Good. So be on your way to Master Isgaroth now.
I'll do it.
Good, then take the message and choose one of these spell scrolls.
When you have delivered the message, I shall reward you accordingly.
Not now!
No problem. I shall send somebody else.
I choose the healing spell.
Give me the Ice Arrow.
I'll take the spell of light.
I have delivered your message.
Accept my thanks. And now pick your reward.
Listen people! I am needed elsewhere.
It won't take long. When I return I shall tell you the rest of the story.
I do not know whether I shall return. If you want to know the ending, read up on the story in the scriptures.
May Adanos be with you!
I've got a problem with the Eye of Innos. I could use your help.
And will your problem require me to leave town?
I don't know. Possibly.
I have been waiting to be relieved for days. The other Water Mages should have been back in Khorinis some time ago.
If you see to it that at least one of them comes to take over my duties in town, I shall be free to help you solve your problem.
Someone's here to relieve you.
Have the matters beyond the north-eastern mountains been settled?
Yes, they have. Raven is dead, and the threat has been averted.
That is good news indeed. Now let us hope that such things will not happen again.
NOW I can help you with your little problem.
I seem to remember it concerns the Eye of Innos, right?
Pyrokar sent me.
Xardas sent me.
The Eye of Innos is broken.
I know. I have already learned of it from some very upset novices.
The Seekers have used the Fire Magicians' Circle of the Sun to destroy the Eye.
I would call that an inspired move by the enemy.
What will become of the Eye now?
We must join it back together. But that is no easy task, I fear.
The setting is broken into two pieces. A skilled smith should be able to repair this.
But that is really not the problem. It's rather the inlaid gem that worries me.
It is dull and powerless. The enemy seems to have known exactly how to weaken it.
How can the gem get its power back?
I see only one way. A union of the three reigning divinities should achieve the desired effect.
A well prepared ritual of reversal in the place of its destruction will give the gem back its fire.
However, the problem is that you must bring an earthly representative of each of the three gods to this place.
Furthermore, a lot of swampweed is required for this ritual. I estimate it should be at least 3 plants.
Where can I find this swampweed?
I have heard about an old quack in the woods named Sagitta. She supposedly sells such herbs.
But you could also try your luck down at the harbor.
Who could those three earthly representatives of the gods be?
I shall represent the god Adanos myself.
Pyrokar, the highest fire magician, would be the right person to represent the god Innos.
But for Beliar, I cannot think of an appropriate candidate. It must be someone who commands black magic.
Black magic? What about Xardas?
That's it. That could work.
But I ask myself how you will bring all three of us together.
I can just see Pyrokar's face when he hears that he must cooperate with Xardas.
Where can I find a smith capable of repairing the setting of the Eye?
Ask around in the area for someone who knows how to repair jewelry.
Why did Pyrokar send me to you of all people?
I suspected that sooner or later something like this would happen.
Pyrokar always thinks himself so invulnerable and superior that it almost borders on carelessness.
Thus his precautions for protecting the Eye were also careless.
I simply think that he unconsciously relies on the abilities which Adanos has granted me.
It doesn't bear thinking about what would happen if I were not available now.
News spreads fast in this city.
That's a good thing, too. The enemy won't be sleeping, either.
I've got to go.
I shall also set out and prepare the ceremony at the Circle of the Sun.
Send Xardas and Pyrokar there. And don't forget to bring the swampweed. I am counting on you.
How are things with the Eye of Innos?
Remember: only a ritual of reversal at the Circle of the Sun together with Xardas and Pyrokar will restore the Eye.
And don't forget to bring the Eye, with its setting repaired.
I did everything you told me to do. Here's the repaired Eye.
Indeed, there is nothing missing now for the performance of the ritual.
What about the swampweed?
Ah, yes. Do you have 3 swampweed plants, then?
Ahem. Yes. Here are the 3 plants.
Excellent.
No. Alas not.
All right. Then we shall have to make do without.
You have done well, but now step aside so that we may begin the ceremony. May our spirits unite.
It is finished. We have succeeded in thwarting the enemy's plan and restoring the Eye.
Let Pyrokar explain to you how to use its power.
I hope that I shall see you again, once you have accomplished your mission. Farewell.
Thank you for helping to heal the Eye of Innos.
Do not be so lavish with your thanks. Your greatest task yet lies before you.
Speak to Pyrokar, he will explain everything else to you.
I hope to see you again in one piece, my son.
Lobart's wife Hilda is sick.
What? Again? The good woman should take better care of herself.
One hard winter, and she won't be with us anymore. All right, I will give her a medicine to reduce the fever.
Oh, you know, while you're at it, you might as well drop it off with her.
I've got this feeling of trepidation.
You don't look well either. You were subjected to the black look of the Seekers for too long.
All I can heal is your body, but only the monastery can purify your soul. Speak to Pyrokar. He will help you.
The dragons will wreak no more havoc.
I knew that you would return safe and sound. However, you have yet to take your greatest hurdle.
I know.
Then equip yourself well and come to me if you need help. Always carry the Eye of Innos with you, do you hear? Adanos bless you.
I know where our enemy is located.
Then let us waste no time and seek him out before he comes to us.
You want to accompany me?
I have thought long about this and have never been so sure of my business, my friend.
I've got too many on my list already. I'm afraid there will be no more room for you.
Then make room. You will need me.
I consider it an honor to have you by my side. We'll meet you at the harbor.
Don't take too much time. The enemy does not sleep, my friend.
I'm going to think about it some more.
Suit yourself. Come back to me if you change your mind.
You had better stay here. The city needs you.
Perhaps you are right. And yet, I shall accompany you if you wish. You know that.
Come with me to the enemy's island.
A wise decision. I hope you are going to stick with it now.
Heal me.
(devout) Adanos bless this body. It is destined to restore the balance of the world.
Your body is undamaged at the moment.
Can you sell me something?
What do you need, then?
Help me. I am possessed!
Take this Potion of Deliverance. Pyrokar has given me some of the healing elixirs at my request.
However, always remember: my means of ridding you of your nightmares are limited.
Pyrokar's supplies are exhausted. I am very sorry, my friend. I cannot help you any more.
I shall not take the risk of giving you another phial after so short a time. Come back later, my friend.
What advice can you give me?
Stay away from the Seekers. Remember that their black look can do you great damage here, far away from the monastery.
Don't worry, I've got the soul summoning amulet.
Should something happen to you nevertheless, come to me. I shall see what I can do.
I have found the traitor Pedro.
He's dead.
I am extremely disappointed. I had not thought it of you.
What do you mean?
I know about your repugnant agreement with Serpentes. I am deeply shaken that I should be proven wrong in the end after all.
Then bring him here to the ship. We shall hand him over to the legal authorities of Khorinis.
It's kind of too late for that. He's dead.
(surprised) Oh. That is very regrettable. I shall pray for his poor soul.
Get out of my sight, you murderer. You can expect no help from me whatsoever.
Teach me your abilities.
I shall do what is in my power.
You are now a magician of the fifth Circle. Use the magic spells you have learned prudently.
You now have access to the highest knowledge of magic.
Be guided by reason and control your human weaknesses. They can cloud your sight.
I've got an Almanac of the Possessed here
Hm. I think it would be best if I take it to Pyrokar in the monastery, if we get away from here again.
Do you have more of them? Bring me all that you can find.
I did it.
I know, I can feel it.
You have dealt a blow to Beliar which will keep him busy for some time.
Can I retire now, or do you magicians have another skeleton in the closet which needs to be driven from this world?
But bear in mind that this was only an episode in the eternal battle between Good and Evil.
Evil always finds a way to enter this world. The war will never end.
As a warrior for the good cause you should know that.
Only Adanos alone stands between the warring gods in order to preserve the balance!
He should have helped me instead.
(mischievously) But he did - of that you can be certain.
Tell the captain that he should weigh anchor as soon as possible. The momentary peace may be deceptive.
And how goes the work?
The same as always. A lot to do, not enough money, and with a bit of bad luck the orcs will come tomorrow and burn down our farm.
The king's paladins have occupied the whole city. But I can hardly believe they'll move their butts out here when the orcs attack us.
Can I help you? I'm looking for work.
Do you know anything about working in the fields?
What is there to know?
Ah! In that case ... I think we're fine here, thank you.
If you want to work for Lobart as a day laborer, I can only warn you. He pays people like you really miserably!
He offered to sell me some clean clothes cheap if I help out on the farm.
Hmm. I don't have anything for you to do, but you can bring me and the boys something to drink.
Fetch me a bottle of wine and I'll tell Lobart that you were a real help to us (laughs mockingly).
But you didn't get that from me, understood?
I don't think so. Someone of your standing wouldn't want to do the sort of lowly jobs I have to offer.
Here's your wine.
I'd better not ask where you got it from, eh? (laughs) Who cares?
Thanks, anyway.
Lobart will hear only the best about you.
I'm headed for town.
And?
Is there anything interesting you can tell me about the city?
Nope. But Maleth goes to the city from time to time - maybe he knows something - I mean, something that would interest you.
Is there any interesting news?
I could have sworn I saw an orc over there on the edge of the woods two days ago.
Since then I've kept at least one eye open at night.
These huge disgusting plague beetles are becoming a real nuisance. They're everywhere. They'll eat everything in sight, if you don't watch out.
A few days ago, I was lying in the grass, minding my own business, just about to doze off, and one of the damn things was chewing on my shoe!
You should have seen me run. Since then, I haven't been able to sleep in peace.
Besides what I already told you? No.
And how's it going for you?
Crappy. The militia found my hidden still.
I hope they never find out that it belongs to me.
Those black-hooded bastards are everywhere. Someone ought to stuff their hoods down their throats.
What's wrong?
(bellows) Damn, beat it. Otherwise, they'll kill me.
You're not at all yourself.
My head ... I can't stand it any more.
You should go to the monastery. Pyrokar, the highest Fire Magician, might be able to help you.
Do you think? Okay. I'll give it a try.
How are you?
Yeah, yeah, all right already. I think the boys here can help me. But I still feel really dizzy.
But, I have to say, their wine is the best I've ever tasted.
Any news?
The number of orcs in the area has gone up drastically.
You paladins will finish them off, won't you?
Soon we'll have to give up the farm and join you mercenaries on Onar's farm, I'm afraid.
Unfortunately, the militia found my still. I just hope they won't catch me.
What are you doing here?
I make sure that nobody enters the houses.
Explicit order from Lord Hagen. And don't even think about violating this order!
How are things?
At the moment, everything is quiet.
I come from our mutual friend Ramirez.
Oh? That Ramirez is a little rat. And he's no friend of mine. Never mind. Did you bring me anything?
That depends on what it is you want.
(quietly) Okay, I'll tell you how it works. You pay 250 gold pieces. Then I won't be here at night.
If you're too conspicuous anyway and I happen to be in the area, the deal is off.
I've got your money ...
All right, then I'll disappear in the evening from now on.
And remember - if you cause trouble around me, I don't know you.
... but not with me right now.
I can't stand it when somebody tries to make a fool out of me. So get the gold.
Don't even think about touching anything here. Otherwise you'll get a couple upside the head, got it?
What's your job?
Onar wants me to spend all day keeping an eye on his stuff.
He's worried that something will go missing. And I would too, in his place.
Most of the mercenaries he's hired are former convicts from the penal colony.
They'll walk off with everything that isn't nailed down, if no one watches out.
There's a whole bunch of junk here.
That's right, and most of it is extremely valuable. Onar collects valuable objects.
A simple man like me can hardly afford such luxury. I stick to other things.
And that would be?
I collect old coins.
I've got an old coin here.
Mmh. Show me.
Oh, yeah. That won't bring much on the open market.
I'll pay you a gold piece for it. Exactly as much as it used to be worth.
You know what I'm prepared to pay for it, you dog. One gold piece. No more.
It's a deal.
Good.
Here's 2 gold coins.
If you have any more of those, you know where to find ME.
Not quite enough. What about 2?
Nothing doing! I'm not a loony! Beat it.
Arrh. Damn. All right. 2 gold coins for every old coin you can bring me, that's my final offer.
Nah, I think I'll keep it then.
They don't have any value for you. You'll be back.
In that case, 3 doesn't sound bad.
Go to hell, you bastard.
Interested in some more old coins?
Sure. Do you still have any?
One.
A few.
Thanks. Here's your money. Bring me all you can find.
Has anyone tried to steal anything yet?
You mean besides you?
A few! And I caught them all!
A few nights ago one of the mercenaries was creeping through the house.
He had on a black robe with a hood so I wouldn't be able to see him.
But I sent him running.
No. Not lately.
The mercenaries seem to be getting ready to break camp.
It wouldn't amaze me if Lee and his boys left the island over night.
Doing all right?
Hey! I know you! From the colony.
What do you want here?
I've come to join you.
Why not. I've got nothing against it. Anyway, you freed our mine from the guards back then.
But don't count on getting along with the others here so easily.
A lot of newbies have come along since then. And some of the old mercenaries won't remember you.
I almost didn't recognize you, you look rather haggard.
When the Barrier fell, I barely got away with my life.
Looks like you got lucky, then.
Do you have anything to sell?
Oh, don't ask.
Bennet, one of the new guys, takes care of the weapons and armor now.
In the colony I was responsible for Lee's entire weapons store, and then along comes a trained smith and 'pow', I'm out of a job.
I desperately need a new job, even if I all I do is guard the farms out there.
I don't care, just as long as I'm not twiddling my thumbs here any more.
Can you teach me anything?
I can teach you a few tricks in handling a bow, if you want. I don't have anything better to do right now anyway.
I want to learn more about archery.
What should I teach you?
There you go. Your aim is more accurate already.
And? Found a new task yet?
Not so far. Let me know if you have a job for me.
Have you tried finding a job in town?
In the city? (laughs) Wild horses couldn't drag me there.
Or do you think I would want to work there as a militia soldier? I can just imagine myself in that courtier's uniform.
And then that obsession with obedience. Nah, forget it - there may not be anything to do here on the farm, but at least I can do what I want.
I heard you know how to make armor from crawler plates?
That's right. Who did you hear that from?
A hunter by the name of Gestath told me.
Could you make me armor like that?
Sure. Bring me 10 crawler plates and I'll make you one.
How much do you want for it?
Forget it. I'll do it for nothing. For old times' sake.
Teach me how to take the plates off of crawlers!
It's easy. The back plates are only attached to the body along the edges. Just take a sharp blade and cut them out.
Got it?
Sounds easy.
That's what I'm saying.
I've got the crawler plates for the armor.
Good! Give them here.
OK, where's the armor?
I'll put it together for you. Come back tomorrow.
I finished it. Here it is.
Turned out really well, I think ...
Thank you!
Don't mention it.
You joker. I need the crawler plates first ...
I may have found a job for you on Bengar's farm.
Let's hear it.
The pass to the Valley of Mines comes out directly at Bengar's farm. He's got problems with all the beasts who squeeze themselves through the pass.
Someone needs to defend Bengar's farm.
That would be something. Then at least I'd be away from the farm here and wouldn't have to stare at the smithy.
Agreed. And since you're one of us, I'll make you a fair price. Give me 300 gold coins and I'm on my way.
Good. That comes to 800 gold coins.
A hefty price.
Well. For one of us, I'd do it for almost nothing. But for you ...
Here's your gold.
Good. I'm off, then, to see to those beasts. Let's see who else on this farm I can enlist.
See you later.
Well, if you had the money, I'd be on my way already.
I'll think about it.
Okay, but don't let me down.
Everything going well?
My employer is dead. Oh well. I always wanted to have my own farm.
Sure! Everything's quiet.
Would you fancy getting out of here on a ship?
No. Not any more. I've found my task. Maybe another time.
Yeah, sure. Let's get out of here. I could be a big help to you defending your ship. Where are we going?
I'm headed for an island not far from this one.
Yeah, what are we waiting for? I could teach you archery and crossbow shooting while we're at sea.
I just remembered that I've actually got enough people already.
(angry) So THAT'S the way it is. First you wave a red flag at me and then nothing comes of it, eh?
Screw you. I hope your tub sinks.
Welcome aboard!
Come down to the harbor. We're leaving soon.
I'm on my way.
I'm going to think about it a little longer.
Oh, you know what, I think you're just a braggart. I don't believe a word of it. Take a hike.
I can't use you after all.
First you give me hope and then a rejection like that. You bastard, I'll pay you back for that.
Listen.
Piss off, you bastard.
How's it going?
Did you HAVE to take Bennet along, man?
What's the problem?
Ah, nothing. It's all right. Do your job and then get out of here, okay?
The smithy isn't the best, but I think I'll give it a try.
Could you build me some armor?
Sorry, man. Not with these tools. That'll have to wait until we're on the mainland.
Train me in long-distance combat.
What kind?
Unlike the crossbow, the bow is very bulky and requires a lot of space. Always make sure that you have enough of that in battle.
Let the string glide through your fingers when you shoot. A cramped finger will mess up the arrow's trajectory.
Try not to jiggle when shooting the crossbow. That's why you should always press the trigger very carefully.
A clever marksman makes use of the wind and tries never to shoot against it.
Everything all right?
Sure. And you? It was a tough one, huh?
Where will you go now?
Anywhere but back. I've had a bellyful of Khorinis.
It's all the same to me where we sail. As long as it's away from here.
How's your duty?
(scornful) These boys swing their swords like farmers.
(convinced) But when I'm done with them, every single one of them will be a tough, hard bastard.
I want to join the militia!
So? Are you a citizen of the town?
No.
Then Lord Andre won't take you.
Sure, you can talk to him - but I don't think he'll make an exception for you.
Yes.
Then talk to Lord Andre. He decides who gets accepted here.
What's it like with the militia?
Lord Andre is our commander now.
The militia used to report to the governor. (laughs) He had no idea what we do here.
But Lord Andre knows what he's doing. He takes good care of the men.
Everyone who starts here gets some decent armor and a good weapon.
And there are bonuses if you've done a good job. He pays a bounty for every criminal captured.
Can you also train me in sword fighting?
Lord Andre has ordered that we train everyone who is in a position to defend the city.
However, that isn't true for mercenaries. Beat it.
But that's only true for combat training. All other kinds of training are reserved for the militia.
Can you at least halfway handle a weapon?
I think so ...
(sighs) All right - you can start when you're ready.
What are the advantages of one or two-handed weapons?
Quite simple. With a one-handed weapon, you're faster. That can be a considerable advantage in battle.
Two-handed weapons are more ponderous. You have to fight with foresight - but you do a lot more damage when you hit.
Where should I start? With one-handed or two-handed weapons?
That's entirely up to you.
If you specialize in only one type of weapon, you automatically learn the other at the same time.
If, for instance, you are good at fighting with one-handed swords, but still a beginner with two-handed weapons ...
... your two-handed skills will go up as well whenever you train with a one-hander.
In that case, the training is more exhausting than if you train with both types of weapons.
Just start and you'll soon see what I'm talking about.
Let's begin with the training.
I don't train mercenaries!
Of course, reverend.
So Lord Andre accepted you!
I expect you to come here and train regularly.
Ruga will train you in the art of the crossbow and Mortis will help you to increase your strength.
But the most important thing is for you to learn to handle your sword properly.
I'll make a good fighter of you yet!
Out and about so early? I'm usually alone at this time of day. But since you're already here, you might as well learn something.
So pay attention. You can deceive some opponents if you dodge their blows and attack at the right moment.
Remember that in your next fight!
I'll be on my way as fast as I can!
Good! And one more thing: don't tell anyone that you have talked to me. Above all, don't tell any magician.
Since I have gone into exile, the Circle of Fire has taken me for dead - and that's a good thing, too.
There you are again! (smiling) I never thought the two of us would meet again.
I feel like I spent three weeks lying under a load of rocks.
Well, so you did. Only the magic within your armor kept you alive.
I had feared I might not be able to rescue you from the debris of the temple.
But enough of that. You're here now.
There's a NEW threat that we have to deal with.
You must become their ally! That's the only way to stop Beliar.
At least we have enough time now. I did it. The Sleeper ...
... has been banned. You vanquished him, so much is true - but it is not within our power to stop the war that ensues now.
With his final, furious scream, the Sleeper has set into movement the armies of darkness.
It was an order to all evil creatures. A word of power that they were all bound to obey.
His last order was: COME! And they came. All of them. Even the dragons.
(amazed) ... Dragons!
They are creatures of ancient power. I can sense their presence - even here.
And they have gathered an entire army of lowly servant creatures around them.
Where's this army now?
The army's camp is not far from here, in the Valley of Mines near Khorinis, and they are getting ready to attack.
(pensively) We do not have much time left.
But that's not all. There is yet ANOTHER threat of which I have learned only recently.
Then let's hurry to get out of here!
If we flee now, then it's only to face the dragons later.
With the help of the soldiers and the magicians who live around here, we can stop them before their army is completely formed.
We're not going to get a better chance.
What can we do?
This time we cannot handle it by ourselves. Only the power of Innos can help us against those dragons.
A group of paladins is stationed in the city of Khorinis, not far from here.
They possess a powerful artifact which could help us defeat the dragons.
They call it the 'Eye of Innos'. You need to get hold of this artifact.
Tell the paladins about the threat. You MUST convince their leader to support us!
And once you have talked to him, you need to find the artifact of Beliar.
It is the counterpiece to the Eye of Innos. It must not fall into the hands of Evil.
Can you tell me anything about this stone tablet?
First I suspected it might be a magical artifact, but I finally concluded that it is not of any great significance.
I have not been able to decode the meaning of this tablet entirely, but it seems to concern the history of a very old culture.
If you want the tablet, it's yours, I have no use for it.
The Water Mages have discovered a portal to an unknown part of the island ...
Interesting ...
As soon as you find out something that is REALLY helpful, be sure to let me know!
The artifact of Beliar could be hidden somewhere there. Find it!
About that unknown part of the island ...
Don't bother me with details. Come back if you really find anything useful.
I've explored the unknown part of the island ...
And, what did you find?
It was all about a mighty artifact. The Claw of Beliar.
The Claw of Beliar?! Where is it now? Do you have it on you?
Yes, here it is.
(greedily) How very interesting.
This weapon can be of great use to us. But it is also extremely dangerous.
Take good care of yourself! And, above all: don't lose it!
I don't have it any more ...
I gave it to the Water Mages so they could dump it in the sea ...
(ranting) Are you out of your mind? Do you have any idea what you gave away there?
This weapon could have been of great service to us!
I think it was for the better this way.
(sighs) The ways of the Gods are unfathomable ...
I need weapons.
I can only give you whatever little I have here.
Look around in my tower. Anything that looks useful to you, you can have.
What exactly is the 'Eye of Innos'?
It is an amulet. Legend has it that Innos himself has poured part of his power into this amulet.
It will restore some of your lost strength and help us to defeat the dragons.
It also has some other hidden powers. I shall tell you more about that once the amulet is yours.
Why would the paladins give me the Eye of Innos?
Because you are the one who is destined to wear it.
How can you claim to know that?
There is a number of reasons, the most important being: you have defeated the Sleeper. If you weren't a favorite of the gods, you'd be dead by now.
Let's assume you are right, and I'm destined to bear the Eye of Innos. How would the paladins know that is true?
The Eye itself chooses the one who may wear it. Once you get hold of it and put it on, the paladins cannot doubt your words any longer.
How can I get to the city?
Just follow the path from here through the mountains. The city is large. You cannot miss it.
But watch out! The path to town is not without dangers. And you aren't nearly as strong as you once were.
Where exactly are we here?
As I already said, near the city of Khorinis.
I have rebuilt my tower here.
But it's only been a few days since we last saw each other in the Valley of Mines...
The servants which I summoned to build my tower have done a thorough job ...
You can say that again.
Where can I find better equipment?
The closest place where you can get better weapons and armor is the city of Khorinis.
But down in the valley you can find some healing herbs that will help you if you get injured in a fight.
See the lake right in front of my tower. A secret passage leads to the valley from there.
Have you talked to Lester yet?
Yes, I have peppered him with questions. He was able to tell me a lot, but he is completely exhausted.
It's almost a miracle that he survived this escape at all. I have sent him to bed for now.
What did he tell you?
Nothing good, I'm afraid. He has seen not only a dragon, but also men in black hooded cloaks.
And?
If those men exist, then their presence will pose a possible threat.
And I don't like that. Here, take my ring. It will protect you against magic.
I've been to town ...
And? Were you able to talk to the leader of the paladins?
They won't let me see him ...
Nonsense! There must be a way for you to see him.
If all else fails, enter the monastery and become a magician.
That might be considered morally questionable, but it would get you what you need.
If you were a magician, he would certainly have to see you.
So what shall we do next?
We shall proceed as planned. There is no other way.
You go get yourself the Eye of Innos, and I shall keep looking for answers.
Why is the Circle of Fire not supposed to know about you?
I used to be a high member of the Circle. Even then I suspected that demon magic might be the key to the magic barrier.
But I could never have convinced the other members of the Circle to follow this path.
So I left the Circle in order to study the Black Arts.
That is a crime for which the Fire Magicians, (snidely) the 'Ordained of Innos', the ever 'Good' and 'Virtuous' will accept no excuse.
They are certain that I am still alive, but they have no idea where to find me - and that's a good thing, too.
I'm back from the Valley of Mines.
High time, too. What did you see?
You were right. The land has been overrun by an entire army of the enemy.
Orcs are besieging the castle, and dragons have laid whole areas to waste.
It won't be long before they attack Khorinis, if I'm not mistaken.
Lester said you wanted to see me at once.
What the hell has happened here in the meantime?
The enemy has learned who you really are and that you are planning to get hold of the Eye of Innos.
He has recognized the threat. It has forced him to leave his cover and openly attack.
The game of hide-and-seek is over. Yesterday nobody knew what the enemy's attack would look like. Now it has become only too obvious.
I was attacked by magicians in black robes.
The enemy has many faces. The Seekers are one of them. They're really the ones who prepare the ground for the enemy.
They have taken up their positions in strategic places and are now only waiting for an opportunity to spring the trap.
Stay out of their way. They are very powerful magical beings, and they shall try to deter you at any cost.
I've finally got the proof that Lord Hagen demanded of me.
What proof is that?
I received a letter from Garond, the commander of the paladins in the Valley of Mines. In it, he asks for reinforcements.
That should be enough to convince that militant warhorse. Well done.
What will be the next step now?
Go and bring Lord Hagen the letter from Garond so that he may grant you access to the Eye of Innos.
Then go to the monastery and talk to Pyrokar. He must give you the Eye.
Nothing is more important than getting this artifact away to safety.
Go now before it is too late. The enemy will also try to lay his hands on it.
The Eye of Innos has been destroyed.
What are you saying? Destroyed!
I found it up in the northern forests - unfortunately, I've only been able to salvage its fragments.
That was our only chance to stand up to those dragons, and it's gone. We have failed.
What now?
This is a painful blow. We have to reorient ourselves. I shall retreat and ponder the matter.
In the meantime, you should go to town and talk to Vatras the Water Mage. I could imagine that maybe he knows what is to be done.
Vatras sent me to you.
That's good. What did he say?
He said something about a reversal ritual at the Circle of the Sun.
(laughs) That old devil. I think I know what he's up to. You have come to summon me to him.
Looks like it. When will you set out?
I must not keep Vatras waiting. I shall be on my way immediately. You must fulfill your tasks and then join me again.
I shall only assist with the ritual when I can be sure that you are ready to face the dragons.
Why don't you go see Vatras RIGHT AWAY?
Sometimes I just don't understand you.
(irritated) Do not talk to me in that tone. If it weren't for ME, your wretched body would still be rotting in that temple.
Then, at least, explain to me why you hesitate.
Ever since I abandoned the Fire Magicians, I have stayed well away from them.
And I do not intend to change that, unless I do not have a choice.
But before I expose myself to the magicians' reproachful glances, I first want to be sure that you stand even the slightest chance against the dragons.
You will not get far, however, with that shabby equipment of yours. Come back, but only when you are strong enough.
Never mind. Just tell me what I need to do.
You are still too weak to fight the dragons. With this equipment, you stand no chance whatsoever.
Do not come back until you are better prepared. Then I will go and join Vatras.
I'm ready to fight the dragons.
We must not lose any more time, then. I shall be on my way to the Circle of the Sun immediately. Fulfill your tasks. I shall meet you there.
Is the reversal ritual going to work?
I cannot be sure. That depends on what exactly Vatras is going to do.
Pyrokar refuses to show up for the ritual.
First, he wants proof that he can trust you.
Ah really. Pyrokar. How interesting.
That old geezer is getting to be a nuisance. But I think I've got something for you that will be useful.
Back when I left the Order of the Fire Magicians, I took a few things with me from the monastery.
I didn't want a troop of paladins or Fire Magicians to turn my tower upside down at some point, and find all those things.
So I hid them in safe places where the magicians would certainly never look for them.
And where?
Some of them lie locked in a chest on Sekob's farm.
You trust that Sekob?
No. But he can be bought and asks no awkward questions. Also, the chest is locked. Here's the key.
There's a very old book among those things. When Pyrokar sees that book, he'll know it came from me.
It is of no further use to me. So I guess it can at least fulfill this purpose.
Now that the Eye of Innos is healed, you must face the dragons!
They all serve Beliar, the god of darkness.
But there must be an earthly power that controls them. That much has become clear to me.
Find out what the source of their power is.
As soon as you have found that out, come back to me!
The Eye of Innos is healed. So what next?
Do not forget to wear it when you finally face the dragons.
Do not lose any time. Now go to the Valley of Mines and kill those dragons.
Go to Pyrokar and have him explain to you how to use the Eye.
What's new?
The Seekers have not left yet. They will not rest before they have hunted you down.
Kill the dragons in the Valley of Mines and find out who's behind those attacks. Otherwise, their strength will only grow more.
You are a convict from the mining colony. Scram!
I am Zuris, Master of Potions.
Do you need an essence of healing or a magic elixir? Then you've come to the right place.
Show me your wares.
I just received some new potions. My guest, Master Daron the Fire Magician, brought them along from the monastery.
Do you brew your own potions?
No, I either get them from the monastery, or I buy them from Constantino, the alchemist.
If you're interested in brewing potions, then go talk to him. He needs an assistant.
But he is too pig-headed to hire somebody himself. He's just as stubborn as a mule.
He always passes me when he goes out the east gate to collect plants for his potions.
Where exactly does Constantino gather his herbs?
He always goes through the eastern city gate here and then disappears into the wilderness to the left.
He once told me that just about everything grows there, except for king's sorrel.
Has Constantino ever told you where to find king's sorrel?
I once heard him say that the stuff grows near stone circles.
Near Lobart's farm, that's the farm near the other gate, there is one of those stone circles.
I think it's on a hill. It used to be a grave or something.
Where can I find Constantino?
His chambers are in the tunnel near Harad's smithy. Shouldn't be hard to find.
Tell me about the monastery.
You had better talk to Master Daron himself. He knows more about that than I do.
You're selling mining shares?
Yes. Some flop that was. That's the last time I get involved in a shady deal like that!
Just follow me.
Find me something!
Get me anything you can find!
I need all kinds of potions.
I need rings and amulets.
I need food and plants.
I need close combat weapons.
I need long-range weapons and ammunition.
I need gold, keys and utensils.
I need runes and scrolls.
Welcome to the 'Ring', my friend.
Vatras will give you your next assignment.
Trouble?
(annoyed) Damn. I don't know where they're all hiding. You kill one, and shortly afterwards they're all back again.
(slyly) Wait a moment. I know you. You're the fellow who was constantly begging arrows from me in the Valley of Mines.
I can barely remember...?
Oh, come on. Back then in my hut outside the Old Camp, I taught you how to shoot a bow and how to sneak. Ring a bell?
Your name is Cavalorn, right?
Ah. I see you haven't forgotten me after all we went through in the cursed colony.
Where are you heading?
To the city.
(laughs) Well, well. To the city, eh.
You may run into problems with the guards.They aren't letting just anyone in any more, since the area here is swarming with bandits.
In the past few days, one of those former psionics from the Valley of Mines came by here. He said he constantly goes in and out of Khorinis.
He went into the valley below the big tower. There must be a way in there somewhere near the waterfall.
Maybe you should talk to the fellow.
Back to the Valley of Mines.
(amazed) Really? Mmh. I wish I could follow you, but I have to finish my duties here first.
When you're in the Valley of Mines, could you please look around and see if my old hut is still standing? I'd like to return there one day.
I don't have a specific goal.
You don't want to tell me, huh? All right.
I was at your hut in the Valley of Mines.
So it's still standing.
Yes. And I also know what you wanted there.
Did you find it?
If you mean your pouch with the lumps of ore... yes, I have it.
You're a fox, you know that?
What else could you have wanted in that old shack? There isn't anything else.
Do you have it with you? I'll give you 100 gold coins for it.
I hope that I'll get it back soon.
No, but I have a lump of ore here.
Also good.
Sure.
Terrific.
No.
Then get it BACK for me. After all, I would even have gone back into that cursed Valley of Mines.
I'm getting all misty-eyed.
Why did you leave it there in the first place?
I had no idea that ore was so valuable here in Khorinis.
For one measly piece of ore, you couldn't get so much as a place to sleep back in the penal colony.
In the harbor city, they'll practically bash your skull in if they find out you have ore on you.
Give me 100 gold coins and I'll give you your ore back.
Deal. Here you go.
You're a real friend. Thanks a lot.
What are you doing here?
I'm sitting tight. If it hadn't been for these damned bandits, I wouldn't be here.
What was that about bandits?
Have you slept through the last few weeks?
Eh...
I'm talking about all the riff-raff from the penal colony that are making themselves at home here in the area. Plundering and murdering for all they're worth.
(sighs) I guess I'm lucky they didn't kill me. I let down my guard for one moment, and they clubbed me from behind.
No idea how I'll get all my stuff back now.
You were robbed by the bandits?
(furious) Yes. They beat me down and tossed me to the goblins for lunch.
It was damned important stuff. A letter and all my money. I absolutely have to get it back.
But without someone to watch my back, I'm not going back there. That cowardly rabble...
Can I help you with the bandits?
(slyly) Maybe. But as scrawny as you look, you surely haven't held a proper sword in your hands for weeks.
Well. I don't have any choice but to take your offer. My time is running out.
So, pay attention. Down this path here, you'll find one of those filthy holes in the ground that bandits like to hide in.
The fellows there are the same ones who stole my stuff.
Let me know when you're ready and we'll nab the rabble.
I need better equipment.
Those swine haven't left me much.
I can give you a wolf knife. Will that do for now?
You call that a knife?
But what about healing?
I still have 2 healing potions here. Interested?
Sure. Give 'em here.
Let's mix it up with those guys.
Sure thing. Just keep my back clear, ok?
Now they're in for a nasty surprise.
Then I can finally fulfill my mission. I've lost too much time already.
What sort of mission... ?
(to himself) Ah. Yeah. First I have to get into the city and then later...
(sighs) I don't know how I'm going to get all that done in time.
(drily) What about me?
(appraisingly) Mmh. Why not. You could take the letter into the city.
Then I'll have a bit more time to take care of my equipment.
One of the bandits must have the letter in his pocket.
Take it to Vatras, the Water Mage in the city. You'll find him in the Tempel of Adanos. He preaches there all day.
Tell him that I wasn't able to get it done.
And if he asks where I am, just tell him I'm already on my way to the meeting point, ok?
Oh, yeah, one more thing. First buy some decent clothes from the farmers.
Otherwise you may be taken for a bandit. Here's a couple of coins.
So, that's done. Hah. They shouldn't have messed with me.
The bandits are finished.
Interesting armor you're wearing. Don't you belong to the Shadows any more?
Shadows? They haven't existed since the fall of the Barrier.
The moment we could finally leave the Valley of Mines there was no reason for me to stick with them.
Now I work for the Water Mages. I belong to the 'Ring of Water'.
Tell me more about the 'Ring of Water'!
I'm not really allowed to talk about it.
All I can do is send you to Vatras. He is the representative of the Water Mages in Khorinis.
The best thing would be to talk to him. Tell him you come from me.
Maybe he'll take you on as one of us. We urgently need more good people...
Weren't you and your people enemies of the Water Mages back then?
Those crazy old days are over. There isn't any more 'New Camp' or 'Old Camp'.
Now that the penal colony no longer exists, everyone is on his own.
Most of us former prisoners are still being hunted.
The Water Mages were able to get my sentence commuted and now I can move around freely.
What are the Water Mages doing now?
They're up to something big. It has to do with an unknown region of the island.
An unknown region? Where is it supposed to be?
I can't tell you more. Talk to Vatras in Khorinis.
I gave Vatras your letter.
I didn't expect anything else. Thanks.
Are you looking for something?
Is it that obvious? Yes, I have an assignment from the Water Mages to look for some lost ornament.
That's convenient. I have the same assignement from Nefarius.
So you belong to the 'Ring of Water'?
Yes.
Not yet, but I'm working on it.
I'm glad. Then I don't have to do this alone.
Have you already found an ornament?
I found the place where we should find one.
This stone circle could be one of those structures that Nefarius described.
Now we just have to find the mechanism we're supposed to look for.
I tried the mechanism. It doesn't do anything at all.
Then Lobart's farmers were right.
They said that one of them had already played around with the stones here.
A stone sentinel appeared out of nowhere and attacked them.
The farmers called the militia, the militiamen called the paladins who came and destroyed the monster.
I've already searched the whole area. If there was an ornament here, the paladins have it now.
I'm going to the city now. We'll meet again at Vatras'.
Then I'll go to them and demand the ornament back.
All right.
Then one of us has to get into the upper quarter of the city.
I don't have any time for that. You'll have to do it.
I got the missing ornament from Lord Hagen.
You see? I thought the paladins had it.
Can you teach me something?
Sure. You know that. Man, they really took a lot out of you.
You can't remember anything at all, can you?
I want to learn your abilities.
Sure. What do you want to know?
With soft soles, you have a better chance of getting close to your opponents without them noticing.
That's better. You've forgotten a lot since then, but we'll get it back.
How's it going?
Wait a minute, don't I know you from somewhere?
Hmm... no. You're not him. Go on, piss off.
What do you know about the attack?
What do I know about it? (laughs) I broke the guy's legs.
(threatening) And I'll do the same to anybody else who wants to attack Esteban...
How's it going?
Quiet up to now.
You look for the traitor - then we'll take care of him...
DON'T wake him!
What???
If you want to do yourself a favor, then stay away from Skinner.
The fellow is unpredictable. He killed the last guy who woke him up.
Let him sleep, for everybody's sake.
Are you a digger?
Because of the pants? No, I just wear them because they're comfortable.
All I do here is cook meat stew. Here, you can try some - it'll make you strong.
It's always important to train your strength - there are many dangers lurking out there.
If you want, I can help you to get stronger.
I want to be stronger.
We'll talk again.
You already know what I'll tell you then...
Beat it.
Hey, slow down! You aren't getting in there - so beat it!
Get out of my way - I have to see Raven.
No one enters these quarters. Direct orders from Raven himself.
You again? You're getting on my nerves!
One more step and it'll be your last!
For Raven!
It is damned important that I get to him.
No. It isn't. Only Bloodwyn has permission to stay in there.
Bloodwyn? Isn't he supposed to be dead?
He's stronger than ever before. And if he finds out that someone is causing trouble out here, he'll make mincemeat out of you.
I'll give you a thousand gold pieces if you let me in.
You're wasting your time, bum.
Bloodwyn is in there? Then get him out.
Ha! Do you seriously believe I'd do that?
Maybe you're an important man in the camp now. But your power ends RIGHT HERE. Got it?
So go to the mine and dig for gold or do something else - but don't stand in the way here!
Here! Do you still want to stop me now!?
Is that... is that... Bloodwyn? ... bleah, that's...
Uh...yes, uh no. I mean... uh... you can go in...
So, on your way to the mine?
Why are they dead?
(laughs maliciously) They worked themselves to pieces.
Actually, I want to see Raven.
(warning) Hey - try to enter the temple and you are as dead as the prisoners here.
Move your ass over into the mine instead.
Yes.
Then watch out for yourself. Watch out better than these guys who are scattered all over the place here did.
How's it going?
It's too bad that we still have so few slaves. We'll have to get some new ones soon.
These guys are totally done in. Probably because they get so little to eat. (laughs)
But I'd rather send the diggers back to work than give these dogs a piece of meat.
The slaves are gone - too bad. Well, then we'll just have to pound on the diggers again.
Do you know anything about the tomb?
Yes. The tomb is behind this passage.
(unmoved) Just follow the bodies and you'll find it.
How's it going?
I slaved away for the ore barons long enough. It's good that someone else is digging now.
Damn. Now we'll have to go back to digging ourselves, huh?
Brain work, boy. Mining gold is a purely mental procedure. Don't try to force the rock - it's harder than you.
Free your mind of everything - and try to become one with the gold. Then it is like meditation, a prayer.
How's it going?
I'm not going to the trouble of mining myself. We have enough slaves to do that for us.
(laughs) We never came by our gold so easily.
Grmpf. What idiot freed the slaves?
Always dig from bottom to top.
That may be difficult, but that way you get more gold out of the rock.
How's it going?
As long as the slaves are working, I'm not budging a finger.
I have to dig a bit so that I get back into rhythm.
The legs, it's all in the legs.
Strength and momentum come from the legs.
Everything all right with you?
The slaves are getting the big chunks out of our way.
(grins) Then we'll harvest the golden fruit later.
Now we'll get the sweet gold.
Hey, do you want to go digging? Then don't forget to stock up with Scatty.
What do I need then?
Well, at the very least a pickaxe. And some provisions can't hurt.
Or how 'bout some healing potions? There are minecrawlers down there.
Everything all right?
Boy, oh boy. The slaves sure were in a hurry.
When they heard they were free, they ran like rabbits!
Yeah. So, don't make any trouble and everything will be all right.
I wouldn't go into the cave up here if I were you - my buddies in there will tan your hide. And they know something about fighting.
Hey - where do you come from, hm?
I've come from the mountains.
Exactly. You come from the mountains. And that is bad for you.
Very bad.
They're looking for you - a whole bunch of evil guys.
There's someone here you absolutely have to talk to. Follow me!
I've come from Xardas ...
Is that the old sorcerer? He's called Xardas ... Brago will be interested ...
Fine! You go first!
Then just follow me, the cave is right up here.
Who's looking for me?
Half of Khorinis is after you, and you're trying to tell me that you don't know anything about it?
Ah! I see! You just don't want to talk to me about it, hm? All right - it's your business.
So, you coming or not?
Who should I talk to?
To my leader. His name is Brago. He can explain everything to you better than I can.
So, what about it - are we going?
How do I know this isn't a trap?
You know, I'm getting tired of you. If you don't want my help, then just go to the city and let them put you behind bars!
You come with me NOW or you forget about it, see?
Easy, my friend! Someone has already tried to trick me ...
Oh?
This guy suggested that we should get an amulet together, and share the profit.
Once we had reached our goal, he and his friends attacked me.
It sounds as though you got involved with the wrong people - where was that?
I was a convict in the mining colony.
(amazed) You come from behind the Barrier? Man, then we were there together.
I don't know you ...
I was a digger in the Old Camp. I didn't have much to do with the whole thing.
(conspiratorially) But what is more important now - you are in big trouble!
Someone has put a pretty price on your head. And he's handed out a few posters - with your mug on them!
If I were you, then I would be very - very - careful. There are people with us who would kill their own mother for gold.
But I think we boys from the penal colony ought to stick together!
Then I guess I had better thank you now ...
It's nothing. Just make sure you stay alive.
That's not important.
Suit yourself. So, are we going now, or not?
Maybe later ...
There won't be a later for you, pal!
It was really stupid of you to follow me ...
Hey people, look who I have here ...
Who's the fellow who pays the bounty?
That I don't know, there's only one of us who knows him.
And who would that be?
Hey, man - I really can't tell you that. You know how it goes ...
10 gold pieces for the name of the guy who raised the bounty.
Oh, man, I really can't do that ...
Spit it out already!
(takes a deep breath) Oh man! All right. His name is Dexter. Near the big farm there's a steep rock.
There's a watch tower up there, and a few mines. He has his hideout somewhere nearby.
See, that wasn't so hard. Here's your gold.
Er - I just realized I haven't got ten gold pieces left.
What?! I ... Oh - forget it - it's my own fault. I shouldn't have told you the name before I saw the gold ...
And just don't tell them who told you.
Can I have the picture?
Sure (grins) - after all, it's YOUR mug on there.
One of the farmers outside of town sent me ...
What? The farmers know the hideout?
They have noticed the missing sheep.
Damn! Well, then I'll have to move. If they find the hideout empty, maybe they won't keep looking for me.
He wants to see you all dead ...
Wait - you're not going do me in, are you - after I helped you?
Go on in and bump off the others if you're that eager to see blood - I'm staying out of it!
There's bound to be a lot of trouble here before long!
What's up?
A guy named Cavalorn is coming to get you!
Rats! He's still alive? I'm outta here.
Is there anything else that might interest me?
You mean about the area here? If you want to stay alive, stay on the paths.
The farther you go into the wilderness, the more dangerous it is.
I've told you everything I can.
Hey, haven't I seen your mug before?
Hey, you bum. You haven't come about that sheep, have you?
Sheep? What sheep?
There's a good lad. And now beat it. There's nothing here for you.
Hey! I'm talking to you.
You stole the sheep from Akil the farmer.
So what? What are you gonna do about it?
Give me that sheep, or I'll punch you in the eye.
Then look out, boyo. All hell's about to break loose.
Nothing. What's that stupid sheep to me?
Then don't get on my nerves. Beat it!
Halt - you can't go through here.
I want to talk to your leader.
(ironic) Oh, I see, you want to talk to my boss. Well, then OF COURSE I will let you through.
(deadly serious) But only if you know his name - because if you don't, I'll be obliged to kill you! Well?
Lee.
Well, what can I say? You just forfeited your life, man!
Dexter.
Well, ... I guess you know the boss. Okay, I'll let you through. But I'm warning you.
You get too close to anybody, you won't get out of here alive!
So take a deep breath and leave your weapons where they are. You'll find Dexter in the house.
Diego.
Right!
No, that was just a joke. You don't have any idea who my boss is.
So there's no reason why I shouldn't kill you.
No idea.
Then you'll die ignorant.
Remember, stay cool and you'll get out of here alive.
Everything all right?
Touch Esteban and I'll chop you to pieces.
HALT!
Get out of my way, guard.
Ahh, all right, you can pass.
As long as Thorus hasn't given you a red stone, you're not welcome here.
Didn't you understand me? (forcefully) GO AWAY!
(forcefully) GO AWAY!
Hey, as long as Thorus hasn't given his go-ahead, you aren't getting through.
Okay, stay calm. You have one last chance. Go back RIGHT NOW or you'll die...
(sighs) You think I'm joking? I'll show you...
We knew that you would come!
My Master shall triumph and bring the whole world under his dominion.
You misguided fool! You had no idea who you were up against, and I shall punish you here and now!
So how are things?
I can't complain. I do my duty as Innos expects of me.
Hey, don't try pulling that 'so how are things' number here. Just get out of my sight, okay?
HALT!
You are wanted in the city for murder! Until that is cleared up, I can't let you into the upper end of town.
As long as you are accused of theft, you can't enter the upper end of town!
A troublemaker like you can't be let into the upper end of town.
Go to Lord Andre and settle the matter!
Only the citizens of the town and the King's troops can get into the upper end of town!
I'm telling you for the last time. One step farther and you'll be in a world of hurt.
You asked for it ...
I carry an important message for Lord Hagen.
Half the city wants to speak to Lord Hagen on important matters.
If we let in every petitioner, he wouldn't have anything to do but deal with the petty problems of the townspeople.
Couldn't we make an exception?
(ranting) What?! There are rules in this town! Rules that apply to everyone without exception!
If we let you break those rules, it would be unfair towards all those who obey them.
I'm a respected citizen of Khorinis! Let me pass!
Whatever prompted the masters of Khorinis to let you sign on as an apprentice - I don't want to know about it.
You may enter! But behave yourself! Otherwise you'll have the worst trouble in your life!
You may have gotten on the good side of some masters in the lower part of town, but if you were a citizen of this town, I'd know about it!
Don't try to pull the wool over my eyes! I'm warning you!
You are the dirt under my fingernails! Make yourself scarce!
I belong to the militia - let me pass!
So Andre accepted you? Then you can't be such a bad guy after all!
You are now one of the protectors of the city! So be nice and friendly toward the citizens!
You dare stand in the way of a representative of Innos?
Ehm ... no! Of course not! The entrance is open to the chosen of Innos!
Pray to Innos for this sacrilege!
Yes, chosen one!
I carry an important message for Lord Hagen!
You're one of those mercenary rabble! Whatever could you want from Lord Hagen?
I bring an offer of peace.
Ah! So you scoundrels have finally seen reason. Then go to Lord Hagen, but be nice and polite or he'll kick your fat, stupid ass!
How's it going?
All is well, comrade!
We are only doing our duty here. Thank you for taking notice of me, chosen one!
I may have to let you in, but I don't have to talk to you!
What do you want?
What's up?
All is quiet. We shall keep our eyes peeled.
Now listen. We can't let you into the city.
But I'll give you a tip, and it's completely free of charge.
Stay well away from this forest in front of us - it's haunted by ferocious monsters.
Crawl back under your rock, you lowlife!
Listen - you now have access to the city. But that doesn't mean that you can do whatever you want around here.
If you don't stick to the rules, you'll lose all your rights here!
Move on - go ahead!
HALT!
(sighs) What is it?
You know exactly what!
You are wanted in the city for murder!
We don't need any filthy thieves here!
We don't need any troublemakers in our city!
Why do you think we should let you in?
What is it?
YOU aren't getting in here, my boy!
Why not?
As ragged as you look, you're sure to cause nothing but trouble here!
We've got enough rabble in the city. We have no use for people without money.
What do you want this time?
The farmer sent me.
So? Have you at least got a good reason for coming here this time?
Are you one of the hands on Lobart's farm? I've never seen you here!
I haven't been with Lobart for long.
What do you want in the city?
(calmly) What?
Pardon me, but those are our instructions.
Are you trying to stop me?
Of course not. All members of the church of Innos are naturally welcome.
I only wanted to take a look at you. Looks like you've got money. You can go in.
No funny business. One more step and I'll hack you to bits!
You asked for it ...
Here's 100 gold pieces. Let me pass!
(greedy) 100 gold pieces sounds good. In you go then.
And go straight to Lord Andre! Otherwise you'll be out another 100 gold pieces the next time!
What?! Where?! I don't see 100 gold pieces. Beat it!
I've got a pass!
Really? And who did you kill for that, you cut-throat?
Now will you let me pass, or not?
Well, go on in before I change my mind!
Seems to be all right. Go on.
I want to see the blacksmith. To have some tools repaired.
(angry) Oh? And why didn't you say so right away?
I was just curious how you would react.
What?! Try something like that with me again and I'll show you how I react to that kind of thing, you stupid yokel!
Okay, fine, in you go then.
And if you see Lobart, you can tell him he should feed his sheep well, we're coming back to him shortly! (dirty laugh)
I'm bringing some herbs for Constantino the alchemist.
(slyly) Really? Then you won't mind showing me what you've brought.
(approving) Mmh. Looks good. All right. In you go. But don't cause any trouble, understood?
What? What is this supposed to be?
What's an alchemist to do with a bunch of clunky turnips? Are you trying to be cute? Get lost!
I don't know much about alchemy, but who is going to use this trussed-up bundle of mixed veggies for anything? Nice try.
What herbs? You don't have any herbs. Beat it!
I've come to join the militia!
That's a good one! Try that at the other gate - maybe THEY'LL buy that from you.
I need to see the leader of the paladins! I've got an important message for him!
Oh? And what important message might that be?
I have come to get the Eye of Innos!
What? Never heard of it - what's that supposed to be?
It's an important artifact.
You don't look much like an important messenger. Do you have some kind of identification?
No, I don't!
Then don't waste my time!
The hosts of evil are camped in the valley of Khorinis!
In the Valley of Mines? You come from there? Have you seen the army?
The city will soon be under attack!
What? By whom? The orcs? Have you seen our army?
No. But I know that it's led by dragons!
Sure! And my grandmother advises the orc generals.
You don't think we'll let you carry an old wives' tale like that to Lord Hagen!
Scram!
No - but I've been sent by someone who saw them.
(distrustful) WHO sent you?
Yes. I was in the valley of Khorinis. I saw some gigantic dragons!
You liar! The pass to the valley is held on both sides. No one gets through!
Get out of here!
A magician.
You have news from the magicians? Then you certainly have a seal as proof!
No.
What? The magicians ALWAYS give their messengers a seal.
Not this magician.
I don't believe you. If you're really a messenger, then spit out your news or clear off!
A paladin.
Hm, that could be - the paladins hold the pass to the Valley of Mines.
Give me your message and I'll report you.
I don't have permission to tell you that.
Don't act like that with me, boy! I'm a member of the city guard.
You can tell me EVERYTHING. So - who sent you?
The army of evil is led by dragons!
What? That can't be true. And I came that close to letting you in.
If you served up THAT story to Lord Hagen, he'd have handed me my head.
