Scram!
I can only give this message to the paladins!
It doesn't work like that, boy!
Like hell will I let you see Lord Hagen if I can't be sure that you won't waste his valuable time.
No. The message is for the paladins ONLY.
Then your journey ends here, stranger.
Move along!
HALT!
No one may enter the store room.
Are you deaf? One step closer and I'll chop you to bits!
That was a mistake!
I belong to the royal army. I want to equip myself!
Do you have an order for that?
Sure.
Fine, you can go in!
No.
Then get out of here.
Why can't anyone enter the storeroom?
The honorable Lord Hagen has confiscated the goods for the king's army.
Hey, you've got no business here, understand?
Who are you?
That's none of your business! I'm the boss here, okay?
The boss? Of what? Of those chests?
Hey, the storeroom is under my supervision, got it? So piss off, or else I'll bash in your skull.
Hey, you're still here. Didn't I tell you to piss off?
Now I'll show you who's boss around here!
How's it going?
Move along! I'm on duty!
HALT!
(sighs) What is it?
You know that only too well!
You're wanted for murder in town!
We need no filthy thieves around here!
We have no use for troublemakers in our town!
Why do you think we should let you in?
Yes?
You look like a poor blighter. In this town, we have no use for people without money.
But I've got a pass!
That one's only good for the other gate!
But I'm planning to join the city guard!
Hah! Don't make me laugh! Go to the other gate and try to sell that story to THEM.
I've already been there - they sent me to you.
(dirty laugh) Oh man! They're always sending us the cream of the crop ...
(calmly) What?
Just wanted to have a look at you. Oh well, you seem to have some money. Go on in.
Something wrong with your ears? Take one more step and you'll feel my blade!
You asked for it ...
Here's 100 gold pieces. Let me pass!
(greedily) 100 pieces of gold sounds fine. In you go, then.
And go directly to Andre! Or I'll charge you another 100 gold pieces the next time!
What?! Where?! I don't see any gold coins. Get lost!
Move on!
HALT!
I would violate my most sacred duty if I were to grant entrance to a murderer.
You are accused of theft. As long as that is true, you may not enter!
You are known as a brawler. I shall not let you through.
Go to Lord Andre and settle the matter!
Only men who are in service to the king may enter the town hall.
If you take one more step forward, by Innos, I shall knock you down!
I need to speak to Lord Hagen!
Do you know how often I've heard that? You can't go in. If you try anyway, I'll have to kill you.
I am a member of the militia.
All right, you can go in.
I am a Fire Magician.
Yes, of course. Forgive me, Chosen One, but I am only doing my duty.
Let me through, I bear a message from the mercenaries.
All right, but I'm warning you. If you cause any trouble here, you won't have time to regret it.
How's duty?
We have everything under control.
My task fulfills me, Chosen One.
Go on in and shut up.
What do you want?
Who are you?
We are the emissaries of King Rhobar, the servants of Innos, also called paladins in the common tongue.
What are you doing here?
You are not coming onto the ship. That is all you need to know.
We have been assigned here as guards. No trespasser may enter the ship. Not you either, sorry.
Frittering away my time. I would much rather be with our brothers in the Valley of Mines.
Wait a moment! Where do you think you're going?
I wanted to ...
Sorry. You can't go through here.
There's nothing here to see. Now move along.
Not one step further. No exceptions.
You don't want to FORCE me to hurt you, do you?
I want to get aboard the ship.
No one may enter the ship! I have my orders!
I shall kill anyone who enters the ship without authorization.
In the name of Innos, I shall defend the ship with my life.
You question the wish of a Fire Magician?
(nervous) No, of course not. May Innos forgive me.
(nervous) The Magicians of Fire are the guardians of the wisdom of Innos ...
(nervous) ... whoever doubts them, doubts Innos and forfeits any right to mercy.
What happens if I go aboard?
(nervous) I shall kill ... I mean, stop you.
You would attack a Fire Magician?
(nervous) I would never lay a hand on a magician.
So what would you do if I went aboard?
(sheepishly) Nothing, Sir.
I will go aboard now.
(nervous) You mustn't do that, Lord Hagen's orders were quite clear.
Do Lord Hagen's orders include me, too?
(nervous) I don't know.
Just think - would Lord Hagen dare to suspect a magician of theft?
I don't believe that.
For the last time: Let me board the ship!
(nervous) Understood. You may go on board.
Do you not trust me, knight?
No, I just follow my orders.
Then you should know which of us has the higher rank.
Yes, Sir!
I hereby command you to grant me access to the ship.
Understood, Sir, access will be granted.
Is there nothing to be done about that?
I don't think I understand.
I could give you money. For looking the other way.
I cannot be bribed, and if you don't disappear right now, I will take that as an insult.
I have a written authorization. I am permitted to board the ship.
Let me see.
All right, you may pass.
Stop - who are you?
The question where I come from is much more important. I came across the pass.
So are you going to stop me now, or can I go in?
Well, I couldn't know that. Of course you're allowed in.
Who's in charge here?
Our commander Garond and his two advisors, the paladins Oric and Parcival.
Just walk on in. During the day, you can find them in the throne room on the ground floor.
Report, soldier!
Yes, sir! Holding position as ordered. No additional losses. Provisions getting short, the orcs are quiet.
The last dragon attack completely destroyed the outer wall. But since then, there haven't been any unusual events.
All right, carry on.
How's the situation?
We have the situation under control. Don't concern yourself, civilian. Everything will turn out all right.
Your appearance here is a sign for all of us. We all draw new courage from it.
We know that our lads in the city have not forgotten us. The Eye of Innos watches over us.
And if the orcs and dragons storm the gates, we shall meet them upright, to victory or death.
You've come from Khorinis, haven't you? When all this is over, I shall return there.
It's a great comfort having you on our side, Sir.
We're going to make it. We'll bring the ore to Khorinis and let them celebrate us!
How's it going?
The area here is extremely dangerous, so you should turn back - we certainly don't want anything to happen to you.
It is very courageous of you to enter the valley. Just as long as you have enough healing potions with you.
Have any bandits passed by here lately?
No idea what you're talking about. As long as we are on guard duty here, nobody passes. And certainly not any lousy bandits.
Ask those peasants back there. Maybe they've seen something.
Where does this path lead?
Behind the gate lies the pass to the Valley of Mines.
We're on this side - on the other, a few orcs have dug themselves in.
It's better if you go back - you cannot get through here.
Are you sure you want to go in there? I'm afraid you won't get very far - the orcs are on the other side.
If there's a way into the Valley of Mines, I shall find it.
Good, then go. Go with Innos.
And what if I go at my own risk?
Then you will die. That's why we're here. So that you don't get such stupid ideas.
How's the situation?
Everything's quiet. We have the situation under control.
Everything ship-shape?
Sure, now that we've got that over with. Those scumbags are as flat as flounders!
Let's get it over with!
No! Hammering's just not my thing.
Don't tell me! You want me to come along and help you flatten those bandits!
You got it.
Why don't you ask the guy who's manning the saw?
I ... can't use all this stress ...
Come with me.
Henry needs one of us to stay HERE ...
Let's go back a little towards the camp first.
(sighs) Aye aye ...
I no longer need you.
If you say so ...
If you want to continue in that direction, don't let me keep you ...
I think I'll be headed back now.
You know what - I've been doing some thinking. You're not such a bad sort!
I'm headed back to the camp, then. See ya!
How's it going?
Stop gabbing at me.
Are you one of Henry's boys?
No. I'm just sawing up this tree for entertainment.
What's up? Did Henry tell you what you're supposed to do?
Yes. I'm supposed to do in a few bandits for him.
(fending off) Ooh no! Don't LOOK at me that way. I don't wanna go there.
Just leave me to my sawing, will you?
Come with me.
Why? You've already got somebody with you ...
First let's go back a little towards the camp.
(to himself) He COULD have asked somebody ELSE ...
(sighs) Aye aye ...
I no longer need you.
I guess I'll go back to my sawing then.
We're too far away from the camp.
I don't like this at all. I'm going back now.
You know what - I've been doing some thinking. You're an asshole!
I'm headed back to the camp, and I hope I never set eyes on you again!
How are things?
Greg's back at last. And none too soon.
Francis should get some wood for the palisade. Hope that's not too much for him.
Bring on the bandits, then. With Greg by our side, we're not afraid of them.
Francis, the camp leader, is nothing but a clown. How can anyone take him seriously?
Greg trusts Francis because he's too dumb to cheat! But to make him our leader for that ...
If Greg doesn't come back soon and I don't get a deck under my feet before too long, I'll be getting landsick!
You're supposed to help me.
Orders from Greg?
You've got it.
The canyon awaits.
That's exactly where I'm headed back to ...
Aye aye, Cap'n!
I no longer need you.
I'm back in camp, Cap'n!
We're too far away from the camp.
I don't like this at all.
I'm headed back to the camp!
The boys and I are headed back for camp!
Ugh, this heat by the fire makes a body thirsty.
Say, have you got some grog for me?
No, I haven't got any.
Rats, I guess I'll die of thirst then.
Here, take a sip.
Thanks, man!
What's up?
I have to take care of this gluttonous crew here.
That's why I'm standing here day and night, slaving over a hot frying pan.
I'd much rather be combing the beach and the shallows for washed-up flotsam.
Last week, a fat merchant vessel hit a reef right off the coast.
And all that good stuff is washing up on the beach now.
I really hope somebody's going to take over my duties soon.
What can you tell me about Francis?
Francis? He's acting up like he's our captain. But just wait until Greg comes back.
Then he'll crawl back under his rock and shrivel like a worm.
He's pulling a fast one on everybody, if you ask me. I bet he's lining his own pockets.
I didn't tell you this. And as long as there is no proof, you had better not repeat this to anybody.
Anything else?
If I were Greg, I'd send Francis to the swamp.
Now that Greg is back, the bandits are bound to think twice before they attack us.
There's more work now that Greg is back, but at least we get paid for it properly.
Francis is a total loser. Everything's been going to shambles here since he's been the camp leader.
Let those bandits go ahead and attack. They'll never know what hit them.
Just as long as Greg comes back soon. I want to go back out, to the open sea.
You're supposed to help me.
Orders from Greg.
Come with me.
I no longer need you.
Where d'you think you're going?
To the house, of course.
Onar pays us not to let guys like you in here!
Just don't let any militia in here! - Those were his exact words.
I want to talk to Lee!
What do you want from him?
Lee is in the right wing. Don't even think about wandering around anywhere else!
I want to join the mercenaries!
Ah, fresh cannon fodder! Then go on in.
But above all, leave Onar alone! He doesn't like it when people talk to him without being asked. Especially not guys like you.
He and I go way back ...
YOU'RE a pal of Lee's? I don't believe a word! But go on in, if he doesn't recognize you, you'll know it ... (laughs)
How's it going?
Go on in, if you want, but don't babble at me.
